text: This brew is a hazy copper color with a medium thick white head that dissipates gradually to an outer ring. Stringy lacing. Aroma of malt, roasted nuts and fruit. Light-bodied with flavors of caramel malt, banana and touches of spice. The finish is sweet with a malt and fruit aftertaste. Decent overall.

Interesting to compare this with regular hefeweissbier. The same wheats, banana ester aroma, but darker in colour with a decent head. Tastes more malty with toffee and caramel. Decent drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Obfita piana, kremowa, drobne, średnie i większe pęcherzyki. Dość szybko opada, zostawia lacing. Barwa miedziana, zmętnione.
W aromacie wyraźny banan, karmel, skórka od chleba. Jakby metaliczny aromat, ale na skórze nie ma żelaza. Z czasem przemija, a pojawia się goździk i pieprz. Może to więc fenole dają taki efekt. Leciutka nuta alkoholu.
W smaku na początku słodkawe, bananowe, owocowe, zbożowe, potem przemija uczucie słodyczy i wchodzi taka przypalona skórka od chleba, a potem wytrawny, gorzkawy, mocno fenolowy finisz przypominający piwa belgijskie. Zostawia uczucie pieczenia na języku.
Wysycenie po przelaniu dość niskie. Gdyby pić prosto z butelki to wysokie. Goryczkę chmielową ciężko ocenić przez te mocne pieprzowe fenole, ale na pewno jest, oczywiście na niskim poziomie. Pełnia piwa średnio-niska.

Pours a cloudy, copperish brown with a full, off white head that quickly fades. The aroma offers a healthy amount of wheat and banana, lighter toasted malts, bread, nuts, and a slight caramel. Regarding this in bitterness and sweetness, they both come across mildly late in he sip. Banana, caramel, and a compliment of apple are given to you initially. Undertones of wheat, yeast, and a bit of spice. Aftertaste is a short wheat. This one is light to medium in body, smooth in texture, and average in carbonation. Very easily drinkable, Id happily enjoy this all evening.

This is a nice dark wheat beer. It pours a cloudy amber with a frothy thick head and smells of bananas and butterscotch. It tastes like a hefeweizen mixed up with an amber ale, some nice malt underscoring a wheaty summer base. Very good, if not quite great. Good for cuddling with yr boo boo while watching some WWE programming on a Sunday night!

Oranje/bruin kleurig bier met een dikke witte schuimkraag.

Aroma: tarwe, banaan en gist.

Smaak: tarwe, banaan, gist, karamel en een hint van geroosterde mout.

Medium mondgevoel met redelijk wat koolzuur.
Bottle from Bilka, Tilst. Pours hazy amber with an of-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, wheat, caramel, yeast banana. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle at restaurant Lungomare, Berlin. Pours hazy light brown with a lasting, foamy, white head. The aroma contains wheat, yeast, overripe fruits (banana), hops, caramel and some spices. It tastes light spicy bitter and medium fruity sweet. Fizzy carbonation, oily texture, medium body. Very good.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

0,5l bottle. Hazy thick dark copper/light brown colour with long lasting big creamy stiff tan head. Aroma: Banana, biscuit with smokey notes. Taste: Sweet short malty start (with nuts), than a softly bitter and slightly sour mouthfeel. Has a very creamy texture and a warming feel. Medium body with medium carbonation. Medium lasting softly sour finish.

Proefglas van 50cl-fles op het Streekbierenfestival te Koekelare. U: Troebel koperkleurig met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Tarwemout, beetje chocolade en licht gistkarakter. S: Moutzoet met een lichte bitterheid. Ook een hint van karamel. M: Mist karakter, medium carbonatie.

Botella en 99 cervezas.

La primera sorpresa es que a pesar de ser "dunkel", que significa negro, no se trata realmente de una cerveza oscura. Es más bien de un color entre ámbar y marrón considerablemente turbio. Generosa formación de espuma en color vainilla de persistencia media, aspecto cremoso y buena adherencia.

De intensidad media-alta en nariz, da de entrada notas claras de plátano maduro. También hay notas florales, así como un cierto punto picante extremadamente suave. Huele indudablemente dulce y de algún modo recuerda al dulce de leche. También hay pan fresco. Complejidad media.

De entre los sabores básicos destaca el dulce, lo que es totalmente consistente con lo que sugería en nariz. Hay también un punto cítrico que equilibra muy bien el anterior y unas notas saladas muy de fondo. El amargor es también muy tenue. El plátano maduro, el pan blanco fresco y el dulce de leche salen de nuevo en el post-gusto.

De cuerpo medio y textura sedosa y ligeramente espumosa. Llena bien la boca y tiene una persistencia notable con un final dulce y chispeante que nunca llega a ser empalagoso (al contrario que otras cervezas de trigo en las que el dulce parece acumularse en la lengua hasta llegar en ocasiones a hacerse pesadas).

Gran textura y final en boca y estupendas notas de plátano maduro y dulce de leche. Totalmente recomendable.
Donker amberkleurig bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: schotelwater, ietwat metaal, wat moutzoetig. Smaak: licht moutzoetig, wat toffee. Goede koolzuurprikkel.

500 ml bottle. Not sure how I missed rating this until now. Pours an orange copper color that is a bit lighter than most Bavarian Dunkel Weissbiers. Huge pillowy beige head is firm and enduring. Wonderful wheat malt nose has notes of caramel, toasted pecans, soy sauce and earthy yeast (or yeasty earth?). First sip is sweet wheat malt, toast, soy sauce, ripe banana and sweet tea. Delicious. Brief dry aftertaste.

Bottle: 500 ml, Price: 1,51 eur 
Labai, labai geras alus..

This dunkel maintains basically the same body and overall flavor characteristics of the regular Hefe. This one is slightly less yeasty and slightly more malty......but just a bit. I would love to try the two together, side by side.

20170507 HOME; 50 cl bottle; BB 25.07.17. A thick off-white foam layer above a cloudry amber coloured beer. Aroma of malt, light roasted, wheat. Enough clove and some yellow fruit. Taste is somewhat dark malt with wheat. A slight sour taste with some malt bitterness. Also a lot of clove with somewhat yellow fruit. At the end the beer become somewhat sticky. The body a little thisn. At lot of CO2.
0,5l bottle. Nose: cloves, banana, yeast. Taste: ripe banana, citrus, nice maltiness. Nice!
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2017 Pours deep clear amber brown. Light bready aroma and flavour. Some esters in the nose. Thin creamy texture. Pleasant sweet subtle malty flavours follow. Quite subtle and nice.

Piana bujna, piękna. Ale tak poza tym to raczej słaby pszeniczniak - przede wszystkim drożdżowy, kwaskowy, z tylko śladem banana. Troszkę ciasta drożdżowego. Brak jakichś bardziej odczuwalnych ciemniejszych nutek. Tekstura może jest całkiem przyjemna, wysycenie oczywiście wysokie. O tak o.

Ar: Mild banana and peach; sweet, doughy malt. Ap: Amber and lightly hazy; very large off-white head with excellent retention, leaving a webbed cap of large-bubbled foam and a trail of suds along the glass sides. T: Peach skins and light banana up front; mild sweetness; hints of clove; toasted, melanoidin-rich accent mid-palate; herbal hop flavor, low bitterness; a bit of dusty cocoa on the finish. P: Medium body with high carbonation; finish is dry. O: Good, solid dunkel weizen; fair amount of expected flavors, like banana, peach, clove, and toast, but not overdone and well-balanced.
Aus der Flasche beim Griechen getrunken. Trübes Rotbraun im Glas mit stabilem weißem Schaum. Mild hefig, im Nachtrunk etwas zu süß.

Sampled at the Bräustüberl Weihenstephan in Freising.
Lasting white head. Cloudy brown color. Huge banana aroma but more balanced in the taste.

Cloudy dark amber/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, some yeast, caramel malt, bananas, & spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, light clove, caramel, and some toffee; Nicely balanced; Solid.

The wheat yeast isnt for everyone but the fruity/spicy aroma on this example is fantastic. The texture and is buttery and the taste has a lot of malt. The beer is a great example of the German dark wheat. Very yummy,
Definitely a wheat beer, not my preference. cloudy medium brown. March madness 2017
Bottle. Opaque brownish color. Banana and cream aroma. Taste follows after, with bready notes. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Not bad.
Very malty, some fruit notes, maybe some caramel as well. Banana is there, as well as a light bit of spice, not as much as some other wheat beers. Pretty good.

Creamy dense, averaged sized beige medium long lasting head. Beer is murky brown. Aroma is pleasant, it smells like flowers, ripe bananas, yeast and brown sugar. Flavor is compared to the aroma a little bit underwhelming but still good. I taste primarily medium sweet malt, banana and yeast. A little bit sour, no bitterness. All in all a good balance but for my preference not strong enough. I would wish myself a Bock Version of this beer. Palate is creamy, medium bodied with a medium to soft carbonation. Finish is average intense and short to medium long lasting.
Rating #4700: Bottle from Savor Growl: cloudy amber pour, medium off-white head. aroma clove, banana, wheat, nutty. tastes are along those lines - earthy, orange peel, wheat, nutty, toasted malts.

Z butelki wyraźne banany ciemne słody, skórka chleba. Cudna piana, jasnobrązowe/bursztynowe. Goryczki brak. Dość wysokie wysycenie. W smaku owocowe/estrowe, chlebowe, ciemne, palone słody. Nieco zbyt wodniste, nie zostawia szczególnego posmaku.

Bursztynowe, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie warstwy na powierzchni. Aromat banan i goździki oraz lekkie nuty opiekane. W smaku owocowe, bananowe, lekko karmelowe. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie bardzo dobra ciemna pszenica, fajny smak i aromat, duży plus.
500ml bottle. Hazy brown with a large white head. Aroma is banana, yeast, caramel and taste is pretty much the same with a little spice thrown in. Rather splendid

Pours hazy, amber colour with a beautiful broken white head. Aroma of bananas, caramel, toffee and some spicy notes. Pretty good. Tasty is mainly sweet, many bananas, caramel, toasted notes. Light phenols in the background. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Low bitterness. Very good dunkelweizen, but the "standard" hefe-weizen is a bit more impressive.
Pours brown with white head. Aroma is yeast, some fruits, flour, banana, light roast. Taste is banana, wheat, yeast, fresh, dried fruits, some bread, light caramel. Very good beer!

Pours murky dark amber with beautiful tall rocky off-white head. I had expected lots of banana, caramel malts, clove in a perfect blend. Thats what I got. It didnt surprise me it just made me happy for a moment.

Bottle 4316. 00277
Aroma is banana and toasty, bready malt becoming very prominent as beer warms up. Banana bread all around. Subtle clove. No hops. 
Appearance: very cloudy copper with off white fluffy head. Low lacing. Average head retention

Flavor: moderately strong banana and some fruity flavors (apricot). Low clove. Subtle vanilla. Grainy toasty flavor in the background. Fairly dry finish with residual fruity flavors lingering in the aftertaste. Slightly oxidized?
Mouthfeel: medium full body. Medium carbonation. 
Overall: good example but not as carbonated as expected. Head retention could be better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DOB:4376 (9/4/16?)2015 BJCP Category: 10B Dunkles Weissbier
AROMA: Strong presence of clove phenols and banana esters. Whole wheat bread scent is quite prominent. Slightly sweet bubblegum or vanilla candy background note. Minor oxidation. 10/12APPEARANCE: Dark copper/light brown hue; fairly hazy body but far from opaque. Effervescence constantly visible. Large white mousse-like foam. 3/3FLAVOR: Soft wheat bread-like base throughout the palette. Not as spicy or sweet as banana bread but close (age may account for mildness). Light peppery phenols up front with a strong sweet taste of banana and slight bubblegum on the second half. Very faint oxidation does not distract. Otherwise to-spec and delectable. 17/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body with a soft, luscious texture. Very smooth and comfortable. Carbonation looks high but feels low; each swig is crisp but not spastic. Tempting to session at 5.3% ABV. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: When fresh this is a World Class beer, but even with a little age its still excellent. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 43/50

Bottle from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer. Slightly cloudy brown, with a very big foamy head. Nose is sweet malt, something between caramel and treacle, plus a little bit of spiciness. Taste is sweet, malty, a little nutty, not particularly bitter; also some spiciness again. Palate is clean and refreshing, with a medium length finish. A really excellent Hefe.
Parádés kis sör. Vöröses-barnás szín. Átható búza illat. Krémes búzás íz banános felhangokkal. Kiváló.

Aromas of cracked wheat,banana peel, and yeast. Taste is banana, wheat, slight tart lemon; almost like a banana sorbet. Some bubblegum esters and more toasted peppery wheat in the middle of the tongue. Tart lemon/banana after taste. After it has warmed, more toffee and caramel flavors appear in the middle and end of the tongue alongside the previous flavors.
Aroma of banana and dark bread. Taste is sweetish, well balanced with some acidity

Bottle. Hazy brown color with big tanned head. Aroma has malt, banana, yeast, fruits and caramel. Taste is malty with a bit sweet long aftertaste. Flavors of yeast, banana, wheat malt and a hint of caramel. Excellent smooth mouth feeling.

12. 1. 2017, Gas Station, Ljubljana. Bottled. I will have to give it a proper 2nd tasting according to my procedure.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Weihenstephen Freising. Hazy brown gold lasting beige head. Like drinking liquid chocolate bananas. Toffee and herby finish. Outstanding. Good length. Finish just goes on and on.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 Zmętniona brązowawa barwa. Bardzo obfita piana. Intensywny aromat dojrzałych bananów, lekko karmelowy, drożdżowy. W smaku świeżo, orzeźwiająco, słodkawo. Dominują banany choć nie tak jak w aromacie. Do tego drożdże dopełniają weizenowy profil. Na finiszu można wyczuć karmel, nie przytłacza, dodaje lekkiego chlebowego posmaku. Wysycenie wysokie. Goryczki właściwie brak. Bardzo dobre piwo, świetnie zbalansowane, a do tego nie jest puste ani mulące

Bottle in Seattle. Soft, tall cream. Gorgeous rosy brown body. Clean, juicy hefe aroma. Lightly spiced body, creamy and sweet hefe with mild banana esters. Cool, sweet, round flavor. Delicious raisins, banana bread, autumnal spice in a way. Nice example of a dunkelweizen, great.
[I have only a rating for this beer but no review, because I couldnt write a review when I tried this one. I am going to drink it again soon and write a proper review.]

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light brown with a beige head.The aroma is mildly yeasty and reminds of banana along with some very light sourish notes. Medium body with low carbonation. The taste is lightly sweet with nearly no bitterness and a very, very light sourness. Flavor of lightly roasted malt, light caramel, clove beside some fresh fruity notes (banana, pear, cherries). Overall very well balanced and rather fresh.

Bottle from Central City liquor store in North Surrey. Medium amber orange color, generous beige head, nose of malts and fruits. Tastes of fruits and malts. Low bitterness as expected. Pleasant but not my favorite style for November chill. 3.4
From backlog. Light brown with thick head. Bubblegum and malt. Flavor follows. Mild hop finish. Medium/heavy body. A hefe with a noticeably maltier flavor.

On tap in Berlin-- Pours clear Amber with thick white head. Nose is yeasty. Aromas are toasted malts, grassy hops, with a sour note. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium bitter and grassy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 W aromacie klasycznie weizenowe, bardzo bananowe, goździkowe, średnio intensywne. W wyglądzie ciemny brąz, mętne, z imponującą pianą. W smaku słodkie, bananowe, miodowe, zbożowe. Ogólnie bardzo solidny ciemny weizen, smaczny, gaszący pragnienie.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu vehnälasiin ruskeana ja sameana, noin kolmen sormen paksuisella vaahdolla, hyvin tyylinmukaisesti. Tuoksussa on kypsää banaania, vehnäisen viljaista kuohkeutta, tummaa hedelmää ja marjaisuutta. Leipäisyyttäkin löytyy jonkin verran. Maussa hedelmäisyys ja viljaisuus on pääosassa, leipäisyyttä ja makeampaa marjaisuuttakin on hiven joukossa. Suutuntuma on raikas, suht hiilihappoinen ja hyvin kuohkea ja pureskeltava. Perushyvä vehnis, jossa vaaleaa enemmän tummempaa marjaisuutta ja leipäisyyttä.
Очередн& хорошее пиво от замечат& немецко& пивовар& Фруктов& тона отлично перекли& нотками тёмного солода.

Serving: from tap at Flying Squirrel.

Aroma: moderate clove and banana.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy white, initial head with fair lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Hazy, dark-amber body.

Taste: lightly sour initial flavor and lightly sour, clove and banana finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: excellent.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with shades of banana, toffee, candy and some spices... the taste is fruity and caramel with notes of toffee, dried banana, bisquit, lolly and some spicy grasses... sweet and dry aftertaste...
A very good, dark beer which once again reinforces that I like darker beers. Full body, medium sweetness, with just a touch of bite. Drinkable. I would buy it again.
Boca 0.5L- nabavljeno u Kući piva(snizite cijena piva za van)...amber boja, tamno gusto pivo, miiris puca od banane, okus je pomalo prazan, nema očekivane punoće, prilično gazirano!!!!
Sample from bottle at Hy-Vee Oktoberfest. Poured brown, off white head. Aroma was wheat, caramel malt, light banana, spice. Taste was medium sweet, spices, caramel.

Bottle at Craft Room - hughe thanks Morko for sharing! Simply couldnt believe some weeks ago that I hadnt tried it before... Misty brown/amber/bronze body with a tiney white head. Wonderful, pungent classic hefe aroma, creamy, with big banana esters rounded by some pear esters. Quite lovely. The taste is a light disappointment after that, but its still a very good beer. Malty, soft wheaty sweetness, light banana, light pear, smooth. Not perfect, but yet another showcase of how great this brewery can be.

Copenhagen 14/10 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. 2 lions, a golden shield and other Heraldic stuff on the label. When you brag about being the oldest brewery in the world you probably need some shields and golden lions to prove it. Pours dark amber with creamy white head. Moderate lacing. Settles slowly as 0,5 cm thick layer of foam. Aroma of banana, lemonade with oranges and a little sugary. Medium carbonation and watery palate. Flavor is quite watery. Medium sweet and lemonadeish with a sour tang. Not bad - but I could use a bit more intensity.
Härski banaanius iskee heti kärkeen. Kirpeä kuparinen jälkimaku. Kaunis olut, hefeweizdunkel on kyl jännä laji.
Pours a slightly hazy light brown with lasting white head and lace. Light banana, clove and caramelized malt in aroma and taste.

Bottle from online shop. Hazy light brown color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, malts, wheat, a bit of nuts, banana and yeast. Bitter finish with citrus, wheat, banana, malts and grass. Excellent dunkel.

Bottle. Brown and hazy with big white head and some lacing. Strong aromas of yeast, bananas and some dried fruits. Medium body, little bit sweet with some spicy notes in the finish, soft and smooth mouth feel. Good and very drinkable.

Bottle @Home (Ryder Cup Day 1 2016 tasting). Pours brown, looks like mud, its murky with an off white almost yellow head, Nose is banana, fruity, cloves and ham (bacon). Taste is banana with a caramel/toffee sweetness on the finish.

Pours a cloudy brown with an off white head. Aromas of malt and dried fruit. Taste the same with some banana and fig flavors. A little smoke at the finish. Very smooth and dry finish. Light to medium mouth feel with a thin film on top and light lacing.

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is spicy Belgian yeasts, cloves, fruit. Taste is spicy and tart. Very crisp and effervescent. Smooth, complex and extremely drinkable. A great German beer.
0,5l bottle. Pours brown with big creamy white head. Bananas, sweet malts and bit of spices. Soft mouthfeel, nicely balanced. Good.
Excelente cerveza,prolija, intensa, color oscuro penetrante, aroma perfecto y sabor banana increible.

Light brown with amber tinge, large head that shrinks fairly rapidly. Aroma is banana, clove, pastry. Taste is banana, bubblegum, belgian yeast, caramel, gingerbread. Luxurious palate much like the hefeweisen, with a similar flavour profile. Very sweet and desserty. Ill take the hefeweisen over this on most days, but theres not a lot of distance separating the two.
Вкусное темное пшеничн& пиво, красивы& цвет, хороший легкий аромат и вкус, но послевк& слабое.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 Cloudy deep amber with a huge offwhite head. Nose of caramel, baguette and crust, wheat, banana, some fruity and zesty notes, hints of spice, candy, smoke, yeast. Light to medium sweetness and tartness, hints of bitterness on finish. Smooth creamy and oily texture, medium body, high carbonation, extremely drinkable. Nice complexity and too damn drinkable!
Hazy brown color with big frothy head. Bananas and sweet malts in aroma. Taste follows the aroma with lots of sweet malts combined with bananas and yeast. Enjoyable weizen

Draught at Biergarten 1040, Tel Aviv. Clear brownish with beige head. The aroma has notes of banana, clove, wheat and yeasts. Sweet flavor with notes of wheat, banana, sourish, yeasty and phenolic. Medium to full-bodied.
Pours murky brown with big frothy off-white head. Aroma is clove, banana, bread. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, oily palate, average carbonation. Soft and bready.

Dark amber. Fruity and somewhat spicy, with notes of banana. Full, lightly sweet taste with a dry and lightly bitter finish. Medium body, with a soft texture. Overall, a good dunkelweizen. However, aside from the darker colour, I did not notice any difference between this beer and the normal hefeweizen.

0,5 L bottle, served in Weihenstephaner Weizen glass. Poured cloudy chestnutty brown with a two finger off white head. Aromas of banana, cloves, caramel, bubblegum. Taste: banana, cloves, burnt toffee, wheat, vanilla, bread, jam, sweet sugar candy, caramel. Very nice malty mouthfeel. Light to medium body with a slightly dry, fruity sweet finish. Very, very good! If you like them sweet and malty this is just for you! Another enjoyable Weihenstephaner, a world class brewery! Prost meine herren!

Marrom claro, média turbidez, espuma bege de otima formação e persistência, aspecto cremoso. Aroma típico de banana, leve torrado e cravo em menor intensidade que as weiss tradicionais. Paladar de leve/médio dulçor, mínimo amargor do torrado. Corpo médio e alta carbonatação. Final mantém a impressão inical do paladar trazendo mais do cravo mas mantendo banana. Referência do estilo.
0.5l vom Fass. Trübes gold braun, schöne schaumkrone, malz und hopfenaromen, Karamell/ malz, solider Körper

Aroma: cloves, banana, dark malts.
Appearance: hazy amber color and creamy head.
Taste: cloves, banana, roasted dark malts, yeasts, quite dry.
Palate: low body and high carbonation, zesty finish.
Overall: Really nice dunkel weizenbier, zesty.

Classic banana and clove in the nose, allied with wheat a hint of pumpernickel/rye bread. Waxy lemon zest and caramel in the mouth. Quite possibly the best dunkel weizen out there - best I can remember - and certainly one that actually tastes like a weizen notwithstanding it is a dunkel.

Пил в Pivnaya Biblioteka.
Прине прокисш& пиво. Поэтому такие низкие оценки.

Jun 16. A 0.5 l bottle that poured a hazy caramel brown body with medium sized ivory head. Fine aroma of banana, lemon, bubblegum with weaker caramel and toasted bread. Flavor was lightly sweet, wheaty, banana, lemon, caramel and brown sugar but so surprisingly thin it left very watery impression. Moderately long finish with watery grainy finish, touched with a metal off note. Very weak, but that what it had shown was mostly fine and elegant. But anyhow, expected so much more from this one its indescribable with words!

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Bottle to cup. Wheat and subtly sweet brown bread aroma. Cloudy dark brown/orange, very active with an off white, brown tinged head. Wheat, hay, biscuit, very slight lemon bitterness with caramel undertones. Medium-light body, very active carbonation.

Cloudy brown color with very strong activity. Thick creamy beige 2 finger sparkly island head, lasting around 20-30 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of bread and fruit esters with a slightly biscuity caramel feel. Flavors of caramel, burnt sugar, lemon, grains, herbal spices. Pleasant thick grainy sourness with a sugary bread feel. Rich and super well balanced.

Smooth and creamy light to medium body with a good amount of carbonation. Well intensified finish like tasting tender bread, lightly wheaty and lemony, ending with a dash of faint spices.

Overall, as always, an excellent craft from Weihenstephaner. Complex, rich, balanced, and delicious flavors. Super fresh, sexy, and a nice well rounded body. Would drink this all day long, and forever.

Tap at Doghouse. Pours cloudy orange with a medium white head which recedes to a foamy layer with bubble activity round the circumference. Aroma is coriander, orange zest, banana and clove. Taste is herbal coriander, orange zest, banana and a modest but pronounced citric bitterness.
Pours an amber color with a white head. Banana. clove, bread, bubblegum and caramel aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a clove and banana finish.
Nice! Wild head. Full thick more malty weizen. Moderately seasoned. Great. Spot on yeasty.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2016 500ml bottle. Dark Amber, with a light brown head that dissapears fairly quickly. Nice rich mouthfeel. Banana and caramel. Medium to light carbonation. Very nice and will buy again.

Pours cloudy and richly tan with a fine off white head. Nose is tame with notes of wheat, light berry, and a touch of roasted malt. Flavor is similar and full bodied with a nice semi sweet finish. Good dunkel

Farbe: braun Richtung ocker, ein helles dunkles
Schaum: nicht super aber gut. Leichte gute Kellernote
Nase: eher wenig, Banane, Klee, Weizen
Geschmack: hm für ein dunles fast spritzig, eher mit ausgewogener Säure und bitterkeit als mit der malz/bananenbreite. 
Im abgang weizen malz, da ein bisschen mehr Breite. Gut, eher leichtes helles dunkles Weizen.
Découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière sombre et épaisse, très mousseuse. Je nai pas trouvé de grande différence avec une Hefeweissbier naturtrüb. Mais bonne bière.
Hazy amber. Banana and malt smell. Banana, hop, tangy citrus, bit of spice too. Nice.

500ml bottle, bought at Central City Liquor Store, tasted on Green Point Campground. Cloudy amber with a huge white head. Caramel, banana, spices. Taste is spices, wheat, banana, caramel. Quite tart aftertaste.

Cloudy copper body, medium white head. Aroma of caramel, banana, bublegum. Flavors of caramel, banana, bublegum. Medium caramel finish, slightly bitter, a tad dry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Belle couleur. Goût ambré délicat mais juste pas assez pétillante à mon goût. Une belle découverte quand même.

Golden brown with one and a half finger bread. Smell of banana. Taste of roast malt, banana, and clove. End with little sour and alcohol taste. Light carbonation and medium body. A good smooth beer with little taste of alcohol like all other weihenstephaner beer.

Good stuff

500 ml butelka. Średnio jasny kolor odcieniu brązowego. Duża, gęsta biała piana, która pozostaje po wypiciu. Lekko gazowana. Widoczna obecność osadu. Szumowina z piany pozostaje na brzegach szklanki. Dominuje silny zapach bananów. Słód pszenny. Zapach drożdży. Niska gorycz, mocniejsze w posmaku. Dość słodkie. Smak rodzynek. Palonego słodu. Nie tak gęsty smak, biorąc pod uwagę, że mówimy o czarnym niemieckim piwie pszenicznym. Solidne, ale nic specjalnego z marki Dunkelweizen. Jak na mój gust zbyt wodniste.
0.5l bottle. Brown color with white head. Aroma is banana, cloves and yeast. Taste is sweet with banama notes. Overall its great beer with nice aroma.

Pours from the bottle cloudy light brown. The crown is frothy and lingers for much of the duration. The aroma is yeasty and banana sweet, with noticeable Weizen. The taste is malty sweet with roasted notes. Finishes crisp and refreshing with a light sour twist that is slightly warming. All in all this feels like a well balanced brew, harmonious, and finishing leaves you feeling ready for the next one. Excellent stuff.

Bottle from andersons. Nose is wheat and dark
Sugar. Super smooth and pretty light with little carbonation that fades quickly. Malty punch up front. Cherry, wheat, toasted cereal, and bit of raisin and clove for good measure. Pretty good and would do again but wouldn't go out of my way to seek it out.
Plum, cinnamon aroma. Heavy off-white head. Flavors of raisin, peach, spice cake and vanilla. Extremely smooth low carbonation beer. Fabulous.

Pint bottle. One I am surprised to not have ticked long ago. Murky brown with a big off white foam that slowly falls. The aroma is wheat and yeast. Plenty of malts in there, too. Rich malts fruit are tasted and they just keep coming. Lighter fruit. Bananas, gentle cloves, bubble gum, and yeast. A little chocolate. Those malts are almost syrupy. The finish brings a little more fruit along with that syrup and then a hint of alcohol.
Flasche - fast rotstichige Farbe, sehr stabiler, cremiger Schaum. Aromen von Banane, Toffee und Malz, alles aber eher dezent und gut abgestimmt. Im Nachgesschmack Brot und Weizen. Gut!

0.5L bottle. Cloudy orange-brown with a large creamy smooth head. Aroma of wheat, dark malts, banana, cloves. Taste is predominantly wheat and malt, with citrus, banana, spices, toffee. Sweet and fruity, the banana flavours more subdued than in similar beers. Extremely smooth mouthfeel, lovely to drink. A favourite.

Poured from a bottle. Generous thick head that dissipates quickly. First taste is very malty and smooth. A slight nutty taste lingers and finishes thick and bread like. A very solid dunkle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Robe brumeuse, laiteuse, modérément trouble pour une dunkel : sur lorange foncée terne.Belle mousse blanc cassé abondante et crémeuse.

Nez : parfum typique dépices, bananes mûres et céréales délicatement grillées (modérément).
Je mattendais à un nez plus "fou" mais peut être bière servie trop froide.

En bouche : fine acidité typique, bouche céréalière typique, corps léger mais laiteux, crémeux "léger" comme un lait écrémé fouetté ou des blancs battus.Tout est assez typique du genre, équilibré.Au vu des notes je mattendez à quelque chose de plus marqué.Peu de torréfaction, comme le laissé présagé la couleur, finalement une blanche allemande à peine plus corsée.

On reste tout de même dans lextrême maîtrise et léquilibre idéal.Manque juste un peu plus de folie.
Pours reddish brown with a fizzy big head. Aroma is of wheat, citrus, spice, gum and vinous notes. Tastes of wheat, citrus, spices, grapes, gum and toast. Has a tingly, dry, medium body.
Cerveza de trigo. Muy buena. El aroma es indicador del sabor tan bueno que deja, intenso.
it pours a dark amber that is hazy with a white head. It has aromas of bananas, toffee, roasted malts, and hints of bubble gum. It has flavors of bread, banana, spices, and wheat.

Hatalmas, tartós hab, barna szín. Intenzív búzamalátás, szegfűszeges, banános illatvilág. Búzás, banános, fűszeres, enyhén karamellás ízvilág. Némi kakaóporos szárazság. Közepes szénsavtartalom. Rövid utóíze a korty folytatása. Közepesen testes. Nekem túl sok a fűszeresség.

Originally rated on 9/5/08. Tried this yesterday after trying the Julius Echter dunkel, although this was good, i prefered the Echter. If i had tried this one alone i probably would have scored it higher. It pours a murky brown body with a mid off white cap that had brown specks in it. A few yeast floaters and minimal carbonation. Aroma and flavors were mild toffe,banana, and a little clove. Mouthfeel was on the thin side. Overall it was fairly decent and i will try it again in the future. RE-RATE 8-14-2013 Tried on tap yesterday, a very nice dunkel, plenty of banana and clove without being overwhelming, very smooth and easy to drink from 3.3 to a 3.8

Couleur orangée-brune, bonne mousse blanche. Nez typique paille, fruité (vieux fruits, banane) note caramelisée. Gout malté, fruité (banane, vieux fruits), pain, assez sec, avec épices (dont clou de girofle). Bon corps, fin sur le fruité caramélisé
Schokoladenbraun mit schöner Schaumkrone. Malzig, weich, leicht bananig und würzig und etwas röstig nussig. Sehr süffiges angenehm zu trinkendes dunkles Weizen.
Dit is een zacht tarwebier. Merkbaar is dat het mout gebrand is, waardoor er een lichte karamelsmaak en -geur aan het bier zit. Het behoudt wel zijn frisheid. Ook tonen van perzik, citroen en thee.

Pours dark dark brown. Frothy caramel head. Sweet nose, hints of treacle. Slightly toasted taste, lots of sweet malt, little bit of bitterness in the finish. Nice.
Pours a hazy copper with an off white head that leaves lacing. Nose is banana and toffee. Taste is same with slight bitterness. Body is medium. Half Liter bottle More cans!

Aromat dojrzały banan oraz w tle zboże
Wygląd jasno brązowe, mętne, obfita piana, która ulega szybkiej redakcji

Bottle at home. Hazy, almost dirty brown colour, with a medium white head. Nose is stong banana with some roasted malts. Taste is also dominated by banana, and light roasted malts. Low bitterness. Nice hefedunkel.

On tap in Daytona Beach FL. 

Pours with a hazy copper body topped by a creamy off-white head that leaves sticky patterned lacing. 

Fruity, spicy and lightly bready Way more balanced (think of the load of banana and clove notes in most competitors) and more complex than perhaps any other beer of this style in my experience. Body is a bit too thin. 

Overall: world-class version

Bottle - Cloudy brown colour with large and stable frothy beige head. Decent wheat aromas with crushed wheat, some breadcrust, banana, cloves. Taste of breadcrust, banana, yeast and a bit of roasted malts, some dried dark fruits maybe. Medium body, lively carbonation, yeasty finish, chewy texture. Classic dunkelweizen, very nice.

Pours from 16.9oz bottle(room temp) a cloudy brown with a large billowy head of foam that shrinks slowly and leaves a fine solid layer, with lots of lacing, right through to the end of the session. 

The smell is Wheat dominated but I can also sense clove, banana, and maybe some dark fruit? 

The taste on first sip kind of surprised me as Im getting a lot of roasted malt and grain. After that, the fruitiness moves in with a good plum and banana presence and the clove, that I noted in the nose, finally shows up adding some most welcome complexity. I like this and I could drink more. 

Bottom line: Plenty of flavour in this Dunkel Weizen....I can easily recommend it.

aroma is resiny citrus,

pours a cloudy dark amber with a big frothy off-white head and some lacing. aroma of banana, cloves, spices. flavour of cloves, yeast, bread, caramelized malts. sweet and slightly bitter finish. classic, not very complex, but nice and drinkable.
God awful. Couldnt drink it and that is saying something. Feels like jagermaister of beer, your stomach starts to digest right away. Very awful feeling.

Bottle. Deep Amber, frothy off white head that dissipates quite quickly. Banana, bubblegum, spice and caramel aromas. Rich mouthfeel displaying deep caramel, banana and clove. Touch of sweetness cleaned up by the sourness of the wheat. Great beer.

500ml bottle from Germany Pours a hazy light brown body with a massive tan head. Aroma is yeast, banana with some cloves-hints and apple. Tastes is quite malty, with the aroma notes making themselves known. Lively carbonated and medium bodied palate. Ends in a quick yeasty finish. Refreshing and really good!
Bottle 500 ml. Cloudy brown color. Good dunkelweizen, banana + caramel + clove, wheat.

Pours murky orange colour with a nice, dense head. Aroma of ground cloves, banana, citrus, a hint of caramel. Fizzy and slightly sour in the taste with solid malty backbone and the notes present in the aroma, all in a perfect balance. Really good.

Murky & dark in the glass with a lush cap of white foam on the surface. Silky smooth in the mouth. Melodic mix of green apples, banana popsicles, ground clove, wheat. Words that come to mind while drinking the are: precision, balance, tasty, & more please. Great way to start a mid-week after work session. Recommended.
Aroma is strong banana, not to complex. The taste is sweet with some wheat and a lot of banana. My second dunkel (I think) and its just not my style of beer....

Bottle picked up at Consumers beverages Niagara Falls. Pours a cloudy deep copper, massive white head, loads of clumpy lace piles. Nose is sweet, fruity. Tastes sweet, light, but malty, a little beer that fades fast. Really tasty, and sessionsable.
Butelka.500 ml.Ciemno herbaciany kolor z biala obfita piana. W zapachu dominuja cytrusy .karmel gozdziki. W smaku tak samo cytrusy z dodatkiem bananow. Swietny przyklad gatunku.

500 ml bottle. Pours a veiled golden pale brown with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is caramel, roast, banana, pepper, chocolate. Flavor is banana, lemon, caramel, roast. Finish is some herbs, lemon, cloves. Lingering pepper, roast, spice. Medium body, average carbonation.

Butelka 0,5l Pite pierwszy raz w browarze we Freising ok.1998r, posiadam kufel. Teraz ponawiam próbę z oceną. Mam wielki sentyment do tego piwa. Kolor ciemny nieprzejrzysty, piana średnia, mocna. Aromat bananów i lekki goździków, smak bananów i suszonych owoców z dominacją śliwek, lekka kwaskowatość. Średnia goryczka, dużo ciała, bardzo dobry weizen ze wskazaniem na ten sprzed prawie dwudziestu lat we Freising. Klasyka.

Bottle from Sprouts: Poured a dark tea brown that was completely opaque because of how much sediment is floating inside the liquid. Foam created a thick monstrous sizing of foam cap. Aroma smells sugary sweet with fruity esters that suggest banana or plantains while a delicate touch of bubble gum and spices stimulate my senses. The beer comes across strong flavor of sweetness but in a delighting good way. Only able to pick up on a minimal taste of caramelized malts with an aftertaste that leaves behind traces of banana, bubblegum and clove. Actually quite tasty and would prefer to drink more than just one pint of this.

Aroma: yeasty, sour; Appearance: dark brown with frothy head and some lacing; Taste: smooth, sweet with some fruity hints; a little bit of a bite; not bad; Palate: medium body, average carbonation; finish a little bitter with some banana; Overall: decent beer; not very complex but pleasant, a bit sweet for my taste; would buy again if on sale or if on tap.
From bottle in Weizen. Pours with billowing head and cola-like hue. Aroma of ale yeast, malt and faint banana. Rich malt-driven taste leading to an inevitable slightly sweet finish.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 2/09/16. Bardzo ladna piana, dosc jasme jak na styl piwo. Aromaty, to przede wszystkim mega intensywne, dojrzale banany. Tak intensywnych chyba jeszcze nie mialem okazji... Poza nimi sa tez gozdziki i delikatne nutki jakichs wisni czy sliwek (swiezych), miodu czy karmelu... Moze chwilami chleba... Moze nie jest to jakas bardzo wyszukana paleta, ale niewatpliwie bardzo mila. W ustach jest bardzo duzo slodyczy... Takiej bananowej :) jest troche kwaskowatosci pszenicznej. Goryczki malo, sladowo, ale nadal wyczuwalna przyprawowosc ja niejako zastepuje. Bardzo duzo ciala, mozna sie najesc tym piwem. Jak dla mnie: najlepszy dotad probowany niemiecki stylowo weizen. Jak widac nie zawsze rewolucyjnosc przebija tradycje ;) KlasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

2015/11/14 - I must have had this beer a dozen or more times. Not sure how it fell through the cracks without being rated, but here goes. Pours a cloudy brown syrup colour with a thin, foamy, white head that lingers as a film and leaves mild lacing. Aroma is wheat, banana, clove, bubblegum, caramel, dark fruits and sweet bread. Taste follows nose; caramel, bread, wheat, banana and clove. Mouthfeel is slightly sticky with sharp carbonation and a crisp finish. The measuring stick for Dunkelweizens.

Bottle @ Haket Pub. Cloudy amber with trick off white head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, caramel and hops. Medium body with a nice balanced finish.

Sweet citrus and malt aroma. Hazy chestnut brown with thick off white head. A pleasant sweet dry citrus taste. Smooth clean finish. Excellent quality brew.

Flavor is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Full body, thick texture with tiny particles, unclear body, average carbonation.

500ml bottle. Cloudy copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are bread crust, burnt caramel, banana, lemon and spices with herbal and nutty notes. Medium body, good carbonation, smooth texture. Nowhere near as good as their Hefeweizen.
From elcervecero. In Paulaner glass. Watching Better Call Saul 1x01. There is nothing wrong with it, but neither it is much special apart from a high drinkability and sessionability

Chestnut color, hazy, rich and lasting head. Perfect sight. Aroma of riped banana, yeast, dried fruits and cloves. Veryveasy drinking and refreshing, dried fruits and yeast in taste. Very balanced, great beer.

Aroma is wheat, Belgian yeast, banana, clove. Appearance is murky tan, light tan. Taste is clove, banana, wheat, not overwhelming and pleasant even until the end. Mouthfeel is crisp but medium body and carbonation. Overall, not bad until the end.

Draught @ Albion. Cloudy dark amber with small creamy beige head, faint caramel aroma, low carbonation, vanilla-caramel flavored slightly sweet taste, smooth body, faintly bitter citrusy finish. Very smooth and easy to drink.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe - GUSHER! - Hazy light brown body with a massive off-white head. Nose is yeast, banana with some cloves-hints and apple-peel. Keg at Bow Bar. Pours hazy amber. Nose is banana, spices, wheat. Tastes wheat, light sweetness, light spices.

0.5 l bottle from Firma Bier, best before 14/1/2016. Hazy, dark golden orange with a huge, creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Yeasty-spicy, slightly fruity aroma of ripe banana, nuts, cloves, some caramel. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy taste of ripe banana, caramel nuts and some clove, followed by a short, yeasty, slightly sourish and gently bitter finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Apart from the ugly yeast flocs a very round beer, highly quaffable. Good.

Drank from a nonic glass poured from a 500ml bottle. Pours a nice magohany, brown, hazy color with tons of fluffy white head. Has wonderful aromas of malts with a hint of banannas you get from the Hefeweizens. Wonderfully complex beer, sweet, and delicious!
500ml bottle from Metro, Xiamen. Pours hazy dark amber with a white head. Smoky aroma with malt and banana. Sweet finish with a little bitterness.
Poured from a 500 MLK bottle into a pint glass. This beer has a fantastic amber color with a sweet and smoky aroma. A crisp palate that is very satisfying. A world class beer.

sampled at 2015 Dayton Alefest = Pours dark golden with a creamy white head. Initial sweet caramel taste. Finished sweet.

From tap. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is malty, roasted, caramel, spicy yeasty, fruity. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with average carbonation.

Very nice. Quaffable, well balanced and fully aromatic. Not on par with my favourite Dunkelweizen from Ayinger, but a very good example of the style.
