Draught at weihenstephaner berlin. Aromas of malt, banana, caramel. Tastes great with malty flavour and hints of banana and dark fruit. Very good.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 16th September 2015 and poured into a weizen glass. The beer poured a hazy copper colour with a nice three finger cream head that stuck around for a long time leaving some spotty lacing. Aromas are mainly caramelised banana with hints of bready malts, caramel and a tinge of pear. Taste is a strong bready malt base followed by ripe banana, bubblegum and caramel with hints of grape and raisin in the finish. Medium bodied with medium crisp carbonation. Overall a very nice dunkelweizen that is very easy to drink. I would buy this again if it was available in Hong Kong, but for now, I will just have to keep bringing it back from Thailand and South Korea.

16.9 oz bottle from Fred Meyer. I didnt even know this was in my market. Thanks a lot, Obama. Aroma is doughy, banana, citrus powder drink, clove, wheat. Pours muddy orange-brown with a thick bone-white pillowy head with excellent retention. Spicy German phenols in flavor, light sweetness, a touch savory. Wonderfully creamy mouthfeel, but a bit thin. Good stuff, but I was hoping for more with this one.
I liked this one it was a good dark wheat beer. Nice aroma pours dark brown with good head. Drinks smooth not bitter would recommend.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, mętne. Piana drobna, wysoka, dosyć trwała.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Klasyka stylu: banany, przypalony karmel, przyprawy, goździk. W tle zboża.
SMAK: Banany oblane gorącym karmelem.Dobra podbudowa słodowa. Goryczka niska, krótka.

Aroma:
Wheat, banana, caramel, dark fruit.

Appearance:
Turbid dark amber/brown with a steady white head.

Taste/Palate:
Wheat, banana, clove, caramel, dark fruit.

Pours hazy dark orange/ light brown with a no e khaki head. Head retention is great. AROMA: Yeast, wheat, slight funk, spice, caramel, malt, Dark fruit, very slight bubblegum, spice and herbs. TASTE: wheat, caramel, herbs, bubblegum, banana, dark fruit, yeast funk, light spice, malt, light hops and light bubblegum. AFTER TASTE: wheat, malt and caramel with an oily rustic finish.

Pours dark orange with plenty of foam. Aroma suggests wheat, malt, caramel, dark fruit and other sweetners. Taste is semi sweet and very inviting. There are many different tastes but none stand out to dominate the other. A very good wheat dunkel in my opinion.

Nice looking cloudy chestnut brown beer with a billowing light tan head. Nose of caramel, banana, and heady spice. Flavor follows with some rich roasted grain buttressed by the banana-and-clove yeast contribution. Caramel and light chocolate come through at the end. Light bodied, this is a complex and flavorful dunkel.
Bottle. Wheat, floral smell. Clean pour with a healthy head. Mostly smooth going down with a smidge of carbonation.

After my good experience with Weihenstephaner Hefeweiss I am almost forced to also follow up with the same brewerys Dunkel hefe. Same good fresh aroma of banana and wheat malt greets me with expectation as good and rich flavor. The banana flavor is unmistakable and convey a weissbier that is not too sweet but still belongs to the tasteful and light beer style as a wheat beer should be, even if it is dark. A little bit of roasted malt character with very light caramel and chocolate notes is in the palate. A little bit of citrus aftertaste keeps it in a nice balance so the sweetness does not get too much domination. Now dunkel weiss beers are not one of the beers I have very highest preferences inside, but I certainly accept that this is very tasty beer,

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn. BB 11.02.16. Pours a murky translucent brownish amber with a well-retaining light beige head thats very big initially but then drops to leave a bubbly layer. Very little lace. On the nose theres quite a lot going on - wheat, malts, overripe bananas, plums, nuts, especially nougat, and weirdly, some alcohol too... Its got this Tosca cake thick sweetness to it, but its also kind of fresh, and fruity. Tastes rather sweet with a home-made apple juice and apple pie very dominant I think, and then some plum liqueur and caramel thats accentuated by sour notes and the thin but active carbonation, and the minimal - but certainly detectable - bitterness. Kind of a watery texture, yet the body feels firm. Wheaty dry on the palate. I quite like it as a warming sipper, but its just not my style of beer.

Botella. Precioso color rojizo caoba con ligera turbidez.
Generosa espuma de varios dedos que se mantiene sin problemas.
Aroma a caramelo, cereal y algo de plátano.
en boca resulta muy equilibrada. Sabor malteado y a caramelo.
Muy cremosa y completa. El equilibrio hecho cerveza.
Really refreshing beer great taste and smell looks great in a glass aswell would buy again

Bottle, 500ml. Pours golden/orangey brown and extremely cloudy. Head is off-white, lively, and of substantial volume, with long retention. Primary notes on the nose are wholemeal bread, salted caramel, banana, with a backdrop of subtle woodsmoke and smaller notes of a spicy, christmas pudding-esque character. A bit later the aroma takes on a mustier, more farmyard-esque nature with hints of apple (or apple pie/crumble) and other fruits I cant quite make out. Very interesting so far. Taste is initially sweet and malty though following this is a more neutral, pastry-esque character with a lot of cereal. Not massively complex in this regard but has a hearty feel to it. Finish is very dry for the most part (like the standard Hefeweizen) and what little aftertaste is akin to that of weetabix, with some VERY subtle bitterness. Palate wise, body is a decent medium while the texture seems a little too thin and watery but this doesnt bring it down much. This is recommended for fans of weetabix, and probably makes a great breakfast beer.
Opaque dark orange, off-white lasting lacing foam head. Decent, not strong, caramel aroma, suttle taste. Some orange tones there. Good beer. (Velp 201506)
Great German beer with a moderate complexity, full of details, with lack of depth for my taste. But style is not the beer.

Prezentacja:
brunatne, mocno mętne, piana bardz obfita, drobniutka, trwała,ładna koronka
;
Aromat: 
goździki, banan, niedojrzałe morele, ciasto ala murzynek z alkoholem
;
Odczucie:
raczej wodniste, nisko nasycone, finisz goździkowy
;
Smak: 
goździki, ciasto bananowe, lekko alkohol
;
Ogólnie:
troszkę płaskie, niewiele się dzieje
.

Bottle from Drinks of the World. Pours hazy brown with a silken foam. The increased amounts of malts are already noticeable in the nose, which is also a bit citric. The taste is fuller and sweeter than in the regular Weihenstephaner, but the texture is a bit watery.

Amber pour, huge barely off white head. Nose is medium roasted grain and yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is soft banana and caramelized malt. Finish is slightly sweet. This went great with pulled pork, coleslaw and bread and butter pickles.

Precioso color miel y madera y sugerente aspecto, muy cremoso. Fantastica espuma densa y muy abundante. Aroma especiado y sobre todo de rica malta. Cuerpo moderado bien estructurado, con una carbonización en su justo punto, sue se nota en la lengua y deja un rico toque de clavo. después aparece un excelente sabor a malta, junto con un leve recuerdo frutal. Gran final con un toque seco. Sin duda entre las top cervezas de trigo morenas.

Pours a light brown color, completely hazy, topped with an avergae sized off-white foamy head. Retention very solid. Malty aroma, mildly biscuity nad sweet. Taste is similar - malty, mild chocolate presence with grassy finish and a bit of that soury feel in the end. Perfectly decent.

Bottle 0,5.
Copper color. Yeasty, sour, little sweetness. Refreshing. Well balanced.
Appealing mid brown with an off white head, aroma of s;lightly spicy banana and soft malt. Light to medium body, flavour pretty much like the aroma, lightly sweet and spicy. Refreshing.

5.3% ABV

Light head. Dark golden brown caramel. Strong wheaty nose. Salty slightly harsh first mouthfeel. Salt predominates throughout the drinking experience.

Cant get past the salty palate. Not my favorite beer. Yeeech.

Food pairing: hot wings.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Bottle 500mL. Home. A brown chestnut shining beer with a huge off-white foamy head ; good retention ; ok lacing. Fruits (banana, apple), clove, light herb, light bread. Light sweet ; light bitter ; dry refreshing. Light to medium body, thin texture, good carbonation (nearly fizzy), dry spicy fruity finish. Overall, a really good refreshing dunkelweizen.
Brown colour with high long lasting head. Wheat, dark malt, banana, caramel. Smooth beer. Nice.

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours a cloudy dark golden brown, with a huge fluffy khaki head that slowly fades. Nose is dark malt with a hint of brown bread and molasses. Taste is light caramel and whole wheat bread. Smooth but not creamy. Well balanced and flavorful. Very good.
Tiene un sabor a clavo bien rico pero esta muy pesada como todas las cervezas de trigo

500 mL bottle. Pours a cloudy golden amber with an incredibly tall, frothy, and long lasting head. Scents of sugar, banana, and malt are very prominent. Taste is slightly sweet with big banana flavor and undertones of spice. Has a medium body, but is a little thin on texture. Lively carbonation and a slightly astringent finish bring things to a close. Overall, this is a good beer. I really like the sweet flavor on the front end, but I dislike the sourness on the back end, since it makes for an odd combination.

Aroma: Banana, wheat, malt, yeast
Appearance: Yellow/brown with a cloudy huge head
Taste: Sweet banana, similar to their other but with a malt backbone and a bit more sweetness. No major bitterness, kind of needs it.
Palate: Refreshing, ish.

I think their Hefeweissen is slightly better, more balance due to it being not as sweet.

Bottle. Pours murky brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is of banana, spice, wheat, and malt. Smells tasty. Taste is big on the banana. Lots of spice. Has a very bready malt backbone. Lingering spiciness. Very sweet in the taste. Mouthfeel is very light, and almost sticky. Body is very light. It definitely drinks easy. Just a really good, tasty beer.

Bought this along with the Julius Echter of the same style to compare. Enjoyed this one more! Cloudy amber pour with offf-white sticky head - looks yummy! Aroma of ripened fruit, yeast, spices and some wheaty malt. Flavors are mostly the same, with a creamy mouthfeel. Finish is clean, soft, and mildly sweet. Very nice!
500ml bottle - pours a medium brown color . Strong banana aroma with a hint of clove . Similar flavors with a mild roast note. Solid .

500ml bottle. Poured into a 630ml weizen glass. Faint hint of banana (first time Ive ever noticed it), and malts. A dark brown beer with creamy white foam. Poured it reasonably vigorously and had three fingers of foam. Head retains fairly well, but did drop to a smaller level fairly quickly which stuck around. Moderate lacing on glass. 
Definitely too cold (about 4 degrees Celsius) when I first poured. Flavours initially suppressed. As it approached cellar temp, it developed a sweetness with light roasted malt finish. Zero bitterness. Stronger malt as the beer came to a more normal temp. Even though the head was large and the initial carbonation was lively, it settled quickly into a fine bead. Might be a little too carbonated and distracting from the feel and taste of the beer. 
Some sediment left at the bottom of the glass. 
Nice beer, but not my favourite.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown color with a medium white head. Aroma of yeast and fruits. Taste of wheat, banana and caramel. Medium bodied and quite sweet with a low bitterness. Has a subtle sourness at the end. Very nice and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellente bière dans la tradition Weihenstephan.
Nez assez prononcé, plutôt sucré et caramélisé.
En bouche, larôme de banane explose et finit avec larôme de miel doux caractéristique des Weihenstephan (que lon retrouve énormément dans la Vitus).
Beaucoup darômes pour ce degré dalcool.

On tap @Hannover train station. Brown colour with rich white foam. Aroma has lots of yeast and fruity notes, a bit of chocolate and spices. Taste: malts, yeast, banana, spices. Delicious! Finish is a bit sweet. A very good example of the style!

Smells of bananas, malts, a bit of cloves, yeast, and a bit of alcohol, but not in a bad way. The colour is darkish brown, hazy; the head big and unstable. Tastes sweetish, a little sour, effectively not at all bitter. Body below medium, carbonation a bit below high, but feels sparkling to the tongue; finish spicy but short, bland, and kind of without taste. A little meek and lacking in character, but overall pretty pleasant.

10th dunkleweizen rate finally! it seems I should have rated this beer years ago by the looks of it. Hazy light brown pour sudsy beige head. Nose is banana amd bubblegum. Tastes of banana, bubblegum, bready, wheat, brown sugar, Hints of earthy bitters. High carbonation. Easy drinking
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 Very pleasant beer. Different than his white brother, but not for the worse. Taste: apple, banana and grassy.

Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 02.23.15.

A: Banana, banana bread, caramel, wheat, and a touch of lemon.

A: 3 finger fluffy head that stays. The opaque, dark brown yeast cloud starts at 2 fingers from the bottom of the glass and goes all the way up. It has a see through caramel body below the yeast cloud.

T: Banana and banana bread dominate. Lemon, wheat, and sweet cloves on the back end are subtle.

P: Creamy smooth with some bubbles on the back end.

O: This was an awesome dunkel.
Old rating. Deep orange brown. Nice blend of Belgian yeast, malt, spices. Fullbodied. Okay, not my fav style.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 50cl weiss glass. Pours a quite abundant slight off white creamy head; dark golden to mahogany brown almost completely cloudy colour. Smells crystal malts with caramel and sweet roastiness, nice yeastiness, clove, nuts. Tastes caramel malty, yeasty, toffee, apples, bready; medium nice sweetness, low bitterness. Quite medium, wheaty and creamy body, lively carbonation, anyway good drinkability. Nice and solid wheat beer, great dunkel, tasty

Bottle (50cl): Served in a shaker:
Medium sized creamy head.
Hazy dark orange brown colored beer.
Aromas of banana, malts, nuts, light citrus, bread, fruit...
Flavour is a delicious mix of banana, bread, yeast, bitters, malts, herbs, nutty...
Aftertaste fruity, nutty, light herbal hoppy and some pudding like sweets yet no sweet beer as bitterness is higher present.
Low carbo, good medium bodied and a creamy mouthfeel.
Great beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Elle a une belle couleur brune-rouge. La mousse est crémeuse est opaque. Elle a un léger goût de froment et de prune (avis perso). Elle nest pas lourde, bonne bière. 19.05.17 I rate again this beer. I
bought the bottle at drink of the world in Geneva, I drank it at Paris, in the hotel room. It is a pleasant beer, classical, on the Bavarian school, a reference for the style and a good one at the terrace, enjoying the sun, easy to drink. The color is brown/orange and troubled, white foam and regular carbonation for the style. The taste has notes of wheat, fruity, plum, a bit watery and you smell at the final a bit the alcool, well balanced, not complex but find.

Va certamente considerata tra le migliori del genere, ha tutte le caratteristiche della sorella weiss chiara, ma col tocco dei malti scuri chiaramente notabile nel sapore di "pane" che si accompagna alla banana. Ha una schiuma quasi bianca nonostante il colore marrone.

Hazy, orange colour with huge and very stable head, nice lacing too. Medium aroma of yeast, malts and spices. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, slightly bitter with spicy finish. Medium to high carbonation. Medium body. Dunkel is not my favourite style, but this one was quite good, maybe slightly too sweet.
Redish brown colour with creamy light brown head. Aroma of plums, bananas, similar is the flavour. Drinkable beer.

Pours a hazy copper brown with a fairly decent sized eggshell head that settles to a thick ring and leaves some spotty, soapy lace. Nose involves brown banana bread, cocoa, leafy herbal hops, stone fruit, brown sugar, and spicy yeasty notes. Fairly sweet, fairly bitter. Medium to light bodied, toasty, active, fluffy, with a drying herbal bitter finish. Equal parts refreshing and dessert-like. Nice brew.

From bottle. Pours a good size frothy beige head and has a hazy amber appearance. Pretty good lacing, sticky. Aromas of malts, yeast and light spices. Flavours are mostly malty, some sweetness and light caramel notes. Hints of toffee and toasted malts as well. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Fairly good retention. Pretty good stuff overall.
Opaque light brown in colour with a substantial head that hangs around. Taste of candied orange and malt. Very smooth and balanced.
Strong and maintained aroma - bananas. High carbonation gives light tan thick head over cloudy, medium dark amber body. No ting on tongue - Nice feel and good aftertaste. Very nice.

500ml bottle into mug. Minneapolis. Part of a three part dunkel tasting 

Pours dark amber, cloudy, light tan head. Some sediment. Really pretty. 

Aroma is toffee, toasty, plum, yeast, grains. Really nice. 

Taste is mostly on the sweet side. Less so than Ayinger. Nicely balanced.

Body is medium. Carbonation is a little more lively, slightly sharp. Finish is medium length. 

Overall, I really appreciate the yeasty nature of this beer.

Strong aroma of ripe banana and bread with coriander spice. Banana bread. 
Pours a hazy dark Amber color with lasting creamy white head
A bit oxidized in flavor. Still getting bread and banana with subtle yeast spiciness.
Medium bodied with high CO2, dry with lingering yeasty finish.
Other excellent beer from this brewery. If only I could get it fresh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A copper dunkel hefeweißbier with high creamy head. Aroma is yeasty, fruity, banana, light caramel, light roasted. Taste is sweet and light bitter.
This beer has balanced, mild taste and distinctive yeast note. Aftertaste is strong and a bit astringent.

Extremely foamy. Dark cloudy brown and orange. Wheat and old banana aroma. Fairly sweet and lightly acidic with banana nut bread and cloves. Flavor is more complex but difficult to describe. Medium bodied with oily texture.

Nice murky brown with a big white head and soft carbonation. It has malt sweetness and some caramel. The flavor is bready malts, overripe bananas, spices, burned malts and yeast. I like it. I prefer the Vitus but this one is very good as well.

The beer pours an opaque chestnut color with a large, pillowy ivory head that fades slowly. The aroma has a nice fusion of heavy banana and wheat with light clove and nuttiness; the taste is mildly sweet and a touch bitter with an aftertaste that is sweet banana with lightly roasted peanuts. The palate has a medium-full body, soft carbonation, and a thick texture.
Dark colour, large creamy head. Banana, malt and some yeast. Medium body. Taste is malty and sweet. Nice bitterness. Well balanced. Great beer
500 mL bottle. Murky medium brown pour, thin cap of tan bubbles. Wheat aroma, some banana, bubblegum. Taste is doughy, cereal, spice. Very enjoyable.
Frisch gezapft. Dunkelbraun und naturtrüb. Grosse Schaumkrone. Malziges Aroma, ganz leicht süss.

Based on the other reviews here, Im thinking my bottle may have been out of date. Pours a crystal clear brown/amber with an explosive light tan head. Aroma is yeasty banana and caramel. Taste is light sugary caramel with a slightly astringent finish and virtually no hops.

A storm day, tucked away indoors, makes this Germanic treat all the more tasty. Fine in appearance, it is a cloudy brownish orange with a foamy and ample ivory tusk. Light yogurt zing, bubblegum, spices, earth and brown bread stimulate the nostrils. An actively effervescent body carries the subtle flavours across the breadth of the tongue. The heads a-lastin and this beer is a blastin. A fine sipper to make any day a sleepy Sunday.

Bottle. Booths, Ilkley. Murky, pale brown. Big, bubbly, lasting, off white head. Nice, marzipan type sweetness to this. Yeasty, banana esters. Brown sugar. Tastes soft sweet, light dry, and a little yeasty. Soft, airy palate. Massaging carbonation. Finishes light sweet, with a light dry close.
Bottle. Teacher says it is slightly oxidized. I get slight clove, bubblegum, dark fruits, and caramelized malts in the aroma. Taste is sweet, finishing dry.
Karamellig, malzig, Hefenoten, Gewürze. Körper etwas dünn/leicht wässrig, malzig, süß, hefig.
Pours a brown colour. Taste is of bananas and bubblegum. Best German beer in a while
Pours a hazy brown color. Aroma and taste are bready malts, bananas, and wheat.
Färgen är brun/röd grumlig med litet skum. Doftar lite rökigt och smakar som en bra weissbier
A taste of cereal and floral. Nice brown color, hazy, minimal head. Lightly bitter aftertaste, full body, creamy, soft carbonation. Very nice beer, but liked the normal Weihenstephaner hefe better.

Orangée, voilée. Mousse beige claire. Beaux lacings.
Au nez léger toastage, blé. Banane et clou de girofle. Sur le sucré. Complexe et balancée.
En bouche sucrée et fruite, banane. Léger toastage, pas damertume. Pas mal, mais déçu par le peu de longueur. Bouche très brève...
Smell is yeast, plums, toffee. Acidic taste, smooth body. Refreshing, but nothing special.

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Aspecto: Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Dunkel 50cl tiene un color marrón oscuro
- Aroma: plátano, clavo y especias, 
- Cuerpo / Sabor: dulce malteada con cuerpo, con final de vainilla

TIPO DE CERVEZA: Dunkelweizen
500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy amber colour with generous white head. Aroma is banana, clove, malt. Taste is banana, bread, malt.

Bottle at Black Fox. Deep ruby body with a thin off-white head. Light lacing. Aroma of crushed red apple, toffee and lightly roasted malt. Flavour of mushy red apple, yeast and candy. Medium body with a powdery texture. Fizzy. A real treat - a lovely Dunkelweizen.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Jeg går hen og bliver afhængig af øl fra dette bryggeri. At ord er nok: WAUV
Nice dunkel. Taste malty, buscuit, some bitter taste and acidic aftertaste. Easy drinking.

Butelka 0,5 l.
Kolor jasno brązowy - mętny.
Piana brązowa obfita drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa utrzymuje się długo.
Bardzo ładna koronka pozostawiana na szkle.
W zapachu dominuje banan, słód, drożdże oraz toffi.
Smak słodowo-bananowy.

50cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 5,3%
Uitgeschonken in Jupiler Tauro glas

Uiterlijk: koperbruin met volle luchtige schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: caramel, kandijsuiker, fruitig als banaan, zoet

Conclusie: iets te zoet, maar wel smakelijk

Pours with, naturally, a lot of head. Smell is yeasty, slight banana notes, pleasant. Taste is carbonated at first, but quicklz evolves in to a fruity-weizen taste, that is truly splendid. A very good beer!
Flaska Bishops arms örebro. Ljusbrun oklar vätska med stort vitt skum. Frisk doft av bröd och unga äpplen. Len och trevlig smak av äpple, torkad frukt, vanilj och Sirapslimpa
A decent dunkel. Pours a nice bright redbroth a grey head. Smells. of fruit and malt. Taste has lots of banana and cloves, with a malty finish. Had in the bottle.

Bottle to hefe glass. Nice wheat aroma. The taste is a super solid wheat beer with added maltiness. Awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle into a tulip. From notes.

A: Pours a hazy dark brown color. The head is a roughly-textured one finger heavy cream shade, featuring poor retention and no lacing. Not one of the prettier weizens Ive encountered.

S: The typical weizen melange is here - banana, cloves, wheat, and noble hops, with the cloves being the most dominant note by a hair. Once it warms up a hair, caramel and brown sugar notes appear. Certainly a very good aroma, just not quite as inviting as their standard weizen.

T: It starts with pleasant notes of caramel and wheat, before its ester character (cloves, mostly) and ever-so-slight hoppiness finishes it off. While its pretty damn simple, everything is in near-perfect balance, creating a fairly effortless brew.

M: While its a bit sweeter than their standard weizen, its still fizzy, light, and easy to drink. The body here seems to be fuller in texture, as well. As such, this is slightly more decadent-feeling.

O: Make no mistake, this really hits the spot in all the right ways. This is yet another solid offering from Weihenstephaner.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Merky brown appearance with a solid, beige head. Mild, malty aroma. Lacking initial taste but picks itself up at the back of the tongue. Sweet, full taste with a mild palate. The bavarians know how to do this. Drank it from a proper weissbier glass the second time around. That helped...

500 ml bottle. Unclear brown body with a decent, lacing off-white head. Aroma has caramel, banana, hint of bubblegum, light toast and some spices like cloves. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, fruity yeast, hint of toast, banana and spices. Fine balanced body and decent aftertaste. A nice one indeed.

Pours a dark, cloudy brown with off white head. Nose has a lot of banana, clove, wheat, spice and sticky caramel. Taste is predominantly banana, clove, wheat and sweet fruits. Some caramel malts, but a decent yeasty/bread like finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy brown beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: bread domination with caramel and malt notes. Taste: nice work on malt notes of caramel and black bread. Really nice taste good job! Aftertaste: notes of caramel. Good dunkel beer, nice by the style.
Lovely stuff. Chestnut brown with a lasting white head and good lacing. Medium, frothy body. Banana, clove and malts on the nose, these plus bread in the taste. Enjoyed that a lot.
Plum and blueberries on the nose and a grassy, bready backbone with hints of aforementioned plum and blueberry, finishes dry. Solid as expected.

Aroma pugent dried sweet bananas, cant help but feeling it is a bit artificial. Nice colour, tast like the artificial sweet dried bananas which overpowers the beer. I dont know how this could be rated so high....

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Poured from bottle. Aroma of malt and candy. Cloudy brown with thick lacing head. Flavors of wheat, caramel, smoke, marshmallow and yeast.  Has a citrus presence that I didnt notice last time.  Great beer on par with its lighter colored cousin.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Pours brown, murky body, thickish latte coloured head. Aroma has banana, grain and a hint of cherry. Sweet taste at first, has some candylike flavours. Turns toward bitter and malty near the end. Mouthfeel is slick and a bit foamy due to the carbonation. Very enjoyable and easy to drink.

Pours amber-to-light-brown, cloudy, 1 and 1/2 inches of pinkish-light-tan head with moderate rate of decay to 2mm frothy residual layer. Aroma is multigrain bread, tart wheat beer flavor, light cloves, maybe even a bit of lactic. Body is light, fairly watery, but with fat carbonation presence accompanied by considerable burn. Overall, a soft blanket feel despite wateriness. Flavor is light grain, a tad bit sweet, like a desert bread, bread crust, hint of spice (less clove though...) As I taste, the relatively simple flavor is made more complex by the noticeable aroma. A very nice, dunkelweizen with a pleasantly simple flavor profile. Lots of breadiness and lack of flaws are chief merits.
Strong wheat taste. Very strong malty body. In comclusion: a very nourishing dark wheat beer.
Praktycznie bez goryczki, wyczuwalna pszenica, banany, lekkie biszkopty. Mętne z drobinami osadu, piana kremowa, przyzwoita, w smaku pełne. Ogólnie zgadzam się z człowiekwiadro :D
Mouais. Quand meme plus de caractère que la original mais ca reste pas fabuleux. Très très moyen.
shared 50cl botte. poured a darker brown colour with a tanned head. chocolate, banana, caramel malt, wheat, yeast, some toffee, malts, pretty tasty
A solid choice of beer, nothing off, just a nice and pleasent beer, but lacking the truly spectaculaire. Nice maltiness and ripe banana aromas.
Pul in paultje van de tap. Mooi troebel amber bruin . dik schuim. Licht zurige geur. Vrij weinig smaak helaas
Banana! Cloves and malty. Nice off white head and very nice mouthfeel. One of my all time favourite Weissbiers.

Bottled from Booths Penrith.  Pleasant sweet clove and banana aroma and taste. Pours a nice looking hazy dark amber colour, has a great malt and biscuit palate, with fruit and soft warming gingery notes and faint aniseed. Finish is fruit cake and yeast, fine bready notes.
Bottle from Booths in Ripon. Pours murky brown with some off-white froth. Starts quite sharp before malt notes with brown sugar, citrus, banana and cinnamon. Nice
500ml bottle. Worth to try! Sorry, my computer is dead. Tasting notes are coming soon!!

przyjemny zapach, goździki, lekki banan i guma balonowa, kwiaty. kolor wody z kałuży, poważnie zmętniony, z kawałkami zbitego osadu, piana kremowa, dość przyzwoita. w smaku pełny, słodki, kwaskowy, praktycznie bez goryczki, wyczuwalna pszenica, banany, lekkie biszkopty. pozostawia dość kwaśne uczucie w ustach.
Tap @ Taphouse, Copenhagen 24/10-14. Aroma: Yeast, estery, banana. Taste: Dito. Body is medium, the finish is a bit watery.

Cloudy dark brown-amber color with large fluffy head. Bananas, yeasts, malts & toffee (but not too much) in the aroma. Fruity-refreshing malty-bananaish taste. Smooth mouthfeel, easy to drink. Just as balanced as the standard Hefeweizen, but I like this style a bit more.

Tap @ Taphouse, Copenhagen 141024. Estery and wheaty with fruity notes and a light sweetness, banana, low carbonation, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter, wheaty and estery.
This is one of my favorite. As a dunkelweizen, this one is the best. Dark and hazy with a big head. Taste of toffee and roasted malt. Great beer at all.

Brown/orange opaque brew with a small white head. Honey, cereal, floral hops banana and some light spice. Taste is mainly sweet at first, with some bitterness in the later stage. Fizzy with a sticky texture. Long finish.

Bottle at home, 19th October 14. Pours a huge annoying head, pretty carbonated, the beer is dark. Aroma is a little banana and yeast, some sweetness. Taste is a watery banana, yeasty blend with a little spice, not bad

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle poured in its own weizen glass.
A - Big fluffy bubbled aired tan head. Good retention and many lacings formed and left in the glass. Cloudy chestnut color
S - Smells pretty much like a hefeweizen: The combination of banana and cloves and also very bready to the nose. The difference is the sweet caramel and honey in the end. Delicious
T - The taste is much more toffee caramel, caramel malts and roasted malts. Some banana esters and brown bread. Very light bitterness
M - Medium and bit molasses body. Medium carbonation. Dry taste and light bitterness. Very pleasant and drinkable
O - Delicious as expected from a Weihenstephaner. Refreshing and delicious
[ BA Review @ 6/11/2011 ]

Aroma: wheat, grains. Appearance: hazy brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: malty sweets coming up after initial sweets. Overall: nice Dunkekweizen. Pint at Big Brew, Morristown.
Pours a cloudy light brown, with a pillowy white head. Aroma includes notes of banana, cloves, and spices. Tasting notes include banana, fruits, spices, and is quite dry. Not bad at all!

Bottle pour. Pours a really cloudy caramel color with a mild banana bread like aroma. Soft caramel and banana flavors with a nice malty background. Semi wheat finish as expected. Interesting beer here. Enjoyed this for sure.

Aroma pugent dried sweet bananas, cant help but feeling it is a bit artificial. Nice colour, tast like the artificial sweet dried bananas which overpowers the beer. But interesting enough and 5.2 gives it a little, how you say in English, a little bang bang? I dont know how this could be rated so high, its interesting but imagine if this beer was the norm, and you drank it all the time, then even Fosters lager would taste good.

Pours a Hazy deep amber colour with one finger of white head. 
Aroma of Caramel and yeast.
Taste: Caramel, banana, yeast with a crisp finish.High carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2015 Nice! I found this one rather by accident, and it has a nice, sort of peach-ey aroma and flavor that complements the roast malts nicely. Very, very drinkable, easily a happily sessionable beer. Very nice. Would definitely consider again the next time Im in the mood for bavarian dunkelweiss.

---

Re-rated 09/12/15, this time on tap: All the same but better. Strong notes of peach and banana, and this is still a great go-to for dunkel. Yum!
Rather low on flavors, although showing some of the characteristic banana notes. Mid to aftertaste is a bit watery and somewhat disappointing.
Bottle. Cloudy, amber, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, flat, & astringent finish.

It has a deep hazy orange amber body with visible carbonation. A quick pour fills the glass with foam. After a minute to settle I very slowly finished pouring and ended up with a nice three finger head. The light beige head hangs on well and makes lots of cool lace patterns on the glass. Big German yeast notes rush up to fill my nose. The aroma is all about the classic banana notes with some mild clove and bready sweet malt. The best way to describe this beer is that is like banana bread with nuts and chocolate chips. The palate is a firm medium body with nice active carbonation.
Solid. Pours cloudy orange brown with an off white head. Aroma is banana / caramel. Medium to full body, very smooth, slightly tart finish.

Classic Bavarian Dunkelweizen with rocky, cream white head and warm golden brown colour, hazy as expected. Gentle, complex bouquet of pear, banana, plums, chocolate, bready yeast; velvety palate, soft and fruity, nutty and chocolatey malts, subtle and elegant wheat sourishness in the finish with a brief, mild hop accent. Exemplary.
This is a swampy little hefeweissbier. Sweet but not too sweet. I dont normally like banana bread, but this is what I wish it tasted like. Is there a better example of the style?
Dark brown color with a big long lasting white foamy head. Aroma is sweet with notes of chocolate, banana and malt. The taste is also sweet with notes of caramel, cinnamon and malt.
Aromes de pa i plàtan, també hi trobo pera, briox, sucre, llaminadura i acidesa. En boca destaca mes el malt que el llevat que es mostra amb un final especiat.

Bottle. Light tan. Big banana clove spice with rich malts, toast, wheat. Low carb. Sugary aftertaste. Decent, not my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark honey colour, large creamy head. Aroma is banana, malt and some yeast. Medium body. Taste is malty and sweet, also banana. Nice bitterness. Well balanced. Another great beer Weihenstephaner.

Draught 50 cl.
Light brown, with a formidable white head. Banana, malt and wheat. Flavour adds bread and yeast. Overall, very well done.
Bottle bought at the Weihenstephaner bottle shop at the brewery in Freising/Germany. Overall a delicious hefeweizen dunkel with a lot of caramel and cocoa. Very refreshing and tasty.

Bottle. Pours opaque tea brown with medium white foamy head. Aroma is malt, banana, cloves, yoghurt and yellow winegums. Taste is light acidic, medium sweet and light bitter. Body is light milky and light chalky with sparkling carbonation. Finish is sweet and a bit short with notes of caramel, malt, brown sugar, banana, pineapple and spice. Well balanced.

Love this easy drinking beer. A little bit more complexity compared to the "regular" weißbeer. Nice banana aroma. Flavor has the same with a touch of dark malt. A bit of gum and allspice as well. So smooth. I like this.
Bottle. Color hazy brown with white head. Aroma of riped banana. Taste of banana, malts,sweet and sour same time and afterwards little bitterness. Medium body. Well balanced. Great beer.
Bottle. Brown color with a hint of orange. Light beige big and creamy head. Body light to medium. Light to medium carbonation. Ok.

I really enjoyed this beer. I love weissbier dunkel and I wished more breweries would bottle it. Usually they just make it as a seasonal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy light brown color, huge off white creamy head. Aroma of wheat, banana and hazelnuts. Medium body, average carbonation. Medium sweet taste. Finish is slightly dry with strong banana presence. Very good dunkelweizen.

Cloudy brown color, huge off-white head. Banana aroma. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice and sweet. Hints of sourness. Banana finish. 
(Za Popent 0,5l bottle)
Brown, clody with nice yellow head. Banana, dry hay mild sour in the aroma. Malt, banana toffee, mild bitterness in the aftertaste.

On tap. served a dark brown decent tan head with some lacing. Aroma of malt, bit of citrus and fruit. taste of malt and some fruit sweetness. Nice bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, smooth and nicely balanced. Enjoyable beer for the style.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: hazy dark blond beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: malts, little smoked, bananas.
TASTE: malts, quite fruity, mostly bananas. Decent, but not my style of beer.
Pours brown with thick off-brown head. Aroma of bananas with some sugar and spice. Tastes of the same. Refreshing and flavourful. Nice.

Drunk from 50cl bottle at hotel in St Wolfgang, Austria. Pleasant dark wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Lazy Dog. Pours a hazy brown with some tan head. Taste and aroma of malts, yeast, and bananas.
Pours nice caramel cloudy color with big white head. Aroma of banana, bread, malt, wheat. Light body.

Pours a dark honey brown with huge, frothy head. Bready sweet malts, hints of honey and caramel on the nose. Highly carbonated, bready flavors, honey, wheat, and caramel. Very sweet, refreshing summer beer.
Cloudy brown red pour with a big pale brown head. Toasty, caramel, some banana and spice aromas. Taste is malty, spicy, caramel, banana lollies. Not bad
Kobberfarge med et hvit skum som varte lenge. Aroma av malt, hvete og banan. Smaken følger aroma, ettersmaken er god og varer en kort stund.

1 pint, 0.9oz. bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours a rich brown with ruby undertones with a tall cream colored head that has good retention and some lacing. 

Smell is of sweet roasted malt, picking up some fruit like banana from the yeast, as well as clove and faint hops.

Taste is similar to the smell, sweet malt up front, with banana and clove in the finish with slight spiciness present throughout. Mouthfeel is highly carbonated and soft, some creaminess as well. 

Overall, one of the best Dunkels out there and is always good to have some on hand.
Mild and smooth; everything you want in a dunkel. Tastes of Carmel and split pea soup. Nice amber color. Frothy head.
Jó kis búzasör. Érdemes egyszer (többször) megkóstolni, itthon nem sok féle kapható még.

Colore ambrato scuro, torbido. Schiuma persistente (rimane sempre un po di schiuma nel bicchiere) e leggermente giallognola. Aroma molto leggero, fresco e leggermente maltato, in bocca si sente il maltato, anche se leggero, nonché anche un leggero acidulo. Lamaro è quasi inesistente. Si sente la freschezza dellorzo. Corpo leggero. Non dà particolari emozioni, ma in una calda giornata estiva, sicuramente disseta parecchio.
Hard to imagine a much better Dunkelweizen could exist. Nice malty sweetness, mushy bananas, clove, easy to drink, very tasty.
Bottle from Old School Cocktail Bar. Poured dark brown orange with decent white head. Aroma of banana and caramel. Light carb med bod. Taste heavier then aroma. Classic.

500 ml. bottle sampled @ Barley Legal Tasting Room. Thanks to Kraddel! Reddish dark amber, tanned head. Smell is pure fish guts mixed with lots of brown sugar & brown banana. Taste is same, lots of fish guts, bread, oodles of brown sugar, sweet spices, brown banana. Very fizzy. Far too much fish guts for my liking maybe age can get rid of that but for now as it is fresh, this is far too much.

Bottle at barely legal tasting room 
Pours rather dark amber , small white foam . 
Smell is german malts . 
Too high carbo 
Taste is german yeast . Not my thing ,..
Bottle. Cloudy brown color witha really nice off white head. Roasted grains with cloves and bananas in both aroma and taste.
hazy brown with a cream colored head that persists. aroma is roasted malts and yeast. Flavor is roasted malt, bread, and banana.

Reviewed from notes.
This was poured into a weizen glass.
The appearance had a nice dark brown color with a three finger white foamy head that moderately dissipated and left a great deal of foamy white lacing sticking finely to the glass.
The smell had a wonderful amount of sweet sticky chocolate to coat over some light banana along with some sweet German malts. I also get some light cinnamon as the beer warms up a bit.
The taste took all of those previously mentioned flavors to town and made a super nice sweet yet still had that slight cinnamon spice underneath.
On the palate, this one sat right at a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about this one. The carbonation was good for the style and for me as it was just right on par all around.
Overall, what a nice dunkelweizen well worth having again.
Bottle. Dark Brown Body with light tan head. Typical fruity (bananas) Aroma. Taste is malty with some yeast and some dark caramel. Aftertaste ist malty sweet with light bitterness.
Bottle at home. Hazy Brown with a large beige head, ok lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted) and yeasty (banana). Flavor medium sweet and fruity. Medium body. Nice.
Aroma of roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, sweetness, wheaty and somewhat yeasty. A good beer to try.

50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is hazy dark brown, with medium initial head, but constant. Aroma is very strong to cloves, some yeast, bread and banana. Medium carbonation and medium body. Taste is low sweet and low bitterness. Aftertaste is short and low sweetness. Expected much better...
An excellent dunked from a solid German brewery. An excellent beer to cheer on Germany as they took on Portugal in the 2014 World Cup!
Poured from a 500ml bottle, swirled last bit to rouse sediment. The aroma is subtle, yeast, banana, clove, bready. The flavor is clove, spicy, bready, malty, light banana. Solid beer.
Barna ködös, zavaros, iszapos, élesztős, frissen, no carbonation. Well-balanced, finom és ízlelőbimbópecektető.

1 pint, .9oz bottle. Weissbier yeasty/ banana on the nose . Pours hazy brown as expected., retains thin head after pouring and for several minutes. Classic taste...malt/wheat, fruity esters. For finish, mouthfeel seemed a bit thin, but not too much.
This is pretty damn solid and good. Bready aroma and smooth rich bready flavor. Really damn good.

50cl shared bottle @ home from Mitra. Hazy deep amber color, strong big creamy off-white head. Aroma tropical fruit and caramel in the nose, flavor is cereal, slightly citric, pie, banana, green tea. Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, hint of sourness. Medium body, creamy and sticky texture, soft to medium carbonation, fruity-sweetish finish. Easy to drink, very refreshing, a bit too sweet for me.

Appearance: Cloudy brown color with a off white head. Nice lace.Aroma: Balanced bready, yeast and banana.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Rich to average carbonation.Taste: Bready, yeast, wheat, fruity and banana.Overall impression: Lovely tasty dunkel weisse.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with kaaz
Bottle. Pours a very cloudy light brown, with an off white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, ans spices. Flavor is light malt, spices, wheat, and yeast.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light brown with a long lasting, huge off-white head. Sweet aroma with notes of banana, wheat, roasted malt and light yeast. Sweet flavour with notes of banana, roasted malt, wheat and yeast. Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation. A very good dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Appearance: Dark golden brown, slight reddish hues, cloudy as all good wheat beer are. Good head about three fingers worth when first poured. A small head stays throughout drinking.

Aroma: Beautiful malty smell, a sweet apple/bread aroma that finishes off with a spicy-ness.

Taste: Medium body, very flavorful. You first pick up a clove and nice twang taste from this beer. There is a bit of bitterness to it but it is balanced out with the flavor of banana and caramel.

Mouth feel: Very smooth and creamy, perfect amount of carbonation. Very crisp and clean tasting.


If you like Dark hefeweissbeirs this is an excellent choice. I will never turn one of these down

Serving type: bottle

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Really nice beer. Really good clove and spice notes. Only real weakness is taste lacks a bit of depth -- but then again pretty much all wheat beers do. One of the better wheat beers I have had.
Dark orange with a light tan head. Malty with a touch of nuts and caramel. Not too sweet. Hints of orange and banana. Very nice and balanced.

Another fine example of its kind. Not my favorite style, but one I try and treat with the respect Im sure it deserves. To me the tastes are that of bread, cloves and koriander (banana). It is fairly sweet and caramel tinged, and I would have liked it if it could have had a bit more hoppy bitterness. Good body, I often think beers like these are a bit "watery".
Hard to track everything going on in this brew, but the bananas and cloves are definitely there (softly) with a smooth, light sweetness. Everything Ive ever had from this brewery has been a delight.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Bottle pours hazy brown with big pillowy beige head. Aromas are banana, caramel, bready yeast, herbs. Light-medium bitter, medium sweet. Medium-full body. Decent dunkel, I like it.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Murky brown color with a smooth, creamy ivory head. Banana, clove and spice aromas with a vanilla ending. Sweet malts taste and a robust medium body.

Bottle. Dark amber, hazy body with small head.
Aroma: Quite intense, bread, bananas, grain, some caramel.
Medium sweetness, some sourness, no bitterness. 
Wheat harshness in mouthfeel, high carbonation.
Very good.

Pours the color of an old penny with minimum clarity and big off-white head. Aroma is almost non-existant with a touch of malt coming through. Very creamy mouthfeel. Taste is herbal with a light sweetness and minute hops in the very abrupt finish. Drinkable, but not what I was hoping for.
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2015 Amazing! Perfect hot weather brew. Delicious classic weissbier flavor heavily malted, mint, banana, and thick creaminess. Nicely carbonated and very refreshing.
On tap. Hazy dark orange body, beige head. Aroma of banana, toast, caramel and ripe pear. Taste of banana, toast, ripe apples, cinnamon and pepper. Creamy texture. Nice beer.

Bona cervesa, amb gust a pa torrat, densa i amb molt bona presència.
Buena cerveza, con sabor a pan tostado, densa y con muy buena presencia.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy amber, big white head. Not as dunkel as I?d expected! Aromas of banana and spice, yeast esters and bread. Taste is more banana, sweet caramel, light herbal hops. Creamy texture, slightly sticky finish. Good.

0,5 l bottle. Unclear dark orange or nearly brown in the glass. Nice light tanned head. Sweet banana and yeast on the nose. Starts the same with a little bit cloves, slightly dry bitterness in the aftertaste. Hints auf sulfur. Nice one.

Bottle. Hazy bronze, two fingers. Aroma of light caramel malt and banana, some light funk. Palate is a little foamy, a little watery. Herbs, banana, light sweetness followed by slight bitterness and dryness on the end.

Pours hazy amber with significant head. Clove on the very front with a subtle bit of bubblegum and some homemade banana bread if you really get your nose into it. Banana wheat tang on the front end bit, bread crust follows and theres a mild but identifiable hop bitterness right at the end. High carbonation, medium body but very creamy.
I liked this beer a lot. Tasty, nice feel and good initial and after taste.

(Bottle) Clear amber brown with big dense white head. Pleasant subtle aroma, mainly banana ester. Medium body with plentiful soft carbonation. Nice balance between sharper fruity wheat flavours and the caramel malt. An excellent beer.

Bottle, 500ml. A golden brown colour with a large head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, spice, yeast. Flavour has wheat, some roasted malt, yeast, fresh orange, a little spice, sweet caramel. Fairly sweet, high carbonation.
50cl from supremo cristal. dark gold color with medium head. Medium bitterness. Low sweetness. Wheat, coffee aroma. Expected better...

Color caoba con espuma color crema. Aromas afrutados y dulces. En boca es ligera y bien carbonatada con un inicio dulce y afrutado al que se añaden toques ácidos qy que acaba en un final seco. Muy rica.

Bottle. In Florida. Poured a cloudy dark brown with medium full head. Aroma is caramel, grains, light fruit. Light sweetness. Great mouthfeel. Average carbonation. Slight candy and maybe banana. Great stuff. Easy to drink. Caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2014 A very thick head with spices and banana taste. Easy drinking beer, enjoyable.
One of the most delicious dunkles weissbier I have so far been drinking. Very pleasant yeast flavor and refreshing bitter with the characteristic flavors of banana and brown sugar.

Pours mahogany with big beige head, that slowly dissapates leaving a small half-finger film. Aroma is BOLD over-ripe banana, bread, yeast, clove. Standard fare but loud. Really enticing.
Medium body, fairly creamy a little dry in the finish. Over-ripe banana replicated in the taste. A little clove and caramel-malt, but nothing eccentric. Heavy drinking but a delicious meal. Almost as good as it gets for Dunkels/hefes.

Pours 2" off white head which dissipates quickly leaving low/moderate lacing. Liquid is hazy amber-brown. Gentle aroma of grains. Well balanced taste but all subdued with clean finish with mildly bitter and bready yeast aftertaste. Good drinkability and overall a very enjoyable example of a dark weissbier.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark pour with spices & banana on the nose & taste. Very easy to drink & satisfying.

Look: Pours with large, very thick, billowy, off-white (yellow hue) head. It has a beautiful, slow retention that leaves medium sized, creamy, thick layer on the top. It stays till the end and leaves fair amount of lacing. Colour is cloudy, creamy toffee, caramel, like milk chocolate sundae shake - delicious. Also lots of active carbonation, lots of bubbly chains. 


Smell: Clove and banana classic. Bit peppery, fresh sweet peeled apples, red earth. Grain, wheat, hay with light darker malt sweetness, hints of caramel and milk chocolate most obvious. 


Taste: Clove and banana with some spice lead the way; also yeasty character gets some ground. Dry apples, light sour. Medium sweet middle, mostly grain/wheat - light caramel sweetness doesnt come out until in the aftertaste. Good balance of clove, banana and pepper play in the after - wouldnt expect anything different from Weinhenstephan. Some light noble hops at the end too. 


Mouthfeel: Light crisp start, this lively carbonation suits it well. Smooth and creamy medium light heavy body. 


Overall: Not that different from the classical hefeweissbier, superb yet relatively simple play of the classical banana clove formation, that looks and feel good. Expected a bit more contribution from the darker malts tho.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 Aroma is esters, banana and some floral grain and lemon grass. Taste is a sweet rich maltiness with some light bitterness. Slightly cloudy brown body with a well retained head.

Shared a 50cl bottle from Ruppert (Luxembourg). Pours a hazy light brown colour with a tan fluffy head. Aroma is banana, clove, yeast and light chewing gum. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is well balanced between bitter and sweet with a sweet finish. Overall, a very drinkable beer. Good!
Simply a good dunkel beer. Lots of sweet in the nose, fruity taste, but not a very long finish. A good beer to start an evening of with. .
Darker malts give this dunkleweizen a more toasty, robust flavor, which compliments the banana and clove notes, and the wheaty, slightly fruity aroma and taste. Nice
Arômes de graines torréfiées, malt et céréales au palais. Couleur marron. Une super bonne bière !

This is definitely not my favorite dunkel. The aroma is very metallic. The taste is someone metallic but this dissipates as it warms. It has a pretty light amber color with a modest white head. Drinks smooth.
Light amber pour with a thick white head. Metallic aroma is a turn off. Taste is fruity and grainy. Its a dunkel definitely. Not a bad beer but nothing that blows me away.

Bottle, 0.50l. Hazy amber brown color with large frothy off-white head, good lacing and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, caramel and mildly roasted malt. Taste starts with moderate sweet biscuit and caramel malt, follows refreshing yeasty, grainy with banana notes and mild bitter finish. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation in palate. I could drink it every day, although I would add a bit more carbonation...

Bottle, 0,5l. Pours hazy brown color with beautiful creamy, tan head. Typical weizen aroma, lots of banana and dough and a bit of caramel. unique rich wheat flavor, full of bananas. Full bodied, medium carbonation and a nice long aftertaste. One of the best beers I had so far.
A nice rusty brown opacity with thick off white head. Spicy, malty, and herby. Tastes great, a hefty hey!

Keg Half Pint at White Horse European Beer Festival 2012, Parsons Green, London in Aug 2012 - Cloudy light brown in colour. Yeasty, wheaty and spicy (cloves). Malty; sweet bready malts, wheat, buttery caramel, hint of chocolate. Fruity; banana and apple. Decent. Very drinkable.

Pours a hazy chestnut brown with a massive thick and foamy off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit and maple/clove.  Taste is mildy sweet banana biscuit and roasted malt with notes of clove. Earthy clove aftertaste. Solid body and thick mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Another solid offering from a great old brewery.
From bottle. Dark brown with sizable white head. Aroma is dark fruit, corn flakes. Less sweet than typical hefeweissen, with caramel notes, clean bitter bursts. Effervescent.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, röstmalzig, Karamell, dunkle Früchte. Geschmack hefig, würzig malzig, dunkle Früchte.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Pours a dark brown with a white head. Smells of fruits and a touch of chocolate and toffee. Medium heavy mouthfeel. Taste is perfect balance between the hefe bananas/cloves and the chocolate malts. One of my favorites.

Bomber poured into Weizen glass. Appears dark gold/amber with off white, pillowy, 2 finger head. Not much smell, just bubblegum. The taste was a simple bubblegum front with a banana back. The palate is medium and it feels smooth. This beer is not bad, just ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy reddish-brown little bit of orange with bright white head. Color fades from top to bottom, dark to light. Aroma of banana, malt, wheat, yeast and clove. Taste is more subtle but same.

500 mml Bottle tasted at home on 26/02/2014. Clear brown ale colour. Banana and aroma in the taste. Medium body with mid carbonation. Nice white head consistent. Medium sweet and nice paladar. Next one please!
Dialing up the dark malts on this one results in a fairly good alternative to the base hefe - but I still like that one better
50 cl. flaske. 5,3%. En mørk weiz øl. Lidt tynd sjappet smag efter min mening.

On the pour, a clear deep amber colour, impressive head, creamy in consistency, lace in fine sheets to coat the glass. Malt nose, clean, fresh, crisp, the front semi-sweet, top skimpy, the finish has a pleasing carbonation, daintily hopped, doughy aftertaste. The whole Weihenstephaner line of beers are quite drinkable, and well worth the time and effort to sample.

Pour is much more of a copper colour with a nice head. Aroma is fairly strong, weizen spice with more caramel as well. Good balance with the malty biscuit and caramel and the more normal weizen notes like banana. Nice beer, but not quite as quaffable as the hefeweizen.

Cloudy with a dark honey like colour and loads of carbonation. Banana and cloves and estery goodness en masse but there is a hint of roast/maple like quality. On the palate it is creamy with estery goodness and a bit of syrop like flavour from the yeast and a finish that is lighter and sweet. Very good sipper.
From bottle, pours brown with an off-white head. Roasty malty aroma. Rich flavor of roasted malts and caramel, fruit, yeast. Delicious.

Banana-like yeast aroma, and a little clove and lemon, and doughy malt. A lot of clove in the flavor, plus the banana. Sweet, biscuit, dough malt; subtle light caramel/toffee aftertaste. Really nice yeast and malt flavors--and well balanced between them.

Interesting brown color for a heffe. Nice head and lacing. Smelled a bit off, slightly unpleasant. Too much carbonation. Maybe chilled too much. Not much taste, yeast, cloves, but no bubblegum or banana for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,5 l, flaske, 5,3 % ABV, købt i Netto på Roskildevej i Valby, 30. januar 2014.
Mørk karamelfarvet tysk hvedeøl med ca. 4 cm tyk skumkrone, offwhite-farvet. 
Syrlig duft af abrikos og passionsfrugt. 
Sur/bitter smag med lidt bitterhed i eftersmagen, som dog også er lidt "vandet". 
Normalt indhold af kulsyre for en hvedeøl. 
En okay mørk hvedeøl, men Indslevs er bedre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at YardHouse Boise. Murky light orange tan with a small sandy head. Soft malty fruity aroma and flavor. Very smooth and mellow. Some classic banana and light toasts malts. Low carbonation and full smooth feel Very tasty!

Pours a dark, cloudy brown with 2 fingers of creamy, off white head. Decent lacing. Nose has a lot of banana, clove, wheat, spice and sticky caramel. Mouth is once again predominantly banana, clove, wheat and sweet fruits. Some caramel malts, but a decent yeasty/bread like finish. As with the Weihenstephaner Hefeweizen, this is my favorite Dunkelweizen.

DATE TASTED: January 11, 2014... GLASSWARE: Weihenstephaner weizen glass...OCCASION: n unseasonably warm January night... APPEARANCE: cloudy brown, iced tea-colored body; thick, blanketing off-white head that settles with strength; lacing is nonexistent?... AROMA: dampened wheat esters; suppressed citrus sits below fragrant bubblegum; an extra malty presence manifests as dough... PALATE: soft, almost fizzy, warming--and highly drinkable; a six-pack of bombers seems possible!...TASTE: doughy, bready flavor balanced by bubblegum and resin; banana, clove and pear as well--not surprisingly, a beer well put together... OVERALL: as Weihenstephaners go, in the same class as its classic; a bit more filling than the hefe, but not as clean or articulated...
Orange-brun, uklar. Hvid skum, hurtigt væk. Aroma, primært gær og malt. Ditto i smag, plus kanel og karamel. Medium fylde og carb. En smule bitterhed og syre i eftersmag.

A dark orange brown, cloudy beer with a thick white head. Typical wheat beer aroma, banana, and mango tropical fruit, clove spice, but all with the added extra of a slightly smoky, toffee malt aroma. Medium mouthfeel. The taste follows on from the aroma, plenty of banana, mango, cinnamon and clove that you'd expect, but with the smooth, slightly sweeter malt element that adds toffee and a hint of smoke. All the elements longer long into the finish.

Tasted at the Weihenstephan Bräustüberl, Freising.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I love most of the beers that this brewery puts out. Which would make sense since they are one of the oldest breweries in Germany and the world.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 16.9 oz bottle poured into weizen glass. Appearance is cloudy brown that goes from diluted iced tea at the bottom to caramel at the top. A billowing tan head settles to a cap of tiny bubbles. Aroma is clove and other mulling spices, yeast, tart apple, green banana, and some sweet malt and earthy bitterness on the finish. Taste is medium banana bread sweetness initially, assertive clove spice, and light caramel on the swallow. Light-medium body, super full,creamy texture, lively carbonation, and a long mouth-coating malt and clove finish.
Nice head that faints quickly. Aromas of bananas, yeast and bread. Excellent Wheathie. Overall: 18/20.
Sweet malty fruity wheat aroma and that even more so on tasting. Probably the best wheat beer Ive ever tasted
Poured into supplied glass from one pint bottle, simply beautiful. Cloudy pumpkin with thick head and excellent lacing. Typical wheat aroma, with same taste but decent malty flavor.

Bottle from Market Basket
Pours a fairly clear reddish brown with a huge fluffy tan head that persists forever. Aromas of clove with hints of banana and peeper with a solid shot of caramelized brown sugary malt. The flavor is rich dark sugary malt sweetness with some clove and pepper to counter. Little to no hop presence. Medium body with a moderate to high level of carbonation and a sweet slick mouthfeel. Dangerously drinkable, not horribly complex but definitely a solid quaffer.
Subtle apricot palate, beautiful color, soft, slightly bitter finish. Soft bubblegum flavor.

Hazy caramel color. Nose is yeast and banana. Taste is a bit malty and quite pleasing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500 ml bottle, Dublin. Dark cloudy pour with large head. Sweet with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Goes down easy

Bottle.

A- Bread, banana, bubblegum, toast, caramel.

A- Brown color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Malty, bubblegum, caramel, bread, toast.

P- Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- Much lighter than I anticipated, the bubblegum flavor comes through quite prominently which I wasnt expecting for a Dunkel.

Bottle, a Christmas gift from my mother. Pours a medium depth brown with a monster of a beige head. Lots of fluffy stuff and tons of lacing. This must be what a beer of sustenance is supposed to be... supple is a good descriptor. A good amount of roast, spent grain, bready, and yeast. Too much yeast presence for my liking. Plenty of good flavors come together, so its pretty easy to get past that. Overall a pleasant brew.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Just an incredible dunkelweizen. Its attractive (well, as attractive as a dark wheat beer can be), heady, and outrageously easy to drink. Seriously. A stein full of this stuff will be empty in no time. As expected with the dark color, theres a bit more earthiness and graininess, but the sweet bubblegum flavor typical of Bavarian wheat beers comes through beautifully. Another excellent offering from the "Worlds oldest brewery."

Bottle. Pours a copper colour

Aroma. that of a general spiciness and bubblegum.

Taste. that of bubblegum, cinnamon and other spices.

Overall. Quite a good beer, nice spicy flavours, refreshing and would be good on a hot day everything i want in a wheat beer.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 (Bue sur place en fût): Des malts Munich à  fond, longue torréfaction et des biscuits au caramel brulé qui viennent ajouter de la complexité à une bière à la buvabilité morbide.

Delicious combination of the consistency I expect from a wheat beer with the flavor of a stout. Enormous head, although it dissipated quicker than Id hoped. Nice cloudy amber on the dark side, but lighter than I expected. Aroma of fruit and oak. Tastes like it has a higher ABV than 5%. Good beer.

0.5L glass on tap at Forst Central in Merano. Similar to the regular hefeweissbier with some roasted tones and a dryer finish.
Hazy dark orange to brown color, massive thick offwhite head to dip your nose in, then reducing to an almost permanent lacing, wow! Typical weizen: wheat, yeast, banana, a pinch of clove and lots of citrus and a roasted note. Balanced smooth\crisp, Sweetish, dry, long sourish finish. Almost as good as the blonde one.

500 ml bottle. Light Brown/copper/orange pour with beautiful, big, frothy head and lacing. Aroma is banana, clove, and lemon. Dry and creamy on the palate, interesting, complex flavor, sweet and sour with slight caramel. Light body, soft to average carbonation, somewhat bitter and sour finish.

Bottle at home (courtesy to Frederick). 
Sour sweet nose. 
Dark hazy orange color, two finger foamy head. 
Medium body, sweet, banana, gum, sharp bubbles, dry aftertaste. Real nice hefe. 


:)
Bolton Brew.

Visual: The second one of a 3pack gift box. Pours translucent pale brown with a smallish lasting foamy head, several steady streams, not much lacing.

Nose: extreme-euro barley malt beverage with a touch of caramel. (9)-aromatic strength.

Attack: airy, sweet-crisp, creamy-fizzy mouthfeel

Mid-palate: (7)-malty sweetness, alcohol detection (MAIN) barley malt, caramel, yeasty, toast (MILD) ginger

Finish: cereal dry, very mild bitter hopped malty finish.

Summary: An okay-decent dunkel displaying the typical flavour of malt. Drinkable, but not my favourite style of brew. (Note: numbers above are on a 10-point weak-strong scale)
50cl bottle, Calgary, AB, Canada. Hazy burnt apricot colour, thin head. Xmas spice, bubblegum and a hop brightness Aroma. Sweet, brown sugar and clove flavour, medium finish.

Last review from the November Coop Discovery Beer Bag. Pour is a dark brown with a fairly frothy beige head with decent retention. Aroma is very malty, with puffed wheat square aroma, mild grassiness. Taste is smooth, malty, and very thick - but a very rounded out, balanced beer. Lots of yeast character evocative of some of the trappist brews. Wicked.
Aroma was fine with sweet aroma. Appearance was good with strong head. Taste was excellent however palate was failing

Aroma: typical for good weizen: spices, banana, sweetness, hint of yeast, caramel is really well hidden behind everything else. Pours hazy brown with nice light tan head. Head stays for a while. Taste: really creamy (almost like butter!), light citrus, spices, caramel, malt, light sourness and sweetness. Medium carbonation. Overall: good example of dunkelweizen, but for some reason I dont really enjoy drinking this as much as I hoped (hence rather low overall).
Did someone seriously just compare this to Blue Moon? You gotta love the internet. Anyway, Bottle. Brown with one finger head. Sweet caramel malt. Mild fruitiness. Excellent mix of flavors.

3 oz. sample at Exhibit A(le). Pours dark brown, with a small, tan head. The aroma is unmistakably banana bread (notes of pecans, ripe bananas, and grains). With that aroma in mind, it was hard to pick up anything else. The flavor is sweet and bready, with very little bitterness. Medium body, smooth and creamy. The aftertaste is minimal. This is a delicious, surprisingly complex, yet balanced beer. Very smooth and drinkable. Recommended.

Very bad beer for how much it costs. 14 dollars for a six pack. Blue moon belgian white is significantly better as far as getting more for your money. Too much head. Too complex and no substance whatsoever. Adds in too much and is an overall terrible beer.
Bottle at home. Pours clear dark copper/brown with a huge white head. Aroma is caramel, banana, some citrus and yeast. Taste is moderate sweet. Medium body with soft carbonation.

hazy orange amber, lot of carbonation, frothy off-white head, stays a while, foamy rim remains, sweet bready nose, banana, wheat, caramel, dough, clove, hint of citrus, wheaty taste, banana, hint of roasted nuts, slightly sour, medium body, lively carbonation, finish as in taste with some roasty bitterness and a peppery feeling on the tongue

Kobber uklar skum hvid tæt lang 
Hved banan gær nødder choklade 
Bitter lidt sød modrate 
Vandede livig 
@home 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mooie heldere caramelkkeur met goede kraag. Licht zoete geur, mout, caramel en iets, vanille. Smaakt meer als een weissen met een lichte zoetige smaak.

A: Brownish Orange Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head, Mild Lacing

S: Banana, Wheat, Burnt Rice

T: Wheat, Dark Malts, Banana, Oranges

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Lightly Sweet

Overall, a pretty solid dunkleweiss that provides the best of both worlds.
Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with thick white head. Aroma is malt, smoke, caramel, hint of wheat. Flavor is malt, cocoa, wheat, hint of smoke.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with foamy white head. Taste Carmel, banana, wheat. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark malts and banana, wheat and yeast in the nose. Cloudy, dark chocolate brown with off-white foamy head. Light-medium carb on medium-thick body. Banana and clove taste with dark malts and yeast. A bit of hops. Peppery wheat after. A good dark wheat bee
Brown with cream short head. Banana, clove, fruits, bit of sweetness. Lovely.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 28.09.2013, 0,5l bottle shared with Palme @ hotel in Leiden:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly toasted and fruity, caramel malts, wheat, banana, yeast, toast, hay, dough, flowers, hints of bubblegum. Taste is mild and slightly dry, yeast, toast, caramel malts, wheat, hay, weeds, burnt caramel, dough. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Tap. Really strong banana-metalic smell coming out of the glass. Tastes soury with smooth feeling on the palate. Medium body. Short banana finish taste.
Poured into pewter stein. Aroma is banana, bread and syrup. Taste is a big stein full of banana bread. Good thing I like banana bread! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a light reddish-brown body, with an average, very light brown head that diminishes slowly, leaving a fair lace. Amazing aroma of caramel, and yeast, but taste was a letdown. Very watery, light sweet, noticed some raisins. Watery texture, thin bodied, light carbonation. Very aromatic and delicate, but also very weak.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy coppery-brown color, medium white head with decent retention and lacing. Nose is clove and banana, some yeasty spice, hints of noble hops. Mouth is medium bodied, characteristic wheat creaminess, kinda thin after the initial taste though. Relatively dry with caramel, clove, banana, vanilla, finishes watery. Not bad, but Ive had much better.
Nice amber cloudy body with awesome head. The full palate gives malts, banana, yeast and roasted barley. Also cloves - as in the aroma. This is bready with tones of fruit and maybe sweet caramel.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Poors a cloudy brown with a white foamy head. Aroma of malts, ripe banana, bread, slight caramel. I like it even better than the regular Hefeweizen from this brewer.
Cereal flavor, strong aroma, refreshing aftertaste, clean in the tongue, kind of malty and little fruity.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2013 Bottle: swamp-like, hybrid color of dark copper and dark tan; off-white head plumps up huge, super thick and creamy. Aroma is mild bubblegum yeast, clove, coriander, and a good amount of toasted malt and light residual sweetness. A hint of alcohol, too, maybe. Taste is malty and fruit; banana flavors from the yeasty esters, along with plums and sweet grapes. Toasted bread, very light caramel, and a finishing hint of kitchen spices and clove. Like a darker version of the regular Hefe, with some darker fruits and less brightness. Still very good.
Pours cloudy brown, smooth mouth feel. Deep fruity and malt flavours, not a bad beer at all.
Pleasant - easy drinking - fruity estery brew - quite tasty but not my preferred style.

Cloudy brown, light golden color. Rapid big white foamy head. Aroma of mature banana, spice, yeast. Sweet taste of banana, sweet malt, clear notes of wheat and cinnamon, little caramel, finishing hobs bitterness at the end.
Bottled offering. Dusty raisined dough. Soft spice. Rustic wheat backdrop. Good, but nod to the old hefeweizen.
On tap at Bad Ragaz. Murky brown pour with an off white head. Mild caramel malt aromas. Mild caramel, pecan, and lightly toasted malt notes. Good body and mouthfeel. Tasty and refreshing...

Truly one of the best unfiltered beer Ive ever tasted in Israel so far.
Recommended for people who love dark beers.

Cloudy brown beer, off-white head. Aroma of ripe banana, cloves, spices, bread and light citrus. Sweet malty flavour, caramel, sweet banana, yeast. Sweet malty bready finish, caramel, yeast and lingering chocolate. Dunkelweizen is not my favourite style, but this is a good example of it.
(From 0.5cL bottle @ home)
Фирма веников не вяжет, как вайцен, так и этот д-вайс - лучшие из тех, что я пил.

On tap 9 oz. pour at the Roasthouse Pub in Frederick, MD, where it was listed on the board as "Weihenstephaner Weizen Dunkel." 

Cloudy, dark copper-brown wiva small off-white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of cloves, banana, sweet malt, cinnamon and yeast. 

Taste of cinnamon, sweet malt, cloves, banana, yeast, peaches and bread. 

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very smooth, sweet, and mellow beer. Good for refreshment on a hot day. Aroma is strong wheat. Taste is wheaty and lightly sweet and not overwhelming yet not watery at all.
Pours hazy light brown with a good head. Clove and bananas with a touch of citrus. Caramel also present. Nice beer.
A floral sweet flavor with slight roasted notes. Color is brown with a white head.
Pours a brown color with a malty wheat beer aroma. Taste is very subtle, with mild fruit notes. A crisp beer with no complexities. A mellow beer, with no frills.

Appearance: lots of haze and particles, its a light bronzish color almost brown, very large beige head, head is dense, but fades quicker than I expected Aroma: yeast, clove, banana, lemon, citrus, Taste: banana, yeast, bread, caramel malt, a slight hop bitterness on the finish, Palate: lively c02, frothy, slight bitter aftertaste, leaves mouth dry, Overall: tastes more like a hefeweizen than I was expecting based on the color, good beer, kind of like a hefeweizen with the banana toned down and added hops and caramel ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2014 Light brown color with an off-white head. Smells of banana and tastes like a dark weizen. Very enjoyable

Bottle, 500 ml, poured into a weizen glass. ABV 5.3%
Dark amber to light brown in colour, with a tall and thick off-white head. Good retention, actually it never leaves the glass.Light lacing left on the glass.
Lots of spices on the aroma other than the expected clove. Cinammon. Maybe nutmeg. All that between both ripe and fresh bananas, 
Very fruity taste, ripe bananas, ripe pears, caramel, toffee, a little bit of bubblegum on the finish.
Medium on the body, with a biting carbonation. 
Great beer.

Das ist gut, verdammt Bier. Es ist eines der besten Biere Verdammt ich je hatte . Dieses Bier erinnert mich an eine bayerische Frauen tanzen sexy mit ihren Kleidern aus. Good job Bayern.

--- Mi nombre es Juan Caja y me gusta la cerveza.
a bit of a musty aroma, a dark coppery cloudy color with a hefe body. flavor is malty and grainy as expected. clean, slightly oily finish. pretty nice.
#113 - bottle fro supermarket. Opaque amber, gorgeous. Aroma of orange and wheat. Sweet to taste, oranges, banana and alcohol. Slight gas.

This pours a turbid mahogany color with a soft glow where the light strikes through. Lots of bubbles making their way to the top. Gold and orange hues. Fat scrumptious head of beige foam that fell slowly and leisurely to a ring and cap and then to a light layer on top. Handsome and stately in the glass. 

Nose is fantastic. Wheat, deep ripe banana, soft malt with a light caramel. Bread, nutty and some apple to give it a crisp tartness with the crisp and dry smelling wheat. Spices are clove and nutmeg, cinnamon and light allspice. Theres a tart aspect to the nose and its complex but not enormously complex. 

Taste is smooth, silky, soft malt. The fruits follow the nose all the way and the spices enhance your every taste of this well rounded body. Carbonation is ample but soft. The apple and the dry wheat give it a crisp flavor, the banana and the nutty malt accentuate the grain. It finishes dry and lightly sweet. Refreshing and well turned out. Silky deep and vibrant in character. 

Vibrant is my favorite word to describe the malt character of a good hefe. Its a beer that lets its malt shine. This one flowed like silk and had plenty of bread to offer but nothing heavy. Sweet, round and creamy. The mouthfeel is supple and sensational. The sweetness lies delicately and just underneath every flavor quality giving it its dark character with the nuts and grain. Spirited, civilized, sensational. Theres a good reason that this is one of the oldest brewers in the world and that they do hefewiezens so well.

On-tap. Pours hazy red-brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel, banana and some cloves. Taste - sweet with malt, toffee, banana, bubblegum and nutty notes. Medium body, good carbonation, refreshing and easy to drink. Nice Dunkelweizen.

Smooth caramel tones in color, aroma and taste. Subdued flavors of banana and clove spice, with distant hints of bitter chocolate carry to the finish as this shrouded twin to the Weissbier charms the palate with old world authority.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
