Lovely wheaty aroma and taste, with fresh bananas, and a pleasing slightly roasted caramel malt base. My favourite of the three Weiss I tried here.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours dark copper with a medium sized head. The aroma contains wheaty maltiness with plenty of banana and spiciness - fresh and rich. Taste is light sweet, very fresh; maltiness provides the basis for estery fruitiness and spices to build on. Seems fuller bodied and maltier than regular hefeweizens, very fruity though too. The palate is medium-bodied, slick and smooth. Very tasty and refreshing, a classic German dunkelweizen.

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange-brown with a fluffy off-white head and lively carbonation. Aromas of caramel, banana, white bread, touch of lemon and cinnamon. Taste is malt, vanilla, biscuit, caramel, spice, a little umami and a light spritz of lemon. Creamy mouth feel with a lingering floral and spicy aftertaste. Pretty great example of the style.

Espectacular apariencia, con residuos, sin filtrar, naranja muy oscuro, espuma densa que desaparece rápido. Aroma débil para su estilo, pero pudo deberse a la botella importada adquirida en México. Buen sabor a maltas, banana y caramelo. Un paladar mas bien tierroso y alcohólico.

50cl bottle from Munich airport. Pours hazy brown with a nice off-white head. Wheaty aroma with ripe bananas, yeast, malt and hints of caramel and roast. Moderate sweet, fruity with a light acidity. Very easy to drink, refreshing and enjoyable.

Hazy Dark orange-brown color. Aroma of yeast and roasted malt. Taste is fruity and roasted malty. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance-Dark orange/brown with a medium off white head.

Smell-Spicy with a hint of banana/fruitiness. 

Tastes-Banana is the most prominent flavor. There is also some clove and maybe a hint of chocolate or coffee. Very pleasant flavor. The sweetness is much more subtle than their Original Hefeweissbier and Vitus but I like it almost as much. 

Palate-Crisp and refreshing. Medium carbonation. 

Overall-Not surprisingly it is great beer from what is probably my favorite brewery. It should please any beer drinker.

dat head, I took the cap off, set the bottle down, got distracted and returned to a beer that was literally overflowing. Big big tan head on top of a slightly cloudy dark amber body. Smells of bread dough dominate the aroma with a bit of spiciness. A bit of hop bitterness is a welcome counterpoint to sweet body. Banana and malt flavors, but strangely weak all-around. Improves during a nice aftertaste. Lively carbonation that sticks to your mouth a bit, sort of like a cola.

from bottle. pours a hazy, dark orange-brown colour with a huge frothy white head. it cant look better than that! intense aroma of banana, roasted malts and pear. medium body, creamy texture and average carbonation. flavours of banana, ripe pear and some roasted malts. highly enjoyable dunkel weizen!
Delicious beer. Has the softness of wheat and the velvet taste of roasted malt.

500ml bottle. Pours a rich creamy deep brown color with a fluffy tannish head. Balanced banana, toffee malt sweet smell. Taste was balanced subtle hops, followed by sweet malty body of bananas, cloves, hints of vanilla, and crisp delicious wheat and a malty sweet finish. Medium bodied, great smooth finish, with malty sweetness throughout.
Very interesting, theres a cookie flavor here. A define sweet note, but still somewhat refreshing. Very different from their plain hefe.

Colour: Hazy, ruby brown. Aroma: malt, fruits. Taste: medium bitter-sour. Palate: refreshing, medium body, high CO2. Overall: very nice.
Muy rica esta cerveza. Huele que alimenta y el sabor es genial. Para mí mejor que la de trigo normal.

butelka. wyborne, pięknie prezentuje się w kuflu. ciemnobursztynowy kolor, mętny ale bez osadu, piana też z fajnym brubatnym odcieniem, w smaku łagodne, z silnymi nutami słodu, nie ma silnego buzowania drożdży jak przy innych weizenach. najstarszy browar świata nie zawodzi

50cl bottle, fresh. Subtle and "supple" Dunkelweizen, pours a cloudy acajou-amber like Scheider TAP7, while about half its perceived WeizenWeight. Typical notes of clove, Lebkuchen, marzipan are brilliantly offset by an unusually high fresh hop dosage (at least for the style) and a hard-working yeast that saves this pleasant beer from being one of those typical maltsugar & heavy wheat bricks that will take hostage your stomache for the rest of the evening. Not as spectacularly refreshing as their regular Weisse, but still of style-redeeming high quality.
0,5l fles thuis. Donker amberkleurig troebel bier. In de geur gebrande mout.. Smaak vol, tikje rook en volle afdronk. Mooie weizen dunkel

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with nice off white head that leaves good lacing. Smells of bread, yeast. Medium body with flavors of coriander and clove. A bit too much carbonation for my preference and ends with a strong clove finish. Interesting brew but not something Id seek out.

Barva: jako lesní med, pěna bohatá, hustá, drící. Vůně: velice příjemná sladově banánová. Chuť: plné sladké tělo s výraznou peničnou ostřčejí chutí, velice osvěující. Příjemný sladový dozvuk s nádechem vanilky a lehké příjemné hořkosti. Osvěující pivo.

Pours a large frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy, light yellowisch brown. Sparkles are visible.
Aroma contains light malts (light bread, hay, molasses), light hops (citrus fruits), very light yeasts (dough, leather) and banana, bubble gum, grape, plum, pear, pineapple and vanilla.
Flavor starts off light acidic, then goes to sweet and light acidic and finishes with slight bitterness added to the sweetnes and acidity. 
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
This beer shows lots of fruits and subtle changes. It's very refreshing. I love Hefeweissbier on a hot day!

Pours a really light brown with a thin but sufficient white head, color is really lighter than I thought it would be. Aroma is really nice with bananas, cloves... everything a hefeweissen should have +1! Taste is slightly sweet with again intense bananas and spices. Like drinking a liquid banana bread, really! This is really, really good. It has been a long while since Ive last enjoyed a german beer that much!

BOTTLE. Head: light beige, huge, creamy, avg. retention. Colour: red-amber-brown, cloudy. 

Aroma: banana evaporates fast, clove coriander, sweetish and a bit sour. More spic than fruity. 

Taste: CO2 acidity, sweetish, spicy with an somewhat astringent finish. 

I think it has a spicier aroma than the plain hefeweisee, and is more sweetish too, though not by much.
A dark wheat beer. This was actually quite a treat compared to a lot of other beers Ive had recently. A spicy banana aroma predominates while the flavour is the right amount of sweetness for a beer.

Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a Weihenstephaner chalice.

In my chalice this dunkelweizen pours a translucent walnut brown color with a reddish tint.  A tan head has a nice original size and density before gently fading.  

The aroma is surprisingly strong on the yeast.  Clove, some banana, and a bit of dark fruit.  Maybe some caramel in the background.

Although I was expecting a burst of robust flavor from each sip, I was somewhat disappointed in the blandness of the Hefeweissbier Dunkel.  The requisite banana and clove notes are there, as they are in the regular Hefe, but they are almost muted by what should be the dunkel part.  The only thing is, there is not much in terms of caramel, toasted malts, or dark fruits to be found.  

The carbonation is vivacious as I was expecting, with a rather light body.  The beer wraps up pretty cleanly with no real aftertaste to speak of.

Overall I have to say this is the weakest Weihenstephaner offering I have had.  I have no issue with how it was brewed per se, but the combination of flavors (or lack thereof) make it tough to say I would want to have this again.

Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a tall glass. Pours cloudy honey. Leaves an off white head with nice lacing. Aroma is mild hops, oatmeal, and wheat with notes of citrus. Flavour is sour mash, wheat, coriander, orange, and spice. There is a long finish with a chorus of hops.
Brown beer with nice head. Typical hefeweizen aromas combined with some more darker aromas. Sweet taste with some banana. Medium body, nice long finish.

Bottle from drink shop tallinn. Dark brown with almost white head. Yeasty aroma. Sour, liquorice, taste. High carbonated.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 Pours a caramel colour with a creamy head. Smells of fruits, yeast, citrus, spice and bananas. Tastes of citrus with hints of bananas. Medium carbonation. Low to medium body. Slightly watery texture. A good brew but I prefer Aventinus.

Bottle, 50cl, Mitra Nijmegen. Had this with friends at a vegan dinner party. Pours with a beautiful dark brown to amber gradiant in a traditional weizen glass. Tastes of rye bread and less sweet than expected (which is good). This beer went very will with dinner: sweet potato purée with nuts and coconut and chicory with mashed peas and mint.
A very nicely balanced beer. Equal parts caramel and subtle clove spicing. Very nice mouthfeel.

Pours dark amber, cloudy body with a huge, creamy long lasting head. Smells of bread, nuts, cookies and fruits. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Medium carbonation, finish is nicely balanced. Taste remembers of bread, chocolate, vanilla.

Eerste smaak is goed, tikje donker wat mout en honing tonen. De smaak wordt met name overspoeld door het koolzuur gehalte. Dit is erg hoog. Lekker bij sommige eten maar om alleen te nuttigen is het teveel.

Bottle - pours a cloudy brown - appears to have some sediment.  Very thick tan head.  Nose full of clove and spice.  Taste of clove however sweetens over time and ends with a lingering maple, brown sugar taste.  Very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle. Cloudy dirty brown with lots of fizz. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat. Taste is a sweet concoction of banana bread, spice, and apple. Lingering sweet, smooth aftertaste.

A - Pours a cloudy honey brown. A mounded 2 finger off-white head that sinks very slow creating a thick ceiling and impressive lacing.

S - Yeasty banana bread, very doughy. Lots of wheat with notes of clove and bubblegum.

T - Follows the nose with moist banana bread, sweet with clove and a thick wheat backbone. Hints of caramel, berries, and slight nuttiness in the middle. Finishes with a bit more grain in the malt

M - Silky smooth and creamy. Tight but low carbonation with a light to medium body.

The mouthfeel is perfect! Very elegant flavors and seems to have great balance with the flavors. The wheat still shines and the esters seem perfectly placed. This beer will leave you wanting more.

Serving type: bottle

10-27-2011

Hazy amber pour with light brown highlights.  Nose of banana esters, clove, yeast spice, and faint citrus.  Flavor follows suit nicely with banana, yeast spice, and a whisp of caramelized fruit.  Light with ample carbonation.  Not a ton different from their plain hefe, but different enough to add to the beer.  Subtle and well-refined.
Great beer. Fruity taste balanced with the alcohol. Medium body and low carbonation.

Really solid beer that has a nice, well balanced mix of chocolate and wheat flavours. High drinkability, way more refreshing than it might initially appear to be. Very enjoyable and I hope to see it back at the LCBO soon
I love this beer. A nice wheaty chocolate go to. This is a marble cake in a bottle. Full flavored, great aftertaste. Yummy dessert pairing.
Wheat beer by the Belgian people, beautiful color like deep caramel and tastes cold and delicious
Smak och doft av humle, malt, jäst, karamell, knäck, mörkt bröd och toner av banan. Friskt och syrligt. Gott.

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to czar! Brown with a huge light brown head, good retention and some lacing. Aroma is bready with banana, caramel and spicy notes. Taste is moderately sweet with acidic notes from the wheat, slight caramel, banana and some spices. Light to medium body. A tad watery. Good carbonation. Good balance and drinkability. Nice Dunkelweizen!
Pale brown and hazy. Flavour is quite mild but has light spicy yeasty edge to it. Some caramel sweetness too.
A nice malty brew...typical German wheaty...not my type of beer...but i kinda like this...and pretty cheap

Poured from 500mL bottle.  Hazy orangey brown with foamy beige head.  Mild aroma of toasted malt, some bread and yeast too.  Very full taste of citrus and wheat followed by a punch of banana.  Very nice full body.

16.9 oz bottle.  Brown and cloudy with a big tan head that slowly dissipates.  A fairly malty aroma, with chocolate, bananas, toast, light clove and light earthiness.  Medium body with a fluffy soft feel and nice carbonation.  Medium sweetness and no bitterness.  Toasted malty yeasty flavor with a smooth finish.  Very nice.

Murky brown, malty and sweet aroma. Very good and tasty. Stickey and flavorful. Well balanced malt and wheat. Almost perfect for style. Up there with the best. Easy to drink but packed with malt/yeast/wheat. This one has a strong roasted caramel body.

Cloudy amber with honey tones and great thick head.  Aroma of ripe banana, toast, and some floral notes.  Soft, smooth, delicious.  Light banana, spice, caramel and dark bread.  Excellent beer from the worlds oldest brewery.

Bottle at home from waitrose. Orange brown colour. Cloudy with a big off white persistent head streams of bubbles driving it. Big bready yeasty aroma subtle. clove. Flavour is really rounded bread and gentle caramel. Lively carbonation, but very nice rounded body. Crisp yeasty finish. Fantastic beer.

Pours a cloudy dark orange with a thick beige head. Aroma is bready with notes of banana, little spiciness. Taste is doughy, lighter banana taste than the regular hefeweissbier, some light caramel taste and spices. Mouthfeel is low with good carbonation. Good but still prefer the hefe.

500ml bottle. Hazy dark amber colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, off-white head. Yeasty and wheaty aroma. Taste is moderately sweet wheat malty with a touch of smoke, slightly spicy yeasty overtones, prickling carbonation.
50cl draught @ Brabantse Aap. Somehow I like the dunkel one more then the regular one.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2014 Jan 2012 - OK, but Im not such a fan of the dark wheat beers.  (3.3)
July 2012 - bottled.  Not as nice as the other varieties, a bit under-flavoured.  But still very drinkable and nicer than many.(3.5)
July 2014 - Keg at Zeitgeist, Lambeth.  Cloudy murky brown, decent white head.  Taste is thin and vaguely wheaty.  Work colleagues thought the same - pretty meh. (3.3)

On tap. Unfortunately a little flat so not a fully accurate measure. Great color, not much aroma, great thick hefe-flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. The color is a hazy orange brown, the head was substantial at first but reduced to remnant pretty quickly. The aroma is malt, citrus maybe some banana, the taste is crisp malt, tang and some clove, no noticeable alcohol taste but over all a disappointment for me. Maybe Ill have the Vitus after this.

appearance: Bit of a cloudy dirty brown/copper/amber looking color with a big and full creamy looking foam head. Looks a bit weird. 

smell: Banana bread, yeast, wheat and malts. Bit of a brown sugar / caramel malt scent. And some spices i cant really define.

taste: Theres the expected banana bread, wheat, yeast flavor of a Hefeweiss, but combined with clove, caramel, brown sugar and some spiced malts. It makes it a little odd flavor combo but surprisingly works really well. Its all very light in flavor, making this very easy and refreshing to drink. And a nice variation to a regular Hefeweizen. 

mouthfeel: Quite light and thin feel for a weiss beer. Medium carbonation. Quite refreshing. 

overall: I didnt really like it at first. But i drank a regular Hefeweis, followed by this one. And then it really is kind of weird. Later i tried it just as a starter, and the more i drink it, the better it seems to get. Its got more depth to it than i thought at the beginning. Very nice refreshing beer with different flavors each time you drink it.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2014 Une grande mousse blanche qui se dissipe assez rapidement. Larôme est très fort de malt, un peu comme du cola, du blé, et aussi un peu de levure, et fruits. Cest marron opaque et quand je la tienne à la lumière il a une teint rougâtre. Le malt domine mais cest miraculeusement équilibrée par un goût subtile dhoublon. Cest aussi très légèrement sucré. Je lai trouvé bonne et je serai content de la boire encore. Très intéressant, mais il mas pas mimpressionner en particulier. Mise à jour: Cest beaucoup mieux quand il se réchauffe. Je trouve un arôme subtile (le mot important est SUBTILE) de banane mûre, avec la même goût dans la finale. Je suis content que je lai bu lentement! À environs 12-14 degrées cest une experience completement differente que à 7 degrees, quand je lai ouvris.

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a branded weizen glass. Pours hazy caramel with a moderate, off-white head. The head fades slowly to a thin cover and leaves a small amount of lace. On the nose, there are notes of toasty malts, caramel, wheat, banana, clove and delicate herbal hops with a touch of citrus. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with caramel, bread, banana and citrus. There is just a touch of hop bitterness and a delicate spiciness that grows towards the end. The finish is long, toasty and subtly spicy. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a smooth, milky texture and lively carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice dunkelweizen. Just the right amount of caramel and toasty malts balance the dry wheat notes. A nice wheat beer for autumn. 2012-09-12

(From notes 2009) Massive head on pouring. A very cloudy orange color. Slowly receding head leaves minor lacing. A strong citrus and earthy smell.

Slightly bitter taste of orange and hint of banana. Crisp tasting, smoother finish, very fruity. A very pleasant beer and very drinkable

Serving type: bottle

Bottle from Whole Foods El Segundo. Light candyish banana aroma with some yeast. Light amber/brown color, with a thick head moving up like slow lava. Sweet malty chocolate initial with a bit a citrus tang / mild smooth mid palate, some raisins / fine powdery sweet final. Thin-medium body. Clear components in flavor. Clean and tasty. Very good.

Smells like a regular wheat beer, some spice and banana there. The look is a murky orange, bordering on brown, with a good head. The taste is slightly darker than a regular wheat beer, but nothing that special. A bit more sweetness and a bit more banana, but the flavours are quite mellow. So mellow actually, that Id rather get the sharper hit of a paler wheat beer. Or get something a bit darker and maltier than this one. The palate is a funny mix of weak and watery and thick and malty. Definitively no hop presence, and in general unsatisfying. Id rather drink a mild for some flavour.
One of the best examples of its style, however I wish it were stronger.  Sadly I do not get any American versions in my area to compare it against, until I do this is the my favorite DunkleWeizen.

Robe brune, un peu pâle, avec des reflets orangés. Une belle mousse fine et tenace coiffe le verre. Nez de pommes (rappelle un peu le cidre), de bananes et dépices. Sur la langue, le côté malté prend plus de place avec une touche de caramel et de fruits rouges. La touche banane-levure revient nous charmer en post-goût. Après avoir goûté la Kristall, la Hefeweissbier et maintenant la Dunkel de Weihenstephaner, je peux dire que japprécie grandement cette gamme de produits comme une excellente déclinaison de trois styles sur une base commune.
Slightly hazy brown with a fluffy off white head. Earthy, spicy aroma. Banana, nuts and spice are the main flavor components. Dark malts add a nice dry finish.
bomber into glass,  cloudy brown pour,  white head,  fruity hehe typoe aroma.. taste is awesome , starting to like this style mpore and more
Bottle at all in hua hin, thailand. Hazy light brown color, big white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, roasted, malts. Wheaty taste, yeast, little roasty, medium body.

Its strange. Im relatively new to the whole critical side of beer tasting, but I am known amongst my personal group of friends as a beer aficionado (a title of which I have clearly not earned...yet) But ill give it a shot.
This beer is interesting, unlike any other wheat beer ive had. Its aroma was quite hop heavy and sweet, not citrus-y sweet, but, i dont know it seemed kind of banana like, My first sip (out of a beer flute, slightly cooled) confirmed this bananary quality. I quite enjoyed the hazy dark golden tones it had going for it though i found the head to be a bit out of control (whether this was because of the temperatures i am unsure) was surprised to find the beer quite mild in flavour, which works for it in a good light. Unlike most wheat beers Ive had it overlooked the distinct wheaty flavour and opted for a sweeter lighter one with the classic thickness of the dark variance, unfortunately the flavour is quite abrupt and didnt linger for too long. It was quite thick and creamy which i found very pleasant and satisfying. I would say as an overall that this is definately one kick ass beer. And one of the best german wheat beers ive had yet. Bottoms up and cheers yall

500ml bottle. Pours a murky brown. Aroma is, well, of a wheat beer. Smells sweet but not sure i get cloves or herbs. Tastes slightly creamy, medium carbonation and rather fruity. Nice but this style is not to my taste.

3 finger head,darker orange? wheat beer,carbinaded fast and alot whole time I am drinking it,so lots and a while head last most the time also and laces the glass. Smells of bannana,yeast,wheat,spice? and chocolate. Taste is of yeast,bannana and chocolate. Heavy bodied and waterty. I would like it to have a stronger wheat beer and stronger dark beer taste and a stronger %,and less watery but other wise its allright. Something I am into,but not best for the style. Cheers!

28/01/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al Deutsche Beer Festival. Bruna, color miele di castagno, limpida, schiuma biancastra leggera, non molto persistente. Aroma di banana e malti, caramello, leggero tostato. In bocca è delicata, ben bilanciata, note dolciastre di malto, finale leggermente amarognolo. Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione buona. Non è il mio genere di birra, ma è indubbiamente ben fatta.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark amber with plentiful and stable white head. Clear aroma of yeast and hop. Pleasant, balanced flavour ofbgrain, yeast and malt. Discreet, slightly sweetish aftertaste. A very good thing.

Aroma of strong clove, ripe banana, cocoa, gum and some rye bread. Appearance is rich taffy brown with creamy bone head. Flavor pretty much spot on the nose. Palate is medium, creamy and very soft. Another beautiful, soft German beer.

Good all around beer. Aroma of banana, bread yeast, some cereal. Floral hops. Pours cloudy brown with foamy head, good lacing. Medium body and slick texture. Average carbonation. Taste has light sourness, light sweetness. Bottle.

Smells like dulce de leche cake, with some gouda cheese, caramel and butterscotch all wrapped in there. A lot going on with the aromas, so enjoy it for a while. It has great color for a dunkel, like burnt caramel. Very nice creamy white head. The flavor is of roasted malt, through and through. Not sweet like some dunkels can be, and thats a compliment. It has the tiniest hint of a sour finish, but in a very pleasant way. It has a finish thats long enough to bring you back for more. Overall, this is what I want a dunkel to be- not sweet and cloying like a cheaply-made dunkel, and in fact a good bit sour. Very enjoyable and Id buy it again for sure.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 500ml bottle. Lovely, lovely dunkelweiss. Beautiful cloudy amber color with thick off-white head. Bready aroma with a wonderfully balanced taste. I love this beer.

Bottle. Cloudy copper colour, small head. Aroma as hints of vanilla and a touch of bread. The taste is mainly bananas and a mild orange citrus flavour. Medium bodied and lightly carbonated. A very good beer. I do like my wheat beers.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
My first Dunkel. Very banana-like taste when being in the glass for longer than 15 minutes. I couldnt  find any bready taste people were commenting about. For a 5,5 % beer it was also quite heavy and filling.

Pretty good, nice colour too!

First rating of a dunkelweizen.  500 ml bottle purchased almost a year ago at BevMo Escondido ($2.99).  Pours an amber-brown color with a big three fingers of puffy off-white foam.  Aroma of grainy nutty wheaty bread with some dark fruits, spice, and a hint of banana.  Flavor has much of the same as the nose -- lightly sweet dark wheat bread, clove and other spice, caramel, dark fruit, and banana.  Finishes with a moderate sweetness.  Enjoyable on a rare cold San Diego day.  (1178, 765)

16.9oz bottle. Pours with a very large khaki pillowy head. Hazy sort of brown color. Estery banana clove hefe nose. Smooth light carbonation, lighter body, dry finish. Smokey flavor, along with wheat and banana. Light sweet, some savory taste. Nice dunkelweizen, but not nearly as good as I remember the standard Weihenstephaner Hefe being. Not as full flavored as I hoped, but still good.

500ml bottle. Wheat, caramel, spicy and subtle roasty aromas. Pours murky brown, with huge tan head, persistent, good lacework. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is cereal, some caramel, nut, spicy and some roasty flavours. Quaffable and nice.

A hazy copper colored beer with a beige head. Sweet malts with plenty of bready aroma and hints of some noble hops. Sweet malt & yeast with some caramel tastes, sticky feel. Havent had this style for quite some time, seems like visiting a friend you havent seen for a while.

16.9oz Bottle A - Pours clear amber brown with a huge frothy 2 inch tan head that has good retention. Good lacing. S - Banana bread & yeast. T - Mellow sweet bread, malted wheat, mild clove, yeasty. M - Light/medium silky body, tangy carbonation. O - A refreshing wheat beer.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 Hazy pale brown with medium white head, that disappears quite fast, lacing nicely drippy.
Aroma.. fruity, mostly banana with some caramel notes. Bit malty, quite yeasty.
Medium sweet with bit spicy almost no bitter finish.. just wheaty.
Not pushy, great refreshing, balanced  beer. Thou it lacks its own identity - pleasant beer but nothing much to remember
Poured from a bottle, a hazy brown color, not dark. Small head with little lacing. Not a strong aroma, mostly malty. Malt flavor with some sweetness and maybe a tart aftertaste. Smooth to drink.
Brown with strong white head. Musty banana-bread aroma which is oddly pleasant.  Taste follows aroma with the addition of citus.
bottle. pours brown nice head. aroma of rich sweet dough. taste is bread and sweet malt
Bottle shared with McTapps. Nose of yeast and peaches. Tastes very fruity with a sweet and yeasty aftertaste. Very fruity and drinkable weizen.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Milky brown colour with steady and creamy head. Taste of rich yeast, green bananas, bittersweet chocolate, green nuts  and mild hops. Easy to drink, quite refreshing.

Bottle from Peckhams Union Square. It pours cloudy amber with a thick beige head. The nose is spice, banana, light earth, brown bread, nut and wheat. The taste is caramel, raisin, wheat, spice, banana bread, nut, earth and orange peel with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Flavoursome and well balanced.

Bottle at home. Murky copper pour, solid foamy off-white head. Aroma of wheat, yeasty, fruity, banana, some caramel and a hint of spices. Flavor is sweet tropical fruits, some spicy licorice and quite heavily carbonated. Decent body, nice balance. Well drinkable brew.

shared bottle. pours a hazy deep ruby with an off white head. nice aromas of bubblegum, banana and citrus. light to med body with a soft wheat body, citrus notes and light spices. light finish that warms with spices and citrus notes. the yeast shines here.

Kleine Bierstube, Aaehus, DK.
Tap, 201212.
Brown with off-white head. Aroma of banana and wheat. Flacour with caramel, spices and yeast.
great white head, brownish-gold cloudy colour; citrus fragrance;greatly ballanced sweetness and sour citrus taste;great wheat beer

Pours hazy dark golden brown colour with thick creamy white head and decent lacing. Aroma of sweet yeast, caramel, banana and cloves. Medium bodied. A little sweetness on the tongue, spices definitely present. A nice slightly bitter finish. This is good, but not quite as good as the original Weihenstephaner Hefeweizen.

Has a huge white head and a dark hazy body.  THere are visible chunks of yeast, which I enjoy to see.  I get a bit of caramel and banana in the nose.  Taste is much lighter than the nose, and has a much thinner body than expected.  Overall, while a bit lower than my expectations, still a good beer.

Dark amber coloured and hazy with a big stable head.Smell of yeast, clove, alittle banana, maybe sherry. Full mouthfeel with malty notes, again clove and banana, spices and a distinct sourness. Refreshing and nice, but not overwhelming.

A personal note on the rating: brings back some of the greatest memories of my life to this point, of 70 friends and I trampling through Germany drinking these beers for 3 blissful weeks. Smells of light banana and clove, wheat and yeast. Tastes rich and wheaty with banana clove spice. The best representation of the style I've found on US shelves. Brings back amazing memories, and for that, it's a fantastic drinking experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a cloudy and dark amber color with a smallish white head. Nice little bit of wheat in the nose with just a hint of citrus underneath the malts. Taste is light, but not too flavorful.
500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy light brown with high brownish head. Spicy aroma. Unique spicy taste. Mild finish.
Huge light borwn head. Cloudy brown-golden colour. Very yeasty banana aroma. Fruity taste and a long lasting, sparkly spicy palate. Really good one.

#337
Ziemlich trübes Braun mit überbordenden Schaum. Hefig würziges Aroma. Ziemlich vollmundiger Antrunk. Im Geschmack nur leich fruchtig, eher hefig-würzig mit Nelkenaroma im Abgang. Gutes Dunkles HW-Bier!
	
Test vom 11.3.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,11,12,11,8,11 - 11,00
Its real good, it has nice hints of clove, banana, and bubble gum.  The apperance is the typical cloudy with a bit of a darker hue from the normal Weißbier.  It drinks real easily and I like it!

500mL bottle purchased at BevMo in Vacaville.  The aroma has a good amount of banana and clove yeast esters present.  Some underlying wheat (cereal) is also detected, but not too much else happening here.  Light sweetness.  Fair enough.  Scantly hazy amber body with a medium-small, strong, fizzy off-white head.  A lot lighter in color than the Erdinger and the Tucher.  Starts with just a touch of the clove yeast ester flavors, before this becomes more minerally in the middle.  Lightly sweet, and a touch of toasted malt comes through.  Finishes with some metallic twang, which dissipates rapidly.  Light cereal after that.  Finishes with a little more light hop bitterness.

Bottle from HolAb, very lively - pours a cloudy chestnut with a huge cream-coloured head, classic banana nose with a touch of roasty toffee. Body is rich and full, with yeasty notes of cloves and cinnamon, plus toffee-like malt and a gentle peppery hop bitterness. Excellent.

Aroma is banana, wheat and a bit of fried tortilla. I love German beer and Mexican food so this works for me. Many dont lke the appearence but I do. Looks like a light dubbel. Easy drinking and tasty.

Bottle at ÖÖWF cons 2012-11-17 Örebro
AR: caramel, banana foam, yeasty and fudgy
AP: hazy copper, wee frothy thin head
F: banana foam, watery, wee grainy, pear soda

Bottle [500ml]. Pours a deep, very bubbly, orange-copper with a huge lasting fluffy off-white head. Aroma of dark fruit, banana, wheat, yeast, caramel malt, a touch of tartness and a hint of spice. Flavour of caramel malt, yeast, dark fruit, light spices, banana and wheat. Average bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Pretty good, these guys make solid beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nothing wrong with this wheat ale.  Its a fine everyday type of beer.  Its smooth and malty, and that is all you need to know.
Nice brown amber color,   long lasting thick beige head, good carbonation, fruity bready aroma with banana and plums, axcellent taste, light biterness, full body. Affable beer
500ml bottle. Banana aromas. Banana, spice and chocolate flavors. Overall a very good dark wheat.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2012 Sweet, mellow aroma evocative of banana cake, chocolate, clove, caramel, spices, and grain. Very nice. Mild, sweet taste with tart and bitter undertones. Sweet aftertaste of clove, fruit cake, and a bit of cinnamon powder. Medium palate with lively carbonation. Loved it.

One of the best dunkelweizens out there. Had a thick velvety head, and aroma has the perfect amount of banana, bubblegum with a hint of roasted grains. Taste is smooth and nutty, mellow and delicious. Truly awesome beer!
Smooth caramel and dark bread aromas with a touch of clove.  Deep hazy brown with a large foamy head.  Sweet with notes of banana, bread, and clove.  Medium to full bodied with a balanced finish.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours hazy brown with a creamy off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana, caramel and yeast. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long banana, yeasty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Medium brown and cloudy. Malty, but very thin on the palate not full enough for my taste. Smell is above taste here.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100818.
Pours dark yellow-brown color with a large head. Aroma of yeast, ripe fruits, some caramel and spices. Flavor of yeast, ripe fruits, spices and hay. Nice.

Pours a cloudy brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is wheaty, lightly roasted notes with toffee and caramel. Taste is also wheaty and toffee/caramel sweetness leading to a dry wheaty finish. Pretty nice.
It looks like light brown with nice head. Aroma is like cigarettes may be a bit banana... I cant put my finger on it. Taste is balanced but i am not sure what I taste...
One of the best beer what I have tasted. Smooth, delicious and its from Germany! Taste it!
Great hefeweissbier,smooth taste lift and nice unnoticable disappearing aftertaste,that doesnt leave bitter taste in mouth.
Bottle. A fine hefeweissbier. Coppery colour with huge dense white head. Aroma typical weissbier with banana, exotic fruits. Nice. Taste sweet malty with wheat notes.

50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 03.09.2010
Aroma is slightly stale with some banana esthers, caramel and roasted notes. Flavour has banana esthers, some roasted malt and toffee. Typical and good dunkelweizen.

Poured into a tall hefe glass. Cloudy, copper color with three! fingers of head. 
Smells like ripe banana and wet hay... in the best way.
Tastes like banana too. Smooth bitter taste, some malty sweetness to it.
Low carbonation. Medium and sticky body.
A great dunkelweizen.
Pours a dark hazy gold with frothy head, aroma has a hint of...chocolate? Pretty smooth, a bit fruity, better than some.
Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a gigantic head. Nice fruity aroma. Not to much aftertaste but a good beer overall

Bubbly coriander and barley on the nose. Moderately murkey brown color. Subtle caramel sweetness with some oat and wheat flavors behind it. Some hops are evident in the back of the palate. A bit of a smokey maple on the finish. Overall, not a bad dunkel. This beer boasts some pleasantly strong malts with a nice touch of oat. Id give this a B rating.
Pours cloudy dark amber. Nose and taste of banana, chocolate, dark wheat malt and spicy wheat. Medium body.

500 mL bottle consumed whilst throwing some beanbags.

The beer is chestnut brown and very hazy. The head is off white to light tan colored, standing in at two inches thick, leaving ample lacing in its wake.

The aroma is the same banana, clove, ester, wheat smell you get from the Hefeweizen, but with additional notes, of sweet breads (banana nut bread?)

Slightly sweeter than the hefeweizen. This is a delicious beer, and deserving of its #1 spot on the Top Beers - Dunkelweizen list. Full of flavor, well balanced and easy to drink. Banana, malt, yeast, bread flavors mingle beautifully.

The feel is creamy and smooth, with appropriate carbonation.

Overall, a shining example of the style. Well worth trying.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-06-2011

Aroma is fresh and fruity, mild: banana, mango, bread. Hazy light brown, beautiful dense blond head is long. Taste has elements from aroma and spices in good balance. Light feel, medium body, fizzy carbonation, good palate. Easy to drink but also much more than that.
Bottle 50cl. Wonderful dark roast aroma, balanced with the right amount of yeast, perfectly carbonated. Refreshinh. Great!

This beer is predictably aromatic with banana and citrus-wheat notes, contrasted with darker roasted malt tones. Swampy tan with a large bubbly head. Excellent switch from sweet to bitter and back. A moderately weighted body that works in all weather. Would you expect any less?

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy brown with some white fluffy head. Smell is sweet with banana and cloves, no real earthy notes Id expect. Palate is medium bodied with a good amount of soft carbonation. Taste is sweet at first with a bit of earthy bitterness, and going into a sweet aftertaste. Not bad overall.

Pours a cloudy copper with a huge off-white head.  Clove, banana, and bubblegum aromas.  Sweet bready flavor with wheat, banana, clove, and bubblegum flavors.  Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel.  Very good beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown-gold with a white head. Aroma is of toasted rye bread, dark malt, yeast and a bit of clove. The taste was rather simple compared to the flagship Hefeweissbier - dark malt, some sweetness, a bit of hops. Medium-bodied.
Draught at Weihenstephaner Belin Am Hackeschen Markt. Murkey brown - offwhite head. Ryebread. Roasted. Nutty. Yeasty. Fruity notes. Light bitterness. Tjaaaa. Plain.

0.5l from gift pack in the LCBO. Served in the glass it came with. Appearance: Cloudy golden-brown, frothy, sparse, beige head. Aroma: Banana, cloves, orange, cinnamon, wheat. Palate: Medium bodied, smooth, medium fizziness, clean finish. Taste: sweet, very slight hint of sour in the finish. Not as complex of a flavour as Id hoped for.

50cl bottle. Heavily hazy, dark orange/brown liquid. Thick medium head with egg shell white color. Nose ; peppery nose with notes of hay, wood, spicy clove, plums. It reminds a bit of spicy red whine. Leather. This thing is really complex ! I have impression I could go on and on. Time to take a sip then ; medium body, with oily texture. Low carbonation. Little sweet malt taste develops delicate dry taste with aromas of hay. The aftertaste is subtle and spicy muscat, cardamon and especially clove. Overall its really a great beer. Refreshing and enough complex in taste to satisfy.

On tap at the Braustuberl Weihenstephaner, Freising (Nov 11) and poured into the appropriate 0.3l glass with a couple of fingers head.
Dark to mid/nutty brown in colour (there wasnt much lighting in the cellar room we were in, so difficult to be precise on this one!).
Malty, mild spices and banana hit the nose. Full of flavour with banana, cloves other spices and a malty/bready taste, and possibly a small hint of caramel/something sweeter?

The mouthfeel was good, but not up to the same quality of the hefeweiss, still a pleasure to drink none the less.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: AUG 15, 2012 500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy poo brown, but lets just call it "milk chocolate" instead. Hearty doughy wheat with rich toffee, cherry and roasted malt aromas. Taste is somewhat sweet hazelnut with caramel and chocolate notes. Medium/light-bodied; smooth as a dream; creamy texture; not too heavy, not too light. Satisfyingly tasty and still refreshing. A beautiful beer for any place, time or season.
Hazy amber with a frothy white head. Spice, malt clove and banana aroma. Sweet caramel flavour with clove and spicey banana in the finish.

O...my...goodness....freaking fantastic beer.  Pours a beautiful dark caramel color with a thick off-white head.  Aroma is very rich, caramel, toasty, doughy, and the typical slight banana note from the weihenstephaner wheat beer yeast strain.  Taste is even richer and yet extremely light and very easy to drink.  Definite malt throughout, with notes of sweet caramel up front mellowing out to a bready, malty finish with a faint wheat/grain note.  Extremely palatable, extremely flavorful, extremely easy to drink, and extremely delicious.  Was not ready for this one to be so tasty

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 This pours as an opaque dark tan liquid with a thick, persistent tan head. The aroma is of smoky caramel, bread and a hint of coffee and citrus. The taste is very slightly bitter, mostly sour and has a definite wheat aftertaste with a hint of hay. This is a medium to strong bodied beer with a thick and creamy texture that is soft and fizzy. It has a sharp finish thanks to the carbonation which is followed by a short bitterness. Overall this is a nice, wheaty dark beer. It is a great fusion of what youd expect from a good wheat beer and a darker beer respectively. The only thing missing was a bit more of those malty aromas I like from its rivals but this is still a great beer in my book. I really enjoyed it.

Bottle- Pours cloudy and deep brown with a huge, effervescent white head. On the nose is toffee, cherry, dark fruit, brown sugar, bubblegum, red licorice, and banana. Taste-wise we have caramel fudge, plum, raisin, oak, dark chocolate, vanilla, lemon, bubblegum, spice, and tropical fruit esters. Mouth feel is thick and creamy with high carbonation. Finish is dry and earthy leaving tobacco, citrus, bubblegum and pineapple. Nice balance between malty caramel and fruity/yeasty flavours. Really liked it!

Im drinking this beer at the moment. The sun has gone and we get fresh air. Well, it always said the hefes in general go very well with the summer and even if I was trying to avoid replacing one of my usual belgian/english or american darlings I have finally invite this hefeweissbier dunkel over my place.

Dark caramel color tone. Hazy. Lots of bubble going up. Huge off-white foam.

Smells good. Roasted malt, some fruits like banana and citrus. Yeast is in there.

Taste is not bad. It comes sweet and smoothy. Medium body. Fizzy and high carbonation annoys me though.

Probably I should have drunk this before the sunset when the day was still warm or with some friends having casual conversations. I am working lonely and well... I do not understand why this beer is too overrated. That is why I am blaming myself.

I am looking forward the next one in the fridge: an IPA.

0.5l bottle. A cloudy brown dunkel with a superb large white head. Nice aroma with notes of fruits (banana, orange), wheat, and spices. Sweet fruity taste with hints of malts, yeast and caramel. A great beer.

Dark copper in colour with a thin but lasting beige head, light lacing.  Aroma is of bananas, caramel, some burnt malts, chocolate and yeast.  Flavour is of some lemon citrus, light powdered chocolate, some wheat, yeast, some pumpernickel bread.  Thin but yeasty mouthfeel, lightish body, high carbonation. Finishes fairly quick and a bit thin, some sweetness.

Its a little weird.  Id rather a straight up dunkel or a regular hefe, not a combo of the two.

500ml bottle purchased at the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario.
Opened on January 31, 2010.
Best before July 27, 2010.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors haze brown with good white head. 
Aroma banana, malts, wood, some caramel. 
Taste is sweet, little bitter. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Good dunkel weissen.

500 mL bottle. Part of a Weihenstephaner tasting pack.  Pours a brown and cloudy copper hue with a tight long lasting white head.  Nice malt and spice aromas, a little brown sugar and banana notes.  Pretty basic malt flavors, similar to the aromas. Smooth and refreshing. Enjoyable.

From bottle bought @ La Birreria (Andorra la Vella), cloudy brown body with a puffy beige head that leaves little lacing. Roasted coffee, clove, banana, caramel as main aromas, some hints of raisins and nuts with a citric finish. Typical light bitterness  and medium sweetness with some sourness. Medium body with a creamy texture and a lively carbonation. Long finish absolutely delightful. Well balanced, complex and solid Dunkel Weissbier, which remains true to the Weihenstephaner tradition of quality. No surprises here, no thrills either but a superb product that deserves its high marks.
50 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Dark hazy orange with a large off-white head. Familiar yeasty banana aroma with a touch of caramel. Lively carbonation and a full round taste. Good dunkelweizen.

Pours a very cloudy deep amber colour with a big off-white head. Aroma is full of banana, cloves, floral scents and spice. Taste is slightly sweet with minor bitter notes. Light body, smooth mouth feel, livelier carbonation. A nice beer and fairly unique.

Pint 9 bottle pours brownish color with off white head that lingered for most of the glass. A true wheat aroma with some dark malt aromas. The flavor is what you would expect. Pure bliss. Nice mildly spiced wheat and malt flavors.  Truly a great beer. So smooth and sweet and delicious.

On tap at Gourmet Haus. Great banana and spice on the nose.  Pours a rusty orange/brown. Nice off-white head. Taste of banana and wheat with slight fruit kick at the end. Yeast and wheat provide medium-full mouthfeel. Great for a hot summer afternoon.

Bottle - Sweet, chalky, malty, with definite yeast notes and grains.  Clear amber with a frothy white head.  Mellow and malty with a yeast and slightly alcoholic taste at the end.  Nice malty beer, but nothing special.
caramel, chocolate, Metallic, roasty, herbs, banana, soy sauce, brown, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively,

half liter - pours murky amber.orange with off-white head.  Nose is banana and clove.  Flavor adds caramel and bread.  Taste is sweet.  Easier to drink than the others of the style.  Burp (tuna and curry).

This is my favorite beer that I have found traveling the world. WOW is all I can say. The slight banana aftertaste is to die for. Smooth and just perfect. I am sold on the German style after tasting this. This is my beer that I compare all others too. Finding it is a bit difficult, but worth every penny.

Bottle at Homebrew meeting. Pours a deep bronze with an offwhite head. Nose is that fantastic Weihenstephaner yeast character. Faint citrus, light clove and banana, bready malt and wheat. Clean and really nice. Faint cocoa. On tasting, pretty dry, yeast forward with plenty of malt and wheat to really support it. Faint cocoa notes. Creamy mouthfeel. Superb.

Bottle (notes from 5/19/12). Slightly hazy dark caramel color with foamy white head. Smells like honey on dark whole rye bread. Tastes lightly sweet and sour with the sweet lingering. Moderate carbonation.

Pours cloudy dark copper color with a thick creamy head leaving lots of lacing. Bananas, clove and citrus aromas. Taste follows with exactly the same with a hint of maltiness. Mouthfeel is creamy with high carbonation. This is a great session beer, but not much different than the standard hefeweizen. 

--- Cheers

Opaque brown beer with massive carbonation which starts off in columns. Big frothy bubbly brownish white head.
Citric peppery wheaty smell with coriander and hints of rotten fruit - banana, apples. Fizzy and leathery.
Coke-like fizzy warmth, caramel salty watery with light bitterness. Dry fruitiness. Unpleasant sour bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Keg in Holborn Whippet. Colour is deep dark brown, cloudy, with ruby red tinges and a white head. Nose is banana and dark fruity esters, lots of clove, malty caramel and grain.Taste is sweet malty, fruity banana, dark fruit, wheat grain, clove. Beautiful balance and full flavoured.

A good looking beer with a nice brown color. Plenty of big foamy head here too, dense and leaving plenty of lacing.

Aroma is rich and malty with your prototypical banananana and clove esssence. The banana and clove aroma is very light.

Taste is all malt. Some banana and clove come through but not much.
I get more of a candied malt taste.

Mouthfeel feels thinner then one might expect.
Smooth and easy clean no aftertaste.

My overall feeling is that its good but lean and watery, just a tad though. I like the candied malt, it was dandy.

Just drank it and now enjoying Jamil Zainasheffs show on the style. He recommends that homebrewers go a little overboard if they want to win a competition, as people expect the dunkelweizens to be heavier than they typically are. I definitely enjoyed this one, Clove banana bubblegum esters... body texture carbonation. Its obviously a good beer from every aspect. If you like the Hefes youll love this one, if not youll hate it. Simple. Were so lucky these have survived the times.

The body is brown and cloudy, darkmalty, yeasty and sour. The taste is sweet-fruity, fresh, yeasty, a bit sour. Overall light and sweet. In the aftertaste fruity, yeasty and a bit sour. 12/10/10/10/11/10

Aroma of sweet caramel, malt, and citrus. Toffee brown cloudy, with a creamy white head. Flavor of citrus and sweet malt with light slightly peppery hops. Not overly heavy for a dunkel and a good representative of the style.

500ml bottle. Floral-orange nose, nothing too special. Sweet attack, with an artificial cherry and cough syrup flavor on the mid palate. The finish is dark and smokey with roasted notes. Carbonation is spot on , and the mouth feel is very coating and luxurious. Very good.
Pours cloudy brown with a lot of creamy head. Smells like most hefeweizen with a bit of caramel. Taste is the same as the smell. Palate is very smooth and creamy.

Keg at York tap. Ugly looking brown cloudy pond water with short lasting head. Aroma is slightly more citrusy than its pale counterpart, lots of clove and a light smokey earthiness, fairly low levels of banana. Moren of the same on the taste, smokey earthiness with lots of clove. Slick and sticky. Didnt like this

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Bottle. Cloudy dark amber color. Fluffy off-white head. Aroma of banana and spice, and bready malts with touch of vanilla. Palate was medium in carbonation and body. Heavy wheat flavors, with some banana and clove, and a touch of vanilla. Nice overall.
Dark brown, cloudy beer with a big head that fades away quickly. Aroma is banana so as is taste. Body is too light and sloppy.

aroma of clove, lemons, yeast. pours hazy brown good thick head with lace. taste, clove, ginger, sour, yeast, slight bitterness, lively on palate, light body slight sour finish with persistent ginger flavor.
Draft in Berlin.  Pours hazy brown/gold with a big off white head.  Aroma of banana and caramel.  Flavour is bread, toffee and banana.  Pretty good example of the style.
500ml Bottle. Very nice nice malt flavours. A well made beer. A nice and enjoyable malty beer.
bread, dough, banana, cloudy, brown, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, lively, creamy,

Hazy mid brown poor with a superb white head that laces the glass nicely.  Dominant dough like yeasty tones and wheat.  Slight presence of cloves.  Nice enough beer but dont think this style is a favourite of mine.

Amber brown color, nice hefe head. Slight banana and clove aroma.  More clove than banana in taste but everything balanced by the slight sweet malt.  This dunkel is the bomb, very good and easy as hell to drink.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 500ml bottle poured into Weihenstephaner glass. Poured a cloudy dark honey gold colour with a three-finger off-white sudsy head that initally collapsed a bit but then took time to diminish. Laced OK. Some yeast particles settled out and this detracted from the beers appearance.
 Moderate to high carbonation. Aroma traces of wheat malt as well as cloves. Taste initally soft wheat malt, some yeast and cloves on the finish. Medium body. Smooth finish. Quite a nice beer!

Draught at Taam HaIr food fair in Tel Aviv. Cloudy dark amber with a steady, creamy white head. Mud, banana and some clove aroma, mildly sweet but very refreshing, medium body, soft-to-medium carbonation, sweetish finish - awesome.
A nicely balanced beer.  Not too aggressive in the flavours, but a easy drinking dunkel.

Half pint in brauhaus, Edinburgh.
Hazy amber brown with sweet Toffee malt and spicy clove nose. Banana dominant in flavour, sweet, malt, rounded mouthfeel.

Copper colored with an off white head. Banana and biscuit nose. Full bodied dunkel. Some sweet malts and more banana flavor. This provides depth and distinction and a marvelous, long finish. A tad sweet, but completely delicious.

The normal brown 500ml bottle, best before 16th Jan 2009, reviewed on a wet and windy English Sunday afternoon in March 2008.

Poued into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass.

Muddy, dirty mid-brown colour and cloudy of course. Light, grubby biege foaming head, which is huge by the way.

The aroma is of toasted bread and burnt vanilla smells in a heady mix which also has hops and yeast esters trying to vie for attention.

The taste is all vanilla and baked bananas. Not as sweet as my discription may imply. This has hidden flavours too, you have to search for them.
Apples and Pears, non-sour citrus fruits as well.

Not as thick as I anticipated, but not watery either. The flavours stay in the mouth and dont fade to anything nasty, like some beers can.

All in all a fine beer, not the best Dunkell Hefeweissbier Ive ever had, but well up there with the better ones.
aroma of roasted malt and over ripe bananas.flavor matches the aroma.light body with heavy carbonation and creamy mouthfeel.nothingcomplex just nice and drinkable

05-MAY-2012, bottle @home, from "Barley Wine".
Murky brown and light! with lasting lacing beige head.
Yeasty and malty nose.
Bread and bananas. Really smooth and mellow drink.
No bitterness, just creamy delight.
Lovely.
(bottle)  Pours a hazy unfiltered amber brown with thick white head.  The flavor is a mellow wheat with smooth palate.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Bottle. Brown, dark gold colour, fast dissapearing faint brown head. Aroma of hefe, rosted malt and some older, very ripe banana. Very rich, yet smooth. Dark, bitter velvety taste, traces of ripe fruits, roasted cereals. A really good one.
0,5l bottle. Cloudy brown color. Medium thick head, stays. Sweet malty aroma, caramel. Smooth, watery, sweet malts all over. Caramel. Very nice beer.

We were really excited to try this one after having the Vitus from the same brewery. To be honest, we were underwhelmed. Beer is good but not great, and not on par with other German dunkels such as Erdinger Dunkel or Hacker-Pschorr Dunkel. Beer is amber in colour and oily to taste. Aroma of bananas.

Purchased at Fox & Obel in Chicago, IL; enjoyed after a 4 mile run before eating Greek food with friends.  Appearance a semi cloudy amber/dark gold with a very rich and frothy white head.  Aroma of wheat, light German yeast, bit of banana, smells light but nice.  Taste is a good blast of banana, clove, and fruit, more malty than a standard weiss beer.  Its pretty smooth too, light carbonation with medium body.  Its good, nothing stands out though.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, brown colour with a white head on top. The head stays on the entire drinking experience, wich lasted over 30 minutes. Aroma is nutty and dried fruits, with hints of typical hefeweizen coming through. Flavour was soft, having a litte sweetness and a litlle bitterness. Easy drinkable, well balanced.
16.9 oz bottle pours brown with a tan head.  Aroma of malt, spices and bananas.  Taste was pretty much the same.

500mL bottle. Pours cloudy and deep brown with a huge, effervescent white head. On the nose is toffee, cherry, dark fruit, brown sugar, bubblegum, red licorice, and banana. Taste-wise we have caramel fudge, plum, raisin, oak, dark chocolate, vanilla, lemon, bubblegum, spice, and tropical fruit esters. Mouth feel is thick and creamy with high carbonation. Finish is dry and earthy leaving tobacco, citrus, bubblegum and pineapple. Nice balance between malty caramel and fruity/yeasty flavours. Huge bubblegum. Delicious.
Bottle. Cloudy-brown with decent one-finger foamy head. A little banana aroma. Taste is of ripe bananas but little else. Very clean, almost watery. Decent mouthfeel.

Tap in the Euston Tap. Murky dark brown colour with thick white head. Malty smell, banana, cloves. Taste is quite smooth, nice malt, bit of apple and gentle spiciness. A little watery in the finish. Very nice, but actually after the normal hefe I was a touch disappointed - it was served a few degrees too cold so maybe will retry.
UPDATED: JUL 23, 2014 Light brown colour with big head. Aroma is wheat. Flavour is yeast, banana. Not that special one, but real solid dunkel hefe.

Appearance: Cloudy amber with a long lasting foamy white head 
Aroma: Yeast(dough), banana, caramel, bubblegum
Palate: Fizzy carbonation, full body.
Overall a good hefe but not off the charts.

On tap at Alquitara (Vicalvaro). Brown colour with a formation of a creamy, decent lasting, toasty and good lacing head. Aroma has slightly toasted malts with citrus and banana notes. Flavour is smooth with mild citric notes, slightly sweet and a final slightly bittery with a moderate duration. Carbonation is low, body is light to medium. Texture is oily.

Draft at Bierstube. Cloudy caramel with a thick head that left some lace. Toasted wheat flavors with some rye. Yeasty esters. Bananas. Cashews. Slight acidic bite. Good mouthfeel. Powdery. Nice dry finish.

Bottle. Hazy amber color with a thick frothy head. Aroma is dry roasted grain with a bit of rye and banana. Dry and slightly bitter taste with medium sweetness also. The whole package is perfectly in balance.
Bottle. Murky, muddy brown with a lively, off-white head. Banana and clove etc. Verging on toffee sweetness. Yeasty. Very nice. I like the foamyness.

Every time I try a new Weihenstaphaner variety, Ive enjoyed it more than I thought I would.  This is a new style for me.  500ml bottle pours a cloudy caramel color with a substantial sticky white head.  Smells of bread yeast and malts.  Aroma is even a little smoky.  Taste is a little bitter but with a very satisfying finish.
One of my favorites. Has a great white sticky head. aroma is malty and sweet.  It tastes  malty and sweet with a little bitterness. Perfect balance.  Drink it cold.

Tasted from tall bottle into a tulip. It poured a completely opaque medium copper color with an everlasting frothy white head of firm tiny bubbles and sheets of fine Belgian lace. A benchmark for beautiful appearance and beneficial bottle fermentation. Aromas of rising dough, freshly baked whole-wheat bread, cut grass, farm fields and wind-blown grain husks, caramelized brown sugar, prominant banana, black pepper and bubble-gum yeast characterists, a little clove and vanilla, distant noble hops. Mellow wheat flavors, crusty bread: fully baked but not toasted or burnt, some malty sweetness perfectly balanced by tangy, fruity, and earthy hops. Hints of apricots, honey, and resiny wood. Full, bready, yeasty, VERY creamy, slightly chalky mouthfeel. Spritzy carbonation, medium body, lingering soft bready aftertaste. An absolute timeless masterpiece of beer brewing. No wonder this brewery has been around longer than any others in the world!
Pours cloudy caramel brown colour with lasting off white head.  Fruity Weissbier aroma.  Enjoyable beer, prefer the non dunkel variety.

pours cloudy amber with a foamy white head which unleashes some awesome banana/yeast aroma with a hint of malt to follow. taste magnifies the aroma with plenty of caramel malt which sits perfectly with the beautiful banana/bubblegum yeast flavour. very carbonated so pour carefully, very drinkable, definitely the benchmark for this style.

Long Island, NY - 500 mL bottle pours a chocolate brown color with lots of flurry slightly off white head and very nice lacing.  Aroma was dead on hefeweizen with cloves and bananas. taste was the same as the lighter counterpart but a slight roasty bitterness was present. Very Good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells of banana, yeast, and raisin. Appearance is hazy brown. Absolutely delicious with burnt sugar notes but with a very well-struck balance (not overly sweet). Great.

500ml bottle at Opus.  Unfiltered orange-brown.  Creamy,, fluffy off-white head.  Medium bodied, thick chocolate tones for a Hefe.  Fresh lemony clove balance.  Quite a nice Dunkelweizen.  Classic.  Light and fluffy but also enough flavor to be interestingly complex.  Smooth yeasty tones.
Very mellow taste, light aroma, pretty good but would not buy again.
Pours a dark hazy brown with massive white head.  Aroma is of grass and hay.  Somewhat sweet flavor, with notes of banana.  Sweet, smooth finish.  Not bad.

Bottle. Rating #1039. Hazy medium brown pour with a nice beige head. Nice aroma, light toast, a little banana and a few other fruits with a bit of sweet spice. Flavor was a little less than the aroma, no toast, still some banana, but the sweet spice was a little muted. Still a decent beer for sure. (2237)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours a hazy brown sugar colour. Sweet and fresh on the nose and very caramel on the tongue. Nice subtle malt flavour.

Pours a dirty brown with a huge tan head...takes a while to pour.
Scent is slight hay,  wheat,  banana.
Flavour is faintly sweet, bready, caramel, malty, creamy....
Very smooth....very nice.
barnyard, grass, roasty, cooked vegetables, rotten eggs, brown, sparkling, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, flat,

On tap at Henriks. Pours a hazy brownish colour with a small off-white head. The aroma is sweet with dried fruit and milk chocolate. The classic weizen touch of sweet banana comes alive in the flavor, and along with chocolate it makes a nice and sweet mixture of those two, like banana split. Rich and slick mouthfeel. A tasteful dunkelweizen, pretty sweet, but good.
Pours a cloudy dark orange with very thick light tan head, minimal lacing.  Aroma of toasted wheat, caramel malt, and yeast.  Flavor matches well and is a pretty enjoyable brew,

500 ml bottle into signature weizen glass, bottled 2/2/2011.  Pours super hazy red orange color with a beautiful 3 finger fairly dense off white head with incredible retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Some nice thick lacing clings to the glass; with a ton of carbonation streaming up as expected.  Took me a while to pour this as I anticipated.  Aromas of huge banana, clove, bubblegum, orange, wheat, bread, and yeast spices.  Huge on the bubblegum here, amazing.  Taste of orange, clove, bubblegum, bread, caramel, light banana, pepper, and yeast spices.  Fairly dry on the finish; with some light lingering notes of citrus, clove, caramel, and biscuit on the finish for a short bit.  Great overall balance of flavors.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  Alcohol is pretty much invisible, and this drinks incredible smoothly.  Overall this is a fantastic dunkelweizen, and my first one in the style.  Nice amount of complexity; with very smooth drinking and a great mouthfeel.  I will definitely have it again.
Not as good as Franziskaner Dunkelweissbier, but a solid attempt.  Not as full-bodied as its rival.  Taste is almost as good, though, but not quite.  I like it.
Bottle.  Apple cider brown colored pour with a massive off white head.  Aroma is yeasty-banana.  Taste is red apple, some banana and some sourness.  Lively carbonation.

Pint to pint, fervently overflowing head settling moderately to unveil yeasty banana scent from murky amber depths...gains complexity in mouth, as flavors develop light floral and caramel character. Very smooth on the way down, finishing with pleasant apricot pucker. Quite agreeable.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Delicious and mellow, everything you want your Belgian dunkel to be. Everything I love about their amazing hefeweizen is here and added to a rich complexity and beautiful brown pour, complete with off-white head. C'est magnifique!---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.5L bottle poured into a pint glass

a: medium brown color, hazy, 1/2" off white head woth good retention. light lacing

s: slight toasted malt and banana aroma fill the air, light spice smell

t: nice in your face banana taste followed by toffee and some pleasing light fruitness. Very nice

m&d: light to medoum bodied, smooth and creamy mouth

aroam, fruit, banana cereal bread esters, color, amber hue, livey, head good retetion, taste, mellow fruityness, nice malty background, easy on the palate, overall, nice Dunkel, Ive enjoyed couple times.
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text:
AROMA: grass, hay, nuts, smoked German sausage
APPEARANCE: amber, cloudy, rocky head
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, oily feel, soft finish
OVERALL: very good weissen, nice balance of sweet to sour.

Draft at halfway house TO. Pours hazy orange brown with white head well Retained. Aroma of cloves malt toffee and light grass. Light medium body, medium carbonation. Finish leaves cloves lingering, a touch a citrusy notes and grass balanced with a light malt sweetness.
Pours a hazy light brown-red with a towering tan head.  Smells of banana, caramel.  Tastes sweet with a hint of bitterness - malty.
Bottle. Dark brown with a nice two finger foam. Basement malty notes. Pleasant gentle taste of old german beer. Balanced dryness. Like this hefe.
A more warm taste than Hefeweissbiert and he aromas are more subtle. Not as punchy as other dark beers.

500ml bottle poured into a weizen glass.

Pours a hazy medium brown with tons of carbonation. Had to wait awhile for the head to settle before I could pour the rest into the glass.

Smells quite yeasty along with banana and bubblegum. A slight bit of earthy caramel is detectable as well.

The banana/bubblegum yeastyness is quite prevalent of the taste but is quickly followed by a very light caramel malt. Quite a bit of sweetness is present as well as tons of carbonation. Just a very slight bitterness on the finish.

Overall this is a very refreshing and flavorful beer. My one complaint would be that it is a tad bit sweet but it is just a minor issue. A top notch beer in the end.
Pours a hazy amber with foamy white head. Malt, flowers, and dried fruit on the palate. Honey and dried apricots on the palate. Smooth finish. Nice silky mouthfeel.

Bottle. Cloudy copper with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, bread and banana/clove hef yeast. Flavor is dark bready malt, slightly sweet caramel and a light tart yeast taste. Medium body with average carbonation and a slightly thick mouth feel. Good beer for the style, not my favorite style though.

Bottle (500ml):
An outstanding beverage and one the I insist you look out for and try, this was a steal at only £2.25 for the bottle; if only it was more readily available in my area. I dont think it is just quite as good as the original hefeweizen offering from Weihenstephaner but it is an excellent change and the flavours all work well together. Get a bottle if you can.

1001 Beers Blog:
Some lasting creamy head, dark amber yellow. nose with raspberry, caramel, cocoa, light! Medium body and some creamy length. Taste of cocoa, caramel, fruity.
Bottle.  Caramel color, cloudy, tall white foamy head.  Yeasty aroma, a little earthy, strong carbonation.  Malty balanced taste.  Good dark hefe.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy dark orange with a large off-white head.  Aroma of wheat and yeasty banana.  Flavor of banana, wheat and mild, light roasted malt.  Yeasty finish.  Not a big fan of the banana flavors but not bad.
Bottle. This beer has all the standard hefeweizen characters but with added dark fruit and slight spice. Good but I prefer the normal hefe.

Poured a brown with large head. Was neither heavy nor light and was slightly sweet with hints of light and dark fruits along with hops and a dose of wheat and malt. Aroma was yeasty. Well balanced and refreshing, tasty.
Aroma of malt and sourdough bread. Pours a closet brown with a massive head. Taste is smooth and bready with almost sparkling carbonation with a slightly peppery aftertaste.
Nice dark amber color and has a sweet wheat scent. Has a similar taste as the scent, could drink again.

0,5 l. bottle in to a weizen glass. Unclear, dark brown colour with an orange hue. Big beige head that faded slowly. Lots of weizen aromas: Banana, clove, herbs, those doughy yeasts and chocolate malts. Taste is light sweet with spices, banana and  chocolate. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes with yeasts and sweet, exotic fruits. Very good and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a very hazy, dark orangey amber with a large light beige head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat, spiciness, some caramel. Taste begins banana and cloves, some spiciness and caramel. Aftertaste is strongly wheat, not so sour though. Palate is light, carbonated and refreshing. Alright, but not really up to the standards set by their hefeweizen. Goes well with pizza.

Weihenstaphaner Hefeweissbier Dunkel has a super-thick, fluffy beige head and a cloudy, orange-amber appearance, with some lacing left behind, but not a lot. The aroma is mostly of sweet brown bread and water. Taste is likewise of sweetness, brown bread, and water. Both aroma and flavor have subtle spice aspects, but these are very subdued. There is an overriding watery aspect to this beer. Mouthfeel is pretty heavy (like liquid brown bread), and the finish is easy drinking and somewhat dry. Overall, this is very good, and I think one should try it at least once.  RJT
Brown color with a fine thick head. Wheat aroma. Malty bread flavor. Fine average dunkelweizen.

(Flasche) Es ist hefetrüb und dunkelbraun. Und es hat eine fast weiße Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist leichte malzig mit einer dezenten Röstnote im Kopf. Der Geschmack ist vollmundig, weich und malzig. Retronasal ist sehr gering die Röstnote zu erkennen. Bittere ist nicht vorhanden. Zusammengefasst; ein leckeres Weißbier, aber nicht unbedingt für den Massenkonsum geeignet (an einem Abend).

Big bottle from vintage estates.  Been waiting to taste this for years and I finally scored a bottle. Only $3.50 for more than a pint. Nice big light brownish cloudy pour and it smells mildly like bananas. Rocky alabaster head does not fade and it goes rocky like crags. Lots of gunk in the bottom of this bottle, my mouth is watering. First taste is nice smooth hefe beer sensations. Goodly amount of CO2.  Rather friendly.  Not any bitterness can be detected but this certainly is beer in a refined state. Oh yes, not bad and fairly mild to say the least. I want to really like this beer but there is this slight nagging dullness in there I cant quite identify. Finish is creamy with no lingering aftereffects.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a brown color with a big foamy beige head. Nose is lightly nutty and yeasty with some brown sugar. Palate is smooth and clean. Flavors of nuts, dry earthy yeast notes, light sweetness.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2012 50cl bottle shared with a friend.Decent white head.  Hazy amber pour.  Nice beer.

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Hazy light brown - a bit orange - color with beige frothy head. Banana, yeasty, citrus aroma, deliciously malty. Light bitter taste. Medium body with slick, creamy texture and average carbonation. Frsh citrus finish. Delicious beer, bitterish, wheaty and yeasty. A very good one.
Had this one in a two-liter boot at the Schnitzelplatz in Glendale Heights, Illinois.

500 mL of draught at Zeitgeist in London.  Caramel brown with a good creamy head into an Erdinger glass.  Wheat and malt aroma.  Decent, wheaty and starchy, with a little sweetness.  Tasty but not amazing.

16.9 oz bottle.  Hazy brown with a super foamy head.  Nose is green banana, brown sugar, light smoke and paste.  Medium body with a zesty buzz.  Taste is wheat, a touch sour, cola and bitter clove.  Not the best from these guys.
Pours clear and brown with very foamy head, had to pause the pour for the carbonation to settle the head a bit.  Slight aroma and sweet taste.
500 ml. bottle.  Pours a cloudy brown with a large biege head.  Aroma of malt, grain and yeast.  Taste is wheat, bananas, caramel, a bit of citrus and a bit of hops.  Pretty good.
500 ml bottle that poured a cloudy light brrown color.  Aromas of roasted malt, wheat, banana, clove and a kiss of  citrus.  Flavor matches the aromas, but was nicely balanced and refreshing.

Location/Date:Bottle on November 13, 2011.
Appearance: Pours a medium fading to light brown.
Aroma: Aroma is malty, bready.
Taste: Mostly medium sweetness from the malt.
Palate:Medium light body, fizzy.
Summary: An interesting beer, I dont love the high level of carbonation even if the style calls for it.

On tap at Cardinal. Pours murky, muddy orange with a large, creamy, tan colored head. Plenty of ripe banana and clove on the nose. Sweet, spicy, toasted and light acidic with toasted notes and brown sugar. Medium body. Smooth. Doughy texture. Ends with a light dry tongue.
me gusta un poco mas que la clara aunque se parecen bastante olor intenso a banano clavo y levadura, al paladar fruta,citricos muy agradable y un after taste   unico de una espectacular dunkelweisse
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
26/10/2011 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 9/3/12  (2011-585)
Very cloudy rustbrown beer, huge light beige creamy head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: mainly citrus fruits, bread, little bit of ripe bananas. MF: too much carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus fruits, bit of banana, caramel, bready, raisins. Aftertaste: more banana, still citrus fruits, some milk chocolate. Not bad, but a bit disappointing after the "regular" Hefeweiss.

Meglepően sötét, vöröses mélynarancs színű folyadék, mesebeli, szinte virágos, mézes, propoliszos fullasztó élesztőillattal, amilyet csak Bajorországban tudnak előállítani, vagy legalábbis én még máshol nem találkoztam effélével. A habja olyan, amilyennek lennie kell, grandiózus, kenyérbélszerű, tartós.

Hihetetlenül finom, apró bubikkal pezsgő teste van, megtölti a szádat és komplex kavargó érzéseket kelt. Nehéz pontosan megmondani, mi történik, de az biztos, hogy mindenekelőtt az üde búzaaroma és karamellesség játszadozik egymással.

A kavargás a fő jellegzetessége, kaleidoszkópszerűen keringenek benne a törékeny ízek, és végül ebből a játékból alakul ki a sör egészen megnyugtatóan kerek íze, melyet mintha némi sósság vagy umami is kisegítene, távolról a főtt zöldségek (karalábé, zeller) ízével kiegészülve. Határozottan van benne valami húslevesszerű. A komló itt egyértelműen nem főszereplő, max masiniszta, de jól öltözött, tiszta, és udvarias akár a Savoy londínere.

Eleinte azért is nehéz kiismerni a Weihenstephaner Hefedunkelt, mert nagyon törékeny, finom teste van, a végsőkig kicsiszolt és filigrán, de később, ahogy megül, íze robusztusabb lesz, szétterül, olajosabb, néhol borosabb lesz. Majd végül előtörnek belőle a megnevezhetetlen trópusi gyümölcsök, melyek a nyíltkádas főerjesztés hiszterikus napjaiban költöznek a becsületes maláta közé.
Az utóíze elegánsan kesernyés, leheletnyit csípős, élesztős. Ha hihetünk az előző Weihenstephan kóstolásomnak, akkor ez a barna búza eonokkal izgalmasabb a sima weiss-társánál.

Aroma is a lovely, resounding banana, with a subtle citrus in the back. Also, yeast compliments this and makes that yogurty aroma that I associate with wheat beers. Taste is lovely, but the main feature is how this beer hugs that palate. Ive not yet had a beer sit so nicely on my tongue, and still get its flavours across. Taste wise theres the banana coming through, and the yeast, but almost a chocolate note in the back, along with the slightly more roasted malts, Whether it is chocolate or not Im not sure, maybe its more of a textural thing Im getting. Very light, but noticeable hop at the very end to finish with a floral undertone. This drink sucks you into the glass, Im dying to get tucked into the rest of this, NOM.

On tap at Amundsen, Osl. Murky brown beer. Fruity aroma, cherries come to mind. Soft wheat feel, and a strange fruity flavor, too. I must try this from the bottle - there must be something wrong with this keg.

500ml bottle pours a light brown color with a small white head and minimal lacing.  Aroma is lightly toasted malts with some yeast and bananas and cloves.  Taste is light malty sweetness with some bananas, cloves and a little yeast and a mellow hop bitterness in the finish.  A nice refreshing darker brew that is easy to drink.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Hazy brown colour, moderate white head. Pleasant aroma of ripe bananas, cloves and brown bread. The flavour has also notes of brown bread, hints of banana and cloves, but is far drier than the aroma makes you expect. Minimal bitterness. Refreshing and easy drinking - could easily be recommended even for pale lager drinkers who think that everything darker than piss yellow must be dangerous.

Tap at Weihenstephaner Restaurant, Berlin: Very cloudy dark red-brown beer with plenty of yeast sediment and a large off-white head. Fruity and slightly toasted aroma with notes of caramel, banana, wheat bread and yeast. Sweet, spicy flavor with hints of banana, caramel, toffeee and spices, including a strange but pleasant undertone of cinnamon. Creamy texture, medium body, smooth but well-carbonated. Dry slightly malt-bitter finish.

The aroma is bananas in chocolate syrup in excelsis. Hazy amber-brown in colour with a persistent pillowy head. The flavour dwells on that cocoa and banana with full mouthfeel and and soft thirst quenching body. Theres not a lot to say about this beer that dwells on the negative. Delightful.

The beer pours a hazy brown color with a huge off-white head. The aroma is full of wheat, toffee and cloves with quite a bit of banana mixed in. A very nice aroma.

The flavor is similar. I get a lot of toffee and brown sugar notes, as well as some wheat and banana. All of the notes meld together perfectly as I have come to expect from Weihenstephaner wheat beers. 

Medium mouthfeel and high carbonation.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is dark tanish-orange color with lots of foamy, beige head.  Aroma is sweet and roasty with some fruit notes.
