Taste is good balance of sweet malts and roasted grains, subtle Weizen fruitiness, and a tart citrus note.  Palate is medium-bodied, very smooth texture, average carnbonation, and a long-lasting, sweet-tart finish.

At a tasting in "Temple Bar - Irish Pub" - Haifa branch, on-tap, pours cloudy dark amber color with a white head that remained a long time, sparkling, sweetish, malt and slightly alcoholic aroma, slightly contact glue, tasteless, anemic and metallic taste, flows, medium body, lively carbonated in the palate, and overall a reasonable beer, nothing more.

Cloudy orange.
Complex and prominent flavours.
Too sickly and fruity for my liking.
Rating from memory.

Bottle, poured at the RIFT Dunkelweizen calibration tasting. This was easily my favorite of the Dunkeweizens, combining the rich decoction maltiness with their great, balanced yeast profile. I think very highly of Weihenstephaner when it comes to traditional examples. This is no exception. The richest most expressive darker malt profile. If Im ever craving this style, this is the one Ill go for.

500mL bottle.  Poured medium orange with a creamy, well-retained off-white head.  The aroma picked up warm banana, darker chocolates, and some cocoa.. white peppery yeast and earthy notes surrounded.. well-balanced.  The flavor found similar stuff.. ripe banana, chocolates, and biscuity malt at the core.. peppery yeast and wheat extended outward.. vanilla joined wheaty character and dry chocolate malts on the finish.. tasty.  Medium-bodied and very well carbonated on the palate.. really rolled through the mouth.. very good feel, flow, and balance.

Das dunkle Hefeweizen aus Weihenstephan präsentiert sich mit leicht dunkel-trüber Farbe, stabilem Schaum und viel co2. 
Der Geruch ist fruchtig, hefig. 
Der Anfang gibt sich perlig. Es folgt eine fruchtige, leicht bananige Mitte. Später auch wässrig-bitter. 
Den Abschluß bildet ein säuerliches Finish. 
Kein herausragendes dunkles Hefeweizen, dafür bedürfte es eines volleren Körpers. 
Als Durstlöscher jedoch gut, der flott über die Zunge geht.Test vom 5.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

500 ml bottle from BevMo online (Pleasanton). Nose is bananas, wheaty bread, and caramel. Murky light brown with a big light beige head. Flavor is banana with light bitterness and contrasting hints of sweetness.

Bottle from Peckhams. Pours a cloudy light brown colour with a huge beige head. Aroma of banana, coffee, chocolate and caramel. Quite yeasty with similar banana, coffee and chocolate flavours. Heavily carbonated with a little CO2 prickle. Foamy mouth-feel. Nice balance between fruity hop characters and biscuity malt backbone. Nice yeasty, banana and berry linger.

This pours a cloudy light brown color with a 3 finger foamy beige head that does linger around. It has a ton of carbonation and some spotty lacing.

The aroma is actually quite boring. I get a little wheat notes and some faint yeasty notes.

I can honestly say, I am disappointed by the flavor. I get some wheat notes, yeast. It has hints of some over ripe bananas and very light carmel. It still feels super thin and watery. In addition to that, it is over carbonated.

It finishes with a little citrus zip and some faint hops.  It leaves a strange lingering I have to say not really a great offering. I wouldnt reach for another.
Keg at Euston Tap, London. A brown coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Sweet, malty, banana aroma. Tastes sweet, banana, wheaty, malty, yeasty. Like a Belgian, decent stuff.

500ml bottle in a Weizen glass.  Pours brown with a thick, cream-colored head.  Aroma of wheat, some bread and nuts in the malts, and light floral hops.  Better than the normal hefeweissbier.  Average texture.  A good beer.

On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY.  I was expecting this to be much darker, but it came off the tap as a deep, murky brown.  Tasted nutty and sweet, some caramel in the taste.  Very creamy mouthfeel, and a classic example of the style.

(Bottled) The beer looks fantastic in a weizen glass....glowing deep brown ,with flamboyant beige mountain formats as its head.   Estery nose ...with choco and vanilla ice cream.  In my mouth its basically the unity of a Hefe and a Dunkle ...both vibes .  Rich palate , fruity pear esters ...chocolate oilyness .  A cultured expereince.

A beautiful dark Weissbeer from Weihenstephaner. Isnt the tastiest but very drinkable and a nice color.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice clean taste. Rich flavour up front, but the finish disappears too quickly with a watered down aftertaste.
brown, frothy, brown foam, caramel, nuts, quite short finish is compensated by great foam

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2011 Sűrű malátaszörp, leginkább meggyes, olykor némi édes barack ízzel. Az uralkodó savanykás íz dominaként tapad a nyelvedhez - nem kiemelkedő, "csak" egy jó nyári üdítőital.
Csapolva, Csakajósör!, Budapest, Hu.

Thick malt syrup with a taste of sour cherry accompanied by some sweet peach. The dominant sour taste tends to cling to your tongue like a dominatrix. This is not an excellent beer, its only a nice and refreshing summer drink. 
Draught beer at Csakajósör! Budapest, Hungary.

Bottle in weizen glass. Faint but pleasant aroma of banana poppy seed muffins. Murky reddish brown colour. Nice stable head. Lively palate. Taste is a sweet wheat muffin taste. Not bitter at all. Doesnt last long.

Pours a dirty brown, lightly carbonated. The nose is a little malty and bready, overall pretty light. The taste is as light, but there is a light hop bitterness underneath the wheat & malt sweetness. Finishes a little tangy, but is very smooth and refreshing.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy light brown with a large head of light tan foam.  The nose has a bit of skunk, metallic note, and a sour malt undertone.  I hope this one hasnt gone bad.  The flavor is a little more forgiving with notes of clove and dark rustic bread.  There is a touch of fruitiness, yeast, and subtle spice.  Light to medium body with aggressive carbonation but a clean finish.  Certainly not bad, but not a style I really dig at this time.
Murky and brownish with a huge cream colored head. Aroma of bubblegum, banana, sweet malts, and citrus. The taste is well balanced; sweet, spicy and yeasty. Medium bodied and silky smooth. Very good.
Not quite as good as the helles, but this one is just a stomper, a destroyer, on a hot day it is almost unmatched.

pours medium dark brown with a towering light beige head, excellent retention and lacing. roasted malts and wheat - complex. sweetness, a tad too much for me. medium to full body, lively carb at the beginning and soft toward the end - great. very good brew.

16oz bottle from Picks poured into my Weihenstephaner glass.

Pours a dark tan/light brown. Almost like a light whiskey color. Aroma is very sweet malt. Nuts and caramel. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. It tastes "brown". Like a very dark wheat. Medium bodied with a thick texture. Soft carbonation and an abrupt sweet finish. Overall, its pretty good. I wouldnt seek it out but I would drink it again.
(This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

My Bottom Line :  
Complex and quenching, ripe with apricot fruitiness, toasted wheat malts and earthy hops, this is a fascinating Dunkel Weizen. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A healthy head of foam lingers all the way down the pint glass atop the cloudy amber-brown. 
-Light caramel coats the dark bread impressions. 
-A touch of clove phenols and banana esters are here, obviously, but there is so much more going on. This is so far from being linear like most North American Dunkel Weizens. 
-The body is fluffy and angel-cake-like. At once rich and light.
-All flavors are perfectly integrated into one another.

On tap at the Weihenstephaner restaurant in Berlin.
Light brown with white head. Banana, clove, bready malts, wheat. Light body.

Bottle. Pours light brown, hazy with a big white head. Turns into a steady foam after a few minutes. Strong aroma with wheat, caramel, banana and bread. Great taste with the above hints again. Gentle hop finish. This is the best dunkelweizen I had (so far).

Beer pours light brown hazy with a generous white lacing head. Aroma is of wheat malt, light caramel, fruit (banana) and yeast. Flavour is lightly sweet wheat malt, light caramel, banana and fruity yeast. Very well balanced. Finish is short dry with no detectable bitterness. It is a very good Hefeweizen Dunkel.

Bottle from Thai supermarket. What a surprise to find virtually the entire series of Weihenstephaner here in Hua Hin, Thailand! Never thought this is the place where I would rate most of their beers. :-D Pours a lovely deep hazy nougat body with a big, cloudy head. Nose is deep malts, wheat, dried plums and nuts with hints of banana. Lovely again. Taste is wheat, roasted malts, hints of nougat, wort and toffee. Full-bodied yet utterly drinkable. A great dunkelweizen for sure.
Colour is quite orange for a dunkel. Smells fresh but a bit weird. Tastes not too sweet. Palate is quite soft, low carbo.

Billowy off white head tops this murky brown brew. Cloves, spice, with a hint of banana is typical of the Weihenstephaner brand. Wheat malt is light and refreshing. Added malts give some bready taste but are not very noticeable. Finish is smooth and not at all bitter.

Weihen hefe dunkel - 7/6/11. On tap. Cloudy blood orange pour with a frothy tan head that fades but laces a bit. Light bananas and cream aroma with a touch of caramel. Sweet caramel flavor with bananas and cream again. Straightforward but quite nice.

bottle - First off, oops I poured too fast and my entire glass filled with off-white head. So once it settles, it is cloudy like a hefe, but is a much darker amber brown. There is some lovely lacing on the glass from my rather terrible pour. Aroma is wheat, brown sugar, caramel, nuts, dough, and woody. Taste is slightly sweet and malty. Palate is a little creamy, medium weight. Its like a more zen and less version of a hefe. Awesome!
Hazy brownish orange color., thick lively haed. Smell very musty. Tastes like a thin watery abbey dubbel. low carbo, low body.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, banana ond cloves. Taste is wheat, banana. caramel. cloves. Thin to medium body, high lively carbonation. Lovely crisp and refreshing dunkelweizen. 040711

500ml bottle - Pours hazy chestnut with a huge foamy off-white head. Beautiful. If I closed my eyes and smelled this, Id guess it was a standard hefe. Tons of banana and clove, and very crisp and light. nothing dark about it. The difference comes through on the taste more. Theres still heavy spicing and a bit of bubble gum fruitiness, but its hidden under a layer of dry, bready malt. Some mineral aspects to it, too, which makes most of the finish pretty abrupt. There is some light fruitiness in the long finish though. Overcarbonated, but Ive come to expect that of some of the German wheat beers. Still, an awesome beer.

Appearance is murky orangish-brown with yellowish 3 finger head.  Aroma is clove, bready wheat, and slight banana.  Taste is banana bread, spice, nuts, a hint of tanginess and a lingering spicy yeast finish.  Palate is medium and sticky but with lively carbonation.  The finish is more juicy than dry.  Overall, an interesting style although I certainly prefer regular hefeweizen to dunkel.
Strong banana and fruit in the aroma along with the expected malty element.  The flavor is almost like a banana split, with caramel and a hint of chocolate.  Very solid dunkel.
Appearance  is brown.  Has a very yeasty and wheat aroma.  Mmmm very good taste.  So smooth.  Taste is similar to the aroma.  Hint of carbonation and banana.  Does not taste dark.

On tap at North Bar Leeds. Really liked this one. Dark red-brown colour, decent white head. Spices, vanilla, fruits and a touch of roasted malts in tha rather fantastic nose. Sweet taste with yeast contributing very nicely but not overwhelmingly to the palate. Spice is also there, along with caramel. Fairly medium-full bodied, nice long finish. This is a very nice beer. Incidentally, dunkel is a wonderful word that is a lot of fun to say. Try it, itll keep you amused for hours.
the beer is very well balanced, its dark colour is typical across the dunkel wheat beers. soft malty full-bodied taste

Cloudy copper/amber, good white head. Great nose - sweet, pungent, vanilla, spices. Really rich. Palate is sweet and yeasty but not overwhelming. Hints of orange, more spice. Finish is sticky and reasonably long. Lovely.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a big creamy white head. Aroma is big malty, chewy and dark bready malts with some yeast and hops. Taste is moderte sweet dark caramel, balanced by the hops, light sweet aftertaste, ends rather quick.
An average dunkel with nothing particularly noteworthy.  The aroma is fruity and pleasant.  Pours a carmel brown with very little head.  The palate is on the watery side.

Dark red body and kind of clear. Roasted nuts, caramel, white bread. Medium bitterness, with spices and malts. Too low carbonated for me, especially when served as 50cl pour. Pretty full on flavour so no complaints there. Well balanced. (On tap at Lemmys, 4,80 EUR)

A wonderful appetizing and drinkable dunkel. The pour is a murky brown with a thick two finger beige head. The aroma is thick and malty with a nice roasted wheat malt and German yeast. The middle is sweet with a bready caramel wheat malt and grassy hop. The finish is of a light German hop and wheat yeast. A good brew overall.
light and semi sweet. dark amber/ light brown. finishes banana. very enjoyable, but perhaps a lighter mouthfeel than i would like. it was surprisingly light.

500ml bottle into weizen. Light-brown pour, massive lively head. Aroma is spice, yeast, banana. Taste is sweet, notes of sugar and caramel on top of the flavours in the aroma. Nice beer, but the standard hefe is better.
Well balanced with a sweet mouthful including caramel and some banana. Hint of orange in the finish. Good beer.

Der Antrunk ist malzig, eher aber noch säuerlich. Der Mittelteil ist nussig malzig und wirkt auf mich ein wenig unstimmig. Der Nachgeschmack wirkt wie bei einem Weihnachtsbier, malzig und recht würzig. Dabei ist dieses Bier noch Weizentypisch hopfig. 	 
Test vom 31.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,11,12,9,8,11 - 10,80

Acting like their Hefeweizens sluttier cousin, this Weihenstephaner dark beer comes on bigger and sexier, and leaves you feeling slightly cheap in the end.  While the dark, deep Dunkel debauchery (alliteration is fun) coats your palate in glazed wheat exuberance, the caramel and dark spice flavors grow to be too much, leaving you wishing you stuck with old reliable.  A good bottle, but wont replace Weihenstephaners Hefe in your rotation anytime soon.  (11/08)
Aroma is full of spices, darkened wheat, and banana. Flowery and fresh. Banana, clove, roasted wheat, hard fruits, and citrus peel for flavors. Fizzy mouthfeel. This is a solid beer for sure.

[From bottle pour bought in Carterville, IL]
Appearance: reddish-orange-brown. Head is cloudy and laces the glass but lasts no longer than 2-3 minutes.
Smell: slight bananas, alcohol, little caramel.
Taste: mild bananas, caramel.  The flavors are more subdued than their hefe-weizen.
Mouthfeel:  creamy, very carbonated, but not effervescent like their hefe-weizen.
Overall: Okay, but not as tasty as their hefe-weizen.
Pours brownish amber with a beige head. Aroma is fruity, wheaty malt, yeast, and light spice. Taste is wheaty, sweet malt, and light spice.
Similar to regular hefe but slightly more complex, less banana on the palate.

From notes: Poured cloudy orange-amber with a thick head.  Aromas of banana esters, yeast and black pepper.  Palate was light and smooth.
Pleasant.  Flavor is peppery with a mild banana note.

Appearance: medium brown, frothy off-white head.  Aroma: some banana, nutty bread and spices (clove).	 Taste:  wheat and malt, bread, slight chocolate (?), banana.   Finish: medium, smooth, mellow and a little roasty.   Notes:  Not bad; a drier, darker, nuttier version of a typical HW.  Almost like a banana bread.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, light roasted notes, banana and clove. Flavour is light roasted caramel, wheat, banana and clove.
Color ambar turbio, sabor no muy agradable, como a melasa, con sabor a algo a medio fermentar.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. My 2nd favourite Weihenstephan (after the korbinian). Fantastic roasted flavours mingling with your typical hefe flavours. Great beer

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2011 Aroma: bananas, prominent malt scent, though thats probably the wheat. Sour. Appearance: beer into a tall, straight glass. Its a cloudy bronze, with a massive dense head that refuses to leave the glass. Frustrating, but amusing. Taste: a bit sour, some "banana bread" taste, some sweetness, a bit woody. Pretty good. Palate: fizzy and tingly and it suits the beer. Thin for sure. Theres a bit of an aftertaste, but I cant put my finger on what it is.... Overall: Very refreshing, decent beer for sure. Too bad its $3.50 a bottle..... :-(
Pretty solid drinkable beer. Hints of banana, and maybe very light citrus, and the malty presence was not too overbearing.

Slightly cloudy, golden brown beer with a huge frothy, tan head; lacing is good 

Typical weiss beer aromas: coriander, banana, grains; also a subtle honey; some grainy malty underneath the yeastiness; a bit subdued in all, but at the end there is a touch of sour mash aromas that are interesting

Taste is banana, cloves, lemon up front but a pleasant roasted (a tad burnt) malt undertone; this is a grainy and somewhat simple yet delicious beer

Mouthfeel is a little thin and watery but the beer does sit nicely on the tongue long after it is down the throat. Appropriate for the style IMO.
Darker malts give this dunkleweizen a more toasty, robust flavor, which compliments the banana and clove notes, and the wheaty, slightly fruity aroma and taste. Nice!
Yeah this was a treat as is anything from Weihenstephaner. Darkish haze with a medium body and medium to long finish.

0.5l bottle from fridge, left to warm up a little first. hazy dark brown with some head. great wheaty aroma. Malty and sweet, with a little amount of carbonation, with just a little amount of bitterness. long finish.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2012 50 cl, bottled. Pours hazy tawny beer with an irregular white head. Aroma: Mild banana, wheat, yeast. Taste: Moderate sweetness. mild caffe mocha, malt, potatoes and candyfloss in flavour. Roasted nuts. Some bitterness. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, a bit thin, too. Average carbonation. I can see the dunkel.

Cloudy reddish brown with a big and lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, light caramel, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet. Soft and smooth with a sweet and light acidic finish. Excellent. 011009
Murky, medium-brown colour...malt, banana and clove on the nose...toffee, walnut and coriander on the tongue...one of my favourite wheat beers...the name is a mouthful...so is the taste.

500ml brown bottle. Light brown pour with golden edges. Hazy. Good looking foamy, creamy lasting cap. Clove-like aroma, notes of hay and malt. Flavour of malt, straw, lemon, bread, some soft banana sweetness, cloves. Yeasty dry finish. Soft bodied, mildly carbonated. Very enjoyable, classic brew.

There is a significant funk to this beer I am having trouble placing. There is toasty malts in the nose almost like popcorn. Fruit in there too with some nutmeg, a very strange blend. Good foam on pour, hazy light brown and orangy colour. Th
Bottle. Pours honey brown with a beige head. Wheaty aroma, with banana like fruity notes, brown sugar, and chestnuts. The flavor has light banana, spices, honey, caramel, and chestnuts. Nice.
Bottle 50 cl. Hazy dark golden to amber color with a huge white very durability crown. Aroma yeast, malt and caramel. The taste is slightly sweet forfriskendeog. All in all a great beer

Tap @ Weihenstephan Restaurant, Berlin. This is a hazy light brown body with a one-fingersized off-white head. Nose is yeast, banana with some cloves-hints and apple-peal. Tastes really good. The typical weihensterphan hefe-taste only with a nice dunkel twist. A bit darker and maltier. Also a sweet rich nice melon-note hidden in there. Lively carbonated and medium bodied. Ends in a quick yeasty finish. Refreshing and really good!

Pours hazy, pale bown. Ridiculously big white foamy white head with terrific retention. Aroma is both wheaty and yeasty -- surprisingly clove-heavy. Well well! Taste is heavy on wheat and banana. Oily mouthfeel and sweet finale. Beer rarely gets better than this one. Appropriate for every, every occasion.
Draught. Cloudy orange brown with a good heft head. Aroma is yeast and bubblegum, so citrus. Flavour is bread with a candy base. Finish is dry with some bitter caramel

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2012 Pours a dark orange-brown body with white head. Yeasty intense aroma, cereal, wheat, honey. Sweet flavour with wheat and banana. (8/5/8/5/17)
Cloudy dark copper body with a white head. Great aroma with wheat, lots of banana and vanilla, caramel and licorice. Yeasty flavour with wheat, banana, licorice, vanilla. Great.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2011 It pours a hazy medium gold with a decent white head. Light retention and lacing. The aroma is light with notes of flowers, hops, and honey. The taste is what you would expect from a weiss, not a big fan of this style. The taste was light, and it had a very unpleasant finish that contriubted to a poor mouthfeel as well. You can this all because its so light despite its weird after-taste.

Bottle, thanks to Cole for the share. Pours murky tawny with a green flash. Thick pale tan head, quite persistent, lacing is ropey. Nose is banana, clove, light cinnamon, some bubblegum, light wheat and yeast notes as well. Flavours of spicy wheat, really nice and balanced and bitter, but the bitterness does detract from the yeast notes ever-so-slightly in my opinion. Vague citrus and raisin fruit, some nuttiness and strong clove. Medium to lighter-bodied, underripe bananas come through on the finish...

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Re rate 3/17. Lowered from 3.8.  Not for me.   Sweet carbonation doesnt work. More beer needed.....................banana and grass aroma  pours a caramel/honey color with big white head.   flavor is toned down version of aroma.  great session beer?

will have MORE

Bottle. Fluffy light tan head that lasts a good while; murky orange muddy brown color.  Cloves, apples, wheat, and toffee in the aroma.  BIt of cloves and spice in the flavor, raw wheat, cinnamon, and a slight sweetness and banana finish.  Medium to heavier body with very present carbonation.  NIce brew, but not quite up there with the others in the style.

[3600-20110219] 500mL bottle. Peaty banana aroma. Hazy, dark brown red body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head and some thick lacing. Fresh banana peach yeast flavour. Medium body. Tasty, interesting. (7/4/6+/3/14) 3.4
(@ The Only Cafe, Toronto, ON)

Poured into a large lager glass. Appearance is a hazy dark copper color with an impressive, thick, head of beige foam resting lazily on the top of the beer. Aroma is an interesting surprise. Never having had this style before, I didnt know what to really expect. I was greeted with an exciting green apple scent, some sweet chocolate malts, and perhaps some roasted nuts and wood. With such wonderful scents filling my nostrils, I couldnt wait to have the first sip so, alas, this great smelling beer has graced my tongue; I didnt get the funky taste I was hoping for though. Not to say this isnt a wonderful beer, but I was hoping for something sour after my initial sniffing. The taste I did get was a light, chocolate, some bread, a touch of vanilla, and a dash of woody notes. The finish is a culmination of all of these flavors joining together in a slowly fading finish. I think this is my favorite of the Weihenstephaners thus far, but Ive several to go yet.

Bottle. Murky brown body with a typically good weizen head. Aroma has hints of malt and banana competing with a bit excessive yeast presence. Taste is bready and yeasty; a bit light in general. Finish is short. Good but not very exciting.

med brown, metamucil colour, fairly hazy
wheat beer, banana bread (as opposed to merely bananas) and coriander aromas
med body and very fizzy
banana, toffee, walnut and coriander flavours
slightly breadier than normal weissen
nice
fiziness makes it a bit crisper than normal weissen as well.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 1 pint 0.9oz bottle into a Weizen Glass. The abv is listed on the label at 5.3% and there is no freshness date.

Appearance: It has a deep hazy orange amber body with visible carbonation. A quick pour fills the glass with foam. After a minute to settle I very slowly finished pouring and ended up with a nice three finger head. The light beige head hangs on well and makes lots of cool lace patterns on the glass.

Smell: Big German yeast notes rush up to fill my nose. The aroma is all about the classic banana notes with some mild clove and bready sweet malt.

Taste: The best way to describe this beer is that is like banana bread with nuts and chocolate chips. The palate is a firm medium body with nice active carbonation.

Notes: Outstanding!!! This beer is a work of wheat beer art.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2011 Original rating - Cloudy toffee colour with less head than expected. Banana and toffee on the nose (as expected). Creamy texture, more toffee and banana but slightly drier than expected on the end. It refreshes and makes you want to drink some more.  
Re-rating 14.03.10 - getting a savoury spicey note on the nose, its parsnip!

Bottle from Sams.  I think I love this beer.  Pours a orange brown that almost glows with its haziness... firm beige head.  Beaut of a pour.  Nose shows generous banana and clove, warm yeasty bread, sweet and darker caramels... very well balanced, and similar on the taste.  Light, refreshing palate.  I might stock up on these.  Underrated go-to beer.

I adore the straight hefeweiss from weihenstephaner and was excited to try this take on it!  It pours a very murky brown with mountains of head.  On first impression its exactly like the hefeweiss - same bright fragrant banana/clove/yeasty flavors that are oh so good.  Towards the finish though you start to get some dunkel character - some caramel malty sweetness.  The finish ends up having quite a bit of caramel in it.  Doesnt quite match the original - one could say the original has a "clearer purpose" than this one which muddles about from thing to thing.

Bottle.
Dark amber with some tan head.  Very good aroma - yeast, banana, and some dark fruit.  Taste is smooth with banana, clove, and a nice wheat bite.  Very good Dunkel!

Looks great thick beige head. very rich dark brown colour. Banana and corriander are strong on the nose. Great mouth feel. flavour is amazing. upfront it is all wheat beer. then you get the darker malts coming through mid palate and the spices mingling with the caramel sweetness of the dark malts as the wheat dies off in the finish. This is a fantastic beer!!

500mL bottle, pours a cloudy light brown / dark amber with a big beige head. Aroma of nuts, banana and dark fruits. Flavour of banana upfront, with caramel malts, toasted malt and subtle dark fruits. The banana lingers. Very nice.

Just respect for the oldest brewery in the world.
This is not my favourity stile, but Ive to admit this beer is super.
Dark amber one with off-white foam. Aroma is nice, dark fruits, malt and a marked smell of banana,
very typical in this kind of beer. Some yeasts. Flavour is sweet, with medium body and a medium carbonation.
Theres something hypnotic about this one. Floral notes on the nose. It pours with a nice two inch head. The taste is nicely balanced with extra maltiness and spices. Just a beautiful beer.
This is one of my all-time favourite beers. Smells like a fruit-garden, tastes like sweet bread, bananas, oranges and clove. A wonderful blend, would drink this any time again.
I enjoy this more than the regular hefeweissbier, the dark aspect adds many malty notes to an otherwise beatiful lager, highly recommended

UPDATED: APR 24, 2012 Bottle @ home. Pours a hazy brown appearance with a fairly big, creamy tan head. Dark wheat malty nose with hints of bananas, cloves, and yeast. This has a full bodied, yet soft dark wheat flavor with a fairly strong yeast, banana, and clove flavors. Incredibly smooth and incredibly succulent beer. One of the best dunkelweizen beers in the world. Very nice! Update: Oh fuck yeah. Fuck load of milk chocolate. Chocolate covered bananas. Too mother fucking easy to drink. World class.
Very nice smooth German beer. Produces a fat frothy head. Taste is rich of flavor. Purchased at tacoma boys in puyallup
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2011 Very enjoyable beer. Easy drinkin, nice mellow taste, good body for the abv. Lots of clove. No complaints here.

Supple, malty and mellow. Yep that about describes it. The added heft to their hefe gives it a nice, smooth full body. Not going to blow any one’s mind, but lovely fruity esters keep it interesting enough.
Solid dunkelweisen, wheaty yet rich flavor... Banana notes.. Not a huge fan of the style but well done, great example of the style

500ml bottle from Bevmo. Pours a hazy brown color with a big off-white head that has fair retention and some minor lacing. The aroma is robust with classic wheat characteristics of banana, spices and sweet malts. The flavor is similar to t he aroma, lots of bananas, sweet roasted malts, breads and mild spices. The palate is full and smooth with lively carbonation. The finish is medium in duration and semi sweet. Overall: The name is too long!

Poured an amber, reddish brown, with a decent amount of offwhite, coarse looking head that didnt retain too much. Minimal lacing. Smell was not too strong, but very nice, with banana, dark fruit, raisin, brown sugar, and wheat. Taste was even better; banana bread is a great way to describe this guy, as the banana and wheat are melded together exceptionally by the creamy texture of the beer. A bit of sweetness is present, either brown sugar or raisin, but not too much. Carbonation is intense at first but softens quickly. Creaminess again is awesome, reminds me of a milkshake somehow. Fantastic beer, arguably better than the regular hefeweissbier they make.

500 ml bottle from the Four Firkins.  Cloudy, caramel brown color with a creamy white head.  Aroma is yeasty with some banana and spicy notes.  Flavor is more of the same with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle 50cl. A cloudy brown-orange beer with good head and good lacing. Smell is on wheat as for a usual hefenweizen. Aroma is quite sweet, properly malted, good bread notes, cereal notes, toasted notes too. Nice creamy chocolate at the finish, very perfumed, and impressive weizen.

Bottle at Iron Barley poured into a New Belgium globe.  Pours a deep, muddy root beer brown color with a thick off-white head.  Aroma of sweet caramel and Munich malts, banana, clove, bubblegum, wheaty grains, and earthy fruits.  Flavor of yeast hits first, with banana, clove, and bubblegum again, followed by sweet and caramel malts, cereal, wheat, toast, and dark pit fruits.  Medium-bodied, with a wheaty mouthfeel and high but soft carbonation.  Pretty nice dunkelweizen and paired great with a hearty meal at Iron Barley.
Pours cloudy amber.  Nice head, small amount of lacing.  Taste of sweet caramel, grows smoothly through the finish.  Slight beer bittering to nicely balance.  Solid and drinkable.

Medium dark brown and cloudy with 2 finger off white head. Smells of Wheat, yeasts, mild caramels. Tastes are mild, sweet toffee, caramel, grains, yeasts, bread in the finish. Medium body with zesty carbonation that dances on the tongue. Mild alcohol warmth in the throat and a medium dry finish. A good dark Hefe. Nicely flavored, nothing overdone. Generous carbonation and flavors make this a solid brew.

Bottle. Cloudy, deep amber, approaching brown body. Off-white, frothy head turning rocky. Slowly diminishing. Pleasant aroma of toasted grain, caramel, banana, clove with hints of cookie. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly to moderately acidic. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter and lightly to moderately tart. Medium body, watery texture turning velvety/sticky, lively carbonation. Very much like Weihenstephaners hefe, but sweeter with caramel flavors. Slightly chalky in the mouthfeel and doughy in the finish. One good dunkel.
Nice translucent medium brown color with small tan head. Aroma and flavor are both strong and hugely malty with good dark fruity notes. Very tasty
Bottle 50 cl. Poured hazy brown in colour with slight tan head. Aroma is banana and wheat. Flavour is wheat mostly,  some sweetness like brown sugar and fruity as well.
50 cl bottle. Hazy dark amber/brown with big tan head. Flavour is malt, wheat, caramel, dry and a little banana.

Bottle from "Csakajósör"-store, Bp.
Showed a hazy chestnut brown with a superfrothy off-white coloured head, which remains at last finger thick on the brews top.
Its tart smell brings fermented bananas and chocolate in the nose.
Tasteing begins with a biteble mouthfeel and a tart aroma of chocolate, citrus, cereals with some notes of cloves and sourish yeast, too.
Nice flavour of chocolate balanced by a bitter finish, which is escorted by spice, nuts and citrus and remains in a tart-chocolate flavoured aftertaste.
Tasty!
Pours a dark amber, with a small off white head.  Aroma of bananas, yeast, and faint malts.  Flavor is sweet, with taste of bananas, fruit and some yeast.  A little yeast and wheat in the aftertaste.

Bottle pours cloudy light brown-yellow with thick persistent white head.  Aroma sour fruits.  Taste sour fruit, cloves, banana, wheat, bread.  Clean finish with very mild hops.  Palate on the watery side and carbonated.  Alcohol not apparent.

Really a slightly stronger version of a hefeweizen, which I guess is the point of a dunkelweizen.  Not a lot to make it stand out though.
Nose is rotten fruit, red ale notes, bitter yeast, hay, feel is - surprisingly watery and weak, carb is mediumheavy, taste is caramel, yeast, weak rubber,

Ruskea ja oranssiin vivahtava olut. Päälle muodostuu paksu ja valkoinen vaahto. Vehnäinen, maltainen ja hieman hedelmäinen tuoksu. Sama on myös maku. Hieman vetinen, mutta ei kuitenkaan ohut. Täytynee tehdä tarkempi ja sanallisempi arvio tästä tulevaisuudessa.

The aroma is dark, sugary, hearty wheat. Crazy spicy. Malty dunkelweizen style goodness. Cinnamon and nutmeg.

Appearance is squash orange or brick red, depending on light. Uber-cloudy, hazy and gorgeous.

Flavor is roasted dark sugars, a spicy cinnamon and nutmeg balance. Dark dry wheat flavors. A really nice semi-sour spice in the finish. Touch of banana, vanilla, clove.

Thick, chewy, creamy, a slick finish. Chalky on the swallow. The perfecxt winter/Christmas beer. Spicy and dry.

Draft at the Euston Tap. Cloudy chestnut pour with a voluminous, creamy white head. Holds a welcoming, heavy yeast aroma with plenty of clove and banana, along with slight apple. Good and sweet, very bready and yeasty, with strong clove notes and more subtle apple. Medium in body with lively carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Lightly sugary finish, some demerera and brown, light bread and yeast, some lingering spices. Very nice overall.

Nagy szép barnás-vöröses-narancssárgás színe, és bézsbe hajló árnyalatú, hatalmas, kemény és igencsak hosszú életű habja van. Az illata nem annyira erős, mint a világos ikeré, felleltem benne egy kis banánt, élesztőt és szegfűszeget. Íze citrusos, kissé édeskés és a pörkölt búzamaláta is rendesen érződik, de nem az a fő karakter. Testes, az utóíze pedig enyhén savanykás és alkoholos. Iszonyatosan jó búza!

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured murky brown with a huge, creamy head. Aroma of caramel, yeast, coriander, banana, apple, grapes, hints of chocolate, and hops. Medium body and carbonation. Sweet taste and aftertaste. Delicious!
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Aroma of spicy banana, bread & malts. Cloudy dark brown colour with a big head. Caramel & banana flavour. Mildly spicy aftertaste. Good but not great.

0,5 l bottle, Csakajósör, BP.Murky brown bodied one with a huge foamy and stable head.Caramel, honey, mild roasted-toasted grains, and the fine, matured fruits with nice spicy perfume: mango, banana, clove, cinnamon. Mild cocoa, toasted caramel in the first slip after that come a lot of matured fruits like banana and tropical fruits. Slowly opens a spicy character with a mild hop, clove and honey, some cinnamon. Balanced, fine..

Egészen vöröses és sötét narancssárga színe van. Habja bézsszínű, hatalmasra duzzadó, krémes és olyan kitartó, mint egy maratoni futó. Elsőre nekem olyan sütemény jutott eszembe, amiben banánpuding és citromkrém van, kívül vastag csokoládémáz és az egész vastagon bele van hempergetve kókuszreszelékbe. Az illata édesebb mint az íze, ami egyáltalán nem baj! A déligyümölcsökön kívül uralkodó a csokoládés aroma, pörkölt búzamaláta és a komlót is szépen érezni és az egész alatt kellemes aláfestés egy csipetnyi fanyarság is. Elég sűrű, testes és szénsavas. Utóíze citrusos és keserédes, kissé száraz. Veszélyesen itatja magát és nagyon finom. Bármikor és bárhol szívesen iszogatnám!

On tap at Rustico.

A: Pours a cloudy dark orange with an incredibly-huge of-white head and loads of lacing.

S: Loads of sweet malt alongside the typical clove, banana, and bubblegum notes. Just what I expect from a good dunkelweizen.

T: The sweetness of the malt comes through more with some caramel and a few darker fruits. The yeast flavor then really takes over.

M: Light-bodied; nice and creamy with good carbonation.

D: Just a great beer. I believe I like this quite a bit more then the Hefe, actually.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 05-15-2010
An unclear orange brown beer with huge head.Wheat,banana,light chocolate,cloves,paper,bread,light bitter.An ok dunkel weiss
Pours amber with thick creamy beige head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat and apricot.  Balanced taste that is a bit on the sweet side.
Nice colour of darkly  honey, great freshly taste of yeast, citrus and caramel. I really recommend this beer for all lovers of hefeweissbier!

Brown, cloudy, pour with a huge 3 finger off-white head. Very nice retention and lacing.  Smells very inviting.  Clove, bananas and some caramel.  Some roasted malts coming through.  Taste is earthy up front.  Brown-sugar and maltiness starts it off.  Banana comes out next, with a nice dry finish.  Not 100% what I expected, but very good nonetheless.  Creamy and smooth drink. Medium bodied and full of good carbonation.  Low ABV and wonderful taste make me wish I had more than one.

On tap: aroma is wheaty, yeasty, bubblegum and some caramel, the flavor is yeasty, wheaty, musty. some rusty notes with some caramel and dried fruits notes, not my style of beer but overall decent wheat beer,
Massive head over typical muddy brown. Pepper, spice, and clove aromas. Bit of banana in the taste even though predominatly spicy version of hefe dunkel. Awesome hefe dunkel.

16.9 oz. bottle from Johns Grocery, Iowa City

Ar: A bit of spice (clove, cinnamon) and a bit of banana, but the nose is somewhat off; not skunky but almost a bit like leftover cabbage cooking water.  Odd, perhaps this particular bottle is a bit past its prime?
Ap: Pours a deep amber brown with a huge 2" white head that settles into a pillowy 1/2" head.  Somewhat opaque with a few chunks of sediment.
T: Up front theres a decent level of malt sweetness, which goes well with the banana and clove notes.  The finish is mild, with a bit of spice and just a touch of hop bitterness.  Very nice.
P: Classic chewy hefe body with effervescent carbonation.

O: I found this quite disappointing, the off aroma made it a bit hard to enjoy.  Ill have to try another bottle of this before writing it off, giving how much Ive enjoyed Weihenstephaners other wheats.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2010 Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a weizen glass.

Pours a murky dark caramel color with golden highlights and a huge 4 finger off-white fluffy head. Decent lacing.

Smell: Clove, banana, yeast, light malt and spices. Smells delicious.

Taste: Banana up front followed by clove in the middle and a nice mix of spices at the finish. Typical wheat flavor in the background throughout. Aftertaste is light and somewhat sweet.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a good amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Very high drinkability. You could knock back several of these without any issues.

Overall: Excellent beer overall and a near-perfect example of a dunkelweizen. I would highly recommend this beer.
Bottle pours a hazy orange/brown with a thick tan head, lacing. Scent of fruit and wheat. Taste is is wheaty and mild fruit.
16th April 2006  Warning! Early amateur rating! Bottle in Krakov. Unusual nose, malty bread and fish! Smooth bready beer, not sweet or fruity. Hints of malty chocolate. Inoffensive and easy drinking.

bottle pours cloudy light brown with a a tall pillow of a light tan head.  Aroma is strong banana and marshmallow, just divine.  Flavor is sweet and doughy.  Mild wheat notes with a nutty malt character ends peppery with some fruity yeast.  Nice beer.

Cloudy, light brown pour, light, thick head lingers.  Light aroma that I cant place...   I really like the taste, but I cant find words to describe it (I think banana bread after drinking for a while, but without the sweetness, and some kind of spice on the aftertaste)... its basically a very good dark wheat beer.
Pours a murky brown color. Aroma of banana nut bread. Taste of cinnamon, cloves, earth and grass. Some bitterness on the finish, pretty smooth and tasty.

500ML. Bottle. Pored into a WEIZEN glass. Muddy water in color with a thick foamy white head. Nose is spices over malty scents of caramel covered wheat with notes of fresh bananas. Almost a light banana bread smell. Taste is light, dry caramel mixed with a bit cinnamon and a taste of wheat grain.  Banana esters perk up shortly. Light spicy hops and bitterness. Final hints of malt and spice on the soft, drying finish. Medium-bodied. Fantastic brew from a wonderful brewery!! This is my favorite Dunkelweizen.
wheat, some lemon, yeast, roasted malts and a little banana. Medium bodied, lots of fine carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown yeasty goodness with a robust off white head. Not as complex or as flavorful as I had expectred. Light fruits and yeast dominate the mouth with well balanced sweetness. Decent brew.
Very taste, clean flavour good beer, normal belgian yeast flavour, would have again
Enjoyed at the Biergarten in Wahlberg, TX. Nice, crisp, mildly spicy  refreshing very Bavarian Dunkel!

500. Pours a hazy burnished dark amber with a big dense and rocky off-white head. Plenty of loose stringy lace. Nice sweet brown bread and gingersnap nose. Watery, fairly light body. Active carb. Brown bread, molasses, and cookie dough mid palate. Has a bit of a ferrous note on the mid-palate. Mild brown bread finish. Very likable, approachable, drinkable, forgettable.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 23.8.2010.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a very frothy white head. The flavour is pretty much the same as the aroma; wheat, citrus, yeast, roasted malts and of course banana. Medium bodied, lively mouthfeel with carbonation. Average Dunkelweizen.

Great, malty wheat beer with a flavor that is clean, spicy and full. The beer is a light brown with a frothy head. The nose has a ton of wonderfully-spiced banana. There are caramel malt flavors lurking in the aroma, as well. The malt is sweet and doughy. There is some light bitterness. Bananas and cloves come in from the wheat. Its a maltier version of the Hefeweizen. Great beer.

Pours a medium head.  Aroma of cloves, a touch of banana and licorice.  Taste the same with the added wheat.  Tightly carbonated as per the style.  Just a nice example of a dark wheat beer.  Refreshing yet complex.  Dry yet with a substantive mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellowish brown colour, thick and creamy off-white head. Aroma of whaet, yeast, banana, sweet malts and spices. The flavour is mildly roasted, malty, with lots of banana and a spicy finish.
(bottle) cloudy light brown colour with tall tan head; thin palate; aroma of spice, clove mostly; taste is balanced and light and not very intense

Draught, smallish head, murky dark orange with lots of brown taints, aroma of spice, canned peach, cheesy hints and a touch of cidery apple juice, flavour of apple essence, honey, some spice in the back and a touch of jammy sweetness, as the beer warms up some lambic like hints like vinegar and mustard seeds appear culminating in a long sour bitter aftertaste. Slightly unusual and very good.

From bottle at a restaurant in Berlin.
Appearance : Hazy amber with a medium creamy head. Nice lacing.

Aroma : Lots of fresh banana. Yeasty and malty with spices.

Taste : Bananas and spices. Malty with a slightly bitter finish. Some wheat. Finish is a bit mineral.

Overall : Good beer. Nice banana and stuff but not as good as the regular Hefeweissbier. I just dont get this style. Its not as drinkable and refreshing as the Hefeweissbier with no real added feature. Still a good beer.

Aroma is banana, clove.  The appearance is a dartk red, off-white head.    The flavor is caramel, spicy, banana, bubblegum.  The finish is spicy, sweet, light hops.  The body is medium.  Decent dunkleweizen.

Bottle. Light amber, cloudy. Small to average mostly fully diminishing head. Light to moderate sweetish aroma, wheat, some banana and fruit. Body is light to moderate, flavor has some sweetness and wheat  banana. Finish is short and bit harsh. A bit thin bodied weissbier, aroma and flavor not in balance.
Dark brown, bubbly head.  A touch of bubblegum aroma.  Taste is roasty  - a bit short of coffee.  Mostly malt in the finish - a good thing here.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy brown with a moderate tan head.  Aromas are breadiness and spices. Flavors are just dull for me - I get the breadiness, spices , clove, and a little caramel malt here but overeall It wasnt my cup of tea whatsoever. I dont know what it is about dunkels/dunkelweizens but I certainly havent enjoyed much of any of them..

{thoughts} A scrumptious combination of sweet and toasty aromas; delicate, refreshing and fluffy underneath.

{elements} Tall, ivory froth; deep, cloudy, caramel hue. Toasty, toffee and mildly malty; banana and vanilla wafers. Light sweetness, full acidity, light bitterness; clean and quenching. Velvety texture, lively carbonation, light body. 50 cl bottle, best before 25.05.2011.

Bottle. Pours a muddy amber color, with a beige head. Aroma is of banana, clove, wheat, toasted and caramel malt. Flavor is of over ripe banana, some faint dark fruit, doughy yeast, toasted caramel and bready malts, clove and wheat. Body is medium, with a dry mouthfeel and very lively carbonation. Overall a really good Dunkelweizen!

A: The pour is a light brown color, sort of like a glass of iced tea with a bit khaki colored head that sticks around forever.

S: The nose is distinctly German with some notes of clove, yeast, caramel, and light hints of bananas. A nice bready note to it as well.

T: There is some nice sweetness to the flavor, with banana bread leading the way, followed by some raisins and plums. A good caramel and toffee flavor along with a hint of yeast and cloves on the finish.

M: The body is medium with plentiful and smooth, rolling carbonation on the tongue.

D: Weihenstephaner is another brewery that doesnt seem to make a bad beer. A solid dunkel that I would pick up again.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy brown slightly bittersweet Dunkel from the oldest brewery, some roasty malts taste and far away some caramel too.

Pours a hazy amber brown with nice white head.  Aroma is banana, roasty cloves and dough.  Taste is sweet and spicey, the clove comes through.  Light mouthfeel and good taste make this a good choice for sessions.

In bottle (Not sure the expiration date); pours a golden brown. Aroma is sweet, with yeast. Taste of spice, brown sugar and orange. I was expecting a little more body in the beer. Overall, not a bad beer though for dunkel-weisse, I do like the Hacker Pschorr more.

Pours cloudy hazelnut brown with a modest tan head that retained well and left little lacing. Pleasant aromas of brown sugar, cloves and other spices, caramel and toffee. Flavors are similar, and include a slight balancing hops bitterness. Medium body, high carbonation, and a pleasantly subtle sweetness in the finish. Very nice.

Pours a hazy, dark amber with a big, lingering, light brown head. Nose is a fairly generic brown sugar malt but still pleasant. Flavor is quite rich and based in brown sugar, yeast, a little bittering hops, apples, and coriander. Finish seems to have some banana notes to it as well. A very complex and tasty beer for a low price and wide availability.
Aweseom, first dark weizen that tastes as good as a non dunkel. Excellent foam and nice aftertaste.

Pours hazy dark amber with light brown fluffy big head. Yeast, bananas and spicy malty aroma. Acidy crisp, a bit watery, dry hay flavor. Was expecting more! Acidy & fruity on palate. Finishes sour dry with slight bitterness.

Bottle. Aroma is caramel, cloves and ripe bananas. Appearance is a cloudy reddish brown color with an inch of head. Taste starts off with a strong spiced bread and clove flavor followed by toffee, bananas, toasted malt, butterscotch and lemons. Moutfheel is slightly creamy with medium carbonation and a dry finish. The overall flavor seamlessly blends classic German Hefeweizen flavors with creamy caramel malt and toffee. Its exceptionally smooth with a very modest ABV considering its rich flavor.
From a bottle,bannana,light brown in color,white head,carmel,Its a dark beer for a sunny day.

Second brew reviewed from this self-proclaimed "worlds oldest brewery". Best before date on back label reads 27/07/2010. Pours a hazy dark copper-brown colour that looks like thick caramel. Its head is off-white, big enough, creamy with tiny bubbles, long-lasting and creates minimal patchy lacing. Lots of sediments are seen either floating or at the bottom of the glass. At first whiff, a huge banana smell is present with some yeast. After breathing, the wheat malt resurfaces with some notes from a witbier and nice spices. Active in carbonation with tiny bubbles, the body is on the medium-thin side. The taste is bit disappointing, expecting it to be full, but no. Wheat malt with hints of spices but mild and lacking in the aftertaste. Too bad for this, as the rest is pretty good and had potential to be an amazing beer.

Poured a hazy brown with an offwhite head.  Aroma of citrus with some caramel malts, yeast, apples.  Taste is slightly fruity with spices and some yeast flavors.  Full bodied with a sweet flavorful finish.  Very nice.
Bottle. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is hazy brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, yeast, caramel and hops.
500ml bottle.  A fantastic dunkel.  I enjoyed this much more than their hefeweizen.

Brown bottle, 500 ml,  via Steve Gamble (merci!), best before 27/07/2010, savoured on June 29 2010; eye: copper, hazy, no effervescence, voluminous tan head that falls and turns into an island of melting ice cream, good lacing; nose: wheat, yeast, bread, light caramel, light clove, banana; mouth: wheat, yeast, light caramel, light clove, light hot pepper, banana, finale in wheat with presence of clove, medium-light body, no carbonation, lightly sweet, slick texture but a bit thin and watery; overall: would have been way better if there had been some carbonation

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, via Steve Gamble (merci!), meilleure avant 27/07/2010, savourée le 29 juin 2010; il : cuivrée, trouble, pas deffervescence, mousse fauve abondante qui tombe et se transforme en un îlot de crème glacée fondante, bonne dentelle; nez : froment, levure, pain, léger caramel, léger clou de girofle, banane; bouche : froment, levure, léger caramel, léger clou de girofle, léger piment, banane, finale en froment avec présence de clou de girofle, corps moyen-léger, aucune carbonatation, légèrement sucrée, texture coulante mais un peu mince et aqueuse; en résumé : aurait été bien meilleure sil elle avait eu de la carbonatation

(Bottle) Poured brown and cloudy. Head was white and medium sized. Aroma contained banana and mildly roastedness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, banana, mildly roastedness, malts, hint of grass and medium bitterness. Aftertaste contained malts, banana and bitterness.
On tap at Beer Engine in a weizen, clear yellow/orange pour with a 1/2 white head.  Lots of banana and spice/clove and medium carbonation.  Not my fave.
A good hefeweissbier dunkel, although it didnt stand out in my mind.  I would be willing to give it another try.

Pours a murky caramel-brown monster of a hefeweissbier dunkel. Aroma of yeasty bread, roasty caramel, banana, and nutty undertones. Taste is slightly sour, toasted sweetness, bitter nut skins. Mouthfeel is quite effervescent and mildly viscous. This dunklewiezen is excellent.
Versione dunkel della weihenstephaner, sempre buona come la sua parente dorata

Rating #354, bottle from Lagersalget @ Grønjordskollegiet  

Appearance: A cream caramel coloured opaque beer with a nice head. Aroma is obvious banana, malts and hay. Flavors is roasted wheat, banana, apricot and a mild bitter finish. A bit thin and over-carbonated, but on the other hand a soft mouthfeel.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a murky brown/reddish colour with a magnificent, fluffy, tan head with great lacing. Aroma is nice and strong, all about the yeast and wheat. Taste is light a refreshing, yet complex. Nice alcohol backbone combines with a dark malt character. Very nice.

500ml Bottle  Gravity Beer Market  Olympia, WA
Aroma  Nice dark malt aroma with sweet caramel and wheat in the aroma.  
Appearance  Brown in color, Hazy with a thin head.   
Flavor   Big malt flavor lots of roast and chocolate in the flavors.   
Palate    Dry finish with a Nice Mouthfeel. 
Overall  I can drink these all day.

Pours a three-finger white head that vanishes quickly leaving no lace. Good carbonation and medium bodied. Hazy light amber color, no yeast settling out. Nose is mostly yeast and some malt. Flavor is dominated by the yeast, some wheat, sweet yeasty finish.  Not nearly as good as when I had it 7 years ago. $3.25 for a 500ml bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.

I poured from a bottle into glass mug and served around 50 degrees. The aroma was of bread, cereal, caramel, and a hint of banana. The appearance was an intense dark copper color with half-inch head and lacing that lasted till the end. Flavor had notes of biscuits,  caramel, and  chocolate, fantastic. The mouthfeel was meedium/full over the entire mouth which served to enhance the taste. Filling, amazing character and balance from opening to finish. Quite possibly the perfect beer, superb!

bottle from Table and Vine.  I love this style, and the Weihenstephaner hefe that I had on draft was amazing, so I had to try this.  The aroma is full nutty malt and a hint of banana.  The carbonation makes it refreshing to drink and the cashew, brown sugar, and light fruit flavors all become more pronounced as it warms up to room temp.  I guess they have had enough practice to get the recipe right over the hundreds of years that they have been brewing.
en dominicana beer house, muy excelente birria.  hay que conocer el lugar.de trigo oscura con buen sabor y cuerpo, la mejor de la noche.

Liquide brun clair embrouillé.  Présence de blé, de bananes écrasées et dépices dans les arômes.  Le goût est similaire et bien balancé par lapparition de petites notes amères.   Arrière-goût de levure et de fruits.  Corps moyen à léger et texture suave.  En résumé, parfaite pour lété.

50cl bottle, Old Port Pub at Silja Line. poured cloudy brownish color with a nice white head. Aroma is banana and spices mostly. Flavour is wheat and caramel malt, nice carbonation. Smooth finish. Another excellent brew by weihenstephaner.
Large creamy light brown lasting head and a cloudy brown body with a orange shine. Aroma of caramel, wheat, hay, yeast and banana. Medium body and a thin texture. Medium sweet. Fruity and delicious.
Dark muddy brown wheat goodness. one of the better dunkels Ive had. Rated 4/5/10

Bottle. Murky amber/orange with a huge, thick foam cap and excellent head retention. Classic wheat aromas of lemon and yeast reveal very little dunkel-ness. Pleasant refreshing character, some lemon and vague chocolate undercurrent. Short finish.
Pours cloudy amber with a nice beige head and a roasted malt aroma. There is a substantial nutty malt flavor with a dry finish.

500 ml bottle, bought at LCBO Rideau and King Edward (Ottawa), April 11, 2010. Honey brown, average head. Aroma of malted wheat, a bit toast. Vegetable malty taste (?), slightly sour, not much aftertaste. This thing suck!

Opens with some chocolate, banana and wheat bread. Flavor is soft malt with a hint of roast. There is plenty of banana, bubblegum and spice. Long chocolate finish. Dry and a little chalky. mellow all the way.

In short: A dunkelweizen that is a bit drier and yeastier than average.  Decent beer.
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed fresh a few days after purchase
The look: Cloudy light brown body topped by a persistent small beige head
In long: Nose of ripe bananas, cloves and hospital plastic gloves.  Taste of bread crumbs, dry toasted wheat, dry banana peels, a bit of cloves, some roasted nuts, some caramel.  A bit dryer and nutty than the average Dunkelweizen.  Fluffy body and Belgian-style lively.  I felt the yeast was taking too much room for this style of beer.  I wouldnt drink 4 pints of it.  So this is the oldest brewery in the world.  They have been making beer ages.  It is customary for some establishments (pubs, restaurants, others) to keep the first dollar they made (or other currency), frame it and put it on display in the establishment.  So watch for the stuffed goat in the brewery hallway.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber with a large, foamy white head.  Doughy bread, raisin and clove aromas.  Combo of grassy, flowery taste with subtle hints of spices in the background.  Very smooth, almost a creamy texture.  Average carbonation and lighter bodied.  Very drinkable and enjoyable.

Bottle 500ml. Good session beer, on the sweet side. Aroma is earthly, with cola, nuts, and toast. Taste is sweet, with average length. Palate is velvety, with some fizziness, and medium bodied. Amber, with a thin white head.

Copper with thick creamy lasting head. Aroma sweet yeast, banana, caramel. Taste sweet yeast, caramel, banana. Body medium. Texture smoooth. Carb soft. Finish with  bittersweetness. Better than the ordinary hefeweissbier

17 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy red brown with big slightly brown head.  Fruity and spicy aroma, banana, clove, plum.  In the mouth fruits darker tasting, slightly berry-like, wheat very present in the taste, with a clean finish.  The spice gives it a sort of bite.  Although this is quite nice, its nothing extraordinary.  Very sessionable.

Aroma of spices and chocolate. Wheaty, a bit of alcohol on the nose. Pours brown, slightly cloudy, okay head. Lots of flavour up front, distinctly Weihenstephaner wheat beer taste. Lots of spices, and an excellent mouthfeel, sparkles and rolls from the back of your tongue to the front. An excellent Hefe with a faint chocolatey aftertaste.

Large chestnutty head, fades quickly.
Immediately, light on the nose.  Interesting once you taste it - demarara sugar, banana, orange.  Loafy.
Very drinkable, not heavy in the stomach.

Bottle. Cloudy orange brown with a fluffy beige head that fades to an inch. Very bready aroma with some esters. Tastes rather like a fruit bread with dark sugars. Theres a little sour wheat presence and a little hop firmness at the end too. Solid enough and a typically well-balanced traditional German brewers offering.

Bottle. Medium to dark brown, decent head. Maltier and richer aroma than the light weizen with banana, cloves, chocolate and fruit, slightly roasted as well. Malty taste, heavier body, very little sour edge. Rich dark malts. Malty finish with some roasted character. Excellent, and I think I prefer it to the regular weiss.

500 mL bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Muddy brownish orange pour with a fizzy off-white head.  Aroma of ripe bananas and cloves.  Good flavors typical of the style: bubblegum and banana.  A solid example of a good dukelweizen.

pours a thick dark brown with a dense foamy cream-colored head. Good retention. Banana, fruit, wheat in the aroma. Medium body, easy drinkability. Has a strong banana and caramel taste with fruit and spice. Carbination not overwhelming. Not bad, but for a hefeweizen, I prefer something lighter.

Bottle. Pours a muddy dark brown with a large thick beige head. Banana, wheat, toast and other fruity esters in the aroma. The flavour is of banana, orange peel, wheat and clove. Some sweetness and a spicy bitter throughout this beer. A good hefeweizen dunkel but not outstanding.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a glass.  Pours a hazy light brown with nice thick off-white head.  Taste is clove, ripe banana, and some molasses.  Good dark hefeweizen, I just prefer the Ayinger dunkel better.

Bottle.  Pours orange amber colour with creamy off-white head. Aromas of malts and grains with accents of  hops and citrus. Taste is slightly bitter with flavours of sweet malts, spice and citrus balancing the beer.  Overall it is very nice, but not outstanding.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Bottle.

A - Cloudy chestnut brown and caramel color. Huge, thick, foamy, sticky, creamy off-white head (enough adjectives? the head really is impressive). Really good retention as well.

S - Lots of clove, overly-ripe banana, and caramel, molasses and brown sugar. Reminds me of a french toast made with banana bread.

T - Similar to the smell. A lot like a banana bread french toast (which is delicious by the way) with a touch of maple syrup. Good amount of banana, as well as toffee, caramel, brown sugar/molasses, and a touch of maple syrup. Good amount of clove, also a good amount of other spice (cinnamon and nutmeg mostly). Malted wheat also present along with the sweet malts, and they make up the backbone.

M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Smooth and a touch sticky.

D - Goes down very well, and the favor is great. Just the right strength, not overpowering on the palate. Makes me want to keep coming back for more.

Notes: Really nice beer. Good mix of classical Hefewizen flavors and sweet dark flavors. Ill mention it for one more time, really reminiscent of a banana bread french toast. A touch sweet but a really enjoyable beer. Im not sure if it is better than the original Hefewizen, rather it is just a different beer that I would crave at a different time for different reasons.
Hazy brown color, small white head; chocolate banana aroma with clove-like spiciness; medium body, refreshing carbonation; flavor of banana, wheat and chocolate with quite a spicy finish.

Smokey aroma with some pumpkin pie spices (mace & cinnamon) present.  Dark cloudy amber in appearance with a sweet malt flavor.   There seems to be some spice and creamy banana/vanilla notes thrown in the mix to make the flavor more interesting.  Overall this is a really complex and smooth at the same time.  Great!

From tap. 
Pours cloudy dark amber with a dense tan head. 
Aroma is fruity, with notes of wheat, banana, caramel malt and spices. 
Nice refreshing mouthful with a solid base of caramel malt, citrus, banana wheat and spices.

Reviewed 1/17/2010 (bottle coded 3179):

Pours a very cloudy dark brown color body, big foamy off-white head, somewhat lasting, decent lacing.  Very fruity aroma, lots of banana and fruit like strawberries.  Dry somewhat spicy too, maybe clove.  Not overpowering.  Nice thick mouthfeel, almost like drinking thick syrup.  Very thick, some flavor, but not very much.  Almost a chemical taste to it, plastic or something.  Warming up a bit more, more dark fruit like grape, raisin.  Not very complex a flavor, light.  Better as it warms.

Bottle from LCBO. Dark brown and murky pour, with a head that will flow out of your pint glass unless you use the slowest pour possible. Aroma is of yeast, banana and a whiff of spice and malt. Taste is an obligatory balance of yeast and wheat, with some nutmeg, ginger, banana and that obligatory dunkels caramel/malt backbone... not quite as complex as their regular hefe, but not far behind... superb for the style.

Beautiful cloudy brown body with a creamy, marshmallow-like beige head. I was able to see the bubbles rising rapidly to the top of the glass. The head retention was okay.

The aroma is full of banana, spices (cinnamon and clove), some caramel and/or toffee, a touch of chocolate, and yeast. Smells like a perfect dark wheat beer. You might also be able to pick up some dark fruit notes.

The taste is quite complex for a relatively light-bodied beer. Starts out with a sweet bready taste, with a strong banana suggestion, a fair amount of spices, and a touch of dark fruit (prunes and dates). Then comes the yeastiness, with a slight tartness to it. The finish is a little dry and bready, with some lingering banana notes. Everything youd expect in a dunkel weizen is there.

Extremely pleasant on the palate! Light-to-medium body. Velvety smooth, with a bready sweetness, and a touch of tartness.
This beer goes down so smoothly, that you might happen to lose count of how many you have!

This might be the best Dunkelweizen Ive tried to date!

The pour reveals a cloudy, coppery, brownish color with a medium offwhite head. The aroma is very appealing, theres bananas, cloves, roasted wheat and bubble-gum. Very good flavor of bananas, cloves, roasted wheat and bubble-gum, theres some caramel in there too I think. The palate is comfy, oily, the carbonation is just enough to provide some push to the flavor. This is a very interesting and satisfying dunkelweizen.

Bouteille 500ml, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, moyen de bananes) et de pain, moyen de blé, léger dépices (coriandre et clou de girofle) de caramel / sucre brun avec des notes rôties et de houblon herbeux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, bananes vertes) accompagné dun léger goût épicé (coirandre, notes de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de pain, un moyen goût de blé ainsi quun léger goût de sucre brun et de caramel aux petites notes rôties puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux et de levures. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux et de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, léger zest dagrumes) avec des notes de blé.

Nice, foamy head.  A mild, malty aroma with a little nasty funk in it.  A toasted wheat bread flavor, followed by a lightly floral, banana and honey aftertaste.  Not quite on the same level as Weihenstephaners excellent hefeweizen, but not far behind.

Poured from 16 oz bottle into nonic pint. 

Appearance: Cloudy, brown, apple cider color. Three finger head that quickly settled down to a filmy finish.

Smell: The fruity, yeasty smell of weissbier comes through. The spice presence is very prominent. You can smell something like apple butter here.

Taste: Banana! I can really taste the banana in this one. Got a small bit of vanilla and a wonderful cloves presence. The malt really comes through in the middle of the quaff. Leaves a lingering clove presence on the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Quite foamy at first, then followed by a good medium body. Tons of carbonation.

Drinkability: Being a dunkelweissen, this one has a little more substance than hefeweissens. I like it better for cold weather than the hefes. As tasty a beer as I have ever quaffed.

One of those beers that Ive seen on the shelves and assumed Id had, but alas no, its a new rating. So here goes; Appearance: Dark orange bordering on brown with a cloudiness or murkiness to it, a decent thick white head. Aroma: Overripe oranges, malt, sweet and spicy with a beautiful yeastiness to it. Flavour: A lot of dark fruits to start, mellowing out to a delicious yeasty maltiness, quite a sticky mouthfeel (thats what she said) and has a long malty-yeast finish. Delicious.

Bottle: pours a  Cloudy amber with a thick, off-white head. Aroma of caramel ,roasted barley, and orange peel. Taste is  of wheat and is lightly bitter with a hint of caramel .Overall its a great tasting wheat dark beer,

500mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy medium brown with a giant off-white head that eventually settles down a bit.  Aroma is fruity, spicy, biscuity and earthy.  Flavour is sweet and malty with a hint of chocolate, some spice and acidic fruitiness.  Medium bodied, average carbonation and creamy with an acidic and light hoppy finish.

Pillowy white fluffy head. Copper brown in color with a hint of orange. Aromas of orange, citrus, malt. Tastes of wheat, banana, lemon, minerals. Not as good as I hoped, but solid. I love this brewery. Good stuff all around.
Banana.  Muddy water color, cloudy.  Minimal off-white head.  Pretty mild flavor, but not too shabby.  Good texture, right down the middle.  A solid beer.  Id drink it over most of them.
500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours brown, with reddish hint.  Huge, frothy off white head.  Aroma is roasted malt (wheat malt?).  Taste is similar to regular hefe, with slight milk chocolate hints.
Pours a deep dark orange with a huge white head, smells almost identical to the hefeweizen.  Has the familiar banana notes plus a strong note of coffee and bitter chocolate.  Very enjoyable

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée chez LCBO (Ottawa, ONT). Arôme: Odeur de céréales avec une pointe de clou de Girofle et de banane. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de banane et dépices avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de noix en arrière goût. (Rating #2811)

Bottle. Brown pour with generous white head. Roasted wheat and clove aroma, bananas. Wheaty flavor, quite acetic with some cloves. Good palate, I had low expectations for this beer but its on equilibrium and quite enjoyable.

Disappointing. I found the hefe flavor out of balance, with overwhelming phenol wiping out any of the traditional hefe spicyness. It also wasnt dunkel enough; if youre going to call something dunkel, it should have some testicular fortitude. This just tasted like a mediocre weissbier with a touch of soy sauce in it for color.

Subject of my first succesful traditional Weissbier pour! Pours hazy brown with a frothy white head.  Aroma is sweet malt and some licorice.  Taste is fruity and bananay with some earthy notes.  Light hoppyness and citrus working with molases makes this a really fun beer to drink, even if the duality is subtle.  Finish is bitter at first but turns sweet.  Very refreshing and satisfying.

500ml bottle, slight hazy brown-amber hue, with a thick beige head, yeasty, banana purée, spicy nutmeg, cinnamon, clove nose with a nice caramelized stewed apples, sultana raisin note, with a wheaty, biscuity, toasty malt aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, bananaish, fruity, wheaty, toasted, caramelized malt, spicy character of nice cinnamon, clovey stewed apples, with some ashen hints, and a soft dried fig, raisin accent, leading towards a spicy, cinnamon, wheaty, toasty, stewed apples, bananaish, raisiny finish.

bottle - pours dark honey color with a light tan creamy head. Bananas and cloves dominate the nose with a slight hint of vanilla wafer and apple. The flavor is banana again with caramel and just the lightest bit of bitterness in the finish to even it out. What can I say I really like this beer.
Pours a cloudy burnt orange. Smells of yeast, bread, bannanas and horseblanket. Taste follows the nose. Medium bodied, flavors are light on the palate, lots of carbonation in a good way.

Pours a cloudy light brown with a thick foamy off-white head.  Aroma is earthy and bready with some light maltiness.  Taste is surprisingly light and initially a bit sweet, with a bit of banana, cloves - finishes slightly bitter.  Moderate to lively carbonation with a bit of a thin texture.  Overall pretty nice

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2009 Hazy brown colour, big off-white head, lots of carbonation. Aroma is wheat, malt, yeast, fruit. Tastes with lots of carbonation, fresh, with hints of banana and peaches, a bit more malty ans sweeter than the normal hefeweissbier. NIce and refreshening.

pours opaque brown with a tinge of raw sepia. thin light tan head. aroma is light-orange, lemon, wheat, and a light bitterness. flavor is slightly tart, with banana bread, orange, and lemon. finish is long and wheaty...a little thin and watery for me.

very malty, a little salty(soy sauce), almost flowery, nice rich smell. a very hazy orange-brown with a lasting white head. taste of milk chocolate, dry, a little salty, tiny bit of egg (pleasant), bread, dark fruit. feel is creamy but average. definitely good and i feel stupid for ignoring it for so long, complex but juicy and easily sessionable

On Draft at Stubbies in Gainesville, FL. This is one of their non-rotating beers, rightfully so. Pours a hazy medium brown. Flavor is banana, clove, spice, some toasted malt, caramel. Dry after taste. Excellent session beer!

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2011 (br-btl wh-lbl br-txt)

^eff, ^co2, §weissbier-wheat-tartness, §bready-malt, ^minerally, mostly-clean.

500-ml bottle Marcellos, Lafayette, LA - Aroma: caramel, roasted (malt), spicy, clove, nutmeg (yeast/hop); Appearance: cloudy, orange-brown color, minimal off-white head, little laces; Flavor: sweet, salty, roasted (malt), bitter (hop), nutmeg (yeast); Mouthfeel: medium bodied, thin texture, soft to average-moderate carbonation, bitter-dry finish; Overall: balance and complex aroma and flavored beer with a refreshing roasted-dry finish.
Bottle 500 ml. Dark orange body.Taste is roasted malt, caramel. A really nice beer with a dry finish. Another good beer from Weihenstephaner.

Another solid brew from Weihestephaner.  Pours a dark brown with an offwhite head.  Aroma is malt, caramel and toffee.  Taste is roasted malt, caramel and some hop aftertaste.  A really nice beer.  Ill be looking for this again.

Bottle. Murky brownish orange body with a foamy beige head that lasts well. Aroma has notes of wheat, caramel, banana, spice and dark fruit. Flavour has a touch of sweetness and hints of malt, cinnamon, nuts and caramel. Medium bodied with reasonably high carbonation and a nice dry finish. Excellent dunkel, one of the best beers I have tried from Weihenstephaner.

Bottle at blind tasting 5/09.  Pours translucent amber, bubbly whie head, decent lacing.  Extremely mild aroma that only hinted of a bit of yeast.  Bitter flavor, but some sweet vanilla.  Abrupt sharp fizziness.

500 mL Bottle. Deep murky ruby body with a long lasting frothy off-white head that leave good lace. Aroma of toasted grains, prunes, raisins, other dark fruit, cloves and spices, tangerine peel, fresh vegetables, and autumn leaves. Full body of wheat and grains make up the flavor; prunes, raisins, tangerine peel, and cloves express in the aftertaste and finish. Very smooth in the mouth. Wheat beer lovers: this way please!
Strong wheat aroma. Murky brown with off-white creamy head that thins but stays. Strong smooth creamy banana wheat milkshakey taste with banana aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2011 On tap at Lunar BrewingCo. and although normally served in a Weizen glass, requested a smaller amount in a Czech-pils glass. Poured a cloudy, amber/brown with modest, off white foam to the head, and some curtainy lacing. The aroma had a tomato juice/V-8 scent to it. Although a touch of the nose carried over, the flavor was closer to style with some graininess, light notes of ripe banana cream, and stronger spice/clove notes. Just a hint of sweetness was evident. The carbonation was good and the body was medium. Not bad except for the unpleasant beginning. Will have to try again down the road. Down the road was at the Schnitzel Platz in Glendale Hts., IL.. Poured to a traditional 1/2 liter glass, this time, the head was more substantial and frothy, and the nose was smooth malt, light, brown sugar sweetness, mellow banana and clove, and some nutty hints. +.4

500ml poured from a bottle at an Italian restaurant am Gendarmenmarkt in Berlin. Slowly fading off-white head. Cloudy, dark orange body. Smell of ripe fruits. Dark wheat with sweet malts and overripe banana in flavour, added by a spicy touch of cloves. Bitter fruits and notes of yeast to the ending. Quite flavoursome (Berlin 22.11.2009).
Poured dark amber brown, smooth, malty, dark fruits, caramel, little chocolate, little grainy.

Bottle from Mr Lawrence wine merchants, Brockley. Cloudy brown pour with a lasting off white head. Aromas of smoke, raisins, toffee, chocolate. Flavours of wheat, dark malts, smoke, wood, dark fruits. Finishes smokey and malty.

Bottle pours cloudy amber with a rocky off-white head.  Aroma smells like an oatmeal raisin cookie, with roasted banana and trace amounts of clove.  Flavor also shows additonal notes of nuts and smoke.  Overall body is light to moderate, creamy, and finishes dry.

Pours a murky caramel color with a voluminous fluffy off-white head. Aroma is bread crusts, bananas, vanilla, and clove. Flavor is similar, bready with a strong banana note and just enough clove. Mouthfeel is silky and smooth. Another well-crafted Weihenstephaner beer.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy, dark amber.  Minimal head that faded quickly.  Honey, some cloves, sweet malt, and dried fruits on the nose.  Tastes of dried fruits, mild ginger, yeast, walnut.  Tastes like it has more alcohol than the 5.3% it states on the bottle.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malts, light peat, and overcooked vegetables.  Poured light brown/milk chocolate in color with a large, fluffy, rocky, creamy, dense, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet.  Tastes of yeast, malts, spices, nuts, light burnt caramel, slight banana, slight peat, dark malts, wheat, and hints of bubblegum and smoke.  Medium to full body.  Tingly texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Malt and nut finish.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2009 Thick head and lacing.  Aroma is wheaty and malty.  Taste is about the same as the aroma with a bitter aftertaste.  I like how mild the hops are in this beer.

500ml bottle 
5.3% ABV 
I tried this beer on November 5, 2009 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a dark brown colour with golden highlights and 1" head that lasted.
