The aroma was wheat malt, cloves, and some yeast.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and medium carbonation.  The flavour was wheat malt, cloves, some ginger-like flavours and a bitter finish.

Pours a cloudy brown colour with a big white foamy head. The aroma is yeasty, banana bread, clove, pretty much everything everyone said it was. The flavour is good, banana bread, yeasty, light spice, finishs on a super light anise note. Its pretty good, much better than Erdingers version of this style.

From the 1 pt. 0.9 fl. oz. bottle numbered 5099.  It pours a dark but cloudy amber with a significant beige, puffy head.  The aroma is a pleasing dash of malts, cloves, and wheat.  The taste is a relaxing Allspice-clove-malty mix with mellow hops.  Not to pungent or bitter and generally mild.  Likeable.
500mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours cloudy dark amber with frothy white head. Yeasty, bananna nose. Creamy, flavour of caramel, more bannana, clove,  a bit nutty. Finish a bit sweet.

500ml Bottle: Pours deep, cloudy amber brown, good sized foamy off-white head. Lots of hefeweiss in the nose heavy with cloves and banana bread, along with a toffee malt character and lots of yeast. The taste is a nice blend of styles with a tasty banana and clove based hefeweiss backed with nutty, caramel malts and a bready yeast character. Unfortunately a bit light in body, but largely a nice dunkelweizen.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy brownish orange with decent tan head.  Nose of banana, clove in the nose.  Flavour has banana, caramel, clove and light roastiness.  Finish is dry, lightly sweet and wheaty.  Fizzy, fine carbonation.  Pretty good.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO- Decants a murky brown with orange hues as it is held up to the light. In the aroma, there is soft fruit, banana, some spice, clove, some dark fruit. Tastes of sweet banana and clove, dark fruit and a bit roasty/nutty with some yeast towards the end. Very creamy and fulfilling finish. I like this quite a bit.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a Weizenglas. 
App.:  Cloudy medium copper with a fair light tan foam.
  
Aroma:  Quite a bit of yeast, some dark dried fruits, some nuttiness, a fair helping of banana/clove esters, theres a dirty, earthy note in here.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body and moderate effervescence.
  
Flav.:  A bit of yeast, some banana, quite nutty, some dark dried fruits, still a little earthy, but not dirty, other vague fruitiness; dry with no bitterness and a kinda watery, sorta-Weizen finish.

Not terribly impressed.

Bottle:
Pours a turbid copper wheat ale in the flute glass. Nice off white meringue cap, good retention and lacing.

Aroma of weissbier esters and phenols over a pleasant roasty toffee malt discernment.

Toffee malts in front with fruit and spice tones, mid palate a roastyness and hop herbal bite, lightly sweet but drying finish.

Nice little hefeweizen with added roast and dark toffee tones, I think I like this better than their golden hefe.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO. pours murky brown with a lasting tan head. banana and clove aroma. the flavour has noticeable dark malt, wheat elements of banana and bubble gum, some yeastiness. mouthfeel is pretty thick. nice overall. ill buy it again.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2010 500mL bottle from the LCBO. This beer justifies the existence of this style to me. Poured a muddy reddish brown with a large beige head. Super active carbonation. The aroma is great, straight up bubblegum, minor clove and wheat malts, with some musty yeast as well. The flavour starts out with a sweet malt element that flips quickly into a sort of salty bite that somehow works, with very minor spice, clove, and a yeasty finish. Nice sweet wheaty malt aftertaste. I did not generally like Dunkelweiss until I tried this example, and now I can understand why people bother brewing it. Everything is in good proportion and balance, I dont feel like Im getting beat over the head with one aspect like in all other examples Ive had of this style. Bravo.
This has a great blend of wheat and malt.  The dark roasted malts come out very well.

500 ml bottle - pours a completely opaque swampy brown with some lightness at the edges with a dense cream-coloured head that lasts for quite awhile.  Aroma big on banana, some milk chocolate, yeast phenolics, a splash of alcohol.  Flavour not as good as the aroma, simple:  Mainly caramalt, wheat, yeast.  Body thick at first, then thins out quickly in the finish.  Quite a nice beer.

Such a great hefe!!!! Very similar to their regular hefe but its got a bit of a thicker mouthfeel and some more bready malts. The clove and banana esters are a litte more pronounced and super sharp. This the benchmark beer for the style
Had it on draft as part of a sampler.  It had a good body, but is somewhat bitter.

Sample @ Coles German Tasting. Pours a somewhat murky cloudy brown. Sweet malts & clovey aroma. Taste is well balanced combo of sweet malts, hefe like cloviness, light banana. Light fizzziness on the tongue. Nice beer

500ml bottle. Poured medium brown with about an inch of off white head, that settled down to a cm that lasted the length of the glass. Aroma of caramel malts, with loads of wheat and a touch of citrus, lovely. Taste of mostly the aforementioned malt at first, then lots of wheat comes into play. Sweet on the swallow, with a nice dry wheat aftertaste. Utterly excellent Dunkel, maybe not quite as good as their peerless Hefe but still head and shoulders above the rest. Superb.

Very nice brew. Hazy brown in color with a thick rocky top tan head. Great lacing. Smell is of bread, banana, light citrus, and caramel. Taste was very bready with banana and brown sugar. Thick beer with sweet on the front and a mild citric bitterness on the back. I will definately buy more of this one.

500ml Bottle - Hazy brown in colour with a foamy head. Malty and sweet aroma with hints of banana cake. The taste is malty and slightly sweet with more hints of banana cake along with some dried fruit and spice.
Bottle. Hazy light brown color with an off white head. Nice tart wheat and light roasty malt aromas. Smooth medium body. Decent lightly tart wheat flavor with lightly roasted nuts and banana.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Appearance: Brown, very hazy. Lots of nice creamy head.
Aroma: Hops, citric. Some malt? Wheat.
Taste: Wheat and malt. Some hops. Fresh.
Info: 500ml bottle, 29/9-2009, 222/500

Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of cereal and milk chocolate, light lemon for the hops, moderate leather for the yeast, with hints of toffee, clove and vanilla. Head is creamy, off-white with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy light brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finshes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, oily and has a lively carbonation. This Dunkelweizen is full of diverse flavors and aromas. Again tradition shows its benefits when it comes to brewing.
Cloudy, murky maroon with a light tan head.  Aroma of clove and banana.  Taste of malt, citrus, cinnamon, maybe a bit of raisin.  Nicely complex.  Full bodied.  Top of the line dunkel hefeweizen.

Cloudy brown pour with a massive frothy head. Aroma is very doughy, with notes of wheat, spice, fruity esters, and caramel malt; nice balance between the yeast and malt characters. Flavor is quite nice; similar to the aroma, with a really excellent wheat quality. Palate is light but enjoyable, and has a refreshing crispness to it. Really a solid brew overall.

Hazy brown pour with an excellently gratuitous white head. Aroma is citrusy with lots of banana- typical of a hefeweizen but with a nice dark malt profile. Flavor is sweet with light fruity sugars, and a slightly bitter back that finishes soft and sweet. Banana and clove with a nice caramel component show through the most. Palate is medium with a pillowy and supple mouthfeel. Yummy.

This Dunkelweizen has an aroma of wheat, clove and slight malt. Not as dark as I was anticipating, but still made me thirsty. I tasted obviously malt, but also sweet caramel and hints of banana.
Lively carbonation and a slippery context on the way down. This is a delectable dunkel that I will be enjoying again.

Appearance: A hazy caramel brown in colour with a large off-white head, which shows good retention.

Aroma: Nutty malts on the nose, with a hint of smokiness. There is a definite spiciness, possibly cinnamon, and cloves. Bananas maybe?

Taste: Sweet caramaly malts, and mild brown sugar. The spiciness that is in the aroma comes through strongly in the taste, offering Christmasy cinnamon flavours, as well as cloves. Bananas hiding in the middle.

Mouthfeel: Quite heavy in the palete, mildly lively, with a oily texture.

Drinkability: Really nice beer, great example of a dark wheat beer, from the oldest brewery in the world.

500ml bottle. Pure dark brown hazy color with white head. Theres a slight caramel taste in this one that makes a good reaction to the original dunkelweize bitterness. Satisfying but honestly I expected more than that. OK though...

Pours amber brown with thick white head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, and banana. Medium bodied. Flavor is sweet with chocolate but spicy as well. Plenty of banana and malt. Finishes clean. Flavors develop nicely as it warms. Good stuff.

Picked randomly from a local Wegmans, 1pt .9 ozs. Pours a dark cloudy brown with a fizzy yet foamy off white head. Aromas of banana, spices(some cinnamon, clove), and caramel. The flavor almost resembles some bubble gum at first hehehe. On a more serious note, the flavor is mellow and smooth with a balanced spiced(clove) and fruit(banana) note with a touch of caramel.  
Semi sweet and so well balanced. Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 better than average, full body and flavor for the style. NG Black Wheat is still the best in this group, but this bear has a hearty aroma, and a mix of banana/clove & chocolate/black malt that is quite nice."

500 ML bottle in Germany. This was a very satisfying beer, I thought it would be darker but it was still superior. This is a very effervescent beer and very creamy beer, full body and excellent head. Really like this as one of my favorites. One of the best dark hefes even if its not so dark.
Light brown color.  Roasty yeast aroma.  Taste is malty, with some bitter lactose undertones.  Has a bite in the end.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a completely hazed caramel brown with a large white head.  Aromas of yeasty cloves, green apple, and some caramel in the background.  Flavor is bubble gum and clove with a biscuity malt profile, a touch of green apple, and a very mild caramel impression.  Light finish with cloves and green apple.  Pleasant, but on the lighter side.

Pours hazed brown with a bubbly off-white head that disappears. Aroma is wheat, clove and some banana. Taste is sweet with spice like nutmeg along with wheat and banana. Clean finish with a hint of roast. Medium light body, crisp carbonation.
Bottle. Dark copper with white head. Malty and some bananas. Caramel. Light body and easy to drink. Quite good weizen.
Pours a murky copper with off white head.  Malty aroma with bananas and spice. Light taste with clean wheat finish.

Bottle courtesy of curly at woodys after work.  Pours a very cloudy amber brown.  Nose of yeast and light banana.  Flavor brings a good dark wheatiness to the mix.  Well balanced and slightly sweet vanilla finish.  Nicely done, and aq shitton better than the original.

Honestly, this is one of the best wheat beers I have ever experienced. With a beautiful off-white head and well carbonated body, this offering from Weihenstephaner delivers a complex shadow brown and cherry color and a strong chocolate covered banana flavor. The malty background coupled with the delicious flavor makes this my favorite of the style hands down.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2010 Without looking or knowledge that Id reviewed this, here is the latest:
Clear, light brown brew as there was hardly any sediment at the bottom of my bottle to pour in. Off white cap was creamy and large on the pour. Fizzled down to a cover with solid, consistent 360 degree lacing. Nose says: banana, chocolate powder and stop picking me with a melon baller. Yum! Simple and succulent. Light fruit and my super nose is trying to tell me about a hint of smoke but I call him a dirty lying whore. Light vanilla as well. Sometimes complexity can be overrated. Nice very light hop can be tasted early on, banana, dull chocolate and weak yeast works well. Its a good blend of simplicity just like the aroma. Light richness and light spice linger. A bit dry yet soft feel makes happiness. Old review was 8484 16. mew review is dead on.

Vegas 08 trip
Poured out a modest light bubbly tan head, hazy caramel brew (dead on weizen look) - wasnt totally sure what I was gonna see with this as its my first D-W but I think that the colour of this beer is excellent. Minimal lacing. Subdued aromas of bananas, cloves and vanilla extract (weakest of the three scents) and plums. The taste is pretty good and I wish I had a keg of this as it goes down waaaay to easy. Solid flavour that does not back down but never ever gets close to actually being strong as this is one soft beer. Bananas, wheat, toasty malts, cloves, pepper and a touch of orange. Medium bodied, velvety smooth throughout and finishes with a bit of coating. Good stuff!
500ml bottle from Consumers Beverages, Niagara Falls NY.  Pours an orangy brown with a billowing wizen style head.  Earthy, malty and slightly spicy.
Bottle at ABC beer tasting. Poured orangish gold with a white head. Aroma was dominated by a wheat aroma. Light wheat with a bit of malt and finished sweet.

Bottle @ the now out of business La Bodega. A nice dark copper with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is caramelt, clove, banana, and clove. Flavor is much the same, mostly banana and clove with some burnt caramel. Amazing how good a real weizen bier can be!

Dark copper color; big, tan, bubbly and moderately fizzy head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma caramel, malt, banana, clove, yeast, and bread. Flavor similar: caramel, malt, banana, clove; light, sweet, yeasty finish. Light- to medium-bodied. Not my favorite style but a very nice example.
Flaske: Lækker brunrød uklar weissbier. Tydelig bananduft der går over i smagen sammen med en let brændthed og en smule bitterhed. Forfriskende og lækker.

Poured a dark amber/copper that is mildly opaque. Thick white head filled the glass and persisted for several minutes but never quite disappearing.

Aroma is wheaty, with hints of rye. Hints of spices also apparent such as cloves.

Taste is clean and distinctly wheat with a strong malt character. Rye on the tip of the tongue. Spices play on the back of the palate. Fairly clean finish leads to a very refreshing drink.

Pours a very cloudy walnut with a huge soapy off white head, a lot of esters dancing around in there.Typically enjoyable aroma of clove, banana, and yeast,with a little bit of wheat bread and toasted malt. Flavor is similar, but more full bodied and robust than their regular hefe.

Bottle.  Pours a large, creamy-frothy, off-white, root beer float-esque head.  Murky body with some yeast cloudiness and a light brown color with some orange when the light shines through.  Aroma is of bready wheat malt, cookie and toffee with a pronounced doughy yeast presence.  Vanilla, clove and misc. spices (allspice, coriander) make up the bulk of the yeast phenol.  The esters bring out some banana and from somewhere a bit of pear snuck in.  Medium, creamy body with average carbonation.  Lightly bitter finish.  Very good.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2010 @ the Dixie, pours an hazy brown with a medium head, cheesy aroma with notes of olive and wheat style yeasty aromas of lemon, apple and some lambic tones, flavor of apple, wheat, brett with a lively zest and medium to full body. Impressive 8/3/8/3/14-[3.6]
From tap @BeerFest in Israel, brown to red hazy liquid with medium head, aroma of banana and orange juice, flavor is quite smokey, has some malt banana and clove, finish is pleasant, body is medium. 6/3/6/3/13-[3.1]

This beer seems to do battle with itself - Hefeweissbier vs. dark malt flavors.  It has the flavor of a very good Hefeweissbier with dark malts incongruously added.  Aroma is good - fruity esters with a bit of acid and caramel, but suffers from the same incongruity.  Good beer, but better to go with a pure Hefeweissbier or a Dopplebock, not mix the two styles.
Carmally, malty.  doughy.  has kind of a bad aftertaste, salty.  Some yeast, its rich warm, but has a kind of bad flavor mixed in there.

Bottle.  Pours a mellow hazy brown in color with a fluffy off white head.  Aroma notes are as expected for the style, banana, spice-clove, sweet dough.  Flavors are much the same combining the clove - nutmeg and banana flavors of the wheat with the rich roasty malts of the dunkel.  Very easy drinking and an enjoyable session.

From the bottle it pours with a huge rocky off white head and a yeast haze orange brown colour. The bear combines the wheat beer yeast flavours of cloves-banana with the caramel-toffee notes from the dark malts. Nice.

Bottle from Total wine. Pours a cloudy brown color.  Nice light tan head.  Spices, yeast, caramel, banana, bubblegum and some roast.  Flavor is quite nice.  Smooth and sweet with banana bread, coriander, yeast, and light roast.  Easy and really nice.

Hazy copper/brown in colour with an inch-high head that shows reasonably persistence.
Lots of overripe/cooked banana (like in banana fritters) apparent even during pour. Upon further inspection wheat and some spices (coriander and cloves) are detectable, as well as some sweet darker malts with contribute a caramel note.
Flavours are a mix of wheat and caramel malts, as well as banana and cloves. A restrained bitterness sits nicely in the background.
Spritzy carbonation works well to support the traditional watery wheat flavour/texture. Highly drinkable!

On tap at Taco Mac Lindbergh.

Pours a hazy brownish amber that looks a bit like tea in the glass underneath a big off-white head that shows good lacing.

The aroma is just flush with bananas and bubblegum sweetness mixed with lots of clove spiciness.  It definitely has a bit more malt presence than the hefe and a bit of lemon as well.

The taste ratchets the bananas down a notch and the malts come through a bit more.  The finish brings back the spiciness of the cloves and leaves a dry, clean finish.

The mouthfeel is highly (almost too) carbonated and extremely smooth going down.

I was expecting this to be one of the best dunkels Ive ever had and it lived up to the expectations.  A supremely drinkable beer.

Light orange copper with a thick two fingers of tight off white head.  Sticky lacing.  Big toasted malt and caramel aroma.  Some spicy coriander.  Taste is coriander, lightly citrus, with a backdrop of caramel and burnt sugars.
Brown, huge beige head, nice balance of sweets and fruits, some grain and bitter.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours an unclear caramelbrown beer with a big white head. The aroma wheat with sweetness and caramel. The flavor is caramel and wheat. The palate is refreshing, and overall this is a good wheatbeer.
Dark and cloudy with pearl-white head, nice lacing. Sweet and full-bodied, like spiced fruit (clove and allspice) and banana, mellow. Easy to drink, packs a punch later on.

Bottle. Cloudy deep orange body with a big offwhite forever lasting head. Lots of bubbles keeps rising from the bottom of the glass. Banana aroma with lots of wheat and clove. Some caramel as well. Caramel, banana, clove and wheat in flavour with some spices. Not as sweet as other dunkelweizen. Medium bodied. Refreshing and tasty.

0.5 liter, pours with a massive white head.  Hazy dark brown color, Flavors of banana, hints of cocoa, cloves, malt and a nice sweet finish.  This is a great session beer and one of my favorites from Weihenstephaner.

had at coops .. . chocolate bananas and cloves with tree bark in the nose .. . kinda refreshing but still pretty full .. . not my favourite style but i like it .. led zeppelin live? .. . great lacing! .. . like a donkeys butt, but in an enjoyable german sex slave way .. .
500ml bottle. Huge rocky tan head of foam with good lacing left on the glass. Mild taste of cloves and cinnamon with a slightly fruity aroma.
A cloudy light brown pour with off-white head, very malty wheat aroma, flavor is intense malt and hints of caramel, finishes expectedly wheaty and malty.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, banana, caramel, malt. Flavour is sweet, banana, yeast, caramel, malt. Pleasent and toned down beer.

500 ml bottle, via EDA.  Pours a nicely cloudy amber brown body with a frothy one inch beige head.  Great nose of banana, sweet brown sugar, light roast, and earthy wheat.  Reminds me of banana bread.  Nice Hefe flavor with just that little bit of roast and chocolate thrown in to change things up a bit.  Very yeasty flavor with lots of banana and a bit of clove on the finish.  Mouthfeel is smooth and almost creamy with pinpoint prickly carbonation.  These guys are the kings of all things wheat!

Bottle from BevMo!  Pours a dark maple brown with a thick foamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, brown sugar and banana. Very smooth tasting beer with hints of maple, hazelnut, chocolate, banana and a touch of spice.
Bottle. Poured a large rocky white head over a nutty brown body. Sweet malt ad wheat aroma. The taste was a sweet yeast and malty bread flavor.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy and hazy medium amber color ale with a supper huge off-white foamy head with great retention and good lacing. Aroma of banana ester with some great wheat malt is quite excellent. Taste is very smooth with great notes of banana ester with some lightly sweet wheat malty which provide a great refreshing factor. Full creamy body with great carbonation. One of the best example of the style.

Appearance: Cloudy, muddled brown body with a thinnish, white head.

Smell: Dull, earthy spices over malty scents of caramel covered wheat and cocoa with notes of fresh bananas.

Taste: Light, dry caramel mixed with a bit of cocoa and a taste of wheat grain. Rich blend of spice flavors: clove, nutmeg, and cinnamon. Banana esters perk up shortly. Light spicy hops and bitterness. Final hints of malt and spice on the soft, drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation.

Drinkability: A delightful dunkelweizen and a fine example of the style. Go out and get some!

Bottle from BevMo.  Murky orangish-brown color with an off-white head.  Aroma is yeasty with wheat and sweet malt.  Flavor is sweet dark malt, caramel, wheat, yeast, and banana.  Medium body, smooth palate.  Refreshing.  Very enjoyable beer all-around.

Bottle.  Overly yeasty nose, really a powerful blast, with murky dark caramel and wheat beer remainder.  Murky amber-brown body with a super beige head and a tornadic whirlwind of carbonation.  Taste is muddled and mostly indeterminate, a little wheat, a little thin caramel, perhaps brown sugar, and certain spring water with mineral admixture.  Thinninsh light-medium body.  Aftertaste/whole is dryish and clean, mild and refreshing.  Still, and Id never thought Id say it, but the Kristall was downright exciting by comparison!

Pours a murky brown color that looks like it could be iced tea with a huge fluffy off-white head. Very nice scattered lacing. The aroma is bananas, pears, spices and yeast. Flavors really just follow suit, nothing at all out of place or wrong with it. This beer is light and soft, very clean, refreshing and so easy to drink. Delicious. A perfect beer for the patio.
A nice, rich dark hefeweizen, which in my opinion has a delicious banana bread aroma and flavor.  For a beer this dark and rich it is surprisingly refreshing and uplifting.

16.9 oz. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, bananas, and cloves. Taste is malty, sweet, with hints of bananas and cloves. Nice mouth-feel. It is well-balanced. It leaves a nice lace on the glass.

16.9 oz bottle-slightly cloudy brown pour w/a moderate tan head & good lacing. Sweet spiced aroma of a Hefe. Reminds you of their Hefe w/some malt & more sweetness thrown in, not really a good combination; doesnt really add anything to the brew, Id say it pollutes it. Not terrible, just kind of average. Id drink their Hefe over this any day. Had a lot of carbonation w/a short, thin finish.

(bottle) pours a murky brown colour with a tall frothy off-white head. aroma of lightly toasted malts, straw, wheat and clove. flavour is the same, very wheaty and mellow. medium body with fizzy carbonation.

I absolutely love dark wheat beers and this did not disappoint.  Bottled at Effin Gruven, I had 2 of these for the night cap just catching up with an old friend, great beer to chill with.  Goes down smooth with a heavy bready flavor, heavy lacing, heavy heavy, loved it.

Tap at Toronado. Pours with a dirty brown color and is very murky. Aromas of clover, banana and bubblegum. Flavors of cloves, spices but is lacking some of the breadiness. It is just a bit too thin and not chewy enough. Respectable but not nearly as satisfying as their regular wheat.

Beware...if you are looking for a full-bodied wheat beer then this isnt what you are looking for.  Although rather light given the dark pour and large, frothy head, the overall quality of this dunkelweizen is very appreciated.  The mild fruit and spice tones mix well with the smooth finish.  In the end, this is definitely a beer I would recommend to my friends.
bottle. cloudy amber. big fluffy white head. strong aroma of banana. smooth, light carbonation, light spicy taste with a bit of that banana in the finish

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of yeast, wheat malt, and citrus.  Hazy med brown hue with a large frothy off-white head that diminished and left good lace.  Flavor is sweet and a little sour.  Palate is watery soft.  Nothing special.
Pours a hazy nut brown with a large tan head.  Rich aromas of the yeast and malt.  Very smooth beer with an apple fruitiness and a smooth finish.  Light bodied but very enjoyable!
Light brown in color.  Caramel malts, some light clove, a little bit of earth and grass, as well.  Not too bold, just smooth and relaxing.

Color: Medium dark copper brown.  Thick head that dissipated quickly.  Nose: Malt and spice, grassy.  Medium body, solid carbonation.  Mild malt up front,  clove, hints of fruits, raisins.   Flavors blend nicely and are mild.  Alcohol barely noticeable.  Slightly dry, with a lingering touch of sweet.  Enjoyable.

Pours a very hazy brown color with a big fluffy white head leaving tons of lace. Aroma is considerably spicy, very nice. Lots of good banana and nuttiness on the nose, almost a banana bread sort of thing happening. The aroma is more spicy than fruity sweet though. Flavor profile is nice good notes of brown sugar, clove, nuts, yeast, bubblegum, raisin, and a mild almost citrus like fruitiness. Despite almost every single flavor that I just listed there being in one way or another synonymous with a beer that is very sweet, this has a well balanced dryness that really evens the beer out. Another fantastic brew from Weihnstephaner.

Attractive pour with sustained thin head and light apricot shade. Spicy, ripe banana nose. Somewhat malty intro that transitions smoothly to raisiny, banana bread finish. Pleasantly soft mouthfeel especially in the follow through. Highly enjoyable considering I am rating in a hotel room with a hotel-issued plastic cup!

Caramel and banana arome with some vanilla and bubblegum.
A hazy beef broth color with a tan hue, off tan head that is about a sixteenth inch.
Caramel and banana malt tast with some hints of vanilla and bubblegum and an alcohol flavor is balanced within.
Medim bodied, resinous feel, and has an alcohol feel as well  through to the finish.
Probably better on tap and on par or better than their hefe.
On tap at British Beer Company. Darker wheat with banana and spices. Very good.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2011 Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a huge white head. Sweet aroma of banana and malt. The flavour is sweet, malt and banana with notes of spices and yeast. Medium to light-bodied, very drinkable.

Weihenstephaner dunkelweisse bottle at Belgian Cafe Philly.
Appear: 4
Aroma 8
Taste 9
Palate 4
Overall 18
Trademark banana flavor, dark chocolate malt balanced in.  Nice thick head, dark brown

Bottle. It pours a hazy, brown body with a creamy beige head diminishing too fast. Bananaish nose with caramel and a sweetish aroma. Touch of cloves. Pleasantly sweet, effervescent and medium full on the palate. Slightly herbal bitterness, with banana and caramel doing the most of the job. Some spicyness too. Some bitterness to go with the sweetness in the finish. Quite pleasant, but not as easy to drink as I would like it. Fine. (090205)

Bottle into Weizen glass. Pours very hazy light milk chocolate brown, with a healthy fluffy off-white head on top. Nose is sweet, heavy on bananas, a bit of vanilla pudding. Flavor is very smooth - you get the tangy wheat in there, alongside bananas, clove, a bit of sweet malt comes through in the form of a super light cocoa note, as well as the mellow, smooth quality. Soft carbonation, light bodied. Yum.

Dark tan to copper color with big lacy light tan head.  Aromas of some clove and of course wheat.  Looks excellent in the glass, the head keeps on throughout the beer.  Flavor is strong on the wheat, with some malt and cloves, a small bit of banana flavor.  There is a slight spice, but this is certainly not a spicy beer.

A dark copper body with a lacy tan head, notes of grasses and clove.  A hearty yet still moderate and well-balanced wheat beer, with a background of sweetness to make ti all work well.


grain and faint banana. Nice mouthfeel. Substantial, but not thick. Flavor is wheat, malt, banana, and mild spices. Mainly cloves. Spice is tame and in the background. A little sweet, but not cloying. Quite enjoyable.
[Bottle from Henrik Ab & Zu.] A hidden unknown treasure from the cellar. Great brown look with huge head with notes of small bananas, wheatyeast, great softness, malty, mild and friendly.

Aroma complexo, com variações de fermento, caramelo, malte e azeitona. Coloração entre o marrom e o vermelho, densa. Espuma cremosa. Paladar elaborado, com discreto amargor, também lembrando banana, caramelo e azeitona.
Pours a nice dark/orange-brown colour with a dense, foamy dark-white head. Flavour of malts, wheat, yeast, cloves, banana, bubblegum, and other spices. A great example of the style.

Pint bottle. Pours a hazy deep copper color with a healthy 2 finger head. Moderate lacing. Aroma is wheat grain and faint banana. Nice mouthfeel. Substantial, but not thick.  Flavor is wheat, malt, banana, and mild spices. Mainly cloves. Spice is tame and in the background. A little sweet, but not cloying. Quite enjoyable.
Bottle.  Sweet wheaty aroma, with banana.  Cloudy amber body, very large thick off-white head.  Flavor is smooth but potent, and a typical wheat....no bitterness, fruity banana sweet.  High quality.

dark orange-brown very hazy beer with a slightly offwhite head
smells yeasty and of clove and hidden fruit
tasts yeasty and of much clove and hidden banana and a bit toffee like 
aftertaste is yeasty, clovy,  hidden banana and bittersweet but has some hidden sourish hint too

Bottle. Murky brown, fluffy pale head. Yeasty aroma, with loads of wheat, cocoa and little roastiness. Herbal, wheaty and mildly chocolatey flavor, some banana and yeastiness. Medium bodied, strongly carbonated mouthfeel. Quite subtle dunkelweizen, I like that cocoa though.
Bottle. A cloudy dark amber with a foamy head. Yeasty aroma of banana esters and toffee. A more malty palate, those yeasty banana flavours again. Easy drinking with a soft finish.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2009 500 mL. This is severely underrated. Pours a muddy dark brown with a generous off-white head that settles down. Aromas of chocolate malt, spice, and cocoa with faint bananas and yeast. Taste is conflicting- it is at once yeasty, light and fruity and then more full, chocolately, and coffee-like. Sour finish. A unique experience.
Bottle.  Pours brown with nice white head.  Smell of malt, chocolate with a hint of coffee.  Nice smooth finish.  Taste nice on the palate.
0,5 liter. Lekkere dunkel weizen. goed van smaak. Alleen het sprong een beetje de fles uit. een kliederboel.

A lightly hazed orange brown weizen with a thin white head. A pleasant pungent phenolic aroma, bananas, cloves, very classy. In mouth, a crisp apple dunkel, a bit of solvent and bananas. Very classy and fresh. Flour City brewfest, August 15 2008.

500ml bottle into eponymous branded weizen glass. Cloudy dark amber beer with an ample lingering fluffy off white head. Spicy caramel aromas. Palate of chewy malt with flavours of caramel, bananas and cloves. Sweetish finish. A beautifully integrated wheat beer.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Unremarkable.  Not offensive or bad at all, but nothing special.
bottle 500ml from Alko 3 EXP 20.03.09 light brown huge head Scent:phenols malts Taste: tickling kick of sweet malts and banana  spicy as well. Pleasant aftertaste

50cl bottle from Total Wine (Tampa, FL). Pours a milky dark brown with massive two finger off-white, tannish head that settles slowly and amply laces the glass. Aroma is sweet and spicy with notes of malt, honey, flowers, and molasses. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of banana, clove, chocolate, some toasted malt, and just a bit of tang. Generally medium body with a slightly sweet finish.
bottle. very wheaty aroma. light straw color with thick white head.  has a taste of spice and wheat. not too bad over all.

500ml bottle. White thick head. Cloudy dark brown color. Sour and sweet wheaty aroma with little bit banana and soap. Wheaty flavor. Only dunkel part is little bit sweet malts. toffee, banana. Sour end.

Pours a dark, opaque, golden brown with a thick, foamy, pale tan head. Nice, fairly strong aroma is wheaty, malty and "rubbery" with hints of orange and spice. Flavor is rich, wheaty and malty, and has a spicy and orangy undertone. Texture is very smooth, and finish is pleasing and satisfying.
I am a big fan of Hefes and this is no exception.  Very nice  burnt amber color with subtle notes of citrus but finish of caramel.

Cloudly Burnt colour with an off white and very stable head. 

Aromas of Malt and grains followed by fruit and taost. Medium bitterness and flavours of Bannana and Clove with backings of chocolate.

This was a very enjoyable beer to drink, great after a meal to prepare the palate for a desert. Or just on its own.

The pour was a hazy brown color with a solid off-white head and spotty lacing.  The aroma was malt heavy with some lighter spice, fruit and wheat coming through.  The flavor was lightly roasted malt and dry wheat with some lighter hints of fruit.  The mouthfeel was on the dry side, fairly light in body.  Just OK.
Malty with cinnamon undertones, slightly dark fruit.  A little flat for my tastes, drank from a large 16.9 oz. bottle, and I was a little disappointed.
Nice wheat and banana smell to the beer.  Cloudy brown color.  Malty, banana wheat flavor with slight bitterness.  Slight spice flavor.  Balanced and smooth.  I enjoy this more than the regular hefe.

Banana and clove definitely present.  Pretty bland flavor for a Dunkelweizen.  Medium brown hazy body with a good amount of lasting head.  Aroma of hay/straw.  Extremely light flavored for a Dunkel, I prefer a much more robust flavor.
Hazy copper color. Firm rich banana-flavor and wheat. spices, topped with pretty heavy carbonation. Aftertaste has nice a sour-finish.

Nice dark hue to this. I get a decent amount of banana in this, similar to their Hefe, that was super good. Equally as drinkable, and the extra dark malt adds a bit of body, but its still suprisingly light for a dunkel. Fairly sweet as well. I like the Hefe a bit more, but this was allright.

09-Apr-08 (500-ml bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Muddy amber-brown in color, it’s nearly impossible to see through the beer. It’s topped by two inches of lively heading, though I admit I wasn’t especially careful with the pour. The nose is fruity and tart, lots of cloves and a hint of banana, but not really all the wheaty, so this smells different than the Dunkelweizens I’ve had, and I appreciate the departure. In the flavor, too, there is less emphasis on the bready wheats, and more focus on mild banana, prominent clove and spice, and a moderately chocolaty maltiness. Medium-bodied, cleaner and less heavy on the palate than some others, I find this is an easy-drinking but delicious Dunkelweizen. Whereas most of these beers have had fizzy heads that dissipated rapidly, the long-lasting head here retains a quarter-inch layer atop the beer for most of the session. Overall, this is really enjoyable, one of my favorites of this style.
Hefe’s are not my favorite style, but this is a good one.  It is very sweet, with notes of citrus and unripe banana.  There is a grainy flavor also which reminds me of dry cereal.  Finishes nice.
This has one of the best aromas (sweet) I have smelt in while. It is a very dark hefe. Flavor was not as pronounced as the aroma. Beautiful caramel color.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2012 Update 03/2012: Hard to turn down a classic, pours cloudy brown/orange with fluffy off-white head. Aroma of banana, very faint dark roast. Flavor is wheaty malt, banana, vague hints if chocolate and clove, signs of citrus and wheat malt, yeasty. Mouthfeel is light-medium with soft carbonation. Overall, very well balanced brew and very enjoyable.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. Pours a orange/brown with very nice beige head. Not much aroma , slight bubblegum. Flavor is very nice, some bannana, bubblegum, dark roast. Mouthfeel is light-medium body with high carbonation. Over all I enjoyed this beer. Would have again.
From a bottle poured brown with lots of head.  Nice sweet malty flavor with a lingering finish.

bottle. Pours a hazy copper with a slightly off white head, not much lacing. Nose is somewhat subdued but hints of malt and bananna shine through. Taste is wheat malt but this bottle has a strong taste of oxidation, cardboard. Hopefully I can get a fresher bottle next time, if there is one.

500 mL bottle.  Hazy rust-coloured beer.  Crisp bubblegum-banana-clove aroma.  It tastes like a weizen, but not so much like a dunkel.  Sweet, wheaty, yeasty, well carbonated.  Some spice and just a touch of chocolate at the end.  Good, but could be a little meatier.
50 cl bottle. Hopheads´ tasting 22. august. Hazy amber/light brown color, off-white head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Flavor is sweet and fruity, wheat and yeast.
Its a good German beer, its got some dark toasted malts, not too hoppy and it goes down real smooth. Weihenstephaner are winner and this one is no exception
fine aroma, pours dark with light brown head, flavor is very nice, lots of sweet flavors still the sweetness is under control. weihenstephan sure know how to do a weizen style brew.
Dark and slightly cloudy. The wheat is quite warming and there are traces of malt as well.Quitepleasant.
Pours brown with a nice off white thick head.  Low carbonation level with taste of spices.  Lingering thin finish.  Nice bottle that is useful for homebrewing.

Yummy!  I love the upfront spice of this one, it just grabs you and never lets go, that is untilt he bottle is empty and even then it has a lingering presence on the palate.  Lovely cereal maltiness, with banana, cloves and bubblegum, but fairly dry in the finish.  Nicely done.
Cloudy brown colour. Fairly high carbonation. Aroma dominated by banana with some malt and raisin. Tastes of sweet malt up front with big banana and bubblegum flavours. Beautiful.
Unclear nougat brown with a big head. Lots of banana, caramel and bread in the aroma. The flavours are initially sweet going into a bit of spice and a salty finish. Very nice.
On tap. Hazy amber colour, big fluffy head. Aroma of banana, yeast, wheat, caramel. Flavours are the same, with some spice added. Nice and refreshing, quite tasty beer.

Bottle. Quite yeasty, some smell of bananas, light bread. Large white creamy head, long lasting; cloudy red-brown body. Light acidic and sweet taste, rather short duration. Light to medium body, dry and light creamy texture, lively carbonation; later on it gets unfortunately too watery.
Pours a huge frothy creamy head.  Dark. amber in color.  Aroma of bread.  Very light oily mouthfeel. Almost watery.  Faint bitter finish.  Probably would not buy again.
Cloudy, dark amber beer with a small tan head.  Aroma is banana.  Flavor is fruit and bread. Finish is very faint banana and wheat.  Nice flavors, but not as present as I’m looking for in a dunkel.

A light murky brown with an average head. Sweet wheat malty ester aroma that’s a little too subdued. Toasty caramel  and ester flavour, fruity finish, more banana then many dunkelweizens. Nice and refreshing.
Decent beer. pours a dark copper colour, tan head, medium sized. aroma is sweet, carmel, toffee and almonds. mouthfeel is light, slightly watery. finish is weak.

Bottle. Pours a nice translucent carmel with an modest off white head. Sweet camel malty aromas. Crisp, sweet and bubbly on the palate. I was expecting a heavy thick beer, but I am pleasantly surpirsed at how light it is. A very tastey brew. Hefe’s are my 2nd favorite style and this on is top drawer. I’m looking foward to my next one.
cloudy dark muddled orange color with thinnish head. bitters and orange on the nose and coriander with orange peel, caramel and malts on the taste. A bit thinnish and oily palate

Bottled. Pours amber and toilet shit brown with a light urine tinge and a dirt white head. Mofo reaks of bread and possibly some yeasty vag. Flavor is well malted with banana, banana bread, and some spices. Body is well malted.

[Bottle] Pours a cloudy gold with a medium tan head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, caramel, and maybe a little musty. Flavor is nicely sweet, with a lot of tart wheat, caramel, raisins, and a little bit of vinous notes.

Pours into a Kapuziner weissbier glass a murky chestnut body with an immense tan head. Good retention and lots of clingy patch lacing. Aroma is fresh baked brown bread, spicy hops, dark fruits, ripe banana, and a hint of clove. Very creamy on the palate, with low medium carbonation and a medium body. Taste is very bready, with notes of tangy wheat, spicy hops, bubblegum, ripe banana and some clove. Dark dried fruits underneath. Very tasty!

The aroma is caramelized orange zest and mild dried dark fruits with some mild herbal spice, it has a nice burnt orange cloudy body with a 2 finger white head, lacing is moderate, tastes like a hefe with a vinous wine like character, like an earthy spanish tempranillo with the citrus zest and spice. I give this good marks because it’s better to me than a regular hefe, which isn’t my favorit style unfortunately. It failed my kit-kat test though. :(

Bottle. Poured a brownish see-thru color with lots of foamy head, good lacing too. The aroma has raisins, brown sugar, malt, yeast, and mild hops. The appearance is hazy red brown with a medium-large head that is persistent. The flavor has raisins, lightly toasted malt, caramel, spices, and licorice. The palate is on the thin side. This is a good tasting beer that is just too weak.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2008 old rating: 6/3/7/3/14 - 3.3
pours a cloudy dark orange-brown with lots of sediment, very large off-white head, good lacing.
smell of ripe banana, malt, touch of cocoa, some spice.
taste is creamy and thick, cocoa, malt, touch of spice, wheat, slight banana, some yeast.

Slightly off-white head. Cloudy muddy brown color. Mostly just the smell of a normal hefe. Pretty light-bodied. Really citrusy, mostly lemon... in the aftertaste as well. Flavour is full and badass. Little sour, especially at finish.

This beer is absolutely great. Wonderful malty, fruity aroma. Pours dark brown, almost completely opaque. Very large, foamy head, lasts a while. Delicious malt flavor, fruity overtones. A little bit of bitterness, not much, mostly sweet. Surprisingly full bodied. Feels good in the mouth too. One of my favorites, highly recommended.

A hazy amber colored beer with a huge rocky foamed white head. It stays foor a long time. The aroma of roasted malt, sweet fruity and a little spicey. The taste of a little caramel with roasted malts, banana, a little sweet and bitter. There is almost no aftertaste.

I am surprised at other peoples ratings on this as this is a lovely Dunkel Weissen. This had beautiful color and a nice nose. It had a nice caramel sweetness and full body that made this very enjoyable for me.
bottle, tan head with brown pour, very similar to the hefe with a nutty caramel flavor added, very good

Draft - Brown beer with big tan head.  Standard hefe aroma prhaps a bit more bready than normal.  This is an excellent dunkel Hefe.  The sweet wheat flavors are here without the over abundance of caramel sweetness that the dark malt can sometimes bring.

Pint bottle poured into my trusty stein-poured semi murky brownish orange, a very light head big enough to jump in and land safely into formed and stayed around for awhile, moderate carbonation.  Aroma of yeast and bread.  Hits the mouth with a light-medium body, the wheat malt tastes like it was burned when dried after harvesting, clove and banana make its way from the mess described earlier, finish is crisp and palate cleansining.  A bit odd even for me.

Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Dunkel is a cloudy brown beer with a fluffy off-white head.  The aroma is of banana and clove and possibly nutmeg and vanilla.  It is medium bodied, smooth and soft.  The flavor is spicy: all of the elements from the aroma plus raisins, prunes and apples.  It is bready and semi-dry.  All of the flavor seems to be from the yeast.  What a unique beer.

Very clear golden amber, some big bubble tan head.
Some sweetness on the nose,  light banana.
Sweet, caramel flavor, some banana.
Somewhat cloying.

Nice copper brown with foamy head.  Bready, yeasty aromas pop off along with metallic notes.  Quiet clovey vanilla softness in both scent and texture.  Bready taste and toffeeish subtle cinnamon notes are there too, with quiet souring apples towards the back.

A Sim rate (on tap at some rowdy German bierhaus in Brooklyn, NY): Typical German dunkel weissness in the aroma. So so yeasty, malty and wheaty. Nothing special in the appearance. Its not particularly dark or cloudy as I would expect. Wheaty flavour. But nothing particularly sticks out. There arent any of the flavours Id expect to taste from a dunkel weiss. No metal. No choc or caramel. Is this really a dunkel weiss??

From the bottle, pours a hazy reddish brown weird color with a small white head.  Nice aroma of bananas a a bit of chocolate, and otherwise like a pretty good hefe.  Taste is similar in description to the aroma, with a slightly watery mouthfeel despite being thicker on the palate.  I had higher hopes for this one, but I think it might just have been a bit too sweet.

Pours cloudy brown with huge light tan head. Aromas of wheat and clove. Mild sweet flvaor with clove and citrus. Medium body with minimal carbonation and a velvety mouthfeel. Very refreshing on a hot, humid Miami afteroon.
Great Dunkel...initial flavor is sweet with banana peel and spicy mustard.  Finishes slightly watery.

Bottle courtesy of Gregclow, thanks!!  Looks like perfection - hazy dark yellow and golden brown, big fluffy head (great lacing), lots of slowly moving steady bubbles - lovely.  Strong coriander and wheat malt aroma, cloves, banana and yeast as well.  Taste is nice - lots of citrus like fruit, wheat, yeast, and lots of more clove in the finish.  A really nice dark wheat - a perfect flavourful summer beer.
pours a murky orange brown with huge tan head and a heavy malt aroma. the flavor is mostly caramel malts to me, slightly yeasty, great flavor and very appetizing.

Sampled at Cellars Wine & Spirits Wednesday evening tasting, conducted by Badgerben. Pours a semi-hazy copper brown brew with a creamy off-white head that slowly dissipates to a film top and white ring, with some spotty lacing. Aroma of multi-grain malt, banana esters, some yeast, cloves and a touch of caramel. Taste is medium bodied, light carbonated with flavors of Wheat Chex with bananas and a touch of cloves. Finish is semi-sweet with an aftertaste of spiced cloves and banana. Actually, not too bad for a mass produced Heffe Dunkel.

Munchen import back home. Muddy amber pour fizzing with bits and firmly collared with froth. Aroma spicy and slightly vegetal, with banana, clove, red apple and a slight edge of sourness. Dryish and lightly spicy n the mouth, with more earthy apple peel fruit than banana, pepper and mellowing biscuit. Carbonation a bit prickly and annoying, but as tasty and accomplished as youd expect.
Cloudy amber with a small white head. Weak aroma of banana and clove. Dry and malty flavour with a little banana.
Bottle, Pours hazy, copper with a small off-white head. Sweet fruity nose with light malt and notes of bread. Sweet flavour with fruit and corn. Light to medium bodied. Pleasant.
Excellent example of a dunkelweizen. Full aroma and flavour, goes down very smooth. Nice aroma of banana.
Pours a hazy brown with a large off-white head, a few floaties.  Aroma of banana, caramel, wheat, beautiful. Nice flavor, doesnt quite live up to the aroma however. Very nice.
Pretty much the defineition of the style, this looks cool, maybe neon brown?  Very sweet and smooth it is a nice change of pace on a summer night for a pale ale fan like myself.
ligth brown nice thick foam, nice caramel taste in the beginnning. ligth friut finnish.

Murky light brown with a thick white head. Smells like banana, cinnamon, and yeast, very sweet smelling. A little carmel and molasses in the beginning turns to banana bread at the end. 
.

50cl bottle.   Opaque brown with a big creamy head.   Chocolate-chip banana bread aroma.   Brown sugar, banana, slight tart crisp finish.   Light, but creamy and filling moughfeel.   Nice balanced flavors.   Good stuff, but a little on the light side, and not quite as drinkable as their regular hef, due to the added brown sugar sweetness.

Bottle: A bit unclear, chestnut-amber coloured, bigger, creamy off-white head; cacao-powder and nutmeg in the dark-malty and fruity nose; moderate sweet-sourish flavour, medium bodied, soft MF; nutmeg again in the drier, malty-fruity finish. Pleasant Dunkel-Weizen..............

Hazy amber. Big banana scent with spices as well. Great head. Compared with Ws regular hefe, this is less yeasty and more malty, but only in the aftertaste does it really taste of toffee, cocoa, etc. Main flavor is slightly sour. Good body, tight fizz.

Bottle. Cloudy reddish-orange with a huge foamy white head. Aroma of banana and spice with a bit of caramel and pineapple. Soft and creamy body, fairly low carbonation. Flavour of banana and malt off the top, with some nice clove notes coming though along with a faint yeastiness in the finish. Flavour lingers very nicely, and builds in spiciness as it warms. Nice, I quite liked this.

Bottle. Cloudy brown with uberthick foamy head. Aroma of grilled banana, ginger ale, random tropical fruit. Thin, watery. Yeasty finish. Dry and light. Some dried banana flavors. Solid but seen better.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy dark amber with a billowy off-white head.  Aroma is sweet and earthy, with notes of banana, hops, yeast, and grains.  Taste is full-bodied and sweet, with a flavor of banana, brown sugar, spices, roasted malt, and grains -- long creamy finish as well.  An interesting and unique brew.
Hazy amber with medium off white head. Sweet aroma with banana notes and yeast. Flavor likewise with wheaty notes.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy deep orange with a slowly collapsing off white head. Mild roasted malt to a light wheaty and banana fruity aroma. Banana fruity flavour with a mild malty flavour. Ends light acidic to estery.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with thick fluffy white head. Nice spicy nose and taste. Fine beer.

500ml.  Pours hazy dark brown with light brown highlights.  Amazingly dense, fluffy off-white head... just like the hefeweizen from weihenstephaner.  Nose is caramel apple with some dirt and grass mixed in the bunch.  Body is similar, adds a bit more sweetness and a viscous mouthfeel that really rounds out this beer well.  Everyone has that first quirky beer that no else liked but you, this was that beer for me whilst growing up.

Rated:june 2007
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Head is cloudy, creamy, very big, leaving some lacing, dirty white colour, body is full, hazy or almoast cloudy, mild, soft brown in colour.
Aroma: Creamy, banana, yeasts, malts, malted barley and wheat, very soft alcoholic aroma, almost non existant, a little bit toasty but very minute, rather typical aroma of wheat beer, some hints of mild chockolate.
Flavour: Very mild, the carbonation on palate is noticable, yeast, wheat, some toastyness rather than roastiness, beer is very mellow and mild, in flavour there is a trace of bisquites, some hints of chockolate, flavour is not harsh or strong. 
Palate: Quite wheaty, tangy, some skunkness of malts, not much of wheat, rther poor, much worse as compar to Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier. Aftertaste is rather poor and quite nasty.

Pours cloudy brown, witha fizzy 2 inch foam head. Aroma of medium wheat malt, clean water, and yeast. Flavor is medium/light, grassy, wheat, but full bodied. Mouthfeel is a little fizzy. Really damn good beer, like a lighter dunkel which is perfect for me.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy brown amber color with fluffy beige head. Sweetish aroma with clove, vanilla, caramel, bread and hint of banana. Bready and wheaty flavor with clove, pepper, caramel, banana and tart fruits. A bit watery palate. Im not a fan of dunkel weizens and also in this case the standard weizen from Weihenstephan is much better.

Muito gostosa. aparência perfeita. Coloração lama, com espuma densa e presente ambar/caramelo. Cheiro suave adocicado, com tons de caramelo. Sabor muito bom de caramelo, aveludada e suave. Um pouco gaseificada.
Soft water( like warsteiner). Cloudy golden color. Peppery hops on the lips with malty flavor. Slight watery finish.Hops begining, malty mid, hoppy end. Will drink again.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2008 Bottle pours a slight hazy honey amber color with a huge foamy beige head.  Looks great and smells great too.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, malt, and spices.  Delicious flavor of caramel malt, banana, wheat, and cloves.  Smooth mouthfeel.

A- Pours an unfiltered dark caramel color with a massive, creamy head. The head retains for quite a while and leaves lacing as it falls.

S- Smell is a very sweet, strong banana scent with hints of wheat and darker fruits.

T- Taste seems a bit anticlimatic in that it isnt nearly as flavorful as the nose lets on. Slight banana sweetness.

M- Something about the mouthfeel on this brew really rubs me the wrong way. A bit undercarbonated and leaves a sticky sweet coating on the inside of my mouth.

D- This beer seems like it would be pretty drinkable in that it is not too offensive but its not nearly as flavorful as I was expecting. None the less it seems to be a good thirst quencher

Really really good dunkel that is full of great yeasty aroma, with a crisp citrus sharpness that dissapates and makes you long for another sip.  I also love the murkiness and just about everything about this beer.

Bottled.  Pour is a hazy honey amber with nice head. Looks great.  Taste is yeasty with some clove, all wheat beer characteristics.  Yet, still retains some dark characteristics.  Had this after there Korbinian Doppelbock, although not as big, this one was more my style and much more approachable.  And for the style this one is top notch.

Cask at Zeitgeist @ The Jolly Gardener. Aroma of plums, sour fruits, yeast and malt. Pours an opaque brown beer with a white head. Taste is malty, fruity and yeasty with some carbonation. Finish is moderately sweet. Doesnt taste as good as it smells.

Pours a hazy, brown (like dark iced tea) topped with a large, dense, pillowy, beige head. Nice wispy lace. The nose is a pleasant, sweet wheat with supporting notes of light clove, banana and what smells like iced tea with lemon. Incredibly smooth and well integrated the palate is light-bodied and fairly thin with velvety soft carbonation and a clean, lightly spicy finish. Like their Hefe Weissbier, this is extremely drinkable. The flavor is subtle but supremely integrated: sweet wheat with light supporting notes of clove, faint cocoa, banana and the tea that was on the nose. Im not sure that this is my "favorite" dunkelweizen, but its a very well made brew.
0,5l bottle. Nice dark orange/brown color with good Weißbier-head. Wheaty and somewhat fruity nose. Taste is surprisingly malty. A decent Weißbier, but not much more.
Old rating. Light brown color with gold hints. Aroma is burnt caramel, cloves, spice. Nice mouthfeel. Taste is anise, caramel, bubblegum, brown sugar. Sweetish finish.

Aroma of candied malt, wheat, a pleasing spiciness, deep hazy copper, pours a monstrous long lasting toffee head, gurgling as the carbonation dissipates, some pretty lace too. Flavour is a roasted malt, wheat, caramel, spices are at just the right level. Medium bodied, very well balanced, a well rounded sweet spiciness from beginning to end, woody and effortless to consume. Great example!
50CL bottle, Darkbrown golden color, hazy. Medium head. Great beer, malty taste. lightly bitter, lightly sour, astringent, average carbonation, creamy, medium body,

500ml bottle, served chilled. Looks fantastic in my weizen glass, hazy bronze body, sizeable creamy offwhite head. Spicy banana and caramel on the nose, a touch of vanilla in there also. Full bodied, effervescent carbonation, creamy texture, touch of acid, such a joy. Clove phenols dominate the body, sweeten by some banana and caramel, finishing with a drying vanilla character, begging for more. Fantastic example of one of my favourite styles.

bottle. Poured hazy, dark orange with plenty of foam. Banana present in the aroma and flavor, along with clove. Sort of roasty. Looks more carbonated than it is. Foamy, light mouthfeel. A hint of soft bitterness in the aftertaste. Very subtle and exceptionally refreshing.  Was a little better on tap. One more reason I am a fan of German wheats.

Cloudy dark brown colour with a thin off-white/beige coloured head. Thin to medium bodied with fairly low carbonation. A little sweetness in the flavour...malty, slight taste of banana, low bitterness. Pretty good. - 500 ml bottle.
Murky brown with a tan head. Low to medium carbonation. Sweet, wheaty, with banana and cloves. I enjoyed this more than their regular Hefe Weissbier.

500ml bottle. pours hazy light brown with off white head. aroma of toasted biscuity, banana, cloves, floral hops, hints of chocolate. flavors are a bit citrusy banana, slightly toasted malt, perfumy hop flavor. full of flavor, light on the palate making this very refreshing. a perfect chilly spring or fall beer.

My 100th beer!!  Pours a very hazy dark amber colour with a big white head.  Has a very mality smell and a good wheaty flavor.  Very easy to drink.  Well balanced.  It took me a few minutes at the liquer store to pick out what was going to be my 100th beer and Im glad I didnt screw it up. I drank this out of a Weizen.

Bottle picked up from Sainsburys in Kidlington.  Consumed 26.3.08  Pours murky, hazy dark amber, with a light beige big fluffy head. Some banana & spices on the nose, light fruitiness at the back of the mouth coupled with a sweet vanilla creaminess. A really nice beer.

...one of the greatest beers out there.  Mixes dark malty, and mellow flavors, with a creamy taste that lingers in the head, and begs you to take another gulp.  Dark dryish fruit flavors complement to the complexity of this great beer, drink it.
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2008 Nice flavor. I prefer the regular hefes over the dunkels, but this one is pretty good. Nice sweet balance of the yeast, malts, and fruits- comes together nicely.

Bottled. Pours out in a cloudy, almost opaque brown colour topped with a rich and creamy off-white foam. Cloves and banana in the aroma with touches of toasted malts and dark fruit. Medium to light-bodied with with strong notes of cloves and banana with undertones of nuts, all-spice, almonds and toasted malts. Lively carbonation, of course. Over-riped banana, cloves and toasted malts in the aftertaste Pretty good but I still looking for a Dunkelweizen that blows my socks off...

Pours a cloudy brown.  Had this at a German restaurant paired with Swinehaxen (pork shank).  Has the pleasant traditional aromas and flavors of a Hefeweiss like clove and banana.  Noted were some toasted flavors. One of the finer examples of this style.

Nice hazy dark amber color with a huge billowy head. Aroma is very sweet and malty with some subtle clove spice. The flavor is nice roasted wheat/malt with a little bit of clove/citrus spice. The  palate is very nice with some good mouthfeel and solid carbonation for the style. A very nice Dunkelweizen overall.

Pours a nice hazy brown color with a wonderful creamy white head that lasts forever.  Roasty aroma of wheat and malt, with a touch of spiciness and citrus.  Flavor of wheat toast, with a touch of light fruitiness.  Palate is a little thin, but still refreshing.  Good brew.

Pours a cloudy brown color with a massive creamy off white head that just doesnt die. Nose is of clove coriander, wheat, and some dark malt. Taste is some what bland. Roasted malt, a bit of chocolate, wheat, spice and a bit of watery mouthfeel. Really very average. I expected more for Weihenstephaner.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy muddy amber brown with a largey pillowy white head. Aroma of wheat, grass, cloves and malts. Refreshing palate with lively carbonation. Flavor of wheat, brown bread and slight cloves. Refreshing wheat beer that goes down easy like a Thai hooker.

Aroma of clove, cinnamon, and corinader, with some wheat. Pours with a huge, creamy, off-white head that sticks around. Taste is a bit watery and mouthfeel is dry, but not that bad,  I have had better dunkelveizens.

Bottled 50cl. It pours a very dark hazy orange beer with a beautiful nicely remaining creamy whitish head. The nose is wheaty with hints of mint, maple syrup, banana and apples. Very soft. No cloves detectable. Low bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Rather malty with a hint of mint. Some banana accompanied by a touch of white wine and sour apples. Lightly sour and smoky. Nice lingering yeasty finish with a hint of peppermint. The spritzy characteristic gets cloying after a few sips. Decent, nothing more. Noticeably inferior to a good Dunkelweizen.

Schnitzel Plas-  On draft- Cloudy orange/brown, fluffy head.  Had this right after the Korbinian, and I know its a bad comparison, but I was let down with this dunkel after the stellar performance of the doppelbock.  This beer was a bit on the sweet side for me.
Pours out looking like a brown ale.  Great sweet flavor.  Cant go wrong with this one.

A careful pour produces a voluminous, four-finger thick, lightly cocoa tinged, tan colored head that only laves a touch of lacing on the sides of my glass.  The beer is a earthy, dark plum color, but shows a lightly hazed, lightish cranberry hue when held up to the light.  When held up to the light you also get a good sight of the seething mass of bubbles that are packed into this brew.  Quite an appetizing aroma, it is a melange of banana, caramelized bread crust, a touch of sweet plum, crushed grain, some smooth phenolic clove notes and a light peppery spice character that is just barely noticeable underneath the surface.  The Dunkel part of the malt bill adds a bit more, slightly rich, fruitiness to the aroma than one would find in a pale version.  It also accentuates aromas of toasty grain and fresh baked, whole-grain bread crust.

The carbonation keeps this fairly light and definitely adds a light frothy texture to this brew.  Very lightly sweet, but it does have a richness of malt character to it that pale Hefeweizens do not have.  Soft fruit flavors of ripe plums seem to be a bit more noticeable up front than either of the signature banana or clove notes.  Both are here though with the banana playing a subtle flavor role up front and in the middle, while the clove flavors add a spicy finish to this brew where it plays a pretty significant role.  Coupled with the clove in the finish is a nice, wheat-beer  tartness.  As the beer warms up a bit, the clove flavors begin to stretch into the front parts of each sip.  The texture of this beer really has a nice, soft, velvety character to it; it coats the mouth, but softly as this is a very quaffable brew.  Melanoids and caramelized notes characterize the malt / grain character up front, while a bit of dusty grain character with just a kiss of toast graces the palate in the middle.  At times a spicy, pepper-like character inserts itself onto the palate, it is quite nice and provides a sort of palate cleansing.

This is just a very nice example of a Dunkel Weizen.  The caramelized, slightly toastier malt adds an interesting dimension to the traditional Hefeweizen character.  This is a beer I would be quite happy to drink a few liters of.

Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson AZ
Tasty and sweet! Pours an orange hazy color with minimal head. Taste nice and sweet, good beer!
Pours an off white head and brown/red color.  Aroma of sweet caramel.  Kinda dark and clowdy.  I like this beer, I plan to have more from this brewer.

Bottled.  Pours a hazy brown color with a large frothy off white head.  The aroma is wheat grass, some banana, bready malt.  The flavor is malty; sweet caramel and roasted bread, some spices, and a hint of citrus.  Medium bodied.  My first dunkelweizen, not bad.

Cloudy brown with an off white head. Dusty, leathery, yeasty aroma. Wheaty taste with cloves and a sweetness that has a slightly unpleasant edge of artificial sweetener. Slight bitter finish. Didnt enjoy this as much as I thought I would.

On tap.   Pours a cloudy brown color with a substantial pillowy beige colored head.   Aroma is banana, clove, light floral hops, light chocolate.   Flavor is green banana, light clove, bubblegum,  nutmeg, light toffee.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finished sweet.   Very drinkable.   Good stuff.
Bottle: pours a cloudy burnt orange with a thick, frothy head, sweet aroma of banana, caramel and malt, taste is yeasty, malty and smooth.  Nice weizen.

(Bottle) Pours a hazy brown color with a moderate sized, off-white colored head. Aroma of cocoa, banana, and wheat malt. Taste includes some molasses, nutmeg, clove, vanilla and caramel. Dry, satisfying finish. Solid mouthfeel, and lively carbonation.  I have always been a fan of Weihenstephaner products, and this beer is no exception.

Pours cloudy brown/orange with a big frothy off-white head with good staying power.  Dusty, sweet caramel, and dried banana aroma.  Sweet sugary banana, some toffee, and the aftertaste is yeast and  faint bitter black-wheat. Make sure to serve it at the right temperature or its not very good at all 50-54F is best.  If its too cold the body/carbonation and the flavors are way different.  Body is very smooth at the right temp.
Although Hefes arent really my thing. I did appreciate the fact that this one delivered its yeasty flavor along with the body of a dark beer. A good example of this beer type

Bottle at home ... Thanks to me for buying this :-) ... Hazy Clowdy Yellow Brown ... Big foam Head ... Nice Bananananana wheat little clove nose ... wonderfull rounded sweet banana ... little yeast ... little sweet malts.A great beer.

Aug. 2006 - Not as dark a pour as other dunkels.  Not as roasty as other dunkels. If I were blindfolded, I might have thought this was a plain old hefe...not that that is a bad thing.  Bubblegum, strong banana, light cloves and a silky smooth mouthfeel characterize this one.  Good beer.
pours a cloudy light brown colorwith a healthy off white head.  Has a sweet malty flavor with a citrus touch thats hinted at by the aroma.  A high quality, refreshing beer.

This is one of my favorite beers, and the one that got me started in actually savoring beer.  I remeber my first experience with this beer.  I ordered a bottle of this at Old Chicago.  It poured a hazy brown color with plenty of small bubbles.  I raised the glass to my mouth and was hit with a sweet dough-like smell that I had never experienced before.  I smelled it again and couldnt believe how different this beer was from the big-name American beers I was used to drinking.  Then I took a drink and immediatly craved more.  I never thought a beer could taste this good!  The beer seemed to hug my tounge as I drank it.  I was sad when that beer was gone, but even more sad when I found out that our local Old Chicago was no longer going to be carrying it.  Luckily I have since found a local specialty beer store that was willing to order some for me.  I love this beer!

Bottle into weiss glass.  Pours exactely how it should, hazy light brown with thick, frothy, long lasting off-white head.  Flavor and aroma are very true to style -- bread, banana, clove, and yeast.  Well balanced and very drinkable, nothing unpleasant here.  A very good example of a style I really like.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2008 This is very nice, smooth and tasty, being a less crisp, somewhat caramelly version of their Hefeweissbier, although I prefer the latter.  This is hazy, somewhat dark brown amber with a huge off-white head that lasts a long time but leaves almost no lacing.  The aroma is like a hefeweizen but softer, with hints of toffee and more toasty grain or even a hint of nuts along with the wheat/banana/bubblegum elements, while the bubblegum in particular is more muted and barely noticeable (compared to their light hefeweissbier, where the bubblegum is quite strong).  The taste is similar, being a softer, less crisp version of the lighter beer, with less bubblegum, less bitternes, and a definite light caramel taste and smoothness.  Its very nice, very easily drinkable, and flavourful, with some complexity, but not quite as satisfying as the lighter version.

This beer pours a dirty brown with a medium tan head.  The aromas are slight bananas, roasted wheat and maybe some nuts?  The flavors are a littel dry with some bananas and nuts.  Not one of their better beers.  But it is drinkable I suppose.  Cheers!

Pours a cloudy brown with plenty of carbonation and a good sized creamy head.  Aroma and taste are very similar with bread, spice, cloves and bananas.  Taste also has a sweet malty finish with plenty of carbonation.  One of the only dunkleweizens Ive tasted, pretty nice.

16.9 oz bottle-A cloudy brown body with a nice tight tan head which comes across with an aroma of Aroma of yeast, caramel, brown sugar, and sweetness. Taste of the same with some banana, clove, yeast, and malt all coming out in the taste. Great tasting Dunkel
Great "Bananas Foster" aroma to this beer. Rich yeasty flavor.  Hints of baking spices on the mid-palate and finish.
Pours brown and cloudy with a thick white head. Aroma is malty, banana, and spicy. Very nice sparkling taste that has hints of malt and spices in it. Very nice and easy to drink.

Pours a murky cider-like brown with a couple fingers of off white head.  Aroma is bananna bread with tiny hints of clove, smells great!  Taste is wheaty and sweet, with less of the spices in the flavor than the aroma, but still pretty nice.
Very nice dunkel.  This beer is delicate, sweeter than its lighter counterpart with a slightly sweeter and nuances of sour, finish.  Very sessionable.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2008 Frothy head,misty amber,looks superb,aroma sweet even though grainy wheat smells.Cooking has produced a pleasant sweetness.Flavour full wheat,malty,tangy finish is sweet and toasted dry flavour,I was a little critical when I first rated this beer,that it was nauseating,well second time round things(tastes- buds ) have improved,it is a fair and good beer.

16.9oz bottle- pours a reddish copper color. light off white head. Aroma of malts. Light, crisp and clean tasting. Very easy to drink and could have a few of these fairly easily.
A good Dunkleweizen overall.

Bottle. Poured to a dark cloudy tea color, medium to dark amber, with a light fluffy tan head with little fizz.  Aroma: sweet, wheaty, pear, & light honey.  Medium body & light sryupy consistency.  Clean and crisp.  Quick beginning with little flavor.  Medium middle with lively flavors of wheat, barely, hops and fizz.  Quick aftertaste that does not linger.  Lots of wheat flavor.  Balanced & mild not over powering.
Pours a clear amber/copper with a white head. Lots of malt and nuts on the nose. Taste is a dry sweetness with a nutty finish. Not bad.

The bottle looks a little bit boring. But the beer is everything else than boring. Looks great in the glass. Tastes very fresh, zippy, modest malty - really a good beer from the oldest brewery of the world!
Not as pleasing as the helles-weiss.  Soft caramel sweetness and a mid-palate metallic transition to a sharp wheat finish.  Phenols and cloves in the aroma.  Head did not last.

(50 cl bottle at Haket, Göteborg)
Huge tan head, almost hard to see any beer just after pouring. 
Slight shady deep golden color, big creamy tan lasting head, even after 
waiting a good while.
Estery and somewhat phenolic scent, banana and a bit spicy.
Grainy, malty, spicy, metallic and chocolate taste.
Alcohol and sweet aftertaste.
After a while it does get a bit smoked/rauchbier aftertaste.
Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness
Purchased on December 12, 2007.
6/4/6/3/12=3.1
Excellent beer, some dark malt character with a grainy character.  Flavor gets more complex as it warms in your glass, some yeast, caramel, very light floral hops.  Pretty good change of pace beer.

Beautiful, frothy, off-white head over a murky, swampy and reddish-brown.  Highly wheaty aroma - kind of sweet and filled with honey.  The aroma reminds me somewhat of the smell of breakfast cereal - Special K or something like that.  The flavor is not bad - it is also very wheaty and slightly sweet.  Its a refreshing and easy to drink beer.

Super hazy, bronze-colored beer, with a frothy head that continues to grown long after the pour - complex aroma of sweet, over-ripe fruits, yeasty qualities, a mild nuttiness - very smooth, with a medium body - the expected clove and spicy notes are present, along with a sweet, caramel apple flavor, and some slight notes of fig - quite fruity and sweet, but with enough balance spice to keep it quite pleasant and mellow.
Pours a dark maple brown with a thick foamy tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, brown sugar and banana.  Very smooth tasting beer with hints of maple, hazelnut, chocolate, banana and a touch of spice.

nice and foamy with a fiercely active beige head. really nice flavors of malt clove and banana. caramel sweetness and a touch of appropriate spicing. looks wheaty and dark caramel colored. a very good representation.

Draught weizen at Deep Ellum on 11/3/07Prominent, foamy, beige head tops a cloudy magenta-maroon body.  Strong retention and lacing speak to both the quality of brewing and the cleanliness of Deep Ellums draught lines.Soft and fruity, with warm cherry, date and raisin notes mixing with caramel malts to give an easygoing aroma.  Banana and clove do not bludgeon, but add a tell-tale signature to the finish, leaving spicy hops to add zestiness and dry some of the sweetness.  Bubble gum is fairly strong here, and the lack of roast in this dunkelweizen helps push it to the forefront, for better or worse.  It comes off a little sugary/bubble gummy, then, but still impresses with the cleanliness and mild, comforting notes.  No alcohol or flaws, medium to medium-high strength of aroma.Very soft and chewy palate immediately evokes wheat, caramel sugars and fluffy, yet tight carbonation.  Dates figs cast a more poignant note in the background, while up front sweet, caramel pecan flavors mix with vanilla-dusted bananas and medium dry toffee.  The bubble gum is not noticed as singularly in the flavor, but certainly does add to the overall sweetness when taken with the caramel and toffee-like malt notes.  I wont say the 23oz glass went down with extreme ease, but it certainly wasnt a challenge to drink it either.  Soft, wheat and yeast-blunted flavors provide the mild nature to the beer and improve drinkability, which could be further improved with less sweetness.  Certainly not unbalanced, though.  Flawless, with no alcohol or fusels noticed.

Cloudy mahogany appearance with a large, off white head and nice lacing.  Many of the fruity esters typical in a hefe, accented with chocolate malts.  Yeasty, fruity, slightly sweet, toasted wheat taste; gently hopped.  Smooth mediium/full bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Lingering spicy finish.

Pours is deep red with an initial large head.  Aroma of banana, nutmeg, and some caramel toffee.  Wow, the flavor is great.  I think this easily rivals the regular hefeweizen, with even some more complexity.  It may beat it out IMO.  Very nice and underrated!

Bottle: Poured a deep tea like brown a bit hazy with carbonated bubbles, foramed a thick creamy tan head. The aroma is very yeasty bread and some of that sweet banana, there is also some spices. Taste is a mix between that yeasty hefe taste and a nice spicy malt, there is plenty of carbonation and after tingle. Makes the tongue tingle.

tap @ papago...pours a murky brown with a thin white head. aromas of yeast, wheat bread and some spiciness. flavor is again, wheat bread. its mixed with bananas, clove, yeast and molasses. nice dry finish keeps me coming back. lingering banana flavor. medium bodied with a nice creaminess and pretty active carbonation...

Aroma is a sweet Hefe like scent with tones of banana in it.  Color is a dark golden brown with very high carbonation and a thick head that starts off tight but loosens quickly.  Taste is sweet and toasted.  Starting with a medium body it goes down with a smooth feel.  Finish comes is with a mellow sweet flavor that has a nice toasted taste and mild banana esters.  This is a tasty and impressive brew.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2008 500ml Bottle. 
Muddy orangy brown, thick bready head. Classic rye-bread and banana aroma, sharp spicy hints too. Well carbonated, maybe a little fizzy in the mouth. Sweet and dense malty taste, caramel heading towards treacle. Leaves the mouth surprisingly crisp. Excellent dunkel hefeweizen.
Rerate 20080905 - just as good, identical rating.

Bottled(500ml). -Murky caramelish brown coloured, medium to big sized pale beige head, pleasant wheaty fruity and pappery nose. The aroma is very fruity (strong taste of banana and mild of apple), wheaty and roasted malty with notes of caramel and toffee. Light fruity finish. Very nice dunkelweizen.

Draft @ Kavarna, Decatur, GA.  Pours a murky brown with thin pearl film on top.  Nose is like a banana rye bread: firm and doughy, with some fruity notes.  Peppery on the palate, mildly carbonated, wheats come through strong along with nutmeg spiciness and a relatively full body.  Finishes dry with very mild bitterness.
