Quite nice, like most weihenstephans.

Wonderful Dunkel.  No surprise coming from Weihen.  Pours a perfect deep copper brown with a rich foamy off-white head.  Subtle aromas of banana and clove - perfect for the style.  Flavor is malty and balanced by a touch of bitterness on back of palate that became more pronounced as the beer warms.  Very nice beer.  Recommended.

16.9oz bottle-pours a big retaining offwhite head and cloudy amber color.  Aroma  is husky medium malt-caramel, fruit-ripe pear, some spice, yeast.  Taste is husky medium malt-caramel, fruit-ripe pear/banana, some spice-clove and hops, yeast.  Medium body with light accents.  OK effervescence.

Nice looking wheat beer with its typical cloudy amber hue and frothy head. Fantastic sweet malt aroma with just a little citrus tanginess. What a great tasting beer, sweet and lightly tart with a full bodied malt flavor that ends with just enough bitter to leave your moth watering for more.

From a 500 ml bottle this poured a cloudy brown with small off-white head and light lacing.  Nose of wheat and malts, with a creamy mouthfeel.  Flavor was malty, with a little toffee.  Slightly bitter finish. Almost like a Belgian Ale.  Very drinkable.

500 ml bottle.

Slightly murky,brown beer, with a terrific tan head.( tight and bubbly).
Very wheat filled aroma, some toffeeish malts.
Nice flavor profile, semi-sweet milky almost maltiness, then a good strong wheat mouthful, can barely detect hops in the finish, overall very nice and well balanced.
Very good palate, quite thick for the style and a pleasant after taste.
Good drinking beer.

Suprising for a dunkel.  Maybe I misunderstood what a dunkel was.  Tasted much like a white ale with the bitterness of some kind of fruit peel. Perhaps orange peel.  Very sharp but a lasting creaminess.  Head is thick, grey/white, and never fully diminishes.  Some lacing, but minimally noticeable.  I expected more body from a dunkel, but still a nice beer if you want something light and sharp.  Lots of cloves, too.  Almost reminds me of Aventinus.

This one bore the mark 8167.
Bottle.  Light brown dunkel with decent head.  Aroma is very wheaty and slightly sweet.  Flavor is very sweet and wheaty... Decent dunkel.
Bottle, Huge light brown head, mostly lasting. Light brown hazy body. Coriander aroma. Medium body. A bit flat.

So this is another beer that I found buried in a box of singles in my store back from at least 04 in very poor, to say the least, storage conditions. The last one was pretty good though, so here goes. Appearance and aroma are certainly still there. Mahogany pour with a tan head, with a light but pleasant aroma caramelized bananas, and slight but present oxidation. Alas, the flavor is gone and severely oxidized.. Not really bad, but the damage is clear. Light, earthy, dirt laden caramel notes are all that are left. Cant say that it is bad, but I am positive this beer had more to it in its prime. Palate is medium/full with lingering earthy flavors. Well, this seems to be going fairly well so I think Ill have to continue my experiment of poorly cellared vintage ales that I have found in the depths of my store.
Very similar to the sweet taste of the hefeweizen leicht, but with a little more substance, thus, i found this beer to be quite the pleasant amalgamation of sweetness and bitterness

500mL bottle purchased from Bauer Wines in Boston.  Pours a murky, muddy brown with good head.  The head does fade and there is little lacing.  The aroma isnt overly strong, but then again I dont seem to be smelling all that much these days.  The flavour is sadly weak.  Theres some OK wheatiness, but it fades quicker than I would like, and there isnt much in the way of the banana flavours that I like in a good weizen.  That being said, this may be one of my first dunkelweizens, so perhaps those are different.

Pours a clouded gold brown with no head. Nose is slightly sweet in a banana kind of way. That is basically the prevalent fragrance that hits you the whole time. Bananas. Big fields of them. Flavor is smooth and a bit mild, but even. There is that hefe typical character there, but a strong banana skin profile to it as well, just like the nose. Feel is smooth on the mouth. Definitely drinkable. A really good brew that is worth trying.

(Bottle, Monks Café, Stockholm) Dark brownish amber colour, hazy, with huge beige head. Malty nose with slightly citric wheat aromas, chocolate and earthy notes of yeast. Malty taste with slightly sourish notes of wheat, chocolate, toffee and hints of yeast. Balanced sweetness. Overall very balanced, quite nice.
Dark brown and unclear. Has a off-white head, medium lasting. Notes of fruit in the aroma, banana and caramel. Flavor is mainly sweet. Soft carbonation. Syrup texture.

Poured from a bottle, into a tulip glass. Muddy brown, with terrific, creamy. long lasting head. Fades to great lacing. Smeels of a bannna, malt, wheat bread.

Taste dominated by cloves, with a nice alcohol finish.

I really like this beer. Everything I have tried from Weihenstephaner has been nothing short of wonderful.

Eyes closed. Banana.
A nice dark weisse mit hefe. Just a stand-up beer. I could drink this all day. I am reminded of times in the Bavarian countryside. Maybe some dark bread some local Bavarian meat and cheese would be nice right now

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Name: Dunkleweiss

Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs
Appearance: muddy brown, thin cream head
Aroma: sweet malt aroma with hints of chocolate
Overall: rich dry malt fiavor, touch of tartness

Name: Dunkleweiss

Appearance: brown, thin lasting white head
Aroma: sweet malt aroma
Body: light rich malt flavor, slightly sweet, touch of chocolate, smooth body

Name: Dunkleweiss
Date: August 20, 2005
Score: ii to iii
good sweet chocolate and banana flavor that just keeps getting better and better, good raspy wheat character 

Name: Dunkleweiss
Date: July 05, 2007
Mode: bottle
Source: Ale Atlanta
ditto

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3.1/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *4
My favorite Dunkelweizen. The banana flavor/aroma is downplayed from the traditional Hefe and the maltiness replaces it. The clove flavor is terrific. A fantastic beer.
cloudy brown , nice foamy head ,wheaty fruity aroma  sweet  start slight bitter finish  great beer
Cloudy brownish body with a massive head.  Aroma of sweet wheat and banana.  Sweet and malty flavor.  A very nice dark wheat beer.

Hands above franziskan dunkelweisen.  If you can tell i have been on a German thing for the past week or so. Nose is of wheat and barn stalls.  A Coudy brown with the expected out of controll eruption of head.  Settled down nicely to creamy tan head and slowly to a film of carbonation.  Legs are small  and un-connected, spotty.  Body is malty and smooth.  I am now wishing for an accordian and some knockwurst........Quite acceptrable.  again I berate myself for my lack of vison of only pruchasing one!
500ml bottle, pours a cloudy brown color with a big foamy head, lots of carbonation, smell of banana, fruit, wheat, sweet malt. taste has the same qualitys, very bubbly, soft mouthfeel, great beer.
Bottle. Opaque brown with a big, off-white head. Aroma of banana, cloves and caramel. Some mouth feel with flavours of bananas, spice and yeast. Well-balanced.
Bottle.  darker brown, tastes a lot like regular weihenstephaner weiss but with a dash of caramel.
i really liked this one, amber almost brown color, nose was sweet, i got almost raisin kinda sweetness. nice caremel flavour little tart, well balanced
Thanks to ghawener.  Very nice.  Pours out a a brown, golden color with a small head and low carbonation.  Nice maltiness, caramel, bananas.

(Bottle) Pours hazy light amber. Spicy and light floral aroma with some banana esters. Also some hints of clove. Spicy flavour with tones of banana and wheat. Soft and round mouthfeel with a light sour sting. Lingering wheat and banana-ish aftertaste. Medium bodied.

pours murky orange brown with a thick fluffy cream colored head from the 500ml i emptied. big malty wheat aromas of bubblegum and clove. sweet malty flavor with a light apricot fruitiness. more bubblegum through the finish and some light spicy hops round it out.
Drank with Ramenen. Bottle: Solid Dunkelweizen, strong weizen body with nice malty caramel touch. Low carbonation.
poured into a tulip.  pours brown  with fluffy full head, malty aroma, malty smooth to finish, sticks to tongue in aftertaste, caramel sugar presence, fluid full beer, very good..
On draft. Clear brown coloured, thick head. Malty and fruity notes in aroma. Nice malty flavour with some caramel malty sweetness and just a tad of sourness. Great mouthfeel. Excellent brew.
Clear brown pour.  Some strawerry and cherry flavors.  Nice malty full bodied mouth feel.  Quick finish.  Crisp and simple.
Typical characteristics of a dunkel - cloudy brown, aroma of banana, clove, and citrus.  Flavor is nice, but still somewhat watery and muddled.  Not a great example of the style.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2007 Another excellent weiss from the worlds oldest brewery.  highly carboneded dark brown poor provides everything youd expect, bananas and cloves taste.  The dark malts give it an earthier quality that is quiet pleasent.  Not as aromatic as the lighter hefeweisse but otherwise an excellent beer

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2007 I gently poured the virulent brown contents into my tall pint glass and it produced a massive foamy head that declined unevenly and slowly. As I worked through the foam to the body and flavor, I was nearly rendered speechless as the malty taste was lightly enhanced by the parts of bananas and yeast. All this from a bottle which led me to wonder the usual question: what is like on tap? Update 10/07: The tap version is not as strongly nuanced as the bottle, but it is very drinkable.
Cloudy, dark copper color with a large head.  Slight banana aroma along with some grain.  Thick wheat flavor.  Moderate banana, a little spice, lots of yeast.

Bottle. Pours cloudy mahogany with beige head. The aroma is rich malt with clove, banana, and miscellaneous spices. The flavor is spices and slight wheaty malt up front, followed by some hay notes and a mild wateriness. Clean finish. Pretty refreshing.

Pours a pale cloudy amber color with a thick rich off-white head that coats the glass.  Assertive spicy banana and clove aroma.  Sweet roasted wheat malt flavor along with banana and caramel.  Very good and very refreshing.

Bottled.
Hazy, dark golden. Huge white head.
Yeasty chewing-gum aroma.
Sweet and malty, slightly burnt.
Spicy and fruity.
A very clean dunkelweiss. Fuller and smoother than Sneider Weiss Original. The right amount of carbonation and earthy banana.

The color was a hazy orange/brown.  The head was creamy, foamy, off-white, and thick-bodied.  The aroma was yeast, banana, and earthy.  The flavor was yeasty, tart, and a little earthy.  The palate was thin/medium bodied.  The finish was yeasty.
Bottle at Haket, Glöteborg. Somewhat hazy amber color, great steady offwhite head. Somewhat roasted malt aroma, wheat and some vanilla notes. Fruity, malty flavor, a bit roasted. Malty finish.
A good and tastfull dark heffenweissbeer. Tasted at Viersen Germany at beerfestival

Bottle poured into my Paulaner weizen glass.  Hazy light brown with a thick rocky white head.  The aroma features a delicate balance between the banana and clove.  I get a big of a Dr. Pepper character in the nose.  The flavor, I think, has some very distinct phases.  You get some banana right up front.  It then transitions to black cherry, and finishes very spicy and bitter.  Lots of carbonation.  Good.

Bottle at Haket, Göteborg, Sweden. Hazy amber with a large fluffy off-white head. Fruity and roasted malt aroma with yeast and spices. medium bodied with a mild carbonation. Good balance but a somewhat flat finish. Overall a good dunkelweizen.

Bottle at Haket Göteborg: Hazy brown/ Red colour, with a big creamy head. Aroma and Flavor is almost the same in this beer: Fruity,citrus,banana,and nice toffee ending. Thin to medium body,thin to medium finish.

Murky, drown, rusty body with a large, rocky beige head. The aroma is banana, clove, dough and light black cherry. Flavor is ripe banana, very light clove, some bread, ginger and light molases and cola. Medium body is round with moderate/high carbonation, almost sparkling with fine bubbles. Very enjoyable.

Yet another drinkable wheat beer. I am not a fan of most but there are a couple that are quite nice, This beer has a darkish, cloudy appearance, almost  malty flavor and great finish. If you dont like heffeweissbier, try this one

Sweet and spicy aroma of clove, coriander, and banana of moderate strength. Amber color with a thick frothy yellowish head. Its cloudy, but not as much as I expected. Rather acidic at first with dry grain flavor. It was rather bland when cold, but the flavor of cheerios gets stronger as it warms. Completely yeast free flavor. I would prefer drinking it from a pub glass. Welcome hop finish. Full of surprises.
this a well balanced beer with hints of cloves and bananas.  nice roasted malt on the nose

Bottle. Brown with a fully lasting head. Aroma of banana/cloves. Flavor is a balance of sweet, sour and a little bitter. There is some caramel malt flavor as well. Watery palate. Very drinkable. I found it to be a little bland compared to their regular hefeweissbier. Still good though.

Bottle.  Clear light brown color like a cream soda.  Medium head that mostly fades but a small covering remains throuhout the session.  Sweet malty aroma with strong lemon zest.  Airy light palate that refeshed the tognue.  Robust malty flavor fuller than the Hefewiezen but otherwise contains the same citrus feel.  A more pronounced hop flavor that makes this a great balanced beer.  A thousand years of brewing and they are still going strong.

Bottle. Pours a nice dark brown colour with a huge long lasting solid creamy beige head. Aroma od wheat, yeast, banana and malt. the flavour is fresh with a good mild roastiness, wheat, good fruitiness with especially banana and citrus, yeast and some spices. Great brew!

Bottle.  Pours not too cloudy (lots of sediment stuck to the bottom of the bottle) Munich brown.  Continuous carbonation feeds pillowy beige head and good lacing.  Nose is banana, cloves, and a little sour.  Taste is balance with malt and hops.  Light to medium body, finishes somewhat sour.  Nothing too special, but nothing I dont like.

Kinda uggly tint of brown, smallish beige head. Fruity nose, with a little banana. Surprisingly bitterish and sour, a little burnt with dark chocolate. Crispy carb. A bit on the bitter side rather than sweet. Good.

Berlin Trip beer No.7. Now were getting somewhere! After some average schwartz beers and a bland Kolsch this is more like it. On draft at the Weihenstephan cafe, Hackescher Markt, Berlin. Served in the lovely tapering glass. A translucent chocolatey brown with a large creamy head. Smooth orange peel, lemon zest flavours give way to hints of spice and malt. A long zingy finish. A grand beer.
Bottle. Dark brownish color.  Head had a nice aroma of banana with wheat and some hops for good measure.  Not too much sweetness with the malt, which is good.

Bottle. Very nice banana aroma with a nice beige head. Nice dark brown coloration, the falvor is some bitter fruity and mouthfeel is like bitterness..

Cerveja marrom com uma boa espuma, aroma de banana e com sabor amargo frutado, diferente das demais dunkels...

Dark brown, murky with a nice head. The aroma is nice with strong notes of banana. The flavour doesnt disappoint me, the strong notes of banana, a spicy sweetness and the wheat makes this beer a nicely balanced experience. I liked this one a lot, even if I normally prefer the light versions of a weiss.

The aftertaste is better than the beer itself.  Weird.  Not very dark for a "dark" beer.  Nice wheat and hops aroma and not very sweet, which I like.  I wish I could have had it from a tap in a beer garten in Germany.
Nose has some banana, some wheaty tang, a bit of sweetness. Apperance is brown, with a good-sized head, and quite cloudy. Somewhat chocolatey, lightly sweet. Quite tangy.
Muddy brown color with a tall beige head. Clove and banana aroma with lots of wheat. Banana esters are strong in the aroma, really brought out by the strong carbonation.

Pour is a cloudy brown with a large white head.  Aroma is very much bananas and lots of clove.  The flavor is some wheat with a touch of banana and some yeast.  Could use some more kick in the spice dept. but this is still a very enjoyable and affordable beer.

5/20/2007:  Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Dark pours a hazy brown/amber color with a large, foamy, off-white head that leaves foamy lacing marks.  The aroma has banana, clove, caramel malt, and some yeast.  Muted banana and clove with some extra maltiness in the background blend together in the flavor.  This beer has a medium-light to medium body.  There is a good level of carbonation in the mouthfeel (appropriate for the style).  Good overall, but seems to be lacking in general...

500 ml bottle (2406, 5.3% ABV) shared by alexsdad06 at Dilly Deli.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Rerate 7/31/09. 500 mL bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy orange-brown color with a large frothhy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of banana, cinnamon and other spices, yogurt and a bit of citrus.  Taste is cinnamon, other spices, toast, yeast and very light citrus and banana notes. Thin-medium bodied. 7/4/6/4/13/3.4500 mL bottle. Dark amber. Definite banana aroma... I felt the carbonation gave a light feel to what could have otherwise been a heavier beer. Light yellowish head was present, but lacking. 6/4/6/4/15/3.5

Pours murky dark copper with a large light tan dense head.  The aroma has toasted wheat, dried bananas, 7-Up, clove and meringue.  Medium body at first, but thin on the finish with some semi-sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts with sour dark wheat, some tobacco, toasted malt and light banana.  The finish has a bit of spice added.  A good beer, but not my favorite from the brewery.
Draught. Cloudy light brown with medium head. Wheaty aroma with some banana. Flavor is wheaty and fruity with some malt and notes of light roastiness. Medium-bodied.

One bottle from BOTW.  #550 for me. Nice aroma of wheat with a decent head.  Clove/banana hints and just a bit of roasty malt. Clean, light finish. A little bit thin in body for a dark, Close to the reg. Hefe. and good too.

Strong banana aroma backed by dark roasted malts.  Ruby orange color with a beige head that is firm and leaves intermittent lacing. Starts with banana. A slight sour aspect appears, and then theres a strong burst of ripe banana. Its really smooth, and there is some dark sweetness, but this is all about wheat and banana. It has more body than most hefes, and maybe thats what the dark is all about. Very nice ale.
NIce cloudy brown, with a white head but not much aroma.  The head diminishes pretty quickly.  The beer is a pretty good, refreshing wheat but I wouldve liked more of a yeastiness to it.

Rated 4/24/06:  Ah, smooth crisp and refreshing what a pleasant surprise. The pour is a murky water brown. An extravegant pillowy head forms and never leaves. The aroma fills my nose with some nice banana and clove scents. The flavor is good there is a nice touch of sweet maltiness that helps tame the yeast & wheat dominance. As stated before this beer is really smooth, and absolutely enjoyable. This Dunkelweiss is much better than their original Hefeweiss.

Tap, Berlin.  Dark amber with a big-bubble off-white, bordering to tan, head.  Aroma a bit subdued, with sweet notes of chocolate and caramel, as well as dark fruits. No noticeable spice through banana or clove, and only a very slightly perceivable wheat note.  Taste is caramel and cocoa upfront, but the beer lacks a significant finish.  Very malt-centric, it seemed to me, with no noticeable spice characters and none of that interesting wheat character that ought to be coming through in droves.  Slight alcohol presence which was strange.  Rasping on the tongue, with a bit of hop character which was redeeming if a bit off for the style.  High but finely carbonated, full bodied.

Poured a hazy dark amber with a thick creamy offwhite head. The aroma is predominated by banana and sour notes with some spice coming in as well. The flavor also boasts a lot of banana, some spice, a little citrus, and sour notes. The palate is smooth and refreshing. I thoroughly enjoyed this wheat beer.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2010 Dark brown beer with medium white head. Bananas, yeast and some toffee-like sweetness in the aroma. Flavour is typically yeasty with banana, dark malts and some spicyness. Medium bodied palate with lot of carbonation, nice to drink. Balanced dark hefe dunkel with nice spicyess, but refresness is not at the same level than normal hefe.
Amber color. Tangy wheat aroma and flavors. I didnt smell or taste roasted malt. The same as hefeweissbier as far as Im concerned.

Apricot colored pour.  Caramel-dipped raspberry and banana aroma against a spicy wheat canvas.  A touch of candi sugar or bubblegum.  Taste is reminiscent almost of blueberry pancakes with maple syrup.  Some clove flavor with cranberry tartness. An almost chocolatey aftereffect.  Sharply carbonated, clean palate.  High in quality and again a fine and honest representative of the style.

500ml bottle.  Aroma:  Nice bready wheat malt with a nice dose of caramel and brown sugar.  Lots of pepper and clove, and banana.  Some light bubblegum.  Appearance:  Light coppery brown in color and very hazy.  Off-white head was full and foamy with good retention.  Fair lacing.  Flavor:  Grainy and bready wheat with caramel notes.  Some barley malt noted in the background.  Lots of clove and banana, again with some bubblegun peeking out as well.  A little tartness into the finish.  Palate:  Medium-light bodied.  Medium carbonation.  Overall:  Nice beer.  A benchmark for the style and with good reason.

Bottle. Pours a dark hazy brown with a nice, small creamy off-white head with notable lacing. Sweet aroma, lots of oranges and banana - a distant caramel feel as well. Pleasant mouthfeel. Quite sweet, with some caramel and wheat and a citric bitter aftertaste.

500ml bottle.  pours a nice foamy white head with decent retention as well as notable lacing.  slightly earthy tan/brown haze.  dark citrus dominates the aroma, with ripened orange and lemon peel in the forefront.  aromas are a bit on the tart side, but still retain some sweetness. taste follows the aroma, with a rather pleasant mouthfeel.  the smoothness is rather pronounced on the finish, as is a bit of lemon.  overall, its pretty good, just thinner than my preferences.  its price isnt too bad either.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2011 Bottle on 04/03/2011 from Once Upon a Vine - South. Cloudy amber body with a medium creamy off-white head. Sweet toasty malt and bready aroma with a clove background. Dry clove and toasty malt flavor with a wheat background. Medium body with moderate carbonation. 6/3/6/3/12 - 3.0

04/13/2007 - Very hazy brown body with a large frothy tan head. Sweet banana and light spice aroma. Dry banana flavor with heavy wheat in the foreground and some light molassas in the background. 6/4/7/3/13 - 3.3
500mL bottle.  reddish-brown color.  foamy beige head.  aroma / flavor of bananas, nutmeg, yummy.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2008 Coloração marrom turva. Aroma e sabor: frutado e floral. Presença de cravo. Não é amarga. Média carbonatação. Ótimo conjunto. Elementos bem harmonizados. Agradável aftertaste. Perfeita combinação weiss/dunkel.

Interessante combinação floral das cervejas tipo Weiss (trigo) com o típico malte torrado das Dunkel. Dessa forma, nem ao céu, nem à Terra. Não fica azeda nem com gosto excessivo de café ou torrefação. Coloração marrom escuro, turvo. Creme pouco denso e consistente. Aroma de malte torrado e lúpulo. Carbonatação moderada.

500ml bottle poured ruddy brown like a bay horse, and a thick off-white head which takes a while to diffuse. The bottom of the bottle had lots of dark yeast making the body cloudy. Smells sweet like a doppelbock with clove, date, fruit and bread aromas. Taste is slightly bitter, wheaty and a little malty. The body is reminiscent of a hefeweizen but feels on the light side because it smells like something heavier. Has a sort of dry finish.

Bottle.Cloudy amber.I can smell apples,banana,clove.Good mouthfeel.
Very easy to drink.Ill be having this one again.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2007 Bottle: Pours brown with an amber hue, topped by a very large and stable tan head. Very yeasty aroma, doughy, banana esters. The body is creamy, yet has a very fluffy texture. Flavor has lots of yeasty banana-like notes, light hint of chocolate, raisins. Solid maltiness, bready characteristics and has a nice chewy body. A very well crafted and classic Dunkelweizen.
On tap at Bekeerde Suster, Adam. Creamy and amber coloured Dunkel. Top foam. Prickly with a quite bitter finish. Sweet and spicy, enjoyable.

Pours a very dark amber with a massive head that takes several minutes to subside. Very sticky lacing down the glass. Aroma is sweet bready yeast and some fruits. Taste follows the aroma with a certain brown sugar taste to it. Nice interplay of the sweets with the fruit. Mouthfeel is very good and beer is very drinkable. You could session this beer very easily.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2008 Bottle and draft at several locations. Dark honey color and cloudy. Huge creamy-sticky head that lasts. Classic clove/banana spice nose of Bavarian weizen. Flavor follows and is very thirst-quenching and drinkable.

An aroma of yeast and spicy almost clovish tones. A light brown pour with a rolling white head and a full lacing. A flavor of caramelsh sweet malt and a bit of spice. A palate that is full and surprisingly complete if not for an overly aggressive carbonation this beer may have rated a tad higher. A pleasnat beer that Im glad I tried. Thanks for the recommendation Jay.

Poured from a pint bottle into a pint glass, reddish brown with a big beige head. Aroma is sweet malt and yeast. The taste was fairly thin with a touch of malt and brown bread and a faint hint of cloves. The flavor of both the Hefe Weiss and the Dark of this brand seem to be a bit subdued. I prefer the Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weiss with its heavier malt base.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2007 An OK dunkel hefeweissebier - but not the best Ive had.and thin. page 488 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide. Only 196 of his 500 Classic Brews to go

Fully hazy amber beer with a rosy shine; amber tinted, very dense head. Milk, lactic, traces of diacetyl, and wheat. Roasted malt, only traces of diary flavours. Bit of corn too, and certainly wheat taste. Well balanced. Quite full bodied, aftertaste is typically sourish. Decent Dunkel Weizen. Interesting balance, just fine.
Nice medium brown wit a thick tan head. Light Clove arome with a touch of malt. Light sweet malth/phenol flavor. Light mouth feel, suprisingly dry finish.

An excellent hefeweizen. I certainly liked how this one poured, with the same bubbly texture as the regular hefes but with a dark brown appearance. The brew was rather sweet with a nice texture that goes down very smoothly. Worth a try.
Without a doubt the greatest weissbier Ive ever had.  Dark and sweet flavors, nice warm thick mouthfeel, everythink I could ever want from a weissbier.  Absolutely amazing.
Dark brown colour with nice beige head who stays long,fresh taste of fruit plum and cherrys sweet.

A very traditional style German beer, and although it is needless to say...these guys know what they are doing. A fantastic tasting beer. You have to give credit for knowing how to perfect something and keep it that way over years and years. A clean nose with banana and cloves with a slight sweet malt nose and a punch of yeast. Appearance looks like rusty water, cloudy with a nice fluffy white head. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, on the thin side but still nice and smooth. Flavors were more banana, clove, some bubblegum and light cracker notes. Excellent beer for ANY occasion. I think these brewers sometimes gets a bit overlooked in their quality because they are sooo easy to find. I really respect this brewery and their traditions and its evident in their beer that they do the same.
Preferred to the Hefeweizen, but thats my bias.  Banana, cloves, hearty wheat bread.  A comforting aroma.  Like drinking banana bread.  Yum.

Bottle [Tasting @ Per 23-02-2007]. Head was average foamy and white. Body was cloudy and hue was amber. Aroma was caramel, yeast, coriander, fruit, banana, grain. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Flavor was light sweet, not much bitterness here. Nice sweet finish.
This is a favorite beer of mine, although I prefer the regular Weihenstephaner Hefe-Weizen more.

Its hardly the beast that its big brother is. Aroma gives the usual hoppy for a wheat beer yeasty goodness however lacking the sweetness of wheat or something. Taste is lacking in quite a bit, same yeasty wheat goodness but the darker malt seems to cancel out flavours which i dont really like, iv still to find a winner in this style.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a nice beige head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, roasted malt and yeast.
Bottle. 50cl. Almost as good as the hefe-weissbire, but more malty and less banana, but never the less a damn good beer.

Brown pour, large and rapidly diminishing head, decent at best lacing. Aroma is bananas, caramel, darker fruits, some oxidation, yeast. Flavor brings this, lightly sweet and tart. Overall decent but probably the worst beer Ive had from them.
Malty and caramel scents.  Dark brown.  Lots of sweet malt.  Sweet malt tastes with a slight vanilla flavor.
Lots of malt and brown sugar in the aroma.Pours dark brown with an off white head.Big sweet malt flavor.Medium mouthfeel with a sweet malt finish.

12oz draft at Rathskeller, Indy - Aroma is very yeasty, sweet and bready with a touch of lemon and spice.  Pours cloudy brown-orange with a small head and little lacing.  Flavor matches aroma with the clove and banana coming out.  Palate is smooth and creamy.  Sweet and tasty.

500ml bottle.  Pours a huge, off white head that slowly settled.  Not as cloudy as a golden hefe but the rich, dark amber brown color is appealing.  Smells like clove and banana.  Nice flavor with a smooth, creamy texture.  The flavor to me is not as yummy as a regular high end hefe but I think Ill try to keep a bottle of this around for guest to try out.
Mmmm...clovey.  Deliciously complex without putting the senses on overload.  I just wish it had a bit more aroma.  Other than that, another fine beer.
Pours dark amber with a thick, musky aroma. Smells strongly of wheat. Moderately thick mouth feel. Very spicy tasting. Very mellow caramel flavors.
Bottled - Pours a beautiful hazy dark brown with a hugh head... Nose is lots of wheat and fruits..Taste is lots of spicy esters .. banana and malts.. very nice for this genre

Pours a very hazy bronze/brown with a thick two finger head that slowly fades to a thick cap and leaves behind a substantial amount of lacing.

Smell; full of bananas and cloves. Theres also a bit of a grassy smell, along with a nice caramel sweetness.

Taste; the cloves and bananas have a strong presence, but not to powerful. It has a yeasty bread dough flavor, as well as a bit of earthiness, and finishes with a good malty sweetness. Mouthfeel is rich and creamy, and goes down really nicely.

Im happy that I can get some of these Weihenstephaner beers in my area now.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text:
Pours a hazy copper, topped by a thick and creamy light tan foam. Great head retention, decent lacing. Light malt aroma, with a little bit of dry spiciness in there too.

Flavorful beer - nutty toasted malt, wheat, caramel, chocolate, clove and some other earthy dry spice. All of these flavors are fairly mild on their own, yet blend together for a nice, complex taste. Toasted malt, a little bit o’ honey sweetness, and some dry apple-citrus tartness linger into the finish and aftertaste.

Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, quite well carbonated.
Bottle. Murky brown color. Huge head. Banana and wheat aroma. Fruity tastes of banana, citric fruits and some wheat. A nice dunkelweizen.
Bottle. Cola-colour, thick white head. Typical clove aroma. Nice thick palate, not sweet taste at all but rather fresh earthy notes with nuts and cloves in the finish.

Cloudy, toffee-ish brown.  Huge offwhite head with fabulous lacing.  Aromas of sweet fruit (not just banana) and clove.  Soft mouthfeel.  Flavors are not too sweet.  Yeastiness that appears on the back end is interesting and not unpleasant.  Fine example of the genre.
Brown, unclear. Tall head. Malty somewhat spicy aroma. Medium complex flavour with banana, malts, wheat, yeast. Nuts?
Bottle 46F. Nice and delicious, malty aroma, with a touch of spice. Great tasting vienna malts, with a touch of yeast and very light hops. Very good beer.
Medium to dark amber, cloudy, weak aroma, some banana, light wheat flavor, lightly sweet, mild flavors, needs more.

Bottle. Aroma of clove some banana and a sweet malt. Dark orange/amber bubbly body with off white head. Head stayed with beer till finish. Good mix of malted wheat and slight bitterness. Mild sweet fruity flavor present. Somewhat dry on the palate but a rather smooth and enjoyable brew.
Bottled. German classic dark wheat bier. Cloudy light brown-amber color wtih a huge head. Malt and banana aroma. Good and soft flavor of malt, hop and fruits. Dry an slightly sweet aftertaste.
Pours a nice dark & cloudy appearance with a huge off-white head.  Strong aroma of yeast, banana & wheat.  Taste is complex with yeast, malt & wheat.  A decent dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2006 16.9 oz. bottle. The beer has that classic, appetizing, zesty, lemony, gingery, hefeweizen aroma. This is my first non-fruit hefeweizen in a few months, and I very much welcome the return of that great scent. The color is a hazy gold-tinged light-to-medium brown. The color is lighter than the "dark" designation might suggest. The beer pours with a large amount of head, as is typical to the style. It tastes just as it smells, which is a good thing, but whereas the aroma is powerful, the flavor is disappointingly subdued. The texture is smooth and the carbonation is fizzy, but in a typical, almost boring, sort of way. Overall, this is a pretty good beer, but it definitely could afford a significant boost in the quantity of its tasty flavor.

11/22/06: Bottle.   Medium caramel-brown body accompanied by a rocky, dirty white head.  Lacing.  Nose of wheat and malt.  Flavor is very wheatie, yeastie and bread-like.  Clove also noted.  Finish is creamy with some spice.
Some good banana and citrus in the aroma.  Pours a hazy brown.  There is some good citrus in the flavor, with a nutty, roasted character.
hazy brown with a large off-white foamy head.  slightly nutty, roasted aroma.  flavor has notes of brown sugar and raisins.  i didnt like this as much as some of their other offerings.
hazy and not too dark with a bubbley head. needs more spice in the aroma and a better body.
Hazy brown with a huge off white head.  Aroma is banana esters, spices, and malt.  Taste is caramel malt, wheat, banana esters, slightly spicy.  Light bodied, slighly tart finish.

Looks like muddy water with a big frothy head.  Slight banana aroma.  Flavor is malty and yeasty.  A lot like a belgian dubbel believe it or not.  Definitely not as good as the regular hefe, but still good.
(Bottled at Monks Café, Stockholm) Hazy and dunkel.. good head. Esters galore with a side order of malt.  Excellent.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2007 WOW !  YOU KNOW WHAT THEY SAY ONCE YOU GO DUNKEL YOU NEVER GO BACH! Ok pours a cloudy brown as you would expect any dark wheat too pour. The head was 2 fingers worth and the retention was perfect. The aroma of caramel sweetness and wheat. The taste is amazing, tofee, banana and wheat. This went down so smooth and so tasty. I really enjoyed this.
bottle - Pours dark brown with a big, fluffy head.  It has a very yeasty aroma.  The flavor is mostly malt and yeast maybe a touch of fruitiness.  The body is a little thin and the finish is clean.

Medium brown with tan head, fades to film. Aroma has plenty of yeasty esters, mostly banana, toasted grain, and some faint chocolate. Flavor is all banana and toasted grain up front, fades into a yeasty finish, without much else going on. Finishes clean, easy drink.

[Bottled. Monks Café, Stockholm] 
Light brown colour. Lively, grainy mouthfeel. Big on Co2. Brown fudge, like a dunkel. Fluffy body. Estery bananas.

Pure, yeasty aromas with some spice and ripe fruits: plum, pear, apple.  Light brown coloration with a lively head.  Smooth and maybe a little thin, but malty flavors of wheat and peat, a little banana and a little caramel.  Pleasant beer.
[Bottled at Monks Café, Stockholm] Cloudy pale amber. Papery banana aroma. Medium sweet with soft, spritzy mouthfeel. Mild toffee character. Fairly estery.
(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy brown body with a small beige head.  Aroma of sweet malt, dark fruits, and a hint of sulfur fumes.  Flavor of toasted malt, dark fruit, and some smokiness.
Nice caramel flavor, orange hue,  Banana dominates, slight clove, abit of tartness. A good drink.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2006 Bottle.  Pours cloudy dark orange-brown with a large fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, a hint of caramel malt, and a slight bit of roastiness.  Flavor is the same components, with some yeast and a bit of unfortunate sourness (bad bottle?).  As compared to their normal hefeweizen, this actually has a weaker flavor all around, except for the addition of some caramel malt and a bit of roasted malt.  Doesnt really seem heavier---its substantially thinner, in fact.  In any case, this isnt bad, but their superb normal hefeweizen is a *much* better choice than this dunkelweizen.
Pours turbid deep copper with aroma of banana, clove, Bazooka.  Tastes caramel malty, with the banana, wheaty yeasty malt, clove, and some toffee at the finish.  Medium palate.
One of the better wheat beers Ive had.  Regular clove/banana hints and just a bit of roasty malt.  Clean, light finish.  A little bit thin in body, but not bad.

Gah!  Lost my rating.  16.9oz, no date.  Pours a cloudy orange caramel with a large 3 finger light beige head.  Aroma is typical of banana and clove, though the banana is stronger.  Also some yeast and caramel malts.  Taste is more of the same, but it does have a little bit of the toastiness that I was looking for towards the finish.  Also a little bit of tang in the finish, with very little bitterness in the beginning.  High carbonation, light bodied.  Didnt really seem any heavier than the regular hefe, though I am going from memory and not a vertical.  Not my favorite from these guys, but still good.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: UPDATED: JAN 22, 2007 Light wheat aroma. Cloudy amber body with a nice white head that fades.  Very mild wheat taste.  No aftertaste at all. Im used to more flavor out of a wheat beer. Just a solid beer.

Bottle. Cloudy amber with a fluffy white head. Nose of bananas and clove, but with more malt and wheat. Bubbly mouthfeel. Sweet flavors of banana are blended nicely with the wheat, bread, and yeast tastes.
Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours deep  brown with a large white head. Aroma of  wheat, bananas, and spices. Flavor is bananas and spices, very enjoyable brew.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2006 500 ML bottle.  Very good. I liked this better than their hefeweizen.  Since I like stouts and hefes this was a good marriage of the two.  The roasted qualities added another level to the banana and clove scents and flavors.  I like the frothy head and full body and carbonation of this beer.  Good late summer/fall beer.  Yummy.

Bottle (500ml).  Murky brownish orange with a huge lasting light tan foamy head.  Aroma of yeast, tart fruit, sour white wine, light sweet grain and mild herbal hops.  Taste is pleasing, brown sugar malt, sweetly spicy, very yeasty, lots of slightly tart fruit character, reminds me more of a straightforward brune, as it has essentially no roast character at all, and virtually no graininess.  Decent body, nicely carbonated, a little fruit stickiness and acidity in the quick finish - a wonderfully refreshing beer, and I guess it straddles the fruity hefe and the colour of the dunkel, but not what I envisioned - better, actually!

$1.99 for a 16 oz. bottle.  The beer pours to a cleam vibrant amber/brown body with a lasting creamy white head.  The flavor is sweet and bready with nice wheat.  Seems to be lightly smoked and tart apple juice.  Some banana and clove.  The aroma also comes off as soapy.  Cloves and light banana.  Wheat.  The palate is tart, sticky, and carbonated.  This is no New Glarus Black Wheat.  :(

Nice hazy brown/amber color... not-too-huge foamy, fluffy head... a perfect amount of carbonation.  Aroma of sweet malts, roasted grains, caramel... some yeast, some hint of fruitiness/citrus.  Sweet malty/yeasty flavor, a hint of banana... really good overall.  A nice crisp clean finish, completely refreshing.  I love this style, Ill definitely go for more of these...

Pours dark brown-walnut with a medium frothy off-white head and some spotty lacing.  Aroma is dark baked wheat bread, yeast and toasted malt (meal) with cardboard notes.  Medium sweet start, moderately toasted wheat and malt flavor, slight fruitiness (pear, apple) with a clean finish.  Medium bodied and smooth, fizzy, burpy palate.

Draft @ Ashleys in Ann Arbor. Hazy brown  body smallish creamy white head. (3+) Yeast aroma, some malt and muted banana. Tart wheaty tang with moderate sweet malt.  Average to medium palate, pleasantly effervescent. Solid refreshing pint.
Bottled. Had while in Florida last winter. This one is really enjoyable. Dark and malty. A classic lover that you want to hang with.

Very hazy chestnut pour with a pillowy dusky white head.  Obvious cloves, banana, toasted malt and wheat in the aroma.  Classic banana, cloves, biscuits and wheat flavors atop a roasted malt backbone.  Mildly hoppy roasted malt finish.

Pours cloudy amber with a fluffy white head.  Nose of bananas and clove, but with more malt and wheat.  Bubbly mouthfeel.  Sweet flavors of banana are blended nicely with the wheat, bread, and yeast tastes.  Good malt profile that gives it a filling feel.

Pours deep amber into a weizen glass.  Significant, frothy, white micro-bubble head fills the bulb and does not recede.  Wheat, bubblegum and clove notes.  Upfront clove with a crisp bitter caramel finish.

(Bottle BB 03/04/07) Light banana-like and slightly roasted malty aroma. Brown yellow colour, hazy and huge, white, slightly lasting head with fair lacing. Banana, sweet (caramel?), sour (finish), wheat, roasted malty and slightly hoppy flavour. Lively carbonated and medium-bodied palate. 08/07/06

Bottle.  Poured a murky and ruddy brown with a rich foamy off-white head that would leave considerable lacing.  A fairly subdued, perhaps because the brew was a bit cold, clovy aroma with a perceptible malt backbone wafted off of this one.  A mouthfilling taste of banana and rich spices with very minimal bitterness.  Finishes smooth with a slight tingle before leaving you with a hint of bitterness inviting another taste.  A solid beer!

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2006 Rerate: Had again on draft and it was the same as below, but even more underwhelming. Original Rate: Soft aroma is sweet and yeasty. I love how it looks in a tall weizen glass- pillows of foam atop a highly carbonated cloudy brown body. Flavor is sweet and malty, with clove like spiciness, cake dough, yeast, and a bit of pear/banana. Finish is subtle bitterness, but a little too sweet still.
hazy brown with fluffy white head. Aroma of malts (pilsener & caramel), yeast (wheat) & hops.Texture is medium filling. Finish has slight sweetness. Pleasant though short finish!
Beautiful dark copper color with a large frothy off white head.  Strong bananas and spice in the aroma.  Terrific wheaty flavor.  I love wheat beers and this is one of my favorites so far.
Bottle. Creamy off-white excellent fully lasting head. Powerfull yeasty hoppy aroma and flavor. Oily palate. A very good hefe.
Bottle.  Dark brown looks, nice head with a strong spicy aroma.  Creamy palate, pleasant lingering aftertaste.
Bottle - powerd hazy dark copper in color with large white head.  The aroma was of bannas and had the  tatse of banna bread

Poured very slow and still huge off white head, body clear brown with a reddish tint.  Spicy banana aromas with a hint of alcohol.     
Malty sweetness that is balanced with a slight bitterness that fades into a burnt tasting finish.
Bottle. Off-white high creamy good-looking and lasting head. Hazy amber body. Sweet spicy aroma. Pleasant sweet caramel flavor.

Ah, Im starting to get bored with the dunkelweizen style, as I just cant distinguish among the good ones. Sure, a bad one is bad, but the good ones are all the same to me. This one poured the usual dark brown, cloudy color with a great head and ok lacing. The aroma was typical of the fine examples, some bananas, light spicing, some roastedness. The flavor was more sweet than dry, and the roasted notes were light. The mouthfeel was full and this was a filling finish to the night.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2007 Bottle sampled with Beerded_one. Pours dunkel like, murkey brown with a large off-white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, bananas, spices. Flavor is smooth, bananas, spices, wheat. Good body great brew.

Poured to a hazy, milk chocolate brown, with off-white head that dissipated quickly, and little lacing. Aroma of malt, nuts and chocolate. Taste is malt, chocolate and spice, mostly clove. Could not detect much wheat flavor. Not a bad beer, but have had better Hefe Weiss.
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2007 Malty fruity nose. Dry clean finish. medium body not as sweet as the nose would leave me to believe. Bread and fig notes. A very nice dunkel.
Dark and cloudy with a lose head.  Strong yeast and wheat aroma,  Body is medium, with a lighter wheat taste that the aroma would indicate.  The finish is dry and clean
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Pours a brownish-amber color wiht a thick light tan head.  Aroma is of wheat, citrus, lemon, spices, and sweet malts.  Flavor is basically the same with some hints of banana and a slightly bitter finish.  Not a bad hefeweiss.

(04.20.06)  16 oz brown bottle from Beergeek.biz.  5.3% ABV. Poured hazy dark amber with large white head.  No discernable carbonation. Sweet malt and spicy clove in the nose. Medium bodied dunkel that starts dry with smoky/clove flavors. Some Banana esters. Finished dry with light malt fade. Light hop bitterness detected. Well-balanced and delicious, both this beer and the regular hefeweiss beer are probably the finest hefeweiss beers that Ive tried thus far.
On tap at Ølbaren. Hazy brownish in colour with a small head. Fresh and fruity with notes of berries. A bit too plane though.
Insipid.  Postage stamp paste flavor.  Palate was little more than dead on arrival.  Will never buy/drink another one.

Weihenstephan seems to surprise me with their high-end very drinkable beers. Sitting in the sunshine this is great! nice fruity and spicy  aromas and flavours, everything characteristic. Not as good as there"regular" weizzen maybe, but very quenching.
This is a pretty good beer, pours a light mahogany color with a fluffy tan head.  Taste is might with lemon, cloves, banana, and dry malts, not very sweet.  Very drinkable and light.

Pours a a cloudy brown with a nice size foamy white head.  Aroma is banana, coriander,wheat, semi-malty, with an alcohol undertone.  Taste is definately malty with banana and spicy notes throughout and some subtle lemon notes.  Palate is thin and almost nonexistent.  Nice Flavorful and wonderfully smelling Dunkelwiezen yet the palate kind of leaves you short.
Excellent balanced complexity.  Havent tried a dark hefeweissbier before.   Not overly sweet and a lovely integration of flavours.

BottleBread, banana and fresh clove aroma.
Cloudy brown, huge stable amber head.
Fresh and fruity, fudge, a whif of berries, banana and tropical finish.
Fresh and lovely.

"Not a bad beer but nothing amazing. Poured nice dark cloudy brown. okay head lacing was okay. Aroma was of spices bananas and something. Flavor was sweet caramel and some citrus fruits. Mouthfeel was thiner then i expected. Overall not a bad beer but nothing amazing."

In the 0.5 L bottle at the Huber Haus Weissbier tasting 4/11/6. Pours dark amber with a thin white head. Aroma is mild and subtle- maybe a bit of fruitiness. Surprisingly not sweet at all. Matly and dry roasted. A bit tingly to the tounge. Palate is not smooth.

Bottle. Very large beautiful white head. Orange copper colour. Very cloudy. 
Bitterish but at the same time sweet, a definite yeast aroma.
Round, typical wheatbeer flavour with a hint of tar. Sourish.
After taste of yeast and tar. Fairly light carbonation.

Pours like muddy creek water but with a fatter head of lemon white and gray. Tart banana plum nose. Sweet toffee flavor that works well with the yeasty banana flavor. Some chocolate in the finish. A bit chewy, but I like it that way sometimes. This reminds me of good times spent at the Bavarian in Plano, I really need to write to my bartender there, I need to find some schnitzel around this area, schnitzel would be good right now too. To the kitchen, posthaste.
Ap-3 ar-6 tas-7 pal-5 ov-15

500ml bottle: poured orange/brown with a medium sized beige head. Very strong sweet overripe bananas going on in the aroma with this one. Flavor is more of the same although not quite as full flavored as the nose suggests. Very lively carbonation. Moderate yeast esters with delicate spiciness. Very good.

50 cl bottle. Yeast at the bottom. Muddy brown colour with a little head. Aroma of bread, yeast and some hints of banana. Nice flavour of wheat, yeast and hints of chocolate. Very little noteable that this is a dunkel weissbeer, and not just a hefe-weissen, only the colour tells it.

16.9oz bottle.  Hazy and ruby brown.  White head.  Typical banana and clove aroma.  But also a cinnamon sweet malty character.  Also in the nose, a slight bubblegum and citrus, corny and grainy aroma.  Rich, malty, sweet, sugary, corny and syrupy in the mouth.  Lively and flavorful, it has the typical hefe taste characteristics, yet more.  A cola like effervescence and flavor. Cloying and smooth.  Yeasty and grainy, malty and nutty.  Nicely done!

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2008 [bottle] Overall, pretty sweet. Nice wheat and yeast aroma. Malty background, sort of nutty. Strong clove and phenol aroma. Wheat and malt flavors, with a complex banana/clove phenolic character. Very nice.
Dark hazy brown color. Aroma of bread, malt, and fruits. Flavor has a touch of sweet malt, I think. Overall, not to bad.

a lttlie too malty for my liking.  a nice fruit taste too it but its bread like after-taste left me a little disappointed.   One high not was the apperance a hazy brown color with a tan head that had excellent retention.

Another nice product from weihenstephaner. I have yet to drink anything from this brewery that is not a winner. This particular dark hefe I thought had a nice blend of malt and some mild chocolatey appeal. The aroma of it was very familiar, though i cant place it, a very light malt indeed. I can definitely taste the weihenstephaner all too familiar clove, its not nearly as present in this one as in some of the other sibling brews (kristallweissbier?) Although it might be a liitle too light for dark lovers, I still enjoyed this one personally. thanks again to this company.

Flowery aroma.  Dark like dirty watter with a good sized head.   Slightly sweet with a malty floral character, very little hop action.      Doesnt really leave a lasting impression on the palate.  Worth a try at 2.50 a bottle

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2007 Pours a dark old penny color w/ a full, creamy froth. Head retention sticks like a stubbrn mule. Aromas of musty yet  brisk, dried dark fruits. Medium nectar with very litte residual effers. A little watery on the palate actually. Slightly medicinal malt flavors to include coffee, bakers cocoa, plum, bitters, and fruit cake spice. After a bit the spicey character really opens up and jumps out at you like the Joker and cackles relentlessly in your face. Possesses a mild fruity sweetness. The finish is bittered ever so slightly and has a lingering spicey malt essence.  Overall: this is a more delicate specimen w/ defined style characteristics.  Well balanced yet a little thin at times. A good brew none the less.

at Frankfurt airport, bottled ; everytime I take a sniff of a hefe dunkel I always get that caramel feel, same with this one. Caramel and maybe some light chocolate. Very tasty, typical hefe dunkel, but with a more thick palate than the most of them. Quaffable and tasty

The aroma has raisins, brown sugar, malt, yeast, and mild hops. The appearance is hazy red brown with a medium-large head that is persistent. The flavor has raisins, lightly toasted malt, caramel, spices, and licorice. The palate is on the thin side. This is a good tasting beer that is just too weak.

Creamy-frothy head; apple cider appearance, cloudy and brownish. Highly carbonated; lightish body. A little toast in the malts. Sweet banana esters. Very, very mild bitterness surfaced in the aftertaste. Clean, light and refreshing beer with pleasant flavors, but not very exciting.

Bottle. The aroma is wheaty and yeasty, but a little weak. Cloudy, bright red/brown colour. Big stable head. The flavour is more powerful than the aroma, quite malty and wheaty. Slight liquorice aftertaste.
Pours a dark hazy brown color.  Aromas of bread, malt, and some fruit.  Flavor has a touch of sweet malt and clove, I think.  Overall, not to bad.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark amber color with an off white head. Nose is wheat, yeast and malt. Tiny amount of citrus detectable. Much weaker flavor than expected, wheat and malt, some light spices. None of the banana that other raters had experienced. Body is thinner than usual for the style, leaving a very slight creaminess. Overall, somewhat blah. Not bad, but blah.

Hazy burnt sienna with a thick thick long lasting chewy head.  Grainy aroma with some figs.  Palate that is sweet and sticky, and a little watery at times, some caramel also.  Not one of the best dunkelweisses Ive had.
Pours muddy brown with a thick creamy head. Spicy, fruity banana-ish nose. Smooth, refreshing, fruity flavour. Wheaty, with small notes of apple. Estery finish.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2005 Dark brown, thick head thay stayed the whole time, some nutty flavor, with banana aftertaste, and other sweeteness too it, very different not really my style.

Bottle. Poured a hazy orangish brown with a fizzy off white head that diminished in seconds. It looked highly carbonated and fizzed like soda throughout the length of the drink. The smell was like apple cider (apple, clove, spices), and other fruits like banana. The flavor was lighter than the aroma with cloves, spices, and fruit detected. Light and dry, wanting to pull the moisture out of my mouth with each sip. Im not sure if this ones for me.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2006 Murky brown with an orange tinge - probably what Sydney water will look like in about a year if we dont get much more rain. A large frothy head that lasted a while, particularly due to the endless streams of bubbles speeding their way to the top of the glass. The aroma was of creamy bananas and some cloves, but also a bit of citrus. On tasting the toffee notes became more evident as well. There was a decent balance in the flavour that was leaning towards the dry and bitter end of the spectrum, but the excessive carbonation, a thin body and metallic feel created a disappointing palate and finish. 6 4 7 2 10 2.9 Re-rate: Much better conditioned bottle this time around. Mostly the same, but it had so much more to give when the carbonation was at a decent level.

Dark brown beer with a light orange tint and a thick white head.  Aroma is very fruity, light wheaty aroma, sweet malt, apple, clove.  Flavour is sweet, wheaty, nice spice, apple, apricot, light toasty/bready malts, spicy finish.  As it warms, there is even more fruit, apple, pear, some toast and a bit of malty biscuity sweetness in the finish.  Nice beer.
So-so. I actually prefer Franziskaner dark weisse over this. Little going for it, IMO.
pours dark orange with a white creamylooking head(not actually creamy).  lots of malt and yeast to go around with hints of banana and orange.  little alcohol taste for only being 5.3 %

500ml. bottle. Pours a hazy orange/brown color with a large, creamy beige head. Yeasty, malty aroma with lots of cloves and a hint of banana. Flavor of cloves, wheat malt, banana and a touch of citrus. Very easy drinking beer.

Bottled: Pours a decent dark orange with a fluffy head. Fruity (citrus, banana), clove, and nice malty aromas. Well balanced flavours with good complexity matched with a great mouthfeel make this a beer to remember. Nice one.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 The 500 ml bottle yields a cloudy, orange and caramel colored body with a large tan head that leaves good lacing.  Theres lots of orange citrus, clove, caramel and floral hops in the nose.  Palate entry is relatively dry with the caramel, clove and citrus flavors developing in the mid-palate.  Effervescent, but not overcarbonated, this beer is smooth and very drinkable.  I also detected hints of banana and alcohol in the short, dry finish.  Well done.

500ml bottle.  Pours a dark brown and hazy color. Yeast, cloves, banana, and spice aromas come from this delicious brew.  The flavor was a nice sweet wheat, banana, and clove.  There were hints of spices, caramelized sugar and other goodies.  I really wish i could have more of this wonderful beer.

Hazy, semi-opaque, deep, dark amber with a splash of cola-color. A thick cap of film follows a big head on the pour. Yeasty, dusty hefeweizen aroma with clove & spice, incense, smoke and banana peel... "meatier" than lesser hefes. Flavor was thick & heavy on bitterness with a sweet wheat & yeast character resting on malted haunches. Fat flavors... nice & thck. I bought this for my wife then ended up drinking most of it (sorry, honey). I will continue to purchase, drink and thoroughly enjoy this beer.

<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>

500 mL bottle.  Pours a deep reddish/light brown color with a large lasting head.   Typical sweet banana aroma with just a tad of  roasted malt as well.  When I started drinking this it was too cold, but after letting it warm a bit, flavors of clove, banana, and bubble-gum came through.  Very well balanced with a slightly sweet finish.  Good complexity for the style.
Cloudy light brown pour with a large, well maintained head. Acidic flavors dominated by clove with little hop note. Astringent finish that is very refreshing.
(Bottle 50 cl) Murky brownish with a huge head that simply refuses to settle. Soft, malty and aromatic with a wee touch of hops. Surprisingly low carbonation. 110102

Bottle from Colorado Springs.  Pours  an yellow-brown with a lasting head and clinging lace.   Aroma is a thud of banana and clove, with just a touch of spice in the rear.  Flavor is clove, bubblegum, and it finishes almost exactly like the taste left by eating a ripe banana.  Palate is slick.  Overall, an above average Hefe-Dunkel.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Excellent clove/spice, banana, overripe fruit, candi sugar, its all in there. A really good beer, not overly sweet like some.

Pours brown with a thin white head.  Smells of allspice, cinnamon and clove with a bit of a peppery note in there.  Taste is of figs, brown sugar, pepper, and banana as well as a touch of perry.  Well balanced and very enjoyable.

Bronze, with a gigantic swiss cheeze head.
Rich, grainy aroma with plenty of yeasty spices and a bit of booze that mingled together very nicely.
Easy drinking, the wheaty malt can become a bit cloying.  It finished silky smooth with witbier banana ester yeastiness.  Mixed along with something salty to kill off the sweetness, this Beer is fantastic.

Nice appearance.  Light, mostly clear brown with just the right size white head (small/medium).  Aroma of caramel malt, maybe a bit of chocolate.  Much the same in the flavor except that i also seem to get just a hint of a nutty flavor in there too maybe.  Also i can notice a bit more chocolate in the flavor.  Only a small hint of wheat.  Not bad at all.  A good all around beer that I wouldnt mind to drink again.
Bottle.  Sweet banana, apple and malt aroma.  Orange-brown coloe with small head.  Sweet-sour malt flavor - a tart apple finish.  Light bodied.  Not nearly as good as their Hefe.
WOW! Sweet, malty, chocolate aroma.  Flavor was full of chocolate and wheat.  Best surprise I have had in a long time.  I hope to buy some of this again soon.

Beautiful murky orangish-brown in color with a pillowy, fluffy, grey and 3/4" tall head.  Aroma allures with banana, nutmeg, cloves, pepper and cocoa.  Flavor elaborates with a light banana and chocolate presence complimented by tiny spicing accents pepper, cinnamon and cloves.  Sugared lemons round out the corners with a brown-sugared oats component, which gently transition to something more in line with bran flakes.  Fairly light bodied and an easy drinker, finishing like a weakened chocolate banana milkshake.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2006 Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark orange with a foamy tan head. Flavors of banana, wheat, and citrus, with livening hints of spice. Low carbonation really makes the flavors stand out.
Bottle. Poured with a frothy light tan head. Nice dark appearance with a light flavor for the color.  Decent amount of wheat flavor with a bit of malt to round off the flavor.  A decent beer.

500mL bottle.  A cloudy copper pour with a big, creamy light-tan head that lasts until the bottom of the glass.  Lots of lemon, banana, yeast and wheat in the aroma along with some malts.  A bit more body than the Hefe Weissbier and thankfully, not as much carbonation.  Very similar to the Hefe Weissbier (lots of bananas, lemon, wheat and yeast) only with some sweet malts and quite a bit of sourness.  A step up from the Hefe Weissbier.
A bit lighter in flavor and palate then I expected but still a enjoyable beer.  Good color and sustained head.  The malts were a bit sweet on the sweet side.  I would drink this again.
Brown in color. Nice head to it. Had some interesting flavors in it. I detect a few fruity flavors. This is a solid beer.
Brown colour, thick white head. Mild, hazy, fruit-like flavour. Very good drink, definitely recommended.

From a bottle. Murky brown and not much of an aroma but what is there is good. Quick fading whitish head. I was expecting a bit more in terms of flavor from a supposedly dark beer. Carbonation is definatly strong but it feels good when it burns my mouth a little. Overall a good drink for the price, but I probably wouldnt get it again.

Mild brown appearance, with a thick head. Aroma is slight, but a bit wheaty and bananay. Taste is mild, almost like a wit but not as spicy. A little bit of chewy apple, some wheat and yeast.  Enjoyable and quaffable.

Muddy dirty brown, off-white head is fed over and over again by the extremely effervescent body. Highly phenolic nose. Not really banana accented nor clovey hence quite atypical. It is rather malty and fairly roasty on the other hand, almost burnt bread toastiness. Understated wheat doesnt contribute much, not really refreshing at all as much as the carbonation is agressive and bites the tongue savagely. Clean nature, fruity around the edges. Remotely dry nuttiness, faint leafy hops. I guess this is tolerable as a dunkelweizen, but this brings no joy and is a rather plain drink globally.

Cloudy Brown, foamy tan head. Toasty, malty aroma, with a hint of raisin. Smooth and malty, with a slight rye flavor as well as a hint of fruitiness, and maybe a hint of cola, too. Mellow and understated.
I dont think Ive ever had such a dark beer that had such a wheaty taste.

(bottle) Hazy and cloudy orange to copper colour with a huge slightly off-white foam. Dusty and yeasty aroma with toasted malts and cloves and hints of fruity banana tones. Dense sweet flavour, medium body. Malty taste with a slight banana fruitiness and traces of caramel. Very crispy and tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2006 Very good Hefeweissbier. Aroma is bready with some banana fruit presence.  Flavor si very good, and more on the spice side than fruity.  Definately a bready brew, as is expected  for its class. Very very good.

Lightest, headiest dunkel Ive ever seen. Has a funky aroma, and is very cloudy (the hefe coming through). Not sweet and more like a belgian brown then a dunkel. Not bad, but certainly not up to par for this brewery.

Cloudy brown with a huge tan head that took a long time to settle and made nice lace. Yeasty, wheaty, and a little banana aroma. Fruity palate, sweet, with the expected wheat-phenol presence. Thin-bodied but not watery.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bottled.
Hazy orange coloured with a small off white head.
Sweet fruity aroma with notes of bread.
Sweet flavour of fruits, bread and corn.

Bottle. Cloudy amber with a monster beige head. Swet malt and caramel aroma to go with a nice spiciness. LIghter flavor than the aroma would suggest - some citrusy, yeasty, wheat/malt combination thats a little on the watery side, but its lacking oomph. Easy to drink, but theres a slight off-flavor at the end.

Malty and spicy aroma. Light brown and cloudy. Big fluffy head. Spice and a yeasty profile. Very pleasing mix though it is nothing powerful flavor wise. Subtle malt flavor with a bit of spice that fades into an almost watery finish. It works though overall.

(draft) Took a long time to drink - its pretty filling. Very nice aroma and a good flavor. This beer has convinced me that I now like hefeweissbiers. Seemed to affect more than its 5.3% alcohol would indicate.
13 Feb 2005 - Nice fruit malt aroma.  Cloudy brown-red and great head.  Nice solid earthy flavour and light sweet fruit malt.  Easy drinking with a nice mid mouthfeel.

This poured into the glass as 100% toffee-colored, rocky foam, at first ... the head waterfalled down into a chalky, ruddy orange beer.  Almost a peppery aroma ... The flavors were a bit hard for me to pin down.  This has an oddly light palate ... tad of spicy (nutmeg, clove) malt ... but not as good as their regular hefeweizen or kristal.

Pours with the sound of fizz, and a nice thick biggish-bubble foamy head forms, but it is reduced to just surface bubbles by sip 2.  Appealing caramel-colored, hazy appearance. Im an ale fan, but this is one good lager. Medium body, well balanced malts, and a hint of spiciness. Overall a very good dunkelweizen.   $2.99 for a 500ml bottle.
Bottle. Dark brown hazy hue with a small head. Medium malt and wheat aroma. Medium body. Medium flavor.

Amber and cloudy with a creamy off-white head.  Clove and banana phenols are present, but more subdued than in the hefeweizen.  Soft carbonation with tiny bubbles creates a very smooth mouthfeel.  The description of this beer being mellow is quite apt.  Overall, this beer is delicious and easy to drink.  It is lacking enough complexity to be considered excellent.  The Ur-Weisse has this beat.

Speckled, multicolored orange with an enormous head of foam, which falls and makes fun mountainous shapes.  Very rich, inviting and complex nose, with hints of chocolate dough, banana esters and light spice, along with a suggestion of insect repellent, raspberry cake, toffee, peanut, vanilla, clove, butter and pumpkin with a light touch of cranberry.  Flavor is rich and dynamic, highly progressing from the front palate to the finish, yet it remains slightly watery and it possesses a light touch of solvent.  Mild chocolate throughout, with dark red fruit flavors abound, and lightly chaulky and dusty hints.  Hints of apples, toffee and cocoa.  Immensely enjoyable.  What a great wheat beer.
Cloudy amber color with a long lasting offwhite head. Aromas of clove some banana and a hint of carmel. Flavors of spicy clove, light banana, and some carmel. it also has a pleasent aftertaste.

Poured a dark cloudy amber with a tall off-white head.  Aroma of typical hefeweizen... banana, cloves, touch of hops.  Taste follows from the aroma, rather mellow hefe cloves and banana essence with a touch of caramel.  Very balanced, though nothing exceptional.

Full velvety head, lasting. Body is a rusty, glowing brown, slightly cloudy with slow bubbles. Aroma has hints of chocolate and molassis. Medium to light body, taste is brown sugar, candi, and molassis. Traces of spicy citrus add to the flavor. Finish was short and a little lacking. Overall, quite a nice concoction.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2005 Bottle: Slightly dark, hazy amber with a large off-white head that faded quickly. Sweet, wheaty, spicey aromas with some very well integrated (and natural??) banana notes, and some faint floral tones too (something white). Really a very well structured nose. Unfortunately this didnt translate into a well structured flavour profile. Quite sweet and of course highly carbonated. More banane here with the spicey elements acting as the balancing elements. Not near as enticing as the aromas. Very nice but let down a little by some wet cardboard flavours.

Expected to like this more than I did. Poured a ruby colour with a big lasting head. Yeasty aroma with strong floral traits (lillies?) permeated by sweet malt. Creamy mouthfeeel and light to medium body. Some crisp apple fruitiness - in fact spiced apples - but dark malt is dominant. Sweet but a little one-dimensional. (Bottle)
(Bottle) Yummy! This is my favorite dunkel weissbier right now. It tastes wonderfully like honey and spices. And the color is absolutely perfect hazy amber, with a snow-white head. Im in love!

Pours like mud into the glass cloudy and about that color.  Very big head fluffy and clings to the side of the glass.  Smells fruity some bananna and wheat aroma.  Slight clove aroma as well.  Flavor is first the cloves then more of the fruit.  Smooth on the palate then the taste of the sweet fruit then a little sour aftertaste that makes it very refreshing.  Decent flavor and worth a try for a new style.  I liked it.

Opaque (poured with the yeast), ruddy, muddy, brown with a fuzzy white top that lasts.  Like smelling a banana cream pie with some cloves on top.  While the aroma is more banana, the flavour is more clove that bites a bit with the carbonation and then settles to a smooth banana and a little bitterness that might not be just from hops.  Strawberry notes along with the banana and maybe a touch of sour, horseblanket make this beer very refreshing.  Put the high carbonation and light to medium body with that and you have quite a nice drink.  Thumbs up.
Pours hazy brown with a huge head that fades. Aroma is of hay, banana, and clove. Flavor is a mild but full banana caramel with some clove.
Bottled. Hazy orangebrownish colour, longlasting foamy head. Very fruity aroma, with hints of wheat and weak yeast. Sweet fruity flavour with hints of yeast. Not much aftertaste.

Bier # 2 (German Bier Night). Cloudy brown with a big head that doesnt last long either. I dont know if this is trademark of the brewery or my detergent, but Im not pleased about it. Anyway, toasted malts dominate the aroma. Taste is smooth as silk and medium bodied. Really nice.

Good aroma of a standard wheat.  Fruit, banana.  A very large off white head.  Looks like dirty water; brown, with sediment.  Not as full flavored as their hefeweizen.  Light fruit and flowers, also some malt.  A little sweet.
Pours is light brown with an off colored tan head. Aroma is slight spice. Taste is clove, malt and hints of banana. Very drinkable, and a weizen that I can actually enjoy.

Cloudy dark brown in colour with an off-brown head and very yeasty aroma. Sweet banana taste with a mild lingering skunky tang at the end. I think the bottle may have been a bit old. That aside, its a pretty decent beer with some nice flavours, but not as good as the original.

Pours cloudy brown with a quickly diminishing off-white head.  Nose is wheat and heavy, ripe banana.  The flavor is more banana than anything, with some tasty wheat notes and a bit of clove.  Mouthfeel is distressingly watery, and there is very little aftertaste.  Bitterness is less than 10. I dont taste any chocolate either.  Neh.

I liked the Weihenstephaner and I prefer darks. So, I was really looking forward to this. It poured with a thick head and amber finish (not quite dark enough for me)..  It tasted like a complex blend of banana and puke.

Popped the cap and began looking for the right glass and when I turned around the beer was seeping out (foam). I quickly grabbed a nearby clean pilsener glass. It took a while to pour the full bottle with the foam. Looked like chocolate whip cream on a dusty brown beer. Dusty and mild yeast aroma. Dusty banana flavours, with a building chocolate finish. Quite enjoyable (harmonious even) but not as zesty as expected.

(on bottle) After having the "Tradition", was this quite the dull experience. The wheats with it´s banana-flavour, along with a very mild use of dark malts, makes it more of a thirstkiller, than a full drink.

Pours hazy brown/red with gargantuan continuously rising head. The beer is really churning in there from the tremendous carbonation. Aromas of grassy, yeast, and a slight sourness. Tastes of bitter yeast but not much else.

Completely turbid russet color with a creamy, frothy head that leaves spots of lacing. Yeasty aroma of bread dough, acetic tang of sourdough starter, and the soft warm incense of  baking banana-walnut muffins. Flavor is minerally and tart, club soda, banana smoothie, and a spiciness bordering on outright heat. Fluffy, mousselike palate. Finishes earthy, smoky, and lightly phenolic- wild mushrooms and cocao nibs. I remember this being more bready and chocolately and... better.
one finger head dissipates quickly. pours a golden brown. tons of carbonation taste is bannana and wheat.  I drink this a ton and am always pleased. best on hot summer days.

bottle. mahogany body with a huge luscious white head. aroma consists of banana and yeast, soap, and spice. smooth creamy body. Though it does seem a tiny bit watery. sweet and malty. notes of caramel. Pretty good.
Sweet malt floral grassy aroma. Cloudy brown colour with excellent head that fades quickly. Sweet malt flavour that takes your breath away. Smooth thick palate. A bit too sweet for my palate.

Nice hazy chestnut brown with a decent creamy head.  Pleasant aroma as expected for a dunkel.  Flavor is good, not the best Ive had but good enough.  A little more citric and brittle than some, but still quite flavorful and good.  Drinkable and nice.  Nothing wrong here.
Brown in color with a large beige foamy head. Aroma is malt and caramel, lightly wheat. Flavor is slightly sweet and lightly wheaty. Finish is a little sweet.

Nice color, cloudy wheaty!  Aroma is sweet straw, reminders of working hay in daya gone by. Taste is sweet and very fresh. Almost like a great salad.
Head is big and lingers, helping the extremely smooth nature.
Nice, very nice!
Ill be back!

Tasted from the bottle after a night shift, so my rating may be a bit off key!! Poured into a Weihenstephaner Weiss glass very slowly as I had trouble controlling the massive gassed-up head that spewed from the bottle. Once under control the aroma kicked in. Very fresh and slightly acidic citric hop and sour-dough wheat scents dominated, with hints of lemon & orange peel, milk chocolate and cinnamon. The body a chestnut amber, not as brown as I had expected, with high carbonation keeping the thick off-white head safely in the glass. Lighter than expected body, low yeasty biscuit notes little hints of clove and cinnamon mid-palate. Fruity highlights of lemons, oranges and unripened bananas ( Became sour and slightly lactic half way down ). Short, pleasant aftertaste and quite refreshing. Not the best of the Weihenstephan range, but a decent oddly sessionable Dunkel.

Wheat, lemon and clove aroma. Big head, cloudy brown amber color. Flavor has banana notes, light sweetness. Light hint of burnt chocolate. Light dry, light astrigent finish. All in all not very impressive.
Strong banana aroma and flavor.  As refreshing as any wheat beer Ive ever had.  Remarkably smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Light cloudy caramel in colour.  Pours a big fluffy head.  Nose is very fresh and shops lots of confectionery and the faintest roast note. Palate is much more dry but the clove and lolly flavours play around the edges.  Medium fizz level works well.  Pretty good.
bottle.  looks a little pale compared to other dunkels Ive sampled.  the flavor also was a bit thin in comparison to the dunkelweizens I have tried.

Pint bottle poured into a tall glass. Brown cloudy coloured. off white head. Smooth fill with nice balanced flavours. not tooo complex. Different malts, fruits(banana, cherries,) Some spices(nutmeg, clove) but very faint.  Kinda sweet. I def. enjoyed this. I might keep one of these in the fridge to sip on. *note: my bottles top lable said Dunkel, and the main bottom lable said brown*

Bottle - 500ml. Brown cloudy body topped with a nice and lasting off-white foamy head. Nice yeasty aroma with some fruity (citrus, cherries, banana) notes. Robust and well-balanced taste with various flavors of malt, hops, fruits, and spices. Decent bitter/citrusy finish. Very good example of a Dunkles Weizen.
Bottle.  Cloudy dirty brown with a thick foamy head.  Sweet malt aroma.  Taste is malty and medium sweet with wheat and hints of banana.  Pretty good.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with nice head. Banana, vanilla, nutmeg, caramel-chocolate. Soft mouthfeel.

smoothy banana weizen. Brown-amber, fruit highlights with sourish and malt finish. Some nutmeg, cloves, cinammon, roasting. Medium-light mouthfeel with high carbonation. Easy draught like drink. Reasonable malts and hops, not overdone. Good with spicy pizza.

Draft, at the <a href="http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlac Tree Inn. Not quite up to what I hoped to find. Still pretty nice, though. Color is beer-bottle brown under a fizzy head. Taste is sugary and kind of light. Banana flavor builds up with not much else to balance it.

From the tap, this poured a hazy brown color with a frothy off-white head.  The aroma is grassy with notes of banana and caramel.  This is very soft in the mouth.  The taste is mild but enjoyable, caramel malt with some spiciness to it.  After 964 years, this brewey sure knows its business.
Pours a dark hazy brown color. Aroma is strong and wheaty. Flavor is wheat with lots of spice. Slight malt flavor as well.
Wow, neato. My first dunkel.   I was surprised to find the taste so similar to a regular hefe, albeit with some of them dark malts.  Big old head, nice brown body.  Very tasty!
