UPDATED: DEC 7, 2004   This beer had a great pour and a sensational smell.  However I was expecting it to taste like a strong Hefeweisse and I did not get that.  There was too much malt in the taste which made me miss the Hefeweisse.  Still a good beer.  It was worth the try.  Trying new beers is always very enjoyable.

A very nice dunkel weissbier, a cloudy tan colour with a creamy head that sits high atop. The addition of the yeast added a much higher level of complexity to the flavour and a nicer rounded out flavour. In the mouth it was quite a bit of sprits and tingly on the tongue. Overall very nice and refreshing.

Bottled.  A chestnut brown coloured beer with a good head.  The aroma is reminiscent of banoffee pie - both banana, toffee and caramel notes.  The taste really grows on you through the bottle.  Wheaty lemon notes, caramel, nuts and a bit if banana.  Very nice

Draft.  Murky brown with a lush tan head.  Aroma of cloves, bananas, hint of bubblegum, but also a bready note.  Flavor starts off centered on the malt, sweet but not at all cloying, with a spicy yeast finish, particular accent on the cloves which increased as it warmed.  Exceptionally well balanced, another textbook style example from this brewer.
Copper color, medium fruity malty aroma, light roasted malty taste, medium body, light dry finish.
Wow, a very very good beer! I was kind of surprised by this selection, great copper color, very lasting head. Capped off by a wonderful taste reminiscent of other great german weissbiers

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2011 One of my favorite German brewers. Yet another excellent example of the style. +++ Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy light mahogany color with a huge fluffy tan head that lingered. The aroma was sweet and malty with a hint of fruit and spice. The flavor was sour, malty and tangy with a bit of roasted malt. It was slightly sour and wheaty on the finish. The sourness grows as it warms. Another fine offering from a good brewer.

Bottle from the Offie, Leicester. Beautiful colour, like burnished copper - a cloudy pint, topped with an inch thick head. Standard wheaty aroma. Very tasty wheat beer: all the good points - sweet, crisp, refreshing. No more substantial or different than a Hefe, perhaps a smidge more solid.More toffee, which lingers. I like this style, and this is good stuff.

Cloudy red brown body, big head. Cloves and Cinnamon smell. Taste the same but a touch watery. Lacks the thick rich palate the  aroma promised. Still very nice.  Nice finishing flavours. Some sour and bitterness aftertaste.

Dark and cloudy with luxuriant head. Apple, cinnamon and cider in the flavor. Same in the nose. Carbonation is crisp and satisfying. Enough bananna to stuff a monkey. Charming in that it isnt overly sweet. Very mellow and missing the mild throat tinge often present in wheats.

Has that delicious red-brown colour that looks like liquid toffee. Medium, lacey, slightly off-white head. Malty, abit caramelly-sweet aroma with the usual yeasty banana notes. Taste is slightly sweet, caramelly, hints of chocolate, banana and a bit sour in the finish. Very well-balanced dunkelweizen, one of the best I had so far.

Brownish red in color with a rather large inital head that was light brown and made up of large bubbles.  Sour wheaty aroma, also bananas, cloves, and some subtle coacoa.  Taste was first that sour wheat, but then there were bananas and small chocolate notes.  This was better than I expected, a real treat.

Light brown colored, big beige fastly vanishing head. Very sweet and fruity (banana), slightly alcoholic aroma. High carbonation makes beer even to foam in mouth. Starts with sweet flavor, ends with lasting banana and mild alcohol, which is not bad at all. Ending has also strong bite in tongue coming from strong carbonation and notes of hops, makes you want more. Beer with many sides, excellent dunkelweizen.
Immediate whiff of banana. Yeast and citrus and the banana flavors blend together.  Im new to dunkels (only had a couple)  but Im liking this one

Cloudy mahogney color with a large foamy white head. Spicy clove aroma with a nice dose of banana as well. Light banana and yeasty flavor. Some wheat and light cloves. Finishes smooth and moderatley bitter with some light nutty notes. Well balanced, solid Dunkelweizen

This has got to be the creamiest dunkelweizen ever. Sorry for the hyperbole. Anyhow. I am slightly impressed by this brew. I thnk it represents the style very accurateley. Pours a lovely, billowy autumnal hazy orange. This beer smells like autumn. Notes of bourbon and vanilla, coupled with the usual sourness of the wheat. and perhaps thats what I dont like about this one it is too complex in a sweet way rather than in a sour way. I used to crave Dunkelweizens like i was pregnant...except you cant drink when youve got a kid in your womb...Flavors are excellent if not subdued. Very creamy, this one coats but the flavor just doesnt match the mouthfeel. it dies far too quickly. Good beer deserves the 80.
G-rat

An impressively foamy, bilious head tops a beer with a dark brown, almost pruney, or figgy hue. Aroma is lively and satisfying: citrus, notes of vanilla, banana, cloves, rich, deep, dark. Reminds me of Belgian abbey dubbels, a favorite. Taste is sharp, dry, with a hasty finish, that leaves you yearning for more. A very sociable beer: not too difficult to drink, and not in the least forgettable. Slight bitterness, medium body, and as for flavor, I feel like its close to a lighter version of a barleywine, crazy as that sounds.

pours  a dark cloudy brown with a thick beige head.
Clove aromas dominate, with some bananas and malt.
flavor is much the same, clove, fruit, bread.
Good beer

0.5 l bottle, weiss glass. Pours a cloudy, milky brown, with a big white head. Aroma is a  mix of banana, clove, and milk chocolate. Flavor is much the same, with a big round malt profile. Decent and nicely drinkable.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Bottle pours cloudy caramel, slightly dark, large fluffy off-white head, with fairly sticky lacing.   Clove, banana, and bread on the nose.   Forwardly wheaty, slight banana and clove but somewhat subtle.   Medium body, full mouthfeel.   Finishes like it starts, but with a slight spiciness to it and a slight sweetness.   Good, but I prefer the regular version to this one.
A nice dunkel wheatbeer.Typical in many ways of a quality wheatbeer.Dark cloudy body,big head,fruity aroma,complex fruity taste,sweet.An enjoyment to drink.

A very nice beer. A bit on the sweet side, but still very easy to drink. Good caramel and slight molasses like presence, mixed in with some fruity banana qualities and hefe spiciness. One of the best out of the Weihenstephan brews.

I have just voted this as my favourite wheat beer style based on the experience I have had with the Scheinder Aventinus. Clearly this is a less potent brew. Looks good in the glass with a fine copper/caramel colour and dense white head. A fine toffee and caramel nose too with hints of a plummy undertone. The flavour is lifting and clean, a very good beer that would be best consumed in warmer weather at a barbecue of ribs or barbecued pork.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text:
cloudy murky caromel color with an awsome thick head that lasted the entire beer!!
A little watery and plain tasting.
aroma and appearance is awsome but flavor is lacking. dull

Tawny reddish brown, lots of thick tan foam. Excellent toasted wheat and peachy aromas, fresh and appetizing, medium bodied with slight tartness and very subdued roast, slight ripe/ sweet lemon, dry finish, very pleasant...best dunkel weiss Ive had Id say.

Murky light brown in color. Huge off-white rocky head. Very similar smell and flavor to the hefeweiss. Clove and banana dominate, but with a slight caramel note. Not bad but a more toasted flavor and less cloveness would be better.

Dark brown and murky  pour, with  a head that will flow out of your pint glass unless you use the slowest pour possible.   Aroma is of yeast, banana and a whiff of spice and malt.  Taste is an obligatory balance of yeast and wheat, with some nutmeg, ginger, banana and that obligatory dunkels caramel/malt backbone... not quite as complex as their regular hefe, but not far behind... superb for the style.

Pours a deep reddish brown amber with large white head. Faint aroma of spice, wheat. For the style, flavor tends towards the darker, dry end, especially in the finish, in contrast to other dunkelweizens that might be excessively sweet. I enjoyed that, but the flavor is a little bland overall. Medium body, wheat and roasted caramel notes, with a dry tobacco finish. A dunkelweizen with more dunkel than weizen.
This was a very good dunkelweizen.  It poured a chesnut brown color with a tan/white head.  The taste was malty, fruity, and yeasty, with a perfect balance of flavors.  Recommended.

Hazy amber in colour with a hint of bronze. The nose is wheaty and yeasty with just a kick of grain. The taste is light and somewhat citrusy with an overlay of wheat and copper. Pretty darn good and feels quite light in the mouth. if I only liked wheatbeers better.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2010 Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate banana, light bubblegum, toffee, and just a hint of roast.  It pours a cloudy brownish-orange with an inch tall off-white head that fades relatively quickly until a thin cap of foam that leaves behind some nice webbing for lacing.  The flavor starts with a quick dose citrus tanginess.  The finish has notes of banana, caramel, and light roastiness.  Medium bodied with lively, but mostly soft carbonation.  Certainly not as good as the regular, but it is a nice dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2007 Pours from the bottle with a large, creamy head. Light brown color with orange highlights. Smells of banana peels, oranges and grass. The flavor is refreshing with bubblegum and banana. Overall, this is fairly sweet, even for the style. A decent brew with some peach notes and a little bit of clove in the finish.

Murky reddish golden appearance is only slightly darker than the regular Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier.  The head is appropriately tall and foamy, and carbonation level is high as is should be.  This beer is much less aromatic than its paler brother, with a lot more wheat bread on the nose than cloves or bananas.  The taste is also quite malty, with only a mild level of sweet fruitiness, but a bit of a spicy bite and lemony tanginess.  The mouthfeel is light and feels a bit watered down.  A good Hefeweizen for the people who prefer their iced tea unsweet rather than sweet.
Very good, same qualities as the regular Hefe, but more intense spices and aftertaste-wheat, caramel, chocolate, banana, yummm.

Medium brown color, and, naturally, cloudy.  Aroma is light, but is clove spice as expected with medium-full mouthfeel.  Pours a full weiss head and retains it well.  A heavy lace rolls slowly down your glass as you empty it.
Murky dark amber colour with good foamy head. Aroma is sweet, malty and with some spices. Flavor is sweet with some banana and toffee. Palate is very nice.

Sweet, fruity, yeasty aroma, like caramel-drenched banana with a mildly bready, chocolatey maltiness in the background.  Dark amber color, largely opaque, with a fine, creamy and lasting head.  Flavor profile is malty and and lightly bitter to start, becoming toffeeish and with a spicy, estery finish, featuring some lingering hop flavors, banana and clove.  Lightly acidic and effervescent on the palate, body is light-medium.  Respectable.
Hazy, light mahogoney color.  Moderate carbonation.  Big frothy head, moderately diminishing.  Sweet yeasty aroma.  Clovey.  Somewhat vinous.  Decent.

Cloudy reddish brown with a massive frothy light brown head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, caramel, clove, and dough.  Medium watery body with lively carbonation.  Refreshing.  Slightly earthy flavor of banana, clove, wheat, plum, caramel, with  hints of straw and roast.  The flavor becomes weaker as I finish the bottle - more so than usual, but it is still enjoyable.  Very good.

Pours a medium brown, hazy, huge fluffy tan head. Aroma of darker malts, doughy, and a little bit of yeast. Similar flavor but is a touch less assertive. Palate was lively at first but turned watery and a little bland towards the end of the bottle. Decent weizen.

50cL Bottle, 04.13.04  Pours a medium-dark honey-brown color with a large head of plump bubbles.  Aromas of citrus, green apple, clove and something...plastic?  Flavors of ripe pear, spice.  Honey across the middle and a citrus bite to finish.  Spice lingers in the aftertaste.  There is a sense here of earthiness with the flavor, but it is subtle, as with some barely noticable fruits in the background.  I don't find a predominance of banana that many raters have noted, but I am a bit congested(?).  Mouthfeel is full and malty at first; but it is thin from middle to back.  Tasty beer, but kind of boring.
Dark brown with a large head.  Aromas are wheat, banana, yeast and weetabix.  Flavours are wheat, choc malts and banana.  Perhaps are touch too much sparkle but still a refeshing light dunkel.

color is cloudy amber, with a thick creamy beige head. aroma is spicy, yeasty, wheaty, a touch roasty and a little bit of banana comes through. more banana comes through in the flavor, almost like throwing banana in a raisin bran or something. banana aftertaste. flavor is moderately sweet and sour.
this is a good dunkel, its my first hefeweizen dunkel- but it isnt bad.  im becoming more of a fan of these kind of beers the more i drink.  has a banana taste to it.  not bad

An excellent dunkel. If it weren't for Aventinus, this would probably be my favorite dark hefe (along with Julius Echter). Nice balance and flavor, refreshing and still substantial. Nothing overt in the flavor, but some banana and  subtle chocolate notes. I've never regretted drinking a beer from this brewery.

Brown amber color, slightly cloudy. Large foamy white head. Aroma is wheaty and sweet, with a hint of fruit. A light to medium bodied dunkel. Malts are fruity and sweet, with a touch of banana and clove flavor. Slightly spicy hops. Wheaty, bready and fruity. Very smooth taste. Light and lively carbonation. Nice easy drinking dunkel weiss. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2004 Bottle
Huge light brown head. Blurred brown color. Aroma is sweetish banana with bitterish sidetone. Taste is typical hefeweizen: sweet banana with smooth excellent mouthfeel. Not much difference to standard Weihenstephaner weizen except color. (7/3/8/5/16 3.9)

Re-rate, bottled (BB 04/2005)
Nice dark copper brown with small off-white head. Malty, toffee nose - more like a Belgium ale than a hefeweizen. Roasted, balanced mouthfeel with toffee, lemon and malts. Gives long bitter aftertaste. (7/4/8/4/16 3.9)
Pours a dark brown with little head. Typical banana/clove/caramel tastes. Did not notice anything that jumped out and said, "I'm different than other hefes"

Not much to say here, actually.

Pours a dark honey color with a *huge* off-white head. Very little lacing.

Smells and tastes average at best. It's a little on the weak side. It's not overly sweet, thankfully. Just your typical banana/clove/caramel malts, but not very much of anything.

Mouthfeel is weak in that it almost tastes watered down. It is refreshing, though, which is why drinkability is good.

On tap.  Typical German wheat beer aroma - banana, clove, bread.  Cloudy light brown color, decent head.  Flavor is similar to a hefe, but less tart and with a little caramel flavor.  Medium body.  Great session beer.  Nobody does a wheat beer like Weihenstephan - the ester and phenol profile is perfect.

Muddy dark brown beer. Great tall cream head. Smells awesome. Yeasty banana/bubble gum, malt, both in the nose as well as the flavor. Slightly sweet as well. Better than Hacker Pschorr Dunkel Weiss definitely. Dry and a little metallic. Even a nice little bitterness to end up.

Cloudy, light brown color, huge light beige head. Notes of yeast, a bit sweet, malty (caramel), notes of banana in aroma. Medium and smooth body, lively carbonation. Flavor is yeast-like, a bit sweet, malty, lightly bitter. Finish is dry and a bit acidic. Nice dunkelweizen overall.

Has a clouded dark brown color with an off-white head and high carbonation.  Smell is of spice/clove.  Taste is of the wheat/clove and finishes pretty crisp.  Overall it is not a bad wheat, but same as the regular, not great.
Much like the regular hefe, with a hint of chocolate. very enjoyable but given a choice of regular or dark, i would suggest the regular.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2004 Dirty, muddy brown/dark orange color. Thick and lasting, off-white head. Sweetish, yeasty and wheaty banana aroma with caramel malt. Fruity flavor with yeast and some caramel malt - and a quick, bitter finish. Slightly sour and acidic. Palate is light to medium-bodied, sticky, and quite stingy carbonated. Must be drank cold, or the beer will foam like hell in mouth, leaving not room for actually tasting it. A decent weizen, but I definitely prefer the excellent light version. Also a bit too thin body for a hefeweizen.

This beer pours a brown color with a nice, thick head and it leaves some lacing on the glass.  The aroma is that of malts, with some fruit and caramel as well.  The flavor wasn't very enjoyable, in my opinion.  There was something slightly skunky about it - which I've found rare in darker beers.  The flavor was a mixture of the malts and the caramel, but I didn't find much of the fruit that was in the aroma.  Again, not a terrible beer, but I didn't care much for it.
Dark malty, chewey.  Tangy yeasts offset by mellow chocolate and creamed coffee.  Banana and clove peak in now and then.  Smooth and easy to drink, went well with pizza, I'd like some more, please!

Good Weizens loose their freshness and flavors quickly, but if you can get one of these while it's fresh you'll be rewarded with banana, vanilla, and malt aromas, malt, fruit and yeast flavors with a smooth filling refreshing dark beer.  Some prefer the lighter of their Weissbiers, I'll take the Dunkel.

Body poured dark brown with a light, ample head.  The aroma was complex.  Hints of fruit and caramel and coffee and such.  Kept trying unsuccessfully to pinpoint it.  Good flavor.  Weihenstephaner produces some good brews.

Copper hue with good off-white head and good lace. The aroma hints of banana, spice and citrus (hefe) caramel, roasted malt, and dusty yeast esters (dunkel). The taste starts malty sweet but the weizen character quickly adds notes of citrus and banana and that twangy yeast quality I love in the standard hefe. The finish has a strange (but good) miz of spice and smoke that is a clear indicator of the "blends" of the two styles. I like this because it is unique and offers a wide variety of flavors, complex and very drinkable.

Very sweet, yeasty aroma. Light cloudy brown. Yeasty sweet caramel flavour which is partly psycological colour association. Cloves strongly evident in the finish. A dunkel weiss where the dark doesn't overwhelm the wheat. Almost an Aventinus light.

Hazy copper color with a minimal head but good lacing. Assertive fruity aroma-prunes, cranapple and orange with a slight vinous note to it. Light to medium bodied with plum, chocolate and clove flavors, smooth with a mild finish. Pretty good.

Pours a murky copper brown with a huge puffy white head. Good yeasty citrus and wheat aroma.  Body is sweet, lightly chocolatey, and crisp with mild spice and a full-bodied yeastiness.  Finishes clean and refreshing.  This is one of the best Dunkelweizens I've had.

Terrific muddy golden-brown appearance. Enourmous head and huge chunks of white lace. Nose is mildly sour with notes of banana and spice. The taste is the same only much fuller than the aroma. Refreshingly light bodied but a bit on the watery side. Mild carbonation. A touch of sweetness lingers on the palate after the beer is swallowed.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2003 lots of carbonation, very thick tan head. murky water color. Very sweet and some sourness. Very fruity.Spicy aftertaste. very good taste. They definately have had time to make a good beer since they have been around since 1040 A.D.
I consider this more of a "sipping" beer.  Average consistency, but fairly heavy.  I swear I there is a faint taste of GINGER in this.  Also is very sweet.  Moderately dark, but very drinkable.

Aroma of clove, freshly cut chipboard and a hint of banana. Looks like muddy water. Fairly highly carbonated. Tastes like a decent sort of wheat beer but as it warms has increasing flavour of cloves and banana.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2008 A slight toasty maltiness in the aroma. Sweetish, coffee bitter flavor with a hint of yoghurt and just a bit of sourness. Fairly well made dunkel weizen.
Tasted in june 2008 in Austria: Orange brown color, cloudy. Banana, lemon and a hint of toffee in both aroma and flavor. Citrus and just a dash of clove in the aftertaste. Sharp and refreshing.

Large, tight, tan head that hangs. Substantial nose of grain, breadyness, fruit and dark malts. Hazy dark brown color. Medium body. Dark malt, grainy, yeasty flavors. Kinda thin, dry finish. A little dirty also.

Very murky, copper lager. Medium-sized, frothy, off-white head with little lacing.
Spicy and yeasty aroma. Clove, cinnamon and bubblegum.
Soapy, spicy brew with hints of brown sugar and freshly ground ginger. Well-balanced.
Medium-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Short, spicy finish.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2007 Looks like mud in the glass, nose of hops and cinnamon, and the taste is of banana and smooth malts. Nice beer.

.5L brown bottle. Best before 07 Jan 04. Poured out a cloudy light brown color, with a slightly tan head. The head was thick, dense, and long lasting. Aromas right away of banana, malts, slight clove, and that famous lactic wheat tang. Tastes very rich, malty, and like bananas also. Has a lactic wheat finish to it. Sort of tangy, but good all the same. I'm impressed by this beer. It is truly well made.
Very balanced, smooth finish to it as well.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2003 Wow, this was a really tasty hef. I wonder why the darker hefes haven't made their way into craft breweries more, a good North American micro's rendition of this might be spectacular. Grains take front seat in this beer, prividing a solid flavor for the sweet malt to skate around on. The mouthfeel here was excellent, with an almost dry feeling across the tongue from the grains and a coating of malt over the rest of the mouth. Some esters floating around in there but none as clear as the grains.

Poured murky brown with large head but head retention was disappointing (though my glass washing is somewhat inconsistent). Aromas of clove, pepper and the faintest touch of banana - great. Lighter-bodied, drier and more highly carbonated than their Hefeweizen (which is good). Flavour is wheaty/malty with a touch of citrus and the lightest bitterness in the finish. Yum, the second best Dunkelweizen I've tasted (behind Edelweiss.)

Pours a clouded brown with a tall tan head. Spice and malt on the nose. Seems like a sweeter hefeweizen to me. Spice and citrus fruit with yeast on the tongue. Smooth but with a light bitter hint in the aftertaste. Another great Weihenstephaner beer!

I cannot really say anything that has not been said already.  This beer has a great appearance, big flavors and a great aftertaste.  Slightly peppery and spicy, with some nice malty sweetness int he finish.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2005 Beautiful dark fuzzy brown sugar appearance.  Big cinnamon nose with lemons and ginger.  Mouthfeel is very carbonated, which is very pleasant when presented with a mix of nutmeg, pepper and lemons.  Full and frothy palate, sweet grains and corn, but not that unpleasent I can say.
Brown head, milky tan body.  Flavor is very malty and sweet, some fruitiness is evident.  Palate seems high on carbonation.  Good beer.
The color is nice hazy brownish, with a nice head. The taste is a nice blend of fruits and spices. It has an excellent almost sweet finish

This is swank beer. Not up to Aventinus standards, but damn near close (yes I realize they are different styles). Just a tad darker than Schneider Weiss -- cloudy tarnished copper. Big meringue head, the kind where bubble pop and a leave a permanent pit. The aroma, in addition to some of the typical aromas had this aroma I associate with stilton cheese. It's not a cheesiness, but that aroma that I can't really describe but think of as a smokey earthiness. Great hefe flavors, a bit milder than I prefer (I'm a Schneider Weiss aficionado) but this is made up by the darker malt flavors. A bit like caramel and bananas. Great, elegant beer.
Dark muddy color. Malt, hops, wheat in the aroma. Has a not too rich, toasty, full flavor. Semisweet lingering in the finish. A good drinkable version of this style.

Slightly dark brown body with appropriate cloudiness. Huge long lasting head. Aroma has some malt and caramel in it, along with the usual yeast and banana accents. Front is thinner than expected with some sweetness and malt, top is very light, finish is dry. I believe the dunkelweiss style has something to offer, but this attempt falls short. Still very good tasting weiss, but for a so called "dark hefeweiss" this beer does not say much for the style.

Color is what I compare to the river water of the Mississippi on a good day. It looks like what its suppose to for a dark hefe, one ugly ass murky brown. The top was super fluffy and tall, nearly two inches of fluffy frothyness, liked whipped coffee cream, crumbles slowly to a fine small head that never leaves. Lace is everywhere, some sticks, some drips, mostly patches with some strings.
Smell is quite simple yet very nice, soft and light airy lemon, some maltness, a bit musty and a touch of banana and spice.
Taste is a nice mellow lemon flavor, easy tartness, balanced nicely with darker malts and wheat, a bit of breadish dryness, touch of banana and spice in there, smooth the entire gulp. Nice open and mellow medium body feel, mostly midway action then thins out nicely in the finish leading it to be drinkable beyond comprehension. One excellent, fine beer to drink any Ol' time, but favors the warmth of summer.
dark cloudy body, big head with wheat yeast aroma. Malty, and yeast, wheat, spicey falvor. Light carbonation tingles in your mouthdry aftertaste.

Cloudy dark brown color, frothy white head. Spicy wheat aroma, but with the typical dunkel aroma, some maltiness. I guess it's like a combination of a weizen and a bock. Bit fruity, spicy and malty flavors. Although this one is nice, i personally prefer normal weizens.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2004 May 03.  Dark, muddy brown, massive foamy meringue head, fairly stable.  Nose phenolic, less banana-accented than many; I got dates & cherries primarily, medium strength.  Flavor initially strongly caramel-sweet, thins out in both the taste and palate rather rapidly.  Smooth, dry, rather plain finish.  OK, but I'm not going to cry that I can't get it in VT.

December 03.  I think I got a better sample this time, seemed much spicier and stronger flavored, interesting gingerbread-lemon accents on the nose, maltier than I remember.  Excellent.

The Label on this beer says it is a “Hefeweissbier Dark,” so I presume this is the same beer? Nonetheless, this was a very satisfying beer, I thought it would be a darker wheat beer but it was still very good. This is a very effervescent beer with, a nice two finger white frothy head. This Hefeweissbier Dark has a bit of a bite in the finish, but overall, it needs to be given a try.
Very creamy beer, full body and excellent head. Really like this, the German wheats are a whole lot tastier than the Dutch or Belgian whites.

Tons of very tiny bubbles, a HUGE, dense, uniform, glossy, off white head.  Hazy light brown body.  Light and yeasty, some caramel.  OH so drinkable. Buttery and soft, but clean and refreshing.  Some dry toasted barley near the finish.  Clean and crisp, mellow and smooth.  Great German Wheat!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2007 German wheat beer is probably my favorite style if I absolutely had to choose one and Weihenstephaner is one of the great breweries of Germany. That said, I find this dark wheat to be exceptional in flavor and quality. Beautiful dark brown with standard huge wheat head of froth. Smell is sweet and malty with a definite yeast presence. Full of wheat flavor that is sweet and malty. Full bodied and ultra smooth on the palate.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: A light brown unclear beer with a fantastic head. The aroma is wheaty and slightly sweet. The flavor is a nice lowkey wheat flavor. It is pretty sweet with no bitterness - just wheat in the aftertaste. A little thin. An OK dunkel hefeweissebier - but not the best I've had.

Cloudy brownish hue.  Giant beige head.  Fruity spicy nose.  Turbid carbonation.  Starts mellow and sweet.  Bananas, cloves, bubblegum in the aftertaste.  Light to medium bodied.  Very drinkable with great malt flavors.  A very nice dunkel.

Very nice aromas coming thur---cloves, banana---but not so much in the flavor department.  Some spice in the flavor but needed more malt.  Pours with a very nice, "ice cream"-like, head.  Still, a worthy brew.

Seems to be the hefeweizen with a darker color.  I look for more an assertive maltiness in my dunkels, with Ayinger Altbairisch Dunkel being the quintessential example.  Dissappointing for Weihenstephan.

Pours a dark, burnt orange color with a nice thick, persistant head.  The aroma is a pleasant combination of banana, clove, and perhaps some caramel and chocolate.  Even a hint of bubble gum.  The flavor, while not quite as impressive, is still pleasant.  Malty, but not thick.  A nice, pleasant Dunkel.
Huge head; the color is a washed-out dark brown and isn't very attractive; the taste is very smooth, and the finish has just a touch of bitterness
Like all the Weihenstephaner beers, this is yet another winner. I still prefer the regular hefe-weisse over the dunkel.

A brown color with a medium sized white head. A medium body. The aroma is of yeast, banana and clove. The tast is floral with apple, clove. A little sourness also. Overall a nice smooth and refreshing dark wheat.
This beer was brown in color and cloudy. Nice white head. At first smelled like vinigar and alcohol and tasted sour and alcohol. As it sits smells and taste more like a belgian.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2003 I like this very much and is from the superb Weihenstephaner line. It is almost as good as the Hacker Pshorre Dark Weiss. I like it for the same reason as the other as it gives you a unique rich wheat flavor. I still like regular weiss beers a touch better thoughfor the lack of aftertaste.

Solid dunkelweizen.  Has the expected nice fluffy head, light phenols, some banana.  I am thankful that it refrains from over-indulging in caramel flavors, which can be a major drawback in a dunkelweizen.
Interesting but not the ambrosia that had been described to me prior to drinking. Medium brown with an off white head. Malty aroma. Fairly sweet beer. No great shakes.

Murky, muddy brownish orange with a plentiful foam topping.  An exquisite clover aroma, rather robust, with a hint of chocolate.  The body lacked carbonation--the man detractant, as I Paulaner-like effervescence would have made this beer spectacular.  The taste relied greatly on banana with some yeasty notes as well.  The finish is banana--rolling smoothly over the palate.  A fine german wheat.
Bottle.  A hazy brown color with a foamy tan head.  A musty, yeasty, and malt aroma.  A little sweet.  The malty flavor sits well after a while and is cut nicely by the wheat.

A decent looking dunkel with a generous head, but a LITTLE too light in color, in my opinion.  Aroma is nice, but a little weak.  The flavor is a lot less wheaty than I expected, and also a little weak.  All around, this beer seems to fall a little short of the mark.
Brown color with a light fluffy head.  Caramel and almond aroma.  Flavors of darker malts.  Rather one dimensional, but well made.
Cloudy brown yellow liquid with sudsy beige head. Lovely aroma of bread, bananas and dark malt. Flavour very similar to aroma, bananas only just overpowering the dark malty taste. Nice mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 An initially large off-white head that almost overflowed the glass with moslty fine bubbles. This wheat beer was not one of my favorite, but more or less middle of the road for me. There was no strong after taste, but the taste did linger for a long time.

Lacks any of the intensity of the Weihenstephaner Hefe.  The beer is beautiful, and looks like a chocolate icecream soda  huge white head on a creamy chocolate body.  Beautiful.  But not much intensity or complexity in aroma or flavor.  Not bad ... some malt, some sweetness, some hops, but not a lot of anything.  It tries ... some spice, pepper, cloves, banana.  But not enough.  I was expecting something more like an Aventinus, a huge version of Schneider Weisse.  Instead I just got a dark beer.

This tasted quite a bit like a bock to me.  Looked like a glass of caramel and the flavor backed up the aesthetics of it all.  A bit too sweet for my liking though.  This is quite good for a wheat beer though.

This brew is very similar in taste to the standard Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier. The primary difference, other than the darker appearance, is perhaps a little more sweetness. Big, creamy, off-white head, that is mostly lasting and leaves decent lacing. Root beer float color. I prefer the original.
She gives excellent head and is extremely cloudy...her juice taste very sweet which is nice for some...but not me.
Cloudy brown. Looks like very dirty water. Weak malty aroma. Strange flavour with watery aftertaste.
A pretty regulary german wheat beer. Very characteristic wheat aroma and flavor.
Poured brown with no head.  It had an aroma of apples and wheat, very pleasing.  The taste was fruity, almost a bitter apple cider.  No lace at all.  Great beer!
Pours a dark brown with little head. Smells of fruit, mainly sweet apple with a wheat background. Tastes very sweet for a wheat beer, with a dry carbonation finish. Very Spicy!

Dark,frothy,some caramel. It has a initial flavour that reminds me of Aventinus, the best of the dunkel weizens!!!
Alcohol content is much lower than Aventinus, but the beer is interesting.
Nice dark color, malty taste with a sweet finish! Pours in with a nice head! Great!
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2003 Nice aroma of cloves and yeast, same goes for the flavor.  Cloudy bronze appearance with light brown head. Very pleasant beer.

Seems like Ill just be echoing madsbergs thoughts...  Its very cloudy, but with a nice thick light tan head.  Bubbles rise for some time after pouring.  The only aroma I could detect was a light grainy smell.  Also having a light quality was the taste; there was yeast, citrus, and a hint of malt, but I could barely taste them.  Very watered down.

At least my liquor store gave me a very nice-looking free Weihenstephaner glass (0.5L twisted glass) w/ the purchase of four of these.

Has a foggy dark, quite uninteresting colour. Medium head. Aroma is typical weissbeer. Citrus, yeast, banana and a hint of caramel. Flavour is a very disapointing. One can taste malt, but somehow the flavour is dominated by a very waterish aftertaste. This is by far not one of the top wheats.
Very unique beer. One of the most complex brews that Ive tried. Other than Chimay. Wish I could find this stuff more often.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2004 This one took me fifteen minutes to really get to the bottom of all the flavours that were going on. Instead of the usual light chocolatey flavours you get in a lot of dunkelweizens, this one has a lot of savoury flavours. There's a lot of salty, fishy flavours, as well as some sourness, and a slight metallic edge. At the very end the delicate, drying hop flavours come through and leave you thirsting for more. rer8: this was once upon a time my favourite beer ever, back when i had only had about 350 beers so the flavour brought back nice memories. it's still excellent but not quite so staggering anymore now that i'm old, beerbellied and jaded. cloudy amber with enormous fluffy head, banana and bread aroma. plenty of banana. nice salty, intensely wheaty taste, some nuttiness, and a tasty slightly sour finish. classy.
orangey-brown color with a fresh spicy aroma. nice chewy malty brew. heavy yeast characteristics typical to the style (banana/clove etc)in a word: yum.

Hazy caramel honey brown with a very large short lasting pale beige head. Faint sour grain, soap and wet leather when cold moving to decent fruity and caramel malts when warmer and glass is swirled.  Medium thin body with crisp clean palate. Flavours include apple, grainy wheat and a big malty finish. Aftertaste was strangley lightly tingling but not unpleasant.

Strong, wheat nose with yeasty components. Shit brown color and cloudy with no head retention. Big taste with a little chocolate. Bad aftertaste - like chewing a napkin. Pretty good balance. Certainly aggressive and full beer that shows experienced brewing, but not my fav from Weihenstephaner.
Sweet malt, grain, yeast, dough aroma. Milkcoffe brown body with hints of orange.Sweet malty flavor, somehow with a strange unpleasant aftertaste.
Dark brown color. Malty flavor for a weiss. Hugh head. Fruity flavored, bananas?. Pretty good.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2010 Muddy brown with a big rocky head.  Fruity (banana, pear) aroma with light spiciness.  Fruity in the body, again with light spice.  Light wheaty finish, with a late hint of chocolate.
Pours dark orange with a huge head.  Wheaty aroma, lots of citrus with some earthiness.  The flavour was not quite what I was expecting.  An extra-malty wheat, but quite salty and metallic.

I liked its aroma, like most classic German wheat was pleasant and rich. I had also big head. Lightly carbonated, brownish amber. Still it was missing few key elements (banana was not strongly exposed)
Cloudy amber in color and a smooth taste.  Slightly fruity in taste but not overpowering.  Nice big beer.

Lovelycitrus-like aroma. Creamy, as it looks a lasting head (I just opened the bottle). dark, cloudy looks. Sweet, fruity  taste, spicy. And well-balanced. In the end more bitter. I enjoy this one very much!

Nice, and a little sweeter than the regular Hefe.  Full clove aroma, light hint of banana.  Flavor was mainly clove esters with a light malt sweetness.  Very cloudy amber-brown color, full but short-lasting head, not much lace.
Good thick head - almost too thick! Lasted the entire glass.  Thick active pour with and dark amber color.  Sweet, fruity wheat beer - good representation of the style.
Good head that lasts the entire glass. Fruity and refreshing.
Fruity aroma, nice malt flavor on the palate, adds to the dark flavor.  Some nice spice notes smooth and rich on the palate.
Everlasting head with a taste very similar to a normal wheat beer (even though it is a dunkel) but with a slightly chemically finish.  A reasonable beer.

Nice brownish color, quite clowdy but it has a nice rich head. A yeasty/fruity aroma, but the taste is more malty with only hints of the yeast and fruit. I agree with Inveigler that this is too malty and not yeasty enough to be a real dunkel, but I for one like this much beter.

For a dunkel I thought that this beer was a little overwhelmed with a malt profile.  The wheat didnt really contribute except to the head and body.  Some of the typical hefe yeast character, but downplayed.  I didnt really care for this beer as dunkel.  Slap a diferent label on it, however, and there is something here to be appreciated.
Great dense white foamy head, great aroma, fuirt and spice delight my nostils.Grainy flavor, with banaa and clove, quite spicy..it went great with Guacachips and smoked peach salsa.

Pretty good dunkel.  Very opaque brown color with a light tannish head.  Bananas, cloves and a nice lightly roasted malt notes.  Taste and mouthfeel is typical for a dunkel weissbier (lighter in body than they look) also some hints of chocolate are revealed.  This is a very respectable beer, not one Id go for frequently, but when the craving for a dunkel hits, there are certainly worse choices.
A very nice, well-rounded Weisse. Nice dark amber color, good nose, body, and banana finish. Overall impression: Good!

Mild hefe aroma with caramelized syrup/malt backdrop.  Pithy, grainy, cream-colored head, which holds steady at about 1 cm.  Moderately cloudy, good bottle.  Clean mild hefe with some molasses and pepper.  Thin, and loses carbonation rapidly.

Dark malts and banana, wheat and yeast in the nose. Cloudy, dark chocolate brown with off-white foamy head. Light-medium carb on medium-thick body. Banana and clove taste with dark malts and yeast. A bit of hops. Peppery wheat after. A good dark wheat beer.
The nose is ultra-fine here. The taste falls down a bit. A good bit of clove, quit thin in the palate, not very much more. Not bad, just not what I hoped for.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Culture and upbringing, but no social skills.
A very nice dunkel, chocolety banana flavour and nose, slightly sweet, but enyoyable.

Buttery aroma, lightly yeasty.  Rather thin, watery texture.  Weird sort of maple-y, waffle cone flavor going on.  Most wheat character is masked.  Could use some more spice/clove to balance the sweetness.  Fransiskaners dunkel boots this one in the arse, methinks.
Tastes just a smidge like a tripel or bock.  Very odd taste for a german wheat.  Otherwise, a pretty dark, medium-bodied dunkel.
unfiltered medium bodied, thick creamy head, great yeast flavor.
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2003 Yet another great german brew. A really light flavor, which is great, yet it still has a full body to it. Near perfect, but a bit too much on the carbonation.

Impressive.  The appearance is a lovely dark unfiltered gold, which forms layers in the glass.  The head is huge and creamy.  The aroma is a lovely, sour-yeast smell.  It tastes faintly of almost-ripe fruit -- sour, but not unpleasant.  The flavor lasts from the start to a very long finish that ends in a surprising spiciness, like alspice.

Unfiltered amber in color, with nice head.  Mild and sweet wheat aroma, with hint of banana.  On taste, the sweetness is subdued, the maltiness comes out, and some sourness creeps in.  No bitterness to speak of.

Re-Rate 05/01/02: Clear light brown in color, generous beige head and decent lace. Nose is a bit yeasty, malt, earthy as I like to say. Front is malt, sweet, the top light, the finish is lightly acidic, lightly hopped, somewhat dry, not the best, but not the worst.
Excellent pour and beautiful head.  Looks can be deceiving.  Had an unpleasant candy like flavor.
Big grainy flavor, sort of nutty/fruity bread thing. Typical low hops for the style. Good dunkelweizen color, i.e. much like cloudy Newcastle. Very pleasant indeed.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2012 Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting. Body is hazy light brown, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, caramel), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs), with light notes of gum, raisin, clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. Ok, but nothing special. It honestly seems diluted.
another fabulos beer from weihenstephaner, my favorite brewery.
A good dark wheat, but nothing special seems to stand out about it.

deep tea color, like seasoned copper cookware; bottle conditioned hazy. fabulous lingering lather you could shave with.  aroma is of apple peels soaking in a yeast compote. maybe like what an applesauce factory smells like. great, brisk full-bodied palate and pleasant sweetness; the bavarians drink it for breakfast. perhaps ill try it before the morning commute tomorrow and see if it engenders in me a more affable demeanor toward my fellow motorists, the ones that tailgate, i mean...
Lovely wheat beer with an added maltiness and caramel sweetness, on top of the clove and banana flavours.. Aroma is to die for. Delicious
Very complex flavors in this beer! Too many to list really, but in the end this ended up being a  simply average dunkel to me. Ill take an Aventinus ANYDAY!!!
So-so. I dont think the caramel undertones are really appropriate. Simply average.
all sorts of flavour. a bit of soy sauce for good measure
brown-amber colour, big head, hazelnut and caramel aroma, full-bodied
Nutty and chocolatey with nice underlying Weiss overtones of bananas and cloves. A good dunkel and one that goes down very smooth after you let it sit for a while.

Nice copper color, great head when first poured. A bit too fizzy at first but that passed and the beer became very smooth. Tastes alot like its hefeweisse cousin, but slightly maltier and with caramel and better fruitiness. Some caramel, candy apple, and banana flavors hiding in there. Slightly creamy, lackluster finish.

I was reminded of a candy apple, both by the taste and aroma.  Hints of toasted coconut were nice and exciting, and overall this beer had a nice roasty flavor.  However, the carbonation seemed about three levels higher than it should have been.  As time passed, it did seem to become smoother, and developed a dominant banana taste.  Deep, cloudy brown color with a white head, which remained for the duration of the drink (albeit quite thin by the end). Simply put: very tasty, too bubbly...
A decent Dunkel.  Very yeasty complex taste, thick creamy head
